name: Brewery
description:
Brewery is a competitive eurogame board game.

The game takes place in 6 rounds, each round is divided into two main phases: the placement phase and the resolution phase plus a maintenance sub-phase where employee salaries and restoration are paid.

During the placement phase, the players take turns placing their workers, while during the resolution phase, starting from the first player, he chooses which action to resolve and a benefit is obtained in order of majority. Each action can only contain 4 workers who, identified by the placement order, will be able to resolve the action. During the Placing other workers can be added in the same areas to increase a player's influence. Players with more influence will get more and better effect from the action they are resolving. Resolving some actions will give resources to the player. There are 4 resources available: water, hops (aromas), malt & barley (cereals) and yeast + a special resource for fermentation.

The dominant player, i.e. the one with the most influence or, in case of a tie, the one who placed first will get all the resources of one type (resources are distributed unevenly), and so on everyone will choose what to take from every action where it is present.

The resources obtained from the resolution of the places as well as for the production of the beers are also used to buy more workers and to pay their salaries as $ currency. Buildings function much like buildings in other placement games. Some sponsors give permanent benefits while breweries can be used every turn by placing one of your workers on them to brew beer. As for stocks, having more influence will be beneficial and dominant players will get cheaper workers or get the best resources sooner. The game contains no money, so players will have to be careful when combining resources because if they overpay, no change will be returned. Players accumulate points when brewing beer from factories and hiring new workers. At the end of the 6th round, the points are subtracted for each empty space on the board, then the player with the most points is declared the winner with the most value in resources left in the warehouses!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Doom Room
description:
The Queen’s game has begun! You and the other prisoners of the Royal Jail have been entered into DOOM ROOM, a life-or-death tournament where nothing is certain and each step could be your last.

Your goal is to survive as long as possible in a room full of people trying to kill each other (all in good fun, of course). The longer you last, the more points you’ll earn. It’s a race against time to eliminate your secret target with audacious attacks, daring dodges, and tricky tactics before someone gets to you.

First, you’ll need to find a weapon, with a lucky die roll or by searching chests. Attack cards can only be used once, and only at a certain distance, so get into range and take your shot. But if your target has a Block card with the same range, they’ll survive, and the chase restarts. Otherwise, they’re out!

Strategic plays, clever positioning, and surprise moves keep the game in constant flux. Advantages don’t last long, resources are scarce, and a single play can tilt the odds in anybody’s favour. Every decision could mean your glorious or grisly end.

Remember, the Queen is always watching, and she’ll change things up just to keep herself entertained. She’s not very patient, either: if the game goes on for too long, she’ll join in and take you out herself!

• Replayable: No two games are ever the same.
• Simple: Roll die, move meeples, and play cards.
• Crispy: Big choices, big consequences, no math.
• Quick-start: Choose a room, deal the cards, done.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Multiple Maps, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game

name: Culture Treks: The Travel Game
description:
The object is to become a “Cultural Expert”. The first player to collect one card from each category wins the game. Second place goes to the player with the most cards.

There are 5 card categories: Do’s & Taboos, Superstitions, Food & Drink, Holidays & Festivals and Customs. Each category has it’s own color. The cards are removed from the box and placed in stacks according to category within easy reach of all players. Each player takes two cards from each category and replenishes their hand throughout the game.

The youngest player (player #1) starts the game by rolling the die. The die has 5 colors which match the cards and one wild side where the player can pick the category. The color on the die indicates the card category to be read.
Light Green = Superstitions
Dark Green = Holidays & Festivals
Orange = Food & Drink
Dark Blue = Do’s & Taboos
Light Blue = Customs

Players do not read their own card, rather, the person to the right of the player looks at the two category cards in their hand that match the die. They strategically select the more difficult card to read to player #1. A cultural fact on the card is read along with 3 country answer choices. Player #1 gets one chance to select the correct country that the card applies to (the answer is on the back). If the payer #1 selects the correct country they win the card. If they guess incorrectly, the card goes to the bottom of the deck. End of Turn. Play continues clockwise.

Example:
Player #1 rolls and the die lands on dark blue. The player on the right of player #1 reads a Do’s and Taboos card from their hand.
The card reads:

“Importing or selling chewing gum is illegal. There are high fines for improper disposal of gum.

Switzerland
Afganistan
Singapore X

Player #1 gets one chance to guess Singapore as the correct country.

The game has an optional “Challenge Round” in which the player calls out “Challenge Round” before rolling the die and must guess the country without being read the 3 answer choices. If the player is incorrect the turn ends. If they are correct, they get to keep the card and roll again, but they must again answer the correct country with out hearing the answer choices. If they are wrong, they loose the card they previously won and the player to the right can try to guess the country. Whoever gets it right gets the card.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Prison: Can you escape?
description:
Prison - can you escape? is a strategy board game, which aims to organize an escape plan to break out of prison. It can be played for 2-6 players and during the game you may have setbacks in your plans! The game has 6 characters that have various attributes and traits that can lead to different strategies. The cards and action spaces on the board give it a different character as they can condition the strategies at any time during the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Chaining, Dice Rolling, Prisoner's Dilemma

name: Space Hops
description:
You're a space junker in the YCG System, where a strange phenomenon is taking over every corner of the galaxy: planets are disappearing only to be replaced by asteroids! Hope between planets, collide with other ships, and avoid solar flares to make it out of the asteroid fields. Collect the most space junk to win!

Use your Space Hop cards to travel across the planets, collect tools and upgrades ad you go and collect the most loot before asteroids fill the board!

Avoid solar flares and collide with your opponents to push them away from the best loot. Claim the Upgrade Expert card for bonus points by collecting the most ship upgrades.

A light strategy game with a random generated board to keep games fresh every time you play. Portable and easy to teach for all ages!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Set Collection

name: Ferret Flush
description:
Ferret Flush is a laugh-a-lot, easy-to-play card game for creatures who like to dig a little deeper. In some bizarrely funny situations, players explore the interplay between thoughts, feelings and actions. It’s a fine day to be a ferret.

The Goal: Earn the most points by the end of the adventure!

The Set Up: Shuffle the Situation Cards. Place the cards face down. Shuffle the Play Cards. Deal 5 cards to each creature. Place remaining Play Cards face down next to the Situation Cards

The Play: Dealer is the first Ferret.

Ferret turns up the top Situation Card, reads it out loud, & places it face up for all to see.

For every Situation Card, you’ll play 3 sets: Thought, Feeling, & Action.

Thought Set: All creatures (minus the Ferret) pick a Play Card from your hand with the best* thought for the situation. Pass Play Cards face down to the Ferret & pick up a new Play Card.

Ferret reads each thought out loud, picks a favorite, and places it face up below the Situation Card.

Feeling Set: Rinse & repeat. This time, pick the best* feeling to fit both the Situation and Thought.

Action Set: Again! Pick the best* action for the Situation, Thought, & Feeling.

If the Ferret picks your card for at least two sets, you win this round and earn a point. Keep the Situation Card to track your points. (Keep it face-up in front of you, not in your hand)

If you win three sets, that’s a Ferret Flush™! Keep the Situation Card & also draw an extra Play Card to add to your hand.

When there’s a three-way tie, those creatures must each act out the Feeling from the round. Ferret picks the best* actor to win the round.

Creature to the left of the last Ferret becomes the new Ferret.

Adventure ends when every creature has been the Ferret twice (3-4 creatures) or once (5-6 creatures). Creature with the most points wins.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Acting, Bias, Layering, Player Judge

name: Haunted Halloween: The Trick-or-Treat Game
description:
A game where players take on the role of trick-or-treaters in a haunted neighborhood going door-to-door to collect the most candy. Beware the ghosts who come out of the graveyard to steal your candy! Points are earned by collecting candy and visiting houses.
Players roll dice to move along the board through the graveyard to the houses. But they also roll a GHOST DICE, on their turn, to move the ghosts, who can steal candy from other players. When a player lands on a door-step, they spin the Trick-or-Treat spinner to see what happens. They could get more candy, there might be no one home, or they could trigger the Banshee. Keep an eye on the Banshee as she flies across the Full-Moon Tracker! The Banshee will send out more ghosts to capture your candy, adding to the suspense of your Halloween hijinks. Players can also pick up a BOOst Token that gives them a single-use power that can be game changing.

For those seeking a risky strategy, you can venture into the graveyard to raid the candy coffin. But be warned, this may invoke the wrath of the spirits guarding their pilfered treats.

So gather your family and prepare for an unforgettable Halloween adventure in "Haunted Halloween Trick-or-Treat"! Navigate the neighborhood, outsmart the ghosts, and claim the most candies to emerge as the ultimate champion of this eerie game of strategy and thrills. Can you survive the ghost gauntlet while you trick-or-treat? ”

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Events, Negotiation, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move, Semi-Cooperative Game, Static Capture, Take That

name: Epic Battles
description:
Epic Battles is a deck-building and dice-rolling game. Designed for quick learning and easy playability, Epic Battles is fun for people of all ages. Enough strategy for adults, simple to understand for kids. Epic Battles are sure to be enjoyed by everyone in your family!

Pick a castle, build up a defense, or charge your foe in the Epic tale based on medieval fantasy play.

Power-up cards and special attack cards give the game an epic twist. Just when you think your castle is a well-guarded fortress disaster hits! Plan your attacks carefully, your enemy is waiting to take advantage of your misfortune.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Multi-Use Cards

name: GLORP!
description:
GLORP! is a multiplayer, card-collection style game where the goal is to collect 7 of one type of card. There are currently 4 types of cards each with its own ability. Of the four there are:

Blorp: This card lets you draw a card
Yoink: This card lets you steal a random card from your target
Skraggle: This card forces your target to discard a card
Gwarg: This card is an instant play card, allowing you to guard agaisnt oncoming Yoinks or Skraggles.

The thing that makes this game interesting is the fact that the more cards you spend the greater the effect. For example: Playing 3 Blorps allows you to draw 4 cards. This allows for more strategy and chaos!

Set Up:

To set-up "GLORP!" take all cards out of the box and shuffle the deck, placing it in the center of the playing area.
Deal out 5 cards to every player
When are card or cards are used place them face up in a discard pile, This will shuffled and used as the main deck if you run out of cards.


HOW TO PLAY:
1. On your turn, you have two actions.
a. You may choose to play a card (cards) or not to.
b. Than at the end of your turn you draw a card from the
deck.
2. Once a player collects 7 of the same type of card the game is over!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Sverige
description:
Finally vacation! But don't count on any relaxation. Here, maximum speed applies from start to finish. You have 18 days to visit as many destinations as possible. You travel by car, plane or boat.

Rules.

And so before you is a gorgeous map of the Swedish Kingdom.
At the beginning of the game, 4 destination cards are revealed. To have time to collect as many cards as possible, 18 days are given.
Players move their chips, from city to city, following the directions given after the scroll of the arrow.
A spinning arrow can indicate the number of steps from 3 to 5, a question mark, a ticket, a day.
Steps can be used both backwards and forwards within a single move.
The question mark means that you will have to answer 1 out of 3 difficult questions (for adults) or 1 out of 2 easy ones (for children). Both categories of questions concern Sweden. The prize for the correct answer will be any of the opened 4 destination cards.
A ticket means the player receives an additional ticket (one is already available at the start), which can be used when flying or sailing on a ship.
1 day means that the player advances the chip on the board with 18 days of vacation one day ahead, thereby bringing its end closer.
Of course, the lucky one who visits the largest number of cities wins.

Fair winds, guys!

—user summary
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move

name: Masters of the Universe: Battleground – Wave 6: Fighting Foe Men Faction
description:
Heavy Weaponry

Take your game to the next level with the Battle Ram, an unstoppable armored vehicle that
can be used by any faction! With its rugged construction and powerful weaponry, the Battle
Ram can smash through enemylines and strike fear into their hearts. It's missile launchers
and mounted laser make it a versatile and deadly addition to any army, while its sturdy design
allows it to withstand even the most punishing attacks. Whether you are assaulting an enemy
stronghold or defending your own territory, the Battle Ram is an indispensable tool for
achieving victory on the battleground.

-description from publisher

Box contains:

- 1x Additional rules booklet
- 1x Token
- 1x Manual
- 1x Character mini
- 1x Hexagonal base
- 11x Cards
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Kalahari
description:
Welcome to the exciting world of Kalahari, a captivating board game set in the diverse and treacherous Kalahari desert. In this untamed wilderness that spans three different countries and endures extreme temperatures, survival is a fierce challenge for its inhabitants. Among them, Meerkats embody resilience as they bravely navigate a world filled with perils, including predators like eagles, snakes, and hyenas. But the dangers don't end there – rival Meerkat families also vie for dominance.

In Kalahari, you step into the role of a Meerkat queen, tasked with securing your family's supremacy in this harsh environment. It's time to prove the strength of your matriarchy.

Kalahari is a thrilling area control game for 2-4 players with a very light Meerkat placement element. By strategically pairing your dice rolls, you must decide which crucial locations to deploy your Meerkat meeples to.

The gameplay continues until players exhaust their supply of Meerkat meeples. However, once only one player remains with Meerkat meeples, the game reaches its final round, do your best to position your Meerkats wisely and faster than your opponents!

Carefully consider which locations to fight over because if both players have an equal number of Meerkats there, neither will gain control. To secure victory, players must employ their best strategies to claim the most valuable locations and complete secret objective cards. It is through these endeavors that one can attain the most points and emerge triumphant as the ultimate Meerkat family in the Kalahari.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hidden Victory Points, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Modular Board, Worker Placement

name: Alicorns
description:
Alicorns is "The Niece's Game," designed for my 5-year-old niece who loved it from the beginning. It has been showcased as a prototype at various fairs and has been adored by Moms with Daughters, Grandmothers with Granddaughters, Kids, and Families of all ages who played it with me. Now it's ready and printed :)

Alicorns are happy creatures when they all fly together, like the colors on a rainbow :)

If you're playing with 2 players, choose 4 Alicorns each. If you're playing with 3 or 4 players, choose 2 Alicorns each. If you have 5-8 players, choose 1 Alicorn each. Each card moves all the Alicorns illustrated on the card forward by one space. Each turn, starting with the youngest player and going clockwise, draw a card from the scattered and turned deck and move ALL the Unicorns with that characteristic or r don't use that card. The first Alicorn to cross the finish line... Is the winner!

For example, the "Yellow" card moves Sun and Star forward by one space.

On the website, you can see many examples and learn how to create new imaginative winged steeds invented by you!

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game
mechanics: Alliances, Drawing, Matching, Race

name: Hero Fight: The Board Game
description:
Hero Fight is a board game based on empowering one's hero to defeat opponents in epic battles.

The game consists of:
100 cards
3 dice
30 gold crystals
36 vital crystals

type of cards:
-heroes
-weapons
-armours
-potions
-catastrophes
-environments
-power

How to play:


Each player takes one hero card.
Each turn reveals an environment that defines various effects.
Players upgrade their heroes by purchasing weapons, armour and potions with gold crystals, and attack opposing heroes by reducing their vital crystals.
The hero who remains standing wins.


Card position:


The terrain consists of the hero card in the centre, the assigned weapon card on the right, the assigned armour card at the top and the assigned potion on the left.
Each player will have two slots in his hand where he can keep cards not assigned to his hero.


Dice:


attack die; is rolled by the attacking hero.
defence die; is rolled by the defending hero.
Fortune die; is rolled by the effects of an environment or a weapon or armour.


-PDF of the game rules in the files section (only in Italian, coming soon in English).

-If you have any advice or questions about the rules or the game feel free to leave a comment; we are neophytes in this field so any advice is welcome.

-instagram: hero.fight.blk

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Events, Investment, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Monster Hunter World: Iceborne – The Board Game: Absolute Power
description:
Absolute Power is an expansion containing new monsters, new weapons, new armors, new quests.

Coral Pukei-Pukei: A bird wyvern that stockpiles water inside its body, fortified by the plant life it consumes. When threatened it can expel a powerful stream from its mouth or tail.
Nargacuga: A flying wyvern covered in pitch black fur. It is extremely agile, especially on the ground, moving with explosive bursts of speed. Its eyes glow red when enraged.
Shrieking Legiana: A Legiana Variant shrouded in white frost. It specialises in freezing prey with a powerful chill, then swooping down to strike at them from overhead.
Tigrex: A flying wyvern of primitive origins, known for its thunderous roar and powerful legs that drive its overwhelming charge. Beware its claws and jaws!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Monster Hunter World: Iceborne – The Board Game: Velkhana Expansion
description:
Legend has it Velkhana can control the cold itself, and use its freezing breath to conjure massive ice spires to stand in your way. Find it, hunters, and end its frozen reign!

The Velkhana expansion adds this magnificent elder dragon and all its adrenaline-pumping quests, rare weapons, and powerful equipment crafting options to your pledge. That means:

❄️ New campaign quests
❄️ New arena quests for one-shot boss battles
❄️ New choice-driven narrative
❄️ Every craftable Velkhana weapon type — for all 14 hunters — from the video game

It also introduces a whole new way to win your campaign, because it includes a 5-star quest! Will you be the one to dethrone this crystalline monster, with its regal posture and crown of horns?

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Monster Hunter World: Iceborne – The Board Game: Namielle Expansion
description:
Legend has it Namielle commands water and channels lightning to produce explosive bursts of steam, and will paralyse those who get too close with its electrified water pools.

The Kickstarter exclusive Namielle expansion adds this mysterious XXL elder dragon (120mm base) and all its electrifying quests, rare weapons, and powerful equipment to your Iceborne board game! That means:

❄️ New campaign quests
❄️ New arena quests for one-shot boss battles with ANY Iceborne hunters
❄️ New choice-driven narrative
❄️ Every craftable Namielle weapon type — for all 14 hunters — from the video game

It also introduces a whole new way to win your campaign, because it includes a 5-star quest! Will you be the one to pin down this mysterious, Kickstarter exclusive elder dragon?

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Monster Hunter World: Iceborne – The Board Game: Seething Anger
description:
Seething Hunger is an expansion containing new monsters, new weapons, new armors, new quests.

Nightshade Paolumu: A Paolumu subspecies able to put prey to sleep. It produces a potent sedative gas, stored within its throat sac, that it can expel to knock out unwary foes. Proficient in aerial combat.
Glavenus: A scaled brute wyvern that wields its heavy blue tail like a blade. It grows hotter and more keen with each strike until it glows red.
Acidic Glavenus: This acidic subspecies has corrosive fluid crystallised on its tail, spraying acid with each swing.
Silver Rathalos: A rare and dangerous Rathalos species with a
Shining silver carapace and enlarged spikes, more prone to rage than other Rathalos. When enraged, its breath grows more lethal and it gains a new set of attacks.
Seething Bazelgeuse: A Bazelgeuse variant that exists in a heated state. Its explosive scales burn even hotter than those
of its counterpart, increasing in number and blast radius as combat continues.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Monster Hunter World: Iceborne – The Board Game: Hunter's Arsenal Expansion
description:
The weapons you craft, and the monsters you hunt to craft them, will change your experience in every campaign. Different hunters need different materials, and more hunters means more options and more hunting party combinations!

This expansion includes:
❄️ 5 unique hunter weapon classes
❄️ Starting decks and equipment upgrades these hunters can craft from EVERY monster* in Iceborne. That’s 350 cards!
❄️ One-shot arena quests for all 5 hunters to face every monster in Iceborne*
❄️ Forge Reference books for all 5 hunters, to help in your hunting and crafting plans from one quest to the next!

*Except Elder Dragon equipment and arena quests, which come in the Elder Dragon boxes.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Monster Hunter World: Iceborne – The Board Game: Hunter's Arsenal II Expansion
description:
The weapons you craft, and the monsters you hunt to craft them, will change your experience in every campaign. Different hunters need different materials, and more hunters means more options and more hunting party combos!

This expansion includes:
❄️ 5 unique hunter weapon types
❄️ Starting decks and equipment upgrades these hunters can craft from EVERY monster* in Iceborne. That’s 350 cards!
❄️ One-shot arena quests for all 5 hunters to face every monster in Iceborne*
❄️ Forge Reference books for all 5 hunters, to help in your hunting and crafting plans from one quest to the next!

*Except Elder Dragon equipment and arena quests, which come in the Elder Dragon boxes.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Gladiators: The Card Game
description:
To deliver deadly wounds and bring down your enemy, you must pursue and out-speed their escape. But can the paltry might of your attack penetrate their defenses? Become more powerful by changing your trait cards, and use your cunning to collect advantageous combinations—doubles, triples, and even the game-ending quadruple!

Players begin with four cards in front of them which represent their traits—speed, attack, defense, and health. Think of these traits as the player’s stats: the higher the number, the stronger, unless you seek to debilitate your opponent with the lower ones using a pair.

Each player’s turn consists of a variety of actions that they can perform depending on the cards currently in front of them. Players can choose to “focus” one of their traits, changing its value (whether higher or lower), by flipping over a card from a deck in the center of the playing field. Or they can choose to “attack” an opponent if they have sufficient speed and attack over an opponent’s own speed and defense, dealing damage to them. Finally, they can choose to perform a “gambit” on an opponent, in which they sacrifice a pair in front of them to replace an opponent’s trait (perhaps with something worse).

Additionally, players have a hand of trait cards that they draw under special circumstances and keep secret from others. When performing an action, they may use the cards in their hand to directly change their traits, offering themselves a secretive edge.

In short, Gladiators players compete to have the best stat values and try to inhibit those of their opponents. They may rely on the luck of the draw, or they may use their wits and cunning: to fight to become the last Gladiator standing.

—description from the designer
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action/Event, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, I Cut, You Choose, Layering, Player Elimination, Set Collection, Stat Check Resolution, Sudden Death Ending, Tags, Take That, Trick-taking, Variable Set-up

name: Rocket Ranchers: Severe Weather
description:
This is the first expansion for Rocket Ranchers Herding Cats in Space. Severe Weather adds various new cards to add to the wilderness deck. When added to the wilderness grid, these cards will change the way you play!

Gravity Wells prevent you from taking adjacent cards. Meteor Showers force you to leave behind a card from your beam. Power Storms prevent you from taking space cats. More effects are included in the box along with dogship tokens in your player color that function as a timer for the weather effect.

Will the weather ruin your plans or will you take advantage of these new effects to build the best ranch possible?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Set Collection

name: Ruse: Roll N' Write
description:
The foxes are busy gathering the resources they need to raise their kits, while the curious little ones explore the tunnels of their den in search of fabulous discoveries.

Can you accumulate the necessary resources to ensure the survival of your pack?

Over four rounds, you must collect the necessary resources in vital territories, fulfill objectives, and raise as many kits as possible while developing their instincts. The player who accumulates the most victory points (VP) wins the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Automatic Resource Growth, Dice Rolling, Increase Value of Unchosen Resources, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Track Movement

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Egyptian Desert and Snowy Mountains Railroad Board Pack
description: A new folding double-sided railroad board with new missions.
categories: American West, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Trains
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Hungry King Charles
description: Roll 3d6 to find out what King Charles would like to eat then deliver it (tiddlywink it) for points! You get three food items per turn and the player with the most points - after a set number of turns - is the winner!
mechanics: Flicking

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Terrors of the Deep Enemy Theme Pack
description: A Pharrox vampire mini-boss.
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Shameless
description:
A party card game of action, complete your dare tasks to collect points & win the title of MOST SHAMELESS! This fun game for friends, couples, or family combines an old-fashioned card game with our modern world of social media. Are you brave enough to share your dare on social media?

Simply separate the SHAME and LESS card decks. You’re ready to go! Players complete card tasks & collect points until someone reaches 13 points & wins! Keep the adult party going & play all through game night!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Skies of Victory
description:
Skies of Victory is a tabletop wargame that allows players to command squadrons of bombers and fighters. Set about a century before "Flight Command", the player is put in the shoes of a commander in charge of establishing a new airbase to wage war against the enemy. You must make decisions, such as repairs, replacements, and aircraft management, that will impact your overall campaign.

Each turn, you will control squadrons of bombers, and possibly their fighter escorts, moving them along a flight path towards the enemy targets. You gain points by destroying targets. The more points you gain, the better the chance of a successful mission, and ultimately, a successful campaign.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Super Dice Battle
description:
Choose your fighter and play your combo cards to KO your opponent before they KO you. Super Dice Battle uses a custom set of dice to mimic a video game controllers D-Pad and Buttons to create your combos. Utilize the Super Die for more powerful attacks and unleash your most powerful combos to become the Super Dice Champion!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: Dawn of Battle: Designer's Edition
description:
Dawn of Battle is a hex-and-counter war game system that allows players to experience battles before the modern era. The game spans 3,000 years of combat, from the age of Greek generals to the invention of gunpowder.

The game system is straight forward and action packed. Players depend upon the quality of their army's leadership to provide orders needed to maneuver their armies and strike against the enemy. The better an army's command, the more flexibility it has to move, rally, and attack.

Also included are supplementary rules that cover free deployment in scenarios, barbarian charges, command control and impetuosity, elephant panic, and random events.

Each scenario notes the disposition of the armies that engaged at a historical battle and the terrain that encompassed the battlefield. Units include a variety of infantry (including hoplites and the Macedonian phalanx), cavalry (including chariots and mounted archers), missile units (including slingers, longbows, and early gunpowder weapons, and special units such as elephants and war wagons.

The game's primary engine is comprised of an action deck used to determine command, the randomly determined outcomes of actions, and melee combat. Additionally, action cards provide special effects that players can use to enhance their units' abilities as well as the narrative of the play experience. The deck ensures that no two games are ever the same.

The base game includes twenty scenarios:


Megiddo, 1457 BCE
Che, 717 BCE
Marathon, 490 BCE
Gaugamela, 331 BCE
Ipsus, 301 BCE
Heraclea, 280 BCE
Lake Trasimeno, 217 BCE
Raphia, 217 BCE
Illipa, 206 BCE
Zama, 202 BCE
Sabis River, 57 BCE
Pharsalus, 48 BCE
Hastings, 1066 CE
Dyrrhachium, 1081 CE
Fornham, 1173 CE
Bouvines, 1214 CE
Kalka River, 1223 CE
Crêçy, 1346 CE
Poitiers, 1356 CE
Aljubarrota, 1386 CE


In addition to these battles, the game includes comprehensive guidelines on how to create your own scenarios, making "Dawn of Battle" a complete system usable to recreate virtually any battle from the ancient world to early gunpowder.

This Designer's Edition of Dawn of Battle is an update to the original Dawn of Battle released by Worthington Games in 2021. This edition includes all new scenarios as well as 120 double-sided terrain tiles.

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Fighting, Medieval, Renaissance, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Command Cards, Events, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Impulse Movement, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Omens of Destiny
description:
A story-rich cooperative board game for 1 to 4 players, Omens of Destiny provides an addictive blend of strategy and luck that pulls you along its fantastical quest and combat-laden lands.

Each of the seven characters from which you can choose have several unique racial and background abilities to draw from. During the course of any game you will have opportunity to increase your character's stats, gain new gear and items, and even learn to wield powerful magic by gaining control of the Mystic Forces.

There are a host of Main Quests available that support both one-shot sessions and legacy/campaign play!

Achieve victory by completing your quest objectives before the Corruption takes over the realm.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Legacy Game

name: Grave Trigger
description:
Grave Trigger is an apocalyptic sci-fi miniatures game where players control humans terminally bound to Animus Reactors—sentient, techno-organic armor that feeds on those who wield it in exchange for terrifying power.

Move your models to any point within line of sight and leap off of buildings with dramatic aerial attacks—no tape measures required.

Use explosive weapon techniques and hurl terrain at your targets in a diceless, skill-based combat system.

Losing life fuels your Animus, empowering momentum-shifting abilities and hidden Damage States to surprise opponents.

Multi-act scenarios with evolving mechanics and branching paths make each game of Grave Trigger a unique story.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck Construction, Interrupts, Line of Sight, Modular Board, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Three Dimensional Movement, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Pulp Adventure Allies Set
description:
Guides, a camel, a damsel, a sidekick...Now you're ready to find the lost tombs!

This new set comes with a variety of fun Ally characters to join your Heroes on their Adventures, including 3 Guides to help find your way through the dark halls and buried chambers of the Tombs (it's always good to have someone else that can check out what that sound was in the dark), a Pack Camel to carry your gear and tools on an expedition into the desert, a Damsel with attitude that can't help but get herself into trouble, but is also prone to lucky finds and feisty sneak attacks, and a trusty Sidekick that has been on many Adventures with you and you can always count on them to bring the right tool for the job and to balance out your own shortcomings.

This set also comes with a host of new cards, including Gear, Darkness, and different types/personalities for your Sidekick. It even has cards for some Legendary Sidekicks!
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Huradrim
description:
Huradrim is a party game where 2 to 10 players are brewmasters looking to gather the right ingredients to brew the best beer for the king of dwarves!

The gameplay combines mechanics of collecting components and discarding the right cards for fast rounds!

You keep your score with a points card or try it as a drinking game! (please drink responsibly)
mechanics: Set Collection

name: Zoollywood: Stretchgoal Box
description:
The strechgoal from the kickstarter campaign.
Adds to the game:
30 new terrain tiles
35 new event cards
7 new scene cards
1 new barrier
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Riders of the Storm Enemy Theme Pack
description:
An Enemy Pack themed for the Hell Train and the infamous Mutant Outlaws known as the Scafford Gang. This is the second set of a new type called an Enemy Theme Pack. It's a great way to add a bunch of exciting new Enemies, cards, and Missions that are all themed for a specific World or faction in the game.

The Scafford Gang are the most notorious mutant outlaws in the Southwest! Making their hideouts in the old caves and mines around the ruins of Brimstone, they have becoming grossly mutated by the cursed radiation of the Dark Stone. As their infamy grows, so too do their ranks, welcoming in any fellow mutants that have been ousted by the locals or that are just looking to make a dishonest buck!

Led by Colonel Scafford and his original gang of confederates (including his miscreant sons), the Scafford Gang mostly loots travelers on the road, knocks over frontier town banks, and raids caravans for their gold and precious Dark Stone cargo. But when it comes to bigger heists, the Colonel’s daughter, Captain Belle Scafford, rides out with her mutant Outriders to race down Trains in search of the big scores.

The Riders of the Storm Enemy Theme Pack comes with a host of new Scafford Gang Enemies to challenge your Heroes, as well as new Scafford-themed Missions for the Hell Train, and over 40 new Game cards with assorted counters.

Captain Belle Scafford is the favorite daughter of the Colonel and an expert horsewoman, deadly duelist with a sabre, and a rogue of the highest order. She has a twinkle in her eye, and a cutthroat smile, with a ruthless disposition. Many men have died underestimating her skill, both on horseback and with a blade. Quick on the draw, she never shoots a man in the back… they are rarely fast enough to turn and run.

The Scafford Outriders are mutant train robbers that descend from the hills to hit the rail lines that run through the valleys and gulches near Brimstone. Riding thunderous horses tainted by the Void energy of the black rock, these wild outlaws use their weird and wondrous mutations to great effect during a heist. With slippery skin to squeeze through the train’s windows, flailing tentacles to climb onto the rooftops, or extra limbs to hold up several passengers at once, they hit and run, leaving only a slimy trail and the faint echo of cackling laughter in their wake.

When extra muscle is needed to tear the doors off a train or rip a steel safe to pieces, the Safecrackers always get the job done. These hulking mutants can charge up alongside a train, running at full bore before making a massive leap to land on the rooftop. With meaty barbed claws and rippling muscle, they can shred right through anything that stands in their way, whether it’s the side of a train car, a reinforced bank safe, or even the unfortunate marshals that try to stop them. No cage can keep them in, no wall can keep them out.

Though afflicted with a hideous troll body and diminutive size, Mortimer J. (Morty) Scafford makes up for his shortcomings by being the best heist planner and safe breaker in the West. Armed with the tools of the trade and a custom stethoscope for fine detail work, he often rides into battle perched atop one of the massive mutant Safecrackers to get him where he needs to be. Planning every heist down to the last detail, Morty Scafford leaves nothing to chance. If you think you know what he’s going to do, he’s most likely already been and gone, and he probably stole your wallet too.
categories: Adventure, American West, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Sea Beasts: A Bloody Voyage
description:
Once a Viking raider, you now live simply beside the Nordic Seas with a reputation for your beast-slaying talents. Tales of your past feats were shared with the nearby villages, gaining the attention of a wealthy merchant who hires you and your partner to protect his boat across the terrible beast-infested waters.

In this fully cooperative 2-player game, you must plan your strikes to draw beast blood, gaining more actions in a blood rage while maneuvering around your ever-damaged ship on cruel waters filled with horror and strange fate.

Keep afloat, maintain your precious cargo, and arrive in port to collect your bounty of silver! The efficiency of your voyage will determine how great your reward is or whether you should hang up your weapons once and for all.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Contracts, Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Shakespeare's First Folio
description:
Shakespeare’s First Folio has players taking the role of printers in the early Seventeenth Century competing to print the first folio of Shakespeare’s plays.

The game begins with the Deck of Plays being dealt out to each player. The deck consists of 36 cards in three suits (Comedies, Histories and Tragedies). Each player may keep one card for each trick they took (and pay one coin for each kept card). The rest of the cards are returned to create the draw deck for the Deck of Plays.

The game then transitions to a worker placement game with four possible actions:

Gather resources (from the dice in the marketplace)
Purchase a play (for 1 one of each resource - paper, type, ink)
Hire a person (for 2 coins)
Spin the Wheel of Fortune (the last player to do so in the turn will be the first player in the following turn)


After several turns, when there four or less cards left in the Deck of Plays, the game transitions to the final auction for the remaining plays.

Final scoring is thus:
1 point for each play
2 points for each set (same number of all three suits)
X points for the longest run in each suit (so 2-3-4-5-6 of comedies would score 5 points)
X points for certain personage cards
3 points for most coins (or 2 points to each player tied)

The most points wins and will print Shakespeare's First Folio!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Set Collection, Trick-taking, Worker Placement

name: Stargather: A Cosmic Game
description:
In Stargather, you will race to create stars as you collect colorful stardust and form nebulas full of marvelous discoveries.

On your turn, you will draw 3 tokens from the Galaxy bag. Collecting stardust will grow your nebulas. Discoveries will help your nebulas become stars faster, like the Comet that lets you draw an extra token on your turn. When the nebula is big enough, it will "ignite" and become a star.
Each star has a special one-time effect. If the color of the star matches the color of your nebula, it will have a more powerful "brighter" effect.
Stars' effects can cause big chain reactions, letting you ignite several nebulas on your turn.
Collect 7 stars to win the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Events, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Set Collection

name: Mischief
description:
The Night King and The Queen of Spring are getting married to settle the ancient feud between the seelie and unseelie faerie courts. The players, however, are the scheming faerie nobility who stand to lose - or gain - everything as all of fae politics has come to suddenly hinge on the outcome of this one wild party.

All the fae of Tir na-Nog - from the cruellest redcap who serves the Unseelie King to the most beautiful sprite who serves Titania and her seelie court - have been called to celebrate, seated on long tables in a beautiful forest glade under a full moon. And of course it descends into chaos as the faeries dance, make merry, and scheme to make their rivals look foolish in front of the new couple so that they can assure their place in the new pecking order. Choose your allies wisely and ensure that through a well-timed prank, you come out on the right side of unbridled faerie Mischief.

Mischief is a hand management for strategy card game for 2-4 players that plays in about 30 minutes. Play opposite-suited cards to pull clever faerie pranks and play sequences to bolster support and friendship to shut them down to decide who looks best at each colored table. At the end of the game, reveal the cards in your hand to determine whether you have predicted correctly which factions were best positioned to impress the King and Queen, or best of all - surprise everyone at the party by turning the tables at the end of the night.

Mischief is the first title from Dan Cassar's Dream Cult Game Studio, an imprint he hopes to use to share a unique brand of games that is deep, elegant and accessible.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Closed Drafting, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Scarface 1920: Melvin Purvis
description: Includes the Melvin Purvis miniature to replace the G-Men token from the Bloody Business expansion. The pack includes 3 exclusive G-Men cards.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Tiny Laser Heist
description:
A high stakes, 3D heist game!

Everyone at the table is a career criminal eyeing retirement. Whether you’re the mastermind or hired hand, you want to get involved in as many jobs as possible and make as much money as you can. Walk away from a series of jewel heists as the winner with the most money by cooperating with other burglars to break into a vault. Work together to physically move “padlocks” using tiny hands and steal the jewels they’re protecting. The harder the heist, the bigger the payout – whoever ends up with the most money wins.

During each turn of Tiny Laser Heist, a player becomes the Mastermind and selects his team. Players not selected now play against the team to stop the heist. Both teams play action cards to determine the teams abilities and obstacles the team must face during the heist. The team then has 90 seconds to steal the jewels. If the you do, the Mastermind picks up and distributes money cards to his team members. Play continues until all the money is gone.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Economic, Party Game
mechanics: Action Drafting, Action Timer, Negotiation, Stacking and Balancing, Take That, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Evan and Josh's Very Special Games Company

name: Monsters Outnumbered
description:
Monsters Outnumbered is a math-based card game that uses strategy, deception, and a team of monsters who have taken on number form. Players sabotage each other's Hordes (equations) with calculated assaults while tactically working to strengthen their own. Only the most cunning will be able to command their monsters to victory by achieving the highest Horde in the deadly arena. Players accomplish this using addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, and ability cards. Games can be played in teams or free-for-all.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math, Number
mechanics: Finale Ending, Hand Management, Memory, Multi-Use Cards, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Open Drafting, Sudden Death Ending, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: Monster Hunter World: Iceborne – The Board Game: Overpowering Hunger
description:
Overpowering Hunger is an expansion containing new monsters, new weapons, new armors, new quests.

Fulgur Anjanath: Feared for its sheer strength and thunderous power, this Anjatiath subspecies electrifies its jaws and dorsal membrane to strike down its foes.
Brachydios: This marine-blue brute wyvern uses its saliva to prime the sticky slime coating its massive arms, rendering it highly explosive.
Raging Brachydios: A large and unusual Brachydios variant that is even more aggressive. Its body is covered in highly explosive slime that's quick to detonate.
Gold Rathian: A rare gleaming gold Rathian species with exceptionallv strong scales. When wreathed in hellfire, its breath grows more lethal and its tail swipes more broad.
Savage Deviljho: A mutated Deviljho variant, driven mad by its overpowering hunger. It will attempt to feed on all it sees.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Monster Hunter World: Iceborne – The Board Game: Ruiner Nergigante Expansion
description:
The Ruiner Nergigante expansion adds this XXL spiked elder dragon (120mm base!) and all its adrenaline-pumping quests, rare weapons, and powerful equipment crafting options to your game. That means:


New campaign quests
New arena quests for one-shot boss battles
New choice-driven narrative
Every craftable Ruiner Nergigante weapon type — for all 14 hunters — from the video game


It also introduces a whole new way to win your campaign, because it includes a 5-star quest! Will you withstand the onslaught to take this formidable threat down?

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Monster Hunter World: Iceborne – The Board Game: Blackveil Vaal Hazak Expansion
description:
The Blackveil Vaal Hazak expansion adds this unsettling XXL elder dragon (120mm base!) and all its skin-crawling quests, rare weapons, and powerful equipment crafting options to your game. That means:


New campaign quests
New arena quests for one-shot boss battles
New choice-driven narrative
Every craftable Blackveil Vaal Hazak weapon type — for all 14 hunters — from the video game


It also introduces a whole new way to win your campaign, because it includes a 5-star quest!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Gueroy
description:
Gueroy is a strategic battles board game in a fantasy world.
Choose one of the two Heroes in one of the 4 available Clans and face your opponent in a tactical fast-paced match.
Use Essence Crystals, an in-game currency and Victory Condition token, to summon creatures from your Clan to help you in the confrontation.
Move your pieces through the hexagonal board, perform Attacks, Actions and Effects and collect Treasures in this competitive PvP.
Fulfill your Essence Well, destroy your opponent's Well or kill your opponent's Hero and you will prevail.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Income, Moving Multiple Units, Team-Based Game

name: Galaxy
description:
Galactic regions are defined based on the age of their stars
Stars explode and perish at the end of the 6th galactic year of their life
The regions of the galaxy are being divided
The emperor has chosen you to rule these areas
choose the best areas for yourself
Blame the older areas on others
Who will be the ruler of better regions?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Team-Based Game, Tile Placement

name: Coffee Thief
description:
Compete against rival coffee store owners in this fast and fun card game. Fulfil orders quickly and add special ingredients to score big, but watch out - the thief might steal your coffee!

Coffee Thief is a 2-6 player card game involving strategy, a little bit of luck and straight out theft. Players take turns to collect ingredients, fulfil orders and steal from their opponents.

Play for 10min or 10 hours, its up to you! Coffee Thief is easy to learn - offering a unique mechanic that heightens the intensity of the game as you play.

But beware, you never know when the thief is just around the corner.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Melding and Splaying

name: Legends of Nara
description:
Legends of Nara takes you on a thrilling journey where you step into the shoes of aspiring adventurers, seeking to establish your reputation and become legendary Heroes in this vast realm. With captivating RPG elements and a rich fantasy aesthetic, this game offers an unforgettable gaming experience.

On your turn, you'll have several options. You can move to explore new locations, fight formidable monsters, make a tactical retreat, or rest to regain your strength. Each action has its own consequences, so choose wisely!

As you explore, landing on a small location will present you with an event card. These cards may reveal monstrous creatures, potential companions, or other surprising encounters, adding an element of unpredictability to your journey.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Storytelling, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Warfighter: Fantasy Expansion #1 – Lanolar: Elven Battle Mage
description:
This Warfighter Fantasy Expansion adds 48 cards and 6 Counters to your Backpack!

Lanolar uses both physical combat skills and Mana spells to overcome the forces of evil!

This expansion offers 48 cards including:

6 Player Hero cards
6 Squad Hero cards
16 Skill cards
8 Spell cards
2 Armour/Shield cards
4 Item cards
5 Action cards + 1 Location Marker

—description from the back of the box

Merrick's immense strength and toughness means he is essential in the fight against evil!

All who enter the Temple may Smite the unholy abominations festering in the Dungeons.

Knowledge is power and may your enemies disintegrate from your very touch.

9 Item cards

—description from the back of the box

description:
This Warfighter Fantasy Expansion adds 48 cards and 6 Counters to your Backpack!

"...you thought the deep was hot, it is... until you get deeper, then ice fills your veins..."

This expansion offers 48 cards including:

—description from the back of the box

description:
This Warfighter Fantasy Expansion adds 48 cards and 6 Counters to your Backpack!

Demons! Zombies! Skeletons! Summoners!

This expansion offers 48 cards including:

5 On the Adventure cards
13 Location cards
15 Hostile cards
2 Gear cards
13 Item cards

—description from the back of the box
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

description:
This Warfighter Fantasy Expansion adds 48 cards and 6 Counters to your Backpack!

"...Dragon? I haven't seen one, but if I saw one... I wouldn't be having this conversation..."

This expansion offers 48 cards including:

5 On the Adventure cards
11 Location cards
17 Hostile cards
8 Item cards
4 Gear cards
2 Armour+Shield cards
1 Weapon card

—description from the back of the box
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Game of Drone
description:
Game Overview: A board game for 1 to 4 players. The goal is to use cards to get the drone to the goal point.
Game Genre: Grid movement, card draw, cooperative game.
Game Rules: Each turn, place a card and flip it simultaneously to check the number. Move the drone by comparing numbers. Success when the drone reaches the goal.
Game Components: A deck of playing cards required on the print page of the PnP file (jokers excluded). Includes areas for placing cards and moving the drone. Part of the print page can be used as a Meeple.
Game Features: You can't directly say the card numbers. The game progresses without speaking the numbers.

Everyone can download this game's Rule Book below.

English Rule Book : https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ERd9ljVPGdj0gkclpn3YnlhDMhA...
Korean Rule Book : https://drive.google.com/file/d/1gos43Kbj7cN8rZpOP_N_y3kYnUD...

And Print page Download here
https://drive.google.com/file/d/11Ibf1Wovwa_QyHx_YIdVgxSXGhh...

Game Of Drone is optimized for printing on A4 paper.

—description from the designer
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Hand Management

name: NOH
description:
NOH combines strategy and art, bringing the magic of traditional Japanese mask theater to your gaming table. In NOH, players take on the role of leaders of a troupe of Japanese Noh theater artists during the Edo period, where they are invited to present the most beautiful and harmonious sequences of performances at a festival celebrating the birthday of Shogun Ieyasu Tokugawa, a great enthusiast of Noh theater. In NOH, players will compete against each other to determine which theater company will gain the most prestige among the nobles in feudal Japan, ultimately becoming sponsored by the Shogun himself.

An elegant card game combined with the use of custom dice, featuring the exquisite illustrations of one of the greatest masters of Japanese woodblock printing: Tsukioka Kōgyo (1869-1927).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: Fire & Ice Miniatures Adventure Game
description:
A tactical skirmish game for 2 or more players. In this competitive wargame, the heroes of Firekeep battle the diabolical forces of Icepeak for domination over the realms of men and beast, bringing Frank Frazetta's unfettered primal imagination.

Also includes rules-lite mechanics for continuing the adventure through narrative-driven roleplay.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Fantasy, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Role Playing

name: Mosh Pit
description:
Stand up. Form a circle.
Shuffle your 12 cards.

Everybody will at the same time look at their top card, shout out its name and show the move on the card. All the while looking out for other players doing the same.

When you have eye contact with another player doing the same move, you both drop the card and do the same with the next card.

First player to drop their last card wins.
mechanics: Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Robo Rally Transformers
description:
The fastest robots in the universe have converged on Velocitron to race in the legendary Speedia 500 for the right to rule the planet. This year’s competition promises to be a real rough and tumble affair. So start your engines, charge your weapons, and keep your eyes on the prize! After all: you win, you rule!

In Robo Rally: Transformers, players can choose between six Transformers robots, each with their own upgrades that give them unique advantages and identities. Players can convert between bot and alt (or vehicle) modes to better navigate the many roads, buildings, and obstacles that make up each race. The game features four new double-sided game boards, representing the city and desert landscapes of Velocitron.

Features

- Transformers that convert from Bot Mode to Alt Mode
- New racecourses in a “Cybertronian” city or desert style
- New elements like Buildings, High Speed Roads, Moving Walkways, Bombs and Jump Ramps
- New planning cards to ‘drift’ in addition to the usual program actions
- Includes 6 Transformers miniatures in their bot mode
- Over 80 different possible race course making for great replayability
mechanics: Action Queue, Bias, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Programmed Movement, Race, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: DicTaters
description:
"A hugely horrible game for hugely horrible people in a really very bigly way!"

Play a famous dictator from history or an aspiring one in modern day! Build your empire with Industry and Military. Score Victory Points for accumulating Opulence while watching your Subjects starve! Score more Victory Points by committing Atrocities against your subjects! But having all this much fun has its consequences… Keep your Civil Unrest in check or you’ll face assassination! Run PR campaigns to lower your International Notoriety to keep the UN from invading! Use Play Cards to affect other players or yourself to adjust Unrest or Notoriety tracks, lose or obtain Industry, Military, or Opulence, or temporarily affect what they can do. The first player who reaches the end of their tracks triggers End Of Game then all count their victory points.

DicTaters is a potato themed, fact based card game with hugely amounts of history spread throughout. Cards resemble things and actions taken by real-life dictators and those who oppose them. With a satirical tone, DicTaters uses humor to make the topic of horrifically cruel regimes approachable for conversation. Players learn how dictators operate and recognize the same patterns in today’s leaders.

If you're on Facebook you can check us out here too: https://www.facebook.com/groups/3273865592943765

HQ: https://whatweretheythinkinggames.com/
categories: Card Game, Educational, Humor, Territory Building
mechanics: Finale Ending, Hand Management, Hot Potato, Interrupts, Race

name: Caveman Rumble
description:
Match colors, steal dino eggs and dinosaurs. Unleash your inner caveman on this new egg-citing cardgame!
Join our adorable little cavemen on a 2-6 player cardgame, on the hunt for delicious eggs and dinosaurs by simply matching colors, BUT ALSO adding a kick of competitiveness and strategy by STEALING, DESTROYING, and BETRAYING your fellow cave friends?

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Fantasy, Humor, Party Game, Prehistoric
mechanics: Action Points, Drawing, End Game Bonuses, Events, Lose a Turn, Matching, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Take That, Traitor Game

name: Rock, Paper, Saurus!
description:
An amazing educational game based on rock, paper, scissors for any lover of dinosaurs ages 5 to 65 million. Learn about fascinating dinosaurs and the Mesozoic periods in which they lived. Saurus beats paper, paper beats rock and rock beats Saurus in a game of Dino-domination!
Deal each player 10 cards and place the remaining cards face down in the middle of the table. The dealer will then flip over the top card of this deck, revealing the card you must beat.
Everyone shouts “Rock, Paper, Saurus!” and lays down their card. Cards have values from 1 to 10 and ranked mesozoic periods; Jurassic beats Triassic and Cretaceous beats them all.
Saurus beats paper, paper beats rock and rock beats Saurus. If there are two dinos of the same value the carnivore will always beat the herbivore.
Players earn 1 point for each round won. Once players have played all 10 cards in their hand the game is over and whoever has the most points wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Trick-taking

name: Middle Earth: The Lidless Eye
description:
Middle-Earth: The Lidless Eye is an intriguing card game designed for 1 to 9 players, who design their own unique decks.

You play one of the nine Nazgul, the shadowy Ringwraiths in the service of Sauron, the Evil One.

Influence minions, who form companies and perform missions or undertake quests on your behalf. Journey afar-struggling with a host of hazards and the dangers of death or corruption. Gather resources, including allies, factions, artifacts, and lore.

Compete with other Ringwraiths to do the most to strengthen the curse of the Lord of the Rings.

—description from the back of the box
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Ethos
description:
Ethos is a cooperative survival board game featuring independently crafted game pieces and a wooden four-sided die, along with uniquely themed illustratons for all fans of fantasy. Embark on a new adventure with every playthrough by navigating the uniquely wondrous world of Ethos, and vanquish the Three Beasts.

Play cooperatively with 2 to 4 players, as well as single player campaigns. Gameplay generally lasts for 1 to 2 hours per campaign. Suggested for players ages 13 and older.

Created and designed by Raziel Rosen

All text by Rasiel Rosen

With illustrations repurposed for the board game based on the original artworks of Jon Sideriadis, including hexagon tiles named Paradigm, Dysphoria, Reincarnation and Sanctanimity.

Illustrated by Deckyyuriadi and Illustrasu

Solsayer Figurines designed by ARhisTory

Die designed by Wood Tactics

—description from the creator
mechanics: Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Middle-earth: Against the Shadow
description:
Against the Shadow is the first expansion set for Middle-earth: The Lidless Eye ICE’s collectible card game designed for one to nine players.
Create your own personal deck for this intriguing game and step into J.R.R. Tolkien’s marvelous world.
Expand your collectible card portfolio with this set of 170 new, beautifully illustrated, tradable game cards.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: LoreCraft
description:
Cards Come Alive in this collaborative, story-telling game; improvise a plan and unleash your imagination to complete secret goals!

In LoreCraft, you're trying to achieve a hidden Goal, which is accomplished based on your Story. However you cannot tell your own Story! Instead, you'll be playing Subjects to help guide your fellow players into telling it. You can only watch in horror as they use the clues you laid out for them to decide what happens, which can range from grande, bizarre nonsense to concise, well-crafted prose! In the end, if they can determine your Goal, you all gain points as a team. If they also achieved your Goal during the Story, you all gain extra points.

LoreCraft is endlessly replayable, but we included 3 alternative modes anyway!

- Card Effects - Now you have to decide not only which Subjects are best for your Story, but which Effects you want as well!
- Competitive - Cut throat group? Can't share the glory? Everyone for themselves!
- Hardcore - Increased difficulty for true veterans.
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Player Judge, Push Your Luck, Semi-Cooperative Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling, Voting

name: Legends of Lorem
description:
Together with your fellow adventurers, you will explore the deepest reaches of the wilderness, bustling cityscapes, and mysteries of Lorem. Choose your adventures carefully as not all is as peaceful as it seems on the continent of Lorem.

Legends of Lorem is a tabletop roleplaying game designed to be learned in as little as thirty minutes so you can quickly dive into the rich stories and landscapes of Lorem.

In the tradition of the most popular tabletop roleplaying games, players can create their own stories or use a prewritten story module as they explore this exciting game.

Gameplay varies depending on the stamina of the players, and their chosen adventure styles. Stories can be designed for short 90-minute one-shot adventures or regular multi-week game nights with your companions.

Designed for use in mental health clinics, schools, and community programs this game is simple enough to accommodate the varied skill levels of players without compromising any of the immersive storytelling of other popular TRPGS. This game can be used at home just for fun but is designed to help improve interpersonal effectiveness skills, anxiety management skills, and executive functioning skills. You'll be having so much fun you wont even notice that you are learning important life skills while you play.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Role Playing
publishers: Stubbs Music Therapy and Counseling, LLC

name: REDLINE: Siege – Sapper Deck
description:
Ambush and trap your enemies during combat with deadly landmines when you bring the Crimson Pact of Mars Sapper expansion deck to battle! Overwhelm your enemy with the CPMs new SWARM ability or use efreets with the new REAR GUARD ability to protect your flanks in combat. Then set traps by deploying deadly landmines to the fight to damage unlucky enemy units!

Victory is yours with the power of the CPM Sapper deck!

Battle your friends! REDLINE: Tactical Card Combat is all about battling in simultaneous combat using powerful efreets and cunning tactics to control the battlefield.
Complete 64 card REDLINE deck to expand your REDLINE gameplay.
Includes 2 General cards to lead your forces into battle!
New card type! Strategy cards change how you approach battle!
Sapper Deck: Deploy landmines on missions you control to damage enemy units with every odd dice roll!
Harness the power of new game mechanics, SWARM and REAR GUARD.
Includes 2 limited edition WW2 poster strategy cards and and the 6 card alternate art Throwback Pack!
Requires REDLINE: Tactical Card Combat Core Set to play.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: REDLINE: Siege – Siegecraft Expansion Deck
description:
Crush your enemies with overwhelming firepower when you bring the United Nations of Earth Siegecraft deck to battle! Prepare for every outcome when you use the new INTEL ability to setup your next turn or use efreets with the new REAR GUARD ability to protect your flanks in combat. Then build and protect your heavy artillery to win the war of attrition and defeat your opponent!

Victory is yours with the power of the UNE Siegecraft deck!

Battle your friends! REDLINE: Tactical Card Combat is all about battling in simultaneous combat using powerful efreets and cunning tactics to control the battlefield.
Complete 64 card REDLINE deck to expand your REDLINE gameplay.
Includes 2 General cards to lead your forces into battle!
New card type! Strategy cards change how you approach battle!
Siegecraft Deck: Capture missions then build firebase counters on them to attack your opponents deck and blast them into dust.
Harness the power of new game mechanics, INTEL and REAR GUARD.
Includes 2 limited edition WW2 poster strategy cards and and the 6 card alternate art Throwback Pack!
Requires REDLINE: Tactical Card Combat Core Set to play.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Metamancers
description:
Metamancers is a two-player trading card game (max 6 players) where each player controls a character card and a crucible card.

Players must carefully manage their resources by melting cards in the crucible, utilizing the values on the cards. Each card has its own specific action and synergies, creating an engaging gameplay experience with tactical decision-making and connection with the Metamancers' lore.

The central objective of the Metamancers trading card game is to utilize your deck's unique abilities and synergies to achieve victory over your opponent. The game revolves around a captivating blend of spellcasting, summoning creatures, and tactical maneuvering to attain supremacy. The goal is win by drawing powerful creatures and spells that can lower your opponent's Metamancer's life total while sustaining your own hit points. The first player whose his Metamancer's life total reaches zero loses.

Your primary aim is to reduce your opponent's Metamancer's life total to zero, starting from a designated value. This feat is accomplished through careful deployment of spells, unleashing summoned beings, and executing shrewd strategies that surpass your adversary's defenses.

The game provides an array of strategies and cards that players can employ to tailor their decks to their distinct playstyle. From aggressive tactics designed to rapidly inflict damage to opponents, to more strategic and defensive approaches that seek to thwart the enemy's advances, the game allows for diverse strategies that cater to individual preferences.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Closed Drafting, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Income, Interrupts, Player Elimination, Tags, Take That

name: Startup Unicorns
description:
The card game for future founders.

Build your tech startup to an exit valuation of a million dollars!

Put together a top team and outsmart the competition in this fast-paced game of company building and industrial sabotage.

The game is composed of a double-deck of 108 cards.

You start the game with a COMPANY CARD and a FOUNDING TEAM of 2 members.

Expand your team by getting investors on board, hiring tech savvy programmers, operations staff to run your business and marketing professionals to find customers.

As your team grows, you COMPANY VALUE will grow too. But you will need to be careful how you spend your money or you'll be back looking for more investors!

Some cards combine better with others. You don't need a large team, just a few people that work well together. You can also play ADVANTAGES to further your business or SABOTAGE cards to damage your opponents.

Each turn you:


PLAY A CARD. Placing it in front of you or in front of an opponent.
DISCARD A CARD. Opportunities don't hang around forever.
DRAW TWO CARDS. Always keeping 4 cards in the hand at the end of the turn.


The first player whose company reaches 1 MILLION DOLLAR valuation and has a team member of EACH TYPE can then shout "UNICORN!" to win the game.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Industry / Manufacturing, Math
mechanics: Hand Management, Race, Take That

name: Meine ersten Spiele: Maxis Memo
description:
Lots of cuddly toys are just waiting to be discovered - preferably in pairs! Where exactly are they hiding? The players have to uncover this in My First Games - Maxis Memo from HABA! Tile by tile, the fun and learning curve increases until the child with the highest stack of pairs wins - or all players triumph together when they put the cuddly toys to bed before Maxi. The cute motif tiles and the lovingly designed wooden play figure ensure great fun for young players. My first games - Maxis Memo from HABA is therefore a great gift for children aged 2 and over.


My first games - Maxis Memo from HABA inspires with sweet motif tiles
with a lovingly designed toy figure made of wood
Memo fun in two game variants for children from 2 years: classic or cooperative
a child-friendly topic is implemented in a playful way


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Memory, Neighbor Scope

name: Obscurians
description:
Introducing the Shadow Bazaar: Become an Obscurian!

Step into the enigmatic realm of the Obscurians, a clandestine shadow market nestled within a remote desert planet. As an Obscurian, your mission is to uncover elusive combinations of goods while contending with rival players bent on thwarting your plans.

Intrigue and Deception

Navigate the intricate webs of your fellow Obscurians to achieve your covert objectives with finesse. Employ subtle deception and strategic maneuvers to outwit your opponents, all without uttering a single falsehood.

Secret Missions

Each Obscurian conceals a clandestine client with specific procurement requirements. Fulfill these missions shrewdly while deciphering the intentions of your adversaries to amass the most points by game's end.

Henchmen and Disguises

Utilize henchman dice judiciously to manipulate ever-changing circumstances in your favor while concealing your true aims from prying eyes. Adapt your strategy to the shifting landscape of the game to maintain your advantage.

Goods Exchange and Tactical Maneuvers

Harness the tactical potential of the henchman dice to orchestrate cunning exchanges, bolster your resources, or subtly influence your rivals' actions. Navigate the dynamic gameplay to subtly sway the Obscurians to your cause.

Challenges in Every Round

Each round presents unique challenges, from unexpected visitors to sudden sandstorms, demanding strategic adaptability to prevail. Beware the looming threat of a sandstorm-induced endgame, striking a balance between efficiency and caution.

Obscurians offers a captivating blend of intrigue, deception, and deduction, where actions speak louder than words. Immerse yourself in the allure of the Shadow Bazaar and ascend to the ranks of the Obscurians!

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Dice, Science Fiction, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Contracts, Deduction, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Events, Hidden Roles, Hidden Victory Points, Hot Potato, Set Collection, Take That, Trading, Turn Order: Claim Action

name: REDLINE: Battle of Neom – Immortal Operations
description:
Lead the invasion of Neom as the Crimson Pact of Mars fights to capture the supercity. Or leave it a charred wreck as you fight for control. The choice is up to you with the Immortal Operation deck from REDLINE: Tactical Card Combat.

Battle your friends! REDLINE: Tactical Card Combat is all about battling in simultaneous combat using powerful efreets and cunning tactics to control the battlefield.
Complete 65 card REDLINE deck to expand your REDLINE gameplay.
Includes 2 General cards to lead your forces into battle!
Gain advantages through attrition with the new casualty mechanic.
Take cover and protect your forces behind entrenchment tokens in battle!
Includes 3 Neom mission cards with the scorched earth mechanic. Locations take damage during battle and can be destroyed.
Includes XEF-53 Hellion mini poster.
Requires REDLINE: Tactical Card Combat Core Set to play.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: REDLINE: Battle of Neom – Precise Strike expansion deck
description:
