The city of Neom is under attack! Lead the gallant forces of the United Nation of Earth in their stubborn defense of the city. Protect each district and fight to control each city block with the UNE Precise Strike expansion deck.

Battle your friends! REDLINE: Tactical Card Combat is all about battling in simultaneous combat using powerful efreets and cunning tactics to control the battlefield.
Complete 65 card REDLINE deck to expand your REDLINE gameplay.
Includes 2 General cards to lead your forces into battle!
Use the new spotter ability to call in accurate firepower in battle.
Take cover and protect your forces behind entrenchment tokens in battle!
Includes 3 Neom mission cards with the scorched earth mechanic. Locations take damage during battle and can be destroyed.
Includes XEF-53 Hellion mini poster.
Requires REDLINE: Tactical Card Combat Core Set to play.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Save the Dinosaurs!
description:
Save the Dinosaurs is a fast-paced, laugh-out-loud family card game for kids and adult dinosaur lovers that asks one question: how quick can you be to save your dinosaur from extinction?

Sharpen your strategic skills and have a quick hand to outsmart opponents and become the ultimate dino-champion in this family card game. Prepare to ROAR with laughter as you outsmart and outplay your opponents.

Easy to learn and play - with simple yet exciting gameplay, this card game can be learned within 10 minutes. Large party feeling left out? No worries! Up to 8 players can play! From your 7-year-old dino hatchlings to your 99-year-old Triceratops!

—description from publisher
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Set Collection, Single Loser Game

name: Atomic Kaiju
description:
Atomic Kaiju is a deck-building game, which means you start with a fairly small, weak deck and over the course of the game you accumulate more and more powerful cards. The object of the game is to use your military and your monsters to decimate your opponent’s city, bringing their city points from 75 down to zero.

Spend Science and Material Points to buy cards from a market of over 100 cards to bolster your military might, mutate gameplay, and establish buff locations.

Military Cards: Use these to buy new resources
and attack your opponent.

Location Cards: Play these next to your Kaiju Nest
and reap their benefits every turn.

Mutation Cards: Use these to change the fate
of the game on a moment’s notice.

Research Cards: Use these to buy new mutations
that change the game, or...

Hatch a Gargantuan Kaiju! Draw 7 Science Points in one hand and you can hatch the ultimate weapon - a gigantic Kaiju beast to lay waste to your enemies! There are 8 fearsome atomic beasts in the game, and you never know which one you’ll hatch!

But be cautious! Too much atomic research can lead to a deck full of Toxic Waste!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Pizza King
description:
Pizza King is a family-friendly card game where you score points by collecting the right toppings to complete pizzas.

In a typical round of the game:
Each player is dealt four Topping Cards and one Pizza Card is revealed. Then each player decides on one Topping Card to discard. This is repeated twice more, ending up with three Pizza Cards revealed and each player having nine Topping Cards left in their hand. Then each player gets the opportunity to score points by completing as many of the revealed Pizzas as they can with the Toppings in their hand (as well as the "Free" Topping or an opponent's discarded topping).
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection

name: The Siege (fan expansion for Catan)
description:
An unofficial fan expansion for Catan.

Placing The Siege on an opposing player will give one control over the Settlement or City in question. But at a cost...
With just one game piece, various new challenges and strategies arise. The expansion provides more ways to initiate attacks in the game while maintaining it well balanced.

The Siege introduces scenarios for both the base game of Catan and its expansions; Seafarers, Cities & Knights, Traders & Barbarians, Explorers & Pirates and Treasures, Dragons & Adventurers.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Income, Investment, Modular Board, Negotiation, Network and Route Building, Race, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Trading

name: Westerplatte 1939
description:
The defense of Westerplatte went down in history thanks to the heroism of 216 Polish soldiers attacked by over 2,500 Germans. Attacked from the air by Stukas, shelled from the sea by the battleship Schleswig-Holstein, as well as by artillery and heavy machine guns, they lasted seven long days, inflicting heavy losses on the attackers.

—description from the publisher

Westerplatte is a peninsula in Gdańsk, Poland. Between 1926 and 1939, it was the location of a Polish Military Transit Depot. The place is famous for the battle in 1939 and a long Polish defence (7 days) against German forces, with Polish defenders being outnumbered (216 Polish soldiers vs approx. 2500 Germans) and outgunned.

The game offers two scenarios: one historical and the other one more hypothetical.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation

name: Cursed Empire: Heroes of Thargos – Undead Expansion
description: This is an expansion for the Heroes of Thargos card game that allows players to play Undead Anti-heroes or play a survival game against them. Additional rules mean that you can slay your opponents heroes and turn them to join your shambling ranks of zombies and undead heroes!
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Action/Event, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Move Through Deck, Open Drafting, Role Playing, Stat Check Resolution, Turn Order: Progressive

name: League of Dungeoneers: The False Prophet
description:
This expansion makes a huge game even bigger. It introduces 2 new playable species as well as 2 new professions. There are 22 new double-sided tiles allowing the heroes to explore natural caverns and mines all over the Kingdom. New treasure and enemies awaits those who dare venture forth!

With a new campaign and 17 new quests, this expansion provides hours upon hours of exciting dungeon crawling adventures.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Miniatures, Mythology, Travel
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Movement Points, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Stat Check Resolution

name: Guardians of Matrimonia
description:
In the family-friendly co-operative board game Guardians of Matrimonia, you are an elite event-planning team ensuring that a fantasy wedding goes as smoothly as possible.

In their role of bardfluencer, necromanager, holistic cleric, or ale-chemist, players each have their own unique abilities to tame the magical emergencies that threaten the big day, whether the client spouses are goblins, dwarves, or eldritch hiveminds. You need to put out fires, keep the guests partying, and make the spouses happy. The more successful the celebration, the better your rating at the end of the festivities.

Guardians of Matrimonia includes a competitive mode in which you collect tips, as well as multiple levels of difficulty and rules variants to keep gameplay fresh.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Peek A Beak
description:
In Peek a Beak, you are a newbie birdwatcher partaking in an inaugural 8-day birding competition in Sungei Buloh. Your goal is to snap a picture of the 15 elusive birds that call the nature reserve their home, with each one having a unique quest that can be completed for a handsome reward. But there's a catch - bird-eating snakes roam the untamed wilderness and it is your job to make sure that your prized possessions survive long enough for a picturesque snapshot to be taken. Every turn, you roll a set of dice to determine the trail you can take, though be sure to keep your distance from the birds lest you scare them away. So what are you waiting for? Print out a copy of this single-player board game and showcase your awesome birding skills now!

-description from designer
categories: Adventure, Animals, Dice, Exploration, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Modular Board, Pattern Movement, Pieces as Map, Push Your Luck, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Wheels of Change: The US Auto Industry of the 1950s
description:
“Always give more than you promised.” –Motto of the Studebaker Corporation.
The 1950s auto industry was a fascinating and unique period in USA economic history. Transitioning from a seller’s to a buyer’s market following the post-war economic boom, the automobile market in the USA was marked by tremendous changes inside and out of the industry. New automotive massed-produced technologies such as automatic transmissions, overhead valve V-8 engines, air conditioning, power brakes and other accessories competed for buyers' attention along with new makes (hardtops and station wagons in particular), annual styling changes and new model lines. New marketing techniques were also developed in the face of rising consumer demands, new communication technologies (especially television), and a growing middle class with increasing cash to spend, as well as a growing need for transportation as millions moved from the cities to the expanding suburbs.

In this game players take on the roles of the independent auto makers Studebaker, Packard, Nash, Hudson, Kaiser-Fraser and Willys-Overland (henceforward referred to as Willys) and try to survive and hopefully even grow during this turbulent decade. The rules and card play cover the actions of the "Big Three" (GM, Ford/Lincoln/Mercury/Edsel, Chrysler/Plymouth/Dodge), as well as national events that impacted the overall economy and automobile industry. A variant adds an additional player to take on the role of the Tucker Automobile Company. Players must allocate resources to marketing, product development, new technologies, dealerships and their various car lines (luxury, family, sport and economy models) and live/adapt with the results.

Each turn represents a year, with each side of the game board that players must transit representing a season of the year. Cards that represent various company assets as designers, new products, dealerships among others are played. Event cards are drawn at various points that can adversely affect, or benefit, one of more players during the turn or game. There are three scenarios (1951-53, 1954-56 and 1957-59) that concentrate on key periods of the decade for the auto industry, and a "campaign game" that covers the entire period. Players win by earning profit and gaining market share, and lose by going bust. Can you do as well or better than your historical car manufacturer?

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Economic, Industry / Manufacturing, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Closed Economy Auction, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Income, Negotiation

name: TimeStrike: Shadow of Fear
description:
TimeStrike: Shadow of Fear is a Boss Battle Royale for 2-∞ players. Leave your world behind in this build and battle sci-fantasy adventure as you make your mark across a modular and destructible landscape.

Journey through time itself with TimeStrike, a first-of-its-kind boss battle royale and the first of many games designed to be played on the SOURCE system. TimeStrike integrates with SOURCE's modular system to create immersive and destructible worlds for endless replayability.

At the end of time, the numberless universes collide. It is here that history ends and your adventure begins. Draft a team of legendary characters to journey across this timescape. Scavenge for lost artifacts, mine the map for materials, complete quests to augment your characters, build fortresses and roads to gain tactical advantages, fight and tame mythical monsters to unlock powerful combinations, go fishing for your next meal, and adapt to an ever changing world - all while battling the other players to be the last team standing. At the center of it all a world boss, and master manipulator of time, seeks to erase you from time itself. You’ll compete to control this boss, driven by a deck of unique abilities, and to wield its massively destructive power to control the battlefield and lay waste to your enemies.

Defeated players become one with the game and take control of the boss and monsters to exact their revenge on the survivors. Either one player wins, or the game defeats you all. Experience exhilarating battles with your friends as you command a team of legendary characters from ancient civilizations and distant futures to survive the onslaught of the world boss and a map as shifting as the sands of time.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Modular Board, Slide/Push, Three Dimensional Movement, Tile Placement, Trading

name: Earthborne Rangers: Stewards of the Valley
description: The Stewards of the Valley adds a new Ranger background set, a new specialty set, and it deepens the card pools of each of the background and specialty sets from the Earthborne Rangers core game, giving you even more options for character creation and variability.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Science Fiction
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Move Through Deck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Murder at The Magic Mirror Casino
description:
Disgraced magician and ex-convict, Charlie Young, was found dead in a dumpster behind the Magic Mirror Casino in Las Vegas, with multiple gunshot wounds to his torso. Young had upset many people in his time and most recently, he'd been on the run from the law after cheating in a game of high-stake poker. Now his time is up, but there is a killer at large.

The evidence has been collected for you, it’s your job to piece it all together and work out who it was that killed the victim.

27 PIECES OF PHYSICAL EVIDENCE - Inside the case file, you'll find newspaper articles, CCTV images, prison record, social media profile, police reports, blueprint, phone/text records, a coroners report, a map, witness statements, and more.

SEARCH THROUGH A POLICE INBOX - In addition to the physical evidence supplied inside of the box, you'll need to access an online police officer's inbox to prove the suspects innocent or guilty - but it's not easy...you'll need to be a smart investigator to gain access!

A GREAT NIGHT IN - With approximately 2.5 hours of game play (depending on your skill level) and a difficulty rating of 3.5/5 this "whodunnit" style thriller will provide a fun night in for all who choose to participate. If you can't crack the case without a secret clue, hints and answers are available online.
mechanics: Deduction

name: Battle Formation
description:
Experience the precision and discipline of 18th century warfare with Battle Formation! Test your strategic prowess as you lead your army into battle, outwitting and out maneuvering your opponent. Unleash devastating volleys into the enemy lines or spread out and pick them off one-by-one. Will you claim victory with your tactical brilliance, or succumb to the enemy's cunning?

Battle Formation is a two-player competitive strategy game. Carefully maneuver your troops, make calculated attacks, and advance your forces across the board to kill the enemy general.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Pattern Building, Square Grid, Variable Set-up

name: Go Big And Go Home
description:
A standard research mission goes awry when your crew crash lands on an unknown planet, launching you into a desperate hunt for resources to repair your ship and return home. However, someone amongst your crew may have a different agenda—even you. Are you eager to find a way home or to plant the seeds of a new society on this planet? Will your choices be for personal gain or the good of humankind? With an entire planet to explore and only so much time before your Rover's engine becomes overloaded, you must do whatever it takes to go big and go home… wherever "home" may be.

Go Big And Go Home is a tile-placing and push-your-luck game for 2-5 players divided into two teams. Each team will use the same Rover to explore the map and transport resources to their respective Team Objectives. Players will draw cards from the Rover Deck to find Solar Energy Cards that allow them to perform actions such as Explore (place new Hexes on the map) or Move the Rover among the Roads, but be careful if you reach 3 Failures of the same type, you are out of the Round.

Each team has a Team Objective: Blues want to transport Resources to the 2 Blue Team Objective Hexes to repair the ship, while Reds want to transport them to the Red Team Objective Hex to Build a Settlement. Rush through your Team Objective, or Upgrade the Rover as a crew to try to explore more and earn more Victory Points by completing Personal Objectives or your Origin Quest; but be careful, volcanoes may erupt as a response to overexploiting this planet and destroy everything you built together.

The game ends at the end of the Round in which either team completes their Team Objective, and the Player with the greatest VPs wins the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Push Your Luck, Resource to Move, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement

name: Navigational Portal
description:
Navigation Portal is a game that delves into the intricacies of mathematical prowess as players journey through a vast expanse of about 63 square parsecs in nearby space. Players will be challenged to tackle diverse navigational scenarios, utilizing the Navigation Portal to traverse the vastness of interstellar realms. With each play, players will hone their skills, mastering the art of space navigation.

The game features two modes: Educational and Racer.
In the Educational mode, kids explore trigonometry through gameplay. To grasp the basics of trigonometry, players will typically need a maximum of 10 hours to complete Level 1 and Level 2. Level 3 delves deeper, covering trigonometry as taught in secondary schools. This level can be mastered by players as young as 12.

The Racer mode is designed for experienced players, starting even from Level 1. Each game can accommodate 1-8 players and allows for a mix of Levels 1, 2, and 3. Players are finding their way home.

Quick Start notes
First moment...
When you kick off the game, start timing yourself using a watch with a seconds feature or your phone's stopwatch, and keep it running the entire game. During your turns, you can set your course based on the seconds passed. Remember, don't pause the timekeeping throughout your gameplay. Later, you can tap into this recorded time for game stats, like gauging the average time taken per move or figuring out the overall game duration.

...a moment later
When you begin the game, you'll venture out from the solar system, positioned at the heart of the game board. Your initial direction is set by timing seconds on a stopwatch. Take that count, multiply it by six, and then add the number you roll on the dice. This combination maps out your path and sets the stage for your in-game decisions and strategy.

Gather The keys
Throughout the game, your route is charted using the navigation portal keys, represented by cards you gather along the way. Crossing the polar grid on your journey from start to finish rewards you with a navigation key for every point where you intersect the grid.

Fuel
Throughout the game, your route is charted using the navigation portal keys, represented by cards you gather along the way. Crossing the polar grid on your journey from start to finish rewards you with a navigation key for every point where you intersect the grid. Your game's dashboard starts with a fuel gauge of 21 units. Your journey's length hinges on this fuel reserve. Think of each fuel unit as the power to travel one light year. On your game board, this distance is shown as a single centimeter. So, when considering a scale where a centimeter equals a light year, a span of 9.3 light years in the game translates to 9.3 centimeters. In terms of fuel consumption, you'd spend 9.3 units for that journey.

Settlers
When the game begins, you're equipped with two settler modules, each loaded with 25 settler units. Should you journey to a star or star cluster, you get the chance to colonize adjacent sectors. Think of a sector as a 1/5 ly² square, where you can place one settler unit. Now, if you discover planets in these clusters, keep them in mind, as you can revisit them later to boost your settler count based on the planets present. For a quick illustration: if there are 3 settler units represented by 3 occupied sectors near a planet, you can top up 3 of those groups in your game dashboard's module. And if you come across a system with four planets, that's a potential of adding 12 settler groups back to your resources.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Celeste Galactic Deck Building Game
description:
Sentient drones weave through the treeline. Cybernetically enhanced alien warriors comb the mountainside for fuel and shelter. And in the center of it all, proud native warriors prepare to protect the life force of the planet itself.

War is coming to the small green planet of MD-0715, and it’s time to pick a side.

Manage resources, upgrade technology, and bring your army to battle in this epic deck-building game for up to 4 players.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Player Elimination, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Beastcaller
description:
Beastcaller is a mix of traditional Trading Card Game and a lot of Miniature Tabletop:
A 1v1 where two rivals bashing their heads in using summoned creatures. Additionally they have many spells traps and reaction cards at their disposal.

You take on the role of Beastcaller:
someone who has the ability to call Beasts - inspired by middle european folklore - from their Gromoire and send them into battle.

Before the game, each player picks one Beastcaller with his own unique gamechanging abilities and prepares a deck of at least 20 cards (spells, traps, reactions) and a Grimoire of exactly 10 cards (Beasts).

The game is divided into 2 phases that repeat themselves until one beastcaller faints.
In the first phase, the Beastcaller takes over - here the player prepares, calls Beasts onto the battlefield, cast spells, lay traps and more.
In the second phase the Beasts are activated turn after turn and move across the battlefield.

Powerful Spell cards can only be played if a Beastcaller has enough Beasts of a certain level on the battlefield.
Furthermore dissolved Beasts are not put in an discard pile - they linger on the Soulstack and can be brought back to your Grimoire. But be wary, the more Beasts are in your Soulstack the tinier the chance to get back what you need right now.

Beastcaller combines the strategy of tabletop war games and the exciting creation of your own card decks from a trading card game.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Moving Multiple Units, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: Athenium
description:
Athenium is a head to head summoner battle game in line with most popular trading card games. What sets Athenium apart is that it is permanently simplified to the most basic elements of gameplay.

Starting life points are determined by the number of players. Each player involved adds 5 life points to the starting life point total of every player. It's meant for 2 players, starting at ten, but it's still really fun with 4 players, starting at 20.

There are still resource cards, called Macguffins, that are used to motivate a character into the battle, but instead of 4-7 colors, there are 3, and they are based on genre. The green cards are Fantasy characters, the blue cards are Science Fiction characters, and the red cards are Horror characters.

Each character card has one number, which represents attack, defense, and casting cost, which go up or down based on their type matchups.

They attack and block left to right, just like reading a book. When the defending characters run out, the rest is damage dealt to the defending player. When the defending player runs out of life points, they lose. Last librarian standing wins.

Everyone plays from one deck which may be supplemented with special cards, or later expansion decks. All of the art, graphic design, writing, gameplay architecture and web design were done by Ben Butcher, though the expansions have other illustrators on payroll in the near future.

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Educational, Fantasy, Horror, Mythology, Science Fiction
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Critical Hits and Failures, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Storytelling

name: Anda
description:
Introduction:Anda (from Proto-Germanic: Anþą, which means "breath") is a drawless game for two players: Black and White. It is played at the intersections (points) of an initially empty hexagonal board with triangles. The recommended size is 9 points per side, but it can be played on a 11–sized board for longer games or a 7–sized board for shorter games. There is also an off-board location called the prison. Each player has access to a sufficient supply of stones of their own color.



Definitions:– A group is a set of connected stones of the same color among themselves. A single stone is also a group.
– A liberty is an empty point adjacent orthogonally or diagonally to a group.
– A smothered group is a group where all its liberties has a path of N empty points connected to exactly one enemy supergroup, where N can be zero.
– A territory is a set of connected empty points. You own a territory if all the stones connected to it are your color.
– To annihilate is to place a stone on an empty point that smother all enemy groups, leaving the board with stones only of your color. You cannot annihilate if your opponent also annihilated in a previous turn.



Turns:Black plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, do one of the following actions:

– Place a stone of your color on an empty point where it is not smothered, then move all smothered friendly and enemy groups to the prison. If it's your first turn, do it twice on non-adjacent empty points.
– Remove an enemy stone from the prison.

At the end of your turn, the group of the stone you placed cannot be smothered.



End of the game:– The player who performed the last action wins the game, so passing the turn is not allowed.
– One player has the option to “propose ending” to the game and the other player must accept it or not. If accepted, the points will be counted by adding the friendly territory and the enemy prisoners, in addition to granting an extra half point to the player who made the last move.

For the game to be fair, before it starts:

– Player 1 places two black stones.
– Player 2 either (i) swaps or (ii) places two white stones.
　– If (i), Player 1 places two white stones and Player 2 either swaps or accepts.
　– If (ii), Player 1 either swaps or accepts.

Then, the player with the black stones offers a komi pie, where the first player places several black stones in the prison and the second player chooses a side. The player with the white stones either swaps or accepts. I have called this balancing method dual pie rule.



Variant:For a simpler option, each player places two stones of their color on non-adjacent corners during game setup. Then Black starts the game by playing the first normal turn. The komi pie can also be used for balance.



Notes:Special thanks to Christopher Field for his contribution to a simpler alternative balancing method. The prison mechanism was introduced by David Wolfe and Elwyn Berlekamp in their book "Mathematical Go: Chilling Gets the Last Point".

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Chaining, Hexagon Grid

name: Plank!
description:
Plank! is a 2-5 person competitive treasure-hunting game where players must battle for control of supplies while they attempt to assemble a crew and claim a treasure for the win. Use your crewmember's unique abilities to roam across vast seas and plunder your opponents as you collect resources. Don't like your current crew? Make them walk the plank and pick up new ones from sand bars.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Chess Diamond
description:
This diamond chess board is a modern variation of chess that comes with a unique setup that adds uncertainty and excitement to the game. The shape of the board even lets pieces hide, attack, and block others.

the game comes with the full 32 pieces minus 1 pawn for each team. the goal is still the same; checkmate the opponent king to win the game.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Moving Multiple Units, Pattern Movement, Sudden Death Ending

name: Old School Tactical: Volume 4 – Italian Theater 1943-45
description:
After the victory in North Africa, Allied planners readied a new campaign. It was aimed at the so called ‘soft underbelly‘ of Europe. A bold plan to knock Italy out of the war and drain Axis units from fighting on other fronts. Beginning with the invasion of Sicily in July of 1943, the Allies pressed the enemy, but there was nothing soft about the bloody fight. The drive to Messina in Sicily, the landing at Salerno, the beleaguered beachhead at Anzio, through all the Allies pushed on towards Rome. Countless river valleys and fortified lines favored the German defenders and stymied the Allies at every turn. The Volturno River, the Rapid River, the Liri valley, the Gustav Line, the Caesar Line, all of these names proved a deadly challenge to the Allies fighting to control them. The drive up the Italian Peninsula was costly for both sides and dragged on until the end, which occurred May 2, 1945 with the formal surrender of all Axis forces in Italy.

Old School Tactical Volume IV brings the exciting OST system to this challenging theater of WW2. It brings British forces into the game to battle German and Italian units in difficult terrain. Vickers machine guns, Commandos, Bren guns, PIATs and sticky bombs will see action in the game on the side of the British. They also have an allotment of vehicles including Sherman and Churchill tanks.
The German and Italian forces counter with many panzers including the Marder III and Elefant.
A large map of beautiful Italian countryside is designed for players to contest the many exciting scenarios included in the playbook.

Two players contest each scenario using counters representing the soldiers, guns, and vehicles that fought these desperate battles. On each turn, play goes back and forth between the sides as Impulse Points are spent to enable a player's forces to act. When the battle is over, casualty and victory points are tallied and a victor is declared.

Infantry target other soft units and attack using their Firepower value against the target’s Defense value. The attack can be modified by Leadership, support weapons and terrain effects. When things get intense, Assault moves into enemy hexes result in deadly Close Combat. Dice rolls are made using the Infantry Combat Table, and results are implemented. Attacking armored vehicles requires a roll to hit the vehicle. If a hit is scored, the Firepower value of the attacker’s gun is used against the target’s front or flank defense value. Dice rolls are made using the Vehicle Combat Table and results are enforced. Vehicles may also use their HE Firepower value and secondary armaments directly against soft targets using the Infantry Combat Table.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Carded
description: Get rid of your cards to win. Deal 5 cards to each player. Person to the left of the dealer goes first. Match the first card flipped over from the deck. Match by color, number, and numbers in sequential order (1,2,3,4,5, or 5,4,3, 2,1…etc). Follow the instructions on each card with images (force cards). Stacking or dropping doubles, triples, etc. of numbered cards are ok. When it’s your turn to play, you can drop a force card on anyone even if they are not sitting next to you. For example, I can skip someone’s turn even if they are 5 seats down from me. Force cards are the cards with images, pictures, or words written on them. The force card tells you what to do next once played. All Force cards are also wild cards. You can simply use them to change the color if you desire.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Fighting the Phoenix
description:
Recreates the air battles of the Iran-Iraq war from 1980 to 1988. It follows the trajectory of the was as new systems and tactics evolved. From the opening stages with Iraqi MIGs vs Iranian American made aircraft such as F-4s and F-14 Tomcats.

As the war progressed both the Iranians and Iraqis acquired new modern aircraft such as the Mirage F-1 and the MiG-29.

The book covers 9 campaigns over the eight year span and includes clashes outside the direct conflict with engagements by American and Saudi forces.

Also new or updated data on 30 aircraft involved in the conflict.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: I Am Champion
description:
A doorway opens to another realm, where the greatest inter-dimensional warriors battle to rule the multiverse! I AM CHAMPION!

With your hand selected team of radical warriors you and your opponent go head to head in this epic card game of great magnitude Each card is equipped with a ability determined by a dice roll adding a bit of chance to your outcome.

Warriors cards can be collected with your friends, family or coworkers, battle your neighbors, strangers on the street, the mail man, collect better cards a move up the tiers to be the greatest in the cosmos! The cooler the card, the more rare it is.

Cards can be as rare as one of a kind.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Game System
mechanics: Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Tales of Realms and Ruins
description:
The King has disappeared. When the Othersiders, our sworn enemy, obtained this knowledge, their attacks became more and more frequent. We must not let them take our lands for they will destroy us. It has been decided that each of the three Realms of our Kingdom must present their champion who will unite us under their banner. This is where you come in. Prove that you will be a better ruler than the other pretenders for the throne. Go now! Save our Kingdom!
Tales of Realms and Ruins is a competitive strategy game with slight cooperative elements. The game is for 2-3 players where you take on the role of a Hero campaigning to claim the throne of the Kingdom. You will gain Followers by playing cards, building your deck, conquering Realms and using their effects. Throughout the play, you will encounter various choose-your-own-adventure Events that will shift the odds of success either towards you, your rival players for the Throne, or the game itself. Tales of Realms and Ruins may end in 6 different ways depending on your choices throughout the play.'

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Deck Construction, Events, Hand Management, Interrupts, Map Deformation, Multi-Use Cards, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Semi-Cooperative Game, Sudden Death Ending, Take That, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Traitor Game

name: Summer Tour: The Game
description:
Summer Tour - The Game takes players on a vibrant, musical journey inspired by the spirit of legendary jam bands. In this board game adventure, you'll embark on a cross-country tour, chasing epic jam band shows and collecting tickets along the way. It's all about embracing the good vibes, camaraderie, and the thrill of the road.

Players choose their vans and strategically navigate the game board, moving towards tour stops to collect tickets. Spin and Roll dice to advance. Special bonus rolls add an extra layer of excitement, offering unique opportunities and challenges.

The ultimate goal of Summer Tour the Game is to collect the most tickets by the time you've visited all 12 cities on your cosmic journey. But it's not just about the destination; it's about the experiences along the way. Will you embrace the free-spirited nature of the tour, chase the shows, and collect the tickets to become the ultimate fan? The stage is set, and the adventure awaits!
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Staring Thumbs
description: Staring Thumbs is a multi-player card game that exemplifies family fun. Players must choose cards from their hands that correlate to three common games (staring contest, thumb war, and rock, paper, scissors). If any of their opponents have chosen the same game, they must compete in the chosen game for the points of the cards. After all cards in the decks have been played, the player with the most points wins!
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: Jackpot Royal
description:
Play your combinations cleverly to hit the Jackpot or to achieve powerful three of a kinds!

In this card game, players try to align slot machines symbols on their tableau to snag the symbols tokens and the matching powers.

Each card has three symbols and players place them trying to either align three of the same symbols or create a serie of all seven different symbols. The player can either place each card next to another or partially tuck it under/play it over other cards

Three of a kinds gain the player the matching token either from the center of the table or from the player who owned it before, and then apply their powers. If the player already has the matching token, they gain GAIN cards from the bank.

Jackpots gain the player Jackpot cards which are worth a whopping seven points at the end of the game. If they manage to create both a horizontal Jackpot AND a vertical Jackpot during the game, it becomes a Jackpot Royal and gain both a Jackpot card and a token.

Each token has a unique power that activates when gained by a player. Most of them allow the player to steal GAIN cards either from other players or from the bank. They are also two-sided, with one side being more valuable than the other.

After 14 turns, the players add the points from the GAIN cards, the Jackpot Cards and the tokens they still own at the end of the game. The player with the most points win!
mechanics: Layering, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Take That

name: Nataterra
description:
In this game, players will choose from one of four distinct civilizations vying for control of the world of Nataterra.

At the start of the game, players must construct the game map using randomized tiles. Additionally, players select four out of eleven available victory conditions.

This turn-based game is structured around four phases during each player's turn. Players will move their unit tokens around the map, gather resources from it, combat against other players, and improve their civilization by recruiting more units and exploring the tech-tree researching technologies.

The objective is to be the first player to achieve one of the chosen victory conditions in order to win the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Moving Multiple Units, Multi-Use Cards, Player Elimination, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Worker Placement, Zone of Control

name: Stoner Fluxx: Secret Stash Pack
description: Four-card expansion for Stoner Fluxx. Adds two new Keepers--Hash (counts as Weed) and Secret Stash (allows you once per turn to hide a Weed Keeper under it and treat it as if it doesn't exist, thus preventing it from being discarded)--and two new Goals: Hash Pipe (Hash + The Pipe) and Stash of Hash (Secret Stash + Hash).
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Frisian Landscapes (Fan expansion to Fields of Arle)
description:
New specific needs emerged, and the Arle community has great expectations on you. Will you carry out an intensive farming activity? Will you be the best builder? Will you be a good horse breeder? Craft your strategy following three common goals and find your way to success!

Fields of Arle: Frisian Landscapes is a Fields of Arle print-and-play expansion fully compatible with any other existing expansion of the base game.

The development of this expansion has taken place with the permission of the original publisher Feuerland Spiele.

—description from the designer
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Farming, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up

name: Echt grenzwertig
description:
"Why so serious?" With Echt grenzwertig you create the funniest, most absurd, and most violent statements from different card-combinations. Is "dissing old white men" a new torture method in North Korea? Or will "Bake hash brownies with your parents" be the first action of the German chancellor to solve the country's most urgent problems? There are (almost) no limits of possible combinations!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Spirit War
description:
Spirit War is a luck-based card game where players engage in battle, based on the system of tri-elements, to be the last one standing. Don't be fooled by its initial simplicity, as this game possesses the potential to evolve into a captivating and strategic mind game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Trick-taking

name: Speedy Pickers Junior
description:
Become a junior picker and enter the exciting world of lost items and hidden treasures. Search around different locations and find all the hidden items before the other players.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Galahad's Ordeal: The Battle for Myitkyina, May-August, 1944
description:
“Bad news from Mitch (US code name for Myitkyina). Now they say 800 Japs got into Charpate last night. And 200 crossed the river from the east. McCammon says situation is critical”. –Except from General Stilwell’s May 22nd personal log report about offensive to take Myitkyina.

Galahad’s Ordeal portrays the Allied attack and siege of Myitkyina during WWII. The town and its nearby airfield were a constant threat to the Allied airlift operations that ferried war materials and supplies from India to Nationalist China. The Japanese occupation of the town also severed the only land access from India to China for the Allies.
When the Japanese offensive at Imphal and Kohima was launched the Allied High Command viewed the battle as an opportunity to launch a counter offensive by the US 5307th Infantry Group (Merrill’s Marauders, also nicknamed Galahad Force by their British and Indian Allies) supported by Nationalist Chinese forces against Myitkyina, deep into the rear areas of Japanese occupied northern Burma. The Allies calculated that the Japanese had to have weakened their hold here to launch their massive offensive to the west. Unfortunately for the Allies, the US forces were badly depleted from earlier battles, and the Japanese had not weakened their grip at Myitkyina, and instead, anticipating just such an attack, were in the process of strengthening the town’s garrison. One of the most costly and prolonged battles of the Burma theatre would be waged here. Can you do as well or better than your historical counterpart? Learn and enjoy!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Stonesaga: Meals & Myths
description: Adds a 5th player to Stonesaga.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Stonesaga: Nature of the Beast
description: Adds animal companions to Stonesaga
mechanics: Unspecified

name: The Innsmouth Curse
description:
The Innsmouth Curse takes you on a journey around the ancient, haunted seaside town of Innsmouth, made famous by the writer H.P.Lovecraft. Make your way to the Devils Reef and be rid of the curse that surrounds you! The first person there is the winner, but to get there you will face various Encounters along the way. Only the sane will survive to make it to the end.

Sort out the cards into the different piles and give them all a good shuffle. Lay out the locations, and choose a character, a curse (which indicates where you begin) and take your first clue. Each character gets 6 Sanity points and 4 Health points to begin with. Should either of these gets to zero, your character needs to rest for a turn in the Hotel before continuing. You also lose any Artefacts you may have gathered, including any boat tickets.

Move your character one location at a time to get to the clue destination. Each time you move, take an Event. Resolve the Event and if you survive, you are rewarded with an Artefact. If you have reached your Clue Destination, take another Clue and continue on your way.

When you reach your third Clue Destination, take a Boat Ticket and head to the Harbour. From there, you can make it across the Open Seas and to the Devils Reef. The first person to get to the Devils Reef is the winner!
mechanics: Area Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Age of Swords
description:
Age of Swords is an epic strategy board game that takes you back to the Middle Ages where valor, skill, and cunning will determine who will dominate the Kingdom. As the leader of your army, you will need to recruit your soldiers, equip them with weapons, and send them into battle against your opponents on a dynamic battlefield.

In Age of Swords, you will have at your disposal 28 cards for each of the two armies, each with their own unique units and special abilities. From light cavalry to archers and crossbowmen, knights and commanders, each unit plays an important role in battle. You play on a 8x12 battlefield grid.

Each card has three main characteristics that define its role in battle: movement speed on the board, attack strength, and, in the case of ranged units like archers and crossbowmen, also includes the shooting distance. In combat the defender also rolls a D20 to determine the outcome.

You will have to demonstrate your ingenuity and skill by moving them across the board to claim victory. You win by defeating all enemy units.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Medieval, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: Men of War: Nicaragua 1979-1990 – CONTRAS
description:
Men of War: Central America Nicaragua-CONTRAS is Module 3
Standalone Solitaire Tactical Book Wargame designed to re-create modern low-intensity conflicts at the tactical level. Men of War is an infantry-centric, old-school hex and counter wargame system that mimics the nuances of modern small unit leadership, fire, and maneuver, primarily team and squad-based formations.
In this third installment of the series, “Nicaragua 1979-1990”-CONTRAS the player controls guerrilla forces led by Commander Zero and trained by U.S. Special Forces, backed by the United States intelligence in a controversial covert war against communist encroachment in Central America. CONTRAS are up against the disciplined, well-equipped, and well-trained Sandinista National Liberation Front or FSLN - Frente Sandinista de Liberación Nacional.
Lead CONTRA and U.S. Special Forces teams in missions across the Nicaragua/Honduras border.
¡Contrarrevolucion!
Game Features
Unit Scale – Teams/Squads
Map – Hexagonal, one Hex=40 meters
Turns – Minutes
Playing Time – 30-60 Minutes
Players – One (Solitaire Play)
Complexity – Medium
CONTRA, U.S. Special Forces, FSLN and Advisor Cadre
Dynamic Enemy Bot system.
10 historically Inspired missions

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Civil War, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: To Honor Grandfather: Mongoose Mini-Expansion
description: The Mongoose Mini-Expansion includes five-cards, each tied to the Ancients Trilogy from Mongoose Publishing. These include an escalating series of Encounters, a deadly new Caste, and even a System of hidden wonders.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Modular Board, Move Through Deck, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Future Heroes
description:
Take on the role of a gladiator in a future dystopian world and fight for honor and glory in different arenas across the universe to earn your freedom and gain universal fame!

Future Heroes is a fast-paced trick-taking board game that’s meant to be easy to pick up and with a small footprint, perfect as the in-between game or when you’re in the mood for something fun and light. Best suited for 2-4 players.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Drawing, Hand Management, Trick-taking

name: The Egg Game: Complete the challenges, don't drop the egg!
description:
Complete the challenges, don't drop the Egg!

The Egg Game is our brilliant new party game where you have to complete hilarious challenges whilst trying not to drop the egg.

Before pulling a challenge card, players can choose to use the bouncy rubber egg for one point, or up the ante and use a real egg for 3 points (optional)

Don’t be the one to crack under pressure!

Guaranteed entertainment and endless laughter for both kids and adults, this eggcellent game will surely take top spot on your game shelf!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Get Wavey: The Hilariously Weird Party Game
description:
Get Wavey is the ultimate family party game of general knowledge with a wavey twist!

You're about to get wavey...

This hilarious new party game will have you feel like you’re slurring your words as you attempt to read out wavey sounding questions that will totally throw off your opponents.

Can you guess what your wavey sounding friends are saying?

How to Play

Place the pile of question cards face down on the table. The youngest player starts by turning over a card and immediately reading the distorted question out loud (without attempting to pre-read it or looking at the answer…no cheating!).

All other players have 60 seconds to figure out the question and the answer. The first player to shout out the correct answer wins the card.

If no player can guess the answer after 60 seconds, the reader can turn the card upside down and read the question in plain English. The first player to answer correctly wins the card.

First to collect 10 cards wins the game!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Unicorn Poop
description:
Discover the hilarious world of Unicorn Poop through its illustrated cartoon-style cards featuring animals and insects in their most intimate moments. From the philosophical gaze of a pooping unicorn to the vacant stare of a rhino, this deck is packed with heaps of laughter.

Party All You Want
Whether you have 2, 4, or 8 players, Unicorn Poop has got you covered. A single deck is perfect for 2-4 players, while two decks provide endless fun for a party of 8. It's a choose-your-own adventure kind of game, just like your unique bathroom experience. Each round lasts for 5-15 minutes, exactly the amount of time nature intended for a poo game to be played.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Ashes Magazin: Fabio the Architect Promo Miniature
description:
A promo resin miniature included with Ashes Magazine: Messen Spiel 2023 #8 from Ludus Magnus Studio. It contains rules to be used in Black Rose Wars, Black Rose Wars Rebirth, Black Rose Wars Lex, Nova Aetas Renaissance and Requiem.
Please note that the model comes unassembled in 3 parts (body, right arm, and base): you have to use glue to assemble it.

– 1x Avatar Duel Card, 30x Command Cards, 1x Avatar Card (to play The Architect as Avatar in Black Rose Wars: Duel – Lex, Black Rose Wars, and Black Rose Wars: Rebirth).
– 2x Hero Sheets, 2x Skill Sheets, 9x Equipment Cards, 7x Relic Cards, 1x Blender Automaton Card, 1x Scraper Automaton Card, 11x Various Tokens (to play Fabio as a Hero in Nova Aetas Renaissance).
– 9x Equipment Cards, 1x Companion Token, 4x Simplified Action Tokens (to play Fabio as a Recurring Companion in Requiem).
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Renaissance
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Typeset
description:
You are old-fashioned typesetters, building up words letter-by-letter to be used on a printing press. As the letters come out, you must plan and place them accordingly, while carefully using your bank of vowels to puzzle out a higher score. Use the tools of the trade to twist the rules, and create combos that land you the bonus letters you need to win.

On a turn, both in solo and multiplayer, a consonant is randomly turned face-up for all the players to use in building up words on their player card. The catch? All placed letters must be put in the leftmost empty space of a given line. Players can freely use their bank of vowels before and after to help out, as long as they haven't run out. As more consonants come out, the words get trickier to fit together, and certain letters become more desirable. Certain actions, like taking hard-to-use letters or using the special ability, result in bonus 'wild' letters of your choice, clinching the final pieces to your word puzzle. You have limited room for error, and the letters themselves have no value- only word length matters for scoring. Every five letters, each player may opt out on their own and score their cards, or risk another five letters that may ruin everything.... or fit beautifully into place.

Plan, place, and chance it either on your own or with a group of fellow typesetters. Typeset is built to travel, easy-to-teach, and infinitely replayable with the wealth of ability cards that twist and change the rules.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Spelling, Variable Set-up

name: Varia: Samurai vs. Ninja
description:
Two new and original Varia classes battle in this exciting, accessible stand-alone dueling game.

Varia is a game of tactical card play, powerful fantasy-themed classes, and unique player-controlled RNG.

A fast-paced 2+ player combat game, Varia has you select from a variety of classes that play and feel completely distinct from one another. Attack your opponent or defend against their blows with unique action cards that represent your chosen class. This box contains two such classes - the Sunrise Samurai and the Sunset Ninja.

Sunrise Samurai - Katana in hand, you'll use stances to shift fluidly between offense and defense. If your opponent won't back down, quickly draw your blade and cut them down in a single stroke!

Sunset Ninja - Kukri in hand, you’ll use moves that enable fluid misdirection, both offensive and defensive. If your opponent is reading all your moves, wield the power of darkness to throw them off, and cut them down!

This is a stand-alone release supporting 2 players. Additional classes are required to play with more than 2 players.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Track Movement

name: LevAIthans
description:
LevAIthans (Lev-Aye-Eye-thans) is a adventure, card game, using adjustable, pre-made characters, influenced by Tron. Players, called Controllers, add various types of Bytes to their Byte Mat, or playing field. Each Byte has different base stats and abilities, but they can all be expanded with Programming Cards. Programming Cards fit into Expansion slots for each Byte, some are permanent and some are temporary. Some Bytes can "swarm", which means they work with other alike Bytes during the Hack and Defense phase.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Point to Point Movement

name: Monopoly: Marvel Studios' Eternals Edition
description:
In this Monopoly Board Game: Marvel Studios' Eternals Edition, players travel around the board safeguarding as many properties as they can. The more they safeguard, the more rent they can collect from fellow Eternals in the form of cosmic energy units. Players get to choose from one of the 10 Monopoly Eternal tokens, each with a unique Super Hero ability that can change the course of the game. The last player to have cosmic energy units when all other players have depleted theirs wins! The game makes an awesome gift for kids ages 8 and up.

—description from the publisher
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Loans, Lose a Turn, Negotiation, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding, Track Movement, Trading

name: Oslob
description:
Discover the fascinating world of whale sharks in Oslob! In this semi-cooperative board game for 2-5 players, you immerse yourself in the breathtaking environment of Oslob, where the goal is to skillfully bid on the movements of a whale shark to achieve your personal objectives.

Step into the shoes of a dedicated environmentalist and passionately advocate for the protection of the majestic whale sharks in Oslob. But be vigilant, for you are not alone. Tourists and researchers are also exploring the waters of Oslob Bay, each with their own interests.

Embark on the adventure, play Oslob, and become an active part of the change our world needs. Dive into the world of whale sharks and experience the challenges and responsibilities of environmental conservation up close.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Cooperative Game, Hidden Movement, Tug of War

name: Olympic Weightlifting
description: Solitaire statistical replay game of the sport of Olympic Weightlifting. Realistically rated historical and/or contemporary lifters compete in Olympic Weightlifting competitions, including every Olympic Games where this sport was present and other historical state and national Olympic Weightlifting competitions. As in 'real' Olympic Weightlifting competitions, each lifter has 3 "lifts" in each discipline (eg: snatch, clean & jerk), with the highest combined total declared the winner.
mechanics: Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Sage Stones
description:
In the age of swords and sorcery, disputes were settled not by metal and fire, but the cunning, tactics, and luck of Sage Stones. Battle your fellow Sages and win the chance to forge your own empire!

Sage Stones is a piece placement, dice rolling strategy game for 2 - 6 players. Each player rolls 3D3 (3D6 with numbers 1-3 repeated twice) and places a stone on the corresponding column. The first Sage to place all 10 of their stones wins. However, should your pieces become surrounded, your pieces will be banished from the board. The dice themselves can help or hinder your efforts!

The game boards provide a play area but are also nothing short of a work of art. Made from exotic and local woods, pearlescent colored resin, and then sealed within a resin layer, each board is as unique as the Sage who owns it. The boards also come with a routed hanging notch to easily display the board in your Study.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Take That, Tile Placement

name: Frosthaven: High Seas Ambush
description: A promo scenario for Frosthaven related to Pixel Circus. The scenario was made freely available on July 14, 2023 via Frosthaven’s Kickstarter campaign update #137 “Frosthaven play surface books (and more) on Backerkit“.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Frosthaven: Lost Arcade
description: A promo scenario for Frosthaven related to Penny Arcade. The scenario was made freely available during Gloomhaven Grand Festival on BackerKit on June 29, 2023 via the project update “Running monsters in the RPG and more about Forteller”.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Fairy Market
description:
"The Faerie Market opens at dawn. There are many strange and wonderous items to be had in the markets, for a price, and I've instructed other apprentices in the market to trade with you as well. Return to me when you have the items and I shall give you other chores. Continue to serve well and I shall be mightily impressed. Be warned, Time passes strangely in Faerie, and Beware deals with the Fae."

As an apprentice to an absent-minded wizard in town, you've been sent to the strange and wonderous Faerie Markets to do some shopping. Trade for Magical items, use them to gain an advantage, and even make deals with the fairies themselves. Compete with other apprentices to bring back the goods, and beware deals with the Fae."

Fairy Market is a 2-4 player game in which you will trade goods with an ever-changing market, racing to complete lists for the Wizard. Strategize how to get the cards you need, without letting others know what you're after. Play cards to change the market, change your hand or even lock your opponents options, but beware, the market can be unpredictable. When someone has completed a decided number of lists, how many lists were completed, and how accurately, are tallied for points. The player with the most points wins.

Includes rules for either a lighter game or a more strategic "Timeless Realm" Variation.

-description from designer
mechanics: Contracts, Hand Management, Market, Open Drafting, Trading, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Geekmon Capture
description:
Welcome to Geekmon Capture!

Geekmon Capture is a fast and fun dexterity game, full of geek references, about capturing little monsters.

During the game, players must use their aiming skills to throw their cubes trying to hit the wild Geekmon cards in a dispute to capture them. Each Geekmon is then captured by the player who managed to land the most cubes on their card.

But stay tuned, as you must not throw your cubes randomly, since by capturing the evolutions of your Geekmon you increase the score of your cards. At the end of the game, the player with the highest score is the winner.

Some plot twists during the game, such as the appearance of luminous Geekmon, critical hits, type advantages and even removing opponents' cubes from the cards (or sometimes even your own) by hitting another cube on it, will make the game exciting from the beginning to the end of the match.

-description from designer
mechanics: Flicking, Set Collection, Variable Set-up

name: MAGMAG Baseball: All Star
description:
The MAGMAG Baseball -ALL STAR- is an extension of MAGMAG Baseball.

A total of six character cards, including pitchers and hitters, have been added to enable a much more dynamic game.

Enjoy the game much more conveniently with improved mini game rules and card interface.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Romantic Crocodile: Friends
description:
Romantic Crocodile Friends is an extension of romantic Crocodile.

You can enjoy the game much more fun and party-like with the new item card.

A new landmark card has been added for each score. Place your destination card according to your score and enjoy your own world tour course.

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Travel
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Push Your Luck

name: Masters of the Universe: Battleground – She-Ra with Swift Wind
description:
Even the mightiest heroes require a loyal ally by their side.
And what better companion could there be than a majestic steed?
She-Ra, riding upon Swiftwind – a magnificent winged unicorn that flies fearlessly above the battlefields of Eternia. United, they form an indomitable duo, an unstoppable force that ensures justice prevails over every wicked adversary.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Let's Fly
description:
Would you like to fly to the other side of the world? Can’t find suitable routes? Create your own routes and win the card game Let’s Fly. Get to know various passenger aircraft types and the world’s busiest airports, along with their official names and codes.

Pick one of the 4 game objectives and score points, count the passengers or conquer continents. Each turn decide whether to draw a card from the pile of Aircraft Cards or Airport Cards. Tactically connect the airports using the right aircraft and, together with other players, create route chains in 6 different colours. But be careful, there can only be 1 winner in the end. Will it be you?

—description from the designer
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Educational, Transportation
mechanics: Connections, Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Monopoly: Malta
description:
Travel around Malta in this special edition of MONOPOLY. You can now play this classic game with the landmarks and businesses that give Malta its distinctive character and appeal. Visit every corner of Malta and own your favourite locations.
Your journey begins at the ĦAĠAR QIM TEMPLES, then step forth into the natural beauty of cultural highlights like Riviera Bay and Blue Lagoon.

With over 150 kilometres of coastline, stunning beaches and countless historical monuments, Malta is rich in character, wonder, gorgeous weather and inspirational history. Buy up every location on the board and outmanoeuvre your opponents to victory! Invest in houses and hotels, then watch the rent come pouring in! Stay sharp, because there’s only room at the top for one. Trade your way to success.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: One Card Wonders
description:
Fight a titan, wage a war of conquest, have a drawing contest using only dots, or just try to build better words than your friends - all in the palm of your hand.

One Card Wonders is a library of single-card games that covers a wide range of genres and mechanisms, including area control, dexterity, hidden movement, abstract, racing, pattern recognition, dice games, drawing games, word games, and more!

This set requires only a few simple components to play, most of which you can find around the house, and the games can all be played pretty much anywhere. You can have a space battle on an airplane tray, or try to use the snakes of Medusa to turn your friends to stone without using any table space at all.

The games included in this set are:

Space Ace
Killer Looks
Blown Away
Zomboy +
UFO, Go!
Fly, You Fools
Tiny Titan
Tug of Paw
Breached
Clash of Coins
Science Project Gone Wrong
Dungeon Dash
Realm of Ironfist
Max Tagger
Squarcles
Mini Mosaic
The Letterator
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Bluffing, Card Game, Dice, Party Game, Print & Play, Racing, Science Fiction, Territory Building, Video Game Theme, Word Game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Communication Limits, Dice Rolling, Drawing, Flicking, Hidden Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Recognition, Race, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Take That, Tug of War

name: Happy Corgi
description:
Immerse yourself in the crazy world of a not-so-gutsy, but hilarious Corgi! In this game, you'll have to do a ton of activities to fill up your happiness gauge. Give out hugs, sniff snuggles and go on adventures in the park and flat, all the while avoiding the nasty dog and sneaky cat who are trying to thwart your mad quest for absolute happiness!

How to play?

Step 1: Draw an Action card or take an Action card from the river

Step 2 & 3: Move your corgi to a location and trigger its effect

Step 4: Turn over the Place card
Step 5: Choose between –

Spend your action cards to complete an activity and win hugs
Put a poo on one of the activities to get a hug when the activity is completed
Do nothing


The first player to get 10 hugs wins the game !
Game mode available with the black cat and the naughty dog!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards

name: New England Volunteers Playpack 2
description:
This pack consists of ASL Starter Kit (ASLSK) scenarios that only require the ASLSK HASL Decision of Elst (DaE) to be played. The five scenarios in NEV Play Pack 2 are listed below:
NEV6: Duriez Farm
NEV7: Taking The Fight To The Germans
NEV8: Close Quarters
NEV9: Holy Boys
NEV10: Le Cornet Malo
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Warriors of the Blue
description:
A WW2 air and naval game for two players, About the war of convoys in the Mediterranean.
Fast paced scenarios (4 turns each).
In a turn players assemble and move surface fleets, perform air and surface searching, and prepare airstrikes.
Then players fight aerial combat and perform air strikes against fleets and airports/ports.
Each scenario lasts 4 turns. Each turn is composed of 4 Phases, and each phase is composed of 8 Impulses, that indicate the sequence of actions to be performed.

-description from designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Art Frenzy: Gallery Edition
description:
Using pattern recognition, recall, and quick reflexes, be the first player to spot the piece of art from an array of forty cards with the hint provided by an app on your phone or tablet.

—user summary
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Memory, Party Game
mechanics: Memory, Pattern Recognition

name: Vs System 2PCG: Fractured Family
description: The Fractured Family is the first Issue of the Cosmic Power Story Arc. This 55-card set includes Fantastic Four heroes from across the Marvel Universe. The First Family faces challenges to the balance of power in outer space and threats to reality as we know it!
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Waters Unvexed:  Three Battles of the  Mississippi River, 1862
description:
Waters Unvexed details the three largest naval battles fought on the upper Mississippi River (north of the city of Vicksburg) in the months of May and June, 1862. Both sides viewed control of the river as key to the war’s outcome. The Confederate vessels of the Mississippi River Defense Fleet had been formed from converted river sidewheel paddle steamers whose bows had been fitted with iron rams and reinforced with packed bales of cotton, as well as armed with various numbers and sizes of artillery pieces. The Union Mississippi River Squadron was made up of purpose-built stern paddlewheel gunboats and sidewheel rams. The Union vessels were fitted in many places with thin iron sheets and dubbed “tin clads”. The gunboats were all armed with powerful rifled cannon while their rams were only armed with their iron prows. The game portrays the battles of Island Number 10, Plum Point Bend and the First Battle of Memphis. Can you do as well or better than your historical counterpart?

Each copy of Waters Unvexed is composed of the following:

• Three 11 by 17 inch hex maps.
• One sheet of 154 single-sided, un-mounted counters.
• One players’ aid sheet.
• 8 pages of rules.

Players will also need one standard deck of playing cards, a six-sided die and one ten-sided die to play the game. A die roll of 0 is read as 10 and not zero. An opaque container (mug, envelope) is also needed to play the game.

Each turn represents 15 minutes of time. Each hex is about 200 yards across. Each unit represents 1 warship or a battery of 6-10 cannon.

Players use a standard deck of cards to determine who activates and with how many units, as well as when to determine random events and the end of the turn. Dice are used to resolve combats and other game events. Play is very interactive and true to the history.

-description from designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Hedbanz Blast Off!
description:
Hedbanz Blast Off! is the high-flying, fast-talking version of the classic guessing game 'Who Am I?`

Each team picks a player to be the first Guesser and gives them a Blastoff Timer Headband to wear. Insert a picture card without looking (so that Everyone knows but you!), turn the timer knob, and start asking questions! Your team can only give one-word answers or make sounds. If you guess the card on your head before time expires, insert a new card and reset the timer. But if you`re too slow, the card with BLAST OFF, flying off your headband making you start over with a new card!

First team to correctly guess 3 cards wins the round; win 3 rounds, and you win the game. Includes 100 new picture cards to guess, or add cards from other HEDBANZ editions to keep the fun going!

Includes 2 Blastoff Timer Headbands, 100 Picture Cards, 25 Bonus Cards, 6 Sample Question Cards, and Instructions.
mechanics: Deduction, Team-Based Game

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Wedding Promo Cards
description:
This set of 4 promo cards that were initially only given out to guests of Jason Hill's wedding. This includes:

Elegant Top Hot: Gear. Male Heroes Only. Whenever a Depth Event is rolled while holding back the darkness, you may recover a grit.

Elegant Veil: Gear. Female Heroes only. Spirit armor 4+.

Headline News: Gear. Discard this item to allow every hero to recover a grit (or D3 grit if law or outlaw).

The Cursed Joining: Encounter.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Admiral of the Fleet: Naval Annual 1885-1906
description:
This volume of the AOTF NAVAL ANNUAL Series provides nearly 400 pre-formatted, printable ship logs. It covers the many ship classes of the 1885-1906 period for the navies of Argentina, Austria-Hungary, Brazil, Chile, China, Denmark, France, Germany, Great Britain, Greece, Italy, Japan, Netherlands, Norway, Portugal, Russia, Spain, Sweden, Turkey, and the United States. The ship logs are divided into sections by country, each preceded by summary sheets listing basic information for each of the ship classes included for that country.

The AOTF Naval Annual Series is an obvious play on Brassey’s & Jane’s but with actual ship logs for playing AOTF. There will be three volumes in the series: 1885-1906, 1907-1921, and 1922-1944. Covers will be color-coded similar to Conway’s (blue, green and red respectively) and each volume will be comprised of ship logs for each country (alphabetic by country, then ship type, then completion date) preceded by summary pages for each country. A single ship log for each class (using the data of a representative ship of the class for the time period) is provided and for ship classes spanning volumes (i.e. all the WW1-era battleships and cruisers like HOOD, CAVOUR, PENNSYLVANIA, etc.), updated versions will appear in the subsequent volume.

The first two volumes are limited to battleships, battlecruisers, armored cruisers and light cruisers but the third volume will also contain individual ship logs for classes of destroyers.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Mind Your Own Plate
description:
You are a Foodie! And the dinner table is set!

Your mission in this 2-4 (or more) player game is to put together a meal — consisting of four types of dishes and one beverage — that fulfils your specific (and secret) dinner mission.

Your mission involves one of four important food dimensions: calories, gastronomic quality, price, and carbon emissions.

Watch out! Other Foodies might try to interfere with your mission and food choices — so keep an eye on your own plate and one on the other players’!

It takes around 20-45 minutes to play the game depending on the game mode and the hunger for victory.

Good luck - and bon appétit!

—description from the designer
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Environmental, Party Game
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Deck Construction, Hand Management

name: Ring of Chaos
description:
Welcome to a world of adventure, strategy, and chaos! In the depths of an ancient temple, the all-powerful Ring of Chaos beckons.

Assemble your party of four adventurers, each bestowing unique cards and powers, for they are your key to strength and survival. Engage in a race against rivals and perilous temple guardians, where every decision counts and strategy reigns supreme. Will you harness the Ring's power to summon the Gods of Chaos, or eliminate all competition to stand victorious?

With multiple paths to triumph, Ring of Chaos offers fast-paced, competitive, and seriously fun gameplay. Embark on this epic quest, seize the Ring, and control the chaos that awaits!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Hot Potato, King of the Hill, Multiple Maps, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Gore and Gold
description:
Set sail and embark on an unforgettable pirate adventure! Amidst “Gore and Gold”, you'll battle pirates, plunder merchant ships, explore abandoned wrecks, seize sparkling treasures, and bury them on your treasure islands. But be cautious, danger lurks everywhere: gigantic sea creatures slumber in the depths of the ocean.

In this world, everything is shrouded in shades of black and white, symbolizing the strong contrast between right and wrong, the lure of treasure, and the ever-present danger on the high seas. This unique visual style will transport you to a realm where morality is as treacherous as the ocean itself.

Goal of the game
Bury the most gold treasures on your island

Each round is divided into 4 phases:
Phase I: Drawing an action card
Phase II: Positioning the ships
Phase III: Revealing the adventures
Phase IV: Buying gear cards / Burying and stealing treasures
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fighting, Nautical, Pirates
mechanics: Deck Construction, Push Your Luck, Secret Unit Deployment, Semi-Cooperative Game, Take That, Traitor Game, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: HYDRA: Das Kartenspiel
description:
HYDRA is a card game for 2-6 players, but at its core designed for 4 players. In this game, the order determines who attacks and who defends. As the attacker, you take on the role of the Hydra and try to successfully carry out your attacks and bring home your points (stake). You do this by getting rid of your hand cards before anyone else. The other players try to prevent this or "secretly" support the attacker.

But the whole thing comes with a twist in two ways! On one hand, each player plays for him/herself, but is always part of one of two teams. On the other hand, there are the ever-changing teams, which are determined by the COMPANION CARD and can also change during the game. Phew! Are you still keeping track of who your real team members are, or are you being cheated through your teeth?

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Deduction, Hand Management, Hidden Roles, Ladder Climbing, Team-Based Game, Trick-taking

name: Gemwielders: Aquamarine
description:
