A brand new gem for Gemwielders Deckbuilding Game. It replaces one of the gem types in the core set to create five new possible variations of the draft deck and comes with two water themed cards to track life and power.

The Aquamarine is focused on skill cards and synergy. Combine your gem cards thoughtfully, play them out in the right order, and you will be rewarded with surprising and powerful results.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Muerte Desde Arriba: Air Combat During the Spanish Civil War
description:
Muerte Desde Arriba (Death From Above) is an introductory level aerial combat game set during the Spanish Civil War. Each player takes command of 2 or 3 aircraft and attempts to either conduct a bombing or reconnaissance mission, while the opponent attempts to prevent the mission from being successfully conducted.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling

name: Moolah Madness
description:
Moolah Madness invites you to embark on an exhilarating journey through the unpredictable world of money, strategy, and laughter. It's more than just a card game; it's an adventure where fortunes can change in an instant, where strategic decisions meet wild surprises, and where endless fun awaits.

Gameplay

Setting Up the Madness: Start by shuffling the draw pile and placing it face down in the center of the gaming table.

The Unpredictable Draw: Players take turns drawing a card from the pile, moving clockwise. The draw can result in various outcomes, including exciting events like Crashes and Heists, which can turn the tide of the game.

Strategic Decision-Making: Players privately check their drawn cards and make a choice: play the card immediately or keep it for a future turn.

Playing Your Hand: Cards from your hand can be strategically deployed in two ways: adding Moolah cards to your money pile or playing action cards that can affect the game's dynamics.

Protection and Strategy: Strategic use of Armor cards can shield you from adverse events and actions, while Audit, Market Intel, and Magnet cards offer unique advantages for those quick enough to seize them.

Winning the Madness:

The path to victory in Moolah Madness lies in accumulating the most Moolah cards in your money pile. When all the cards from the draw pile have been claimed, the player with the greatest Moolah wealth emerges as the ultimate victor. Notably, any remaining cards in players' hands are discarded as the game concludes.

Moolah Madness is not just a card game; it's a captivating journey where you navigate the dynamic world of money, strategy, and endless fun. Will you thrive in this unpredictable financial landscape and emerge as the Moolah Madness champion?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event

name: Path of Civilization: Fabien Flamel Promo Card
description:
An additional level 2 Leader card, given out during Essen 2023.

Promo card GL-43

Level II Leader (Spiritism) which give the permanent ability to lose one research point to gain another one each turn.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: HexDragon
description:
HexDragon a mind-tangling puzzle game where the longest dragon usually wins!

HexDragon is a hexagonal tile-based strategy game about building dragons for 1 - 4 players.

Utilising a very well known connection mechanic, we set out to create a strategy game for everyone. Adding the star token as a unique twist + a handful of clever tweaks to make it an awesome experience.

Rules and Features
Game starts with a 6-tailed piece in the center.
Everyone gets 3 "head" pieces and 3 "body" pieces and a star token. Body pieces are refilled to players as the play, but heads are not!
Players take turns putting 1 of their pieces anywhere on the board, or using the star token to reserve a place for some of their later turns.
Points are awarded for connections of any kind - be it tail-head, head-head, tail-tail or a loop.
A few key features make HexDragon way more fun than what you see at first glance.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Connections, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Take That, Tile Placement

name: Vs. System 2PCG: Future Foundation
description:
In this final 55-card installment to the Cosmic Power Story Arc, the young geniuses of the Future Foundation give your deck the scientific breakthroughs it needs to take on even the toughest opponents. Join Ant-Man, She-Hulk, Medusa, and more as they use their powers to defeat their enemies and keep their friends out of harm's way.

—description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Vs. System 2PCG: Frightful Foes
description:
The Frightful Foes is the second Issue of the Cosmic Power Story Arc. This 55-card set includes feared Super Villains from the Frightful Foes. This issue will dive deeper into the darker chapters of the Fantastic Four’s history and the people they once called friends who became the Frightful Foes.

—description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Billion Battles: The Multiverse of Fantasy
description:
Billion Battles is a fast-paced RPG that combines sneaky humour, creativity, and a touch of strategy. In this game, each player blindly selects a unique Hero and Power card, then a shared Goal is unveiled. Your mission? In 10 minutes, role-play your hero and engage in epic polemic battles trying to convince and outwit your fellow players as you make the most persuasive or funny statement on how you would achieve the shared Goal.

However, here's the twist that adds a layer of amusement to the game - each player is assigned a hilarious hidden phrase that they must wive into their speech without anyone else noticing. The challenge lies in seamlessly blending this phrase into your role-playing narrative while keeping a straight face.

The stakes are high, if someone catches you pronouncing your hidden phrase, you're instantly busted and out of the game. Billion Battles offers a unique and entertaining twist on role-playing games. Also, it includes various game modes, ensuring endless hours of laughter and fun for student parties or family game nights.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Acting, Action/Event, Closed Drafting, Cooperative Game, Deduction, Role Playing, Take That

name: Apothecary: Plague Doctors
description:
The Black Death is Coming!

Take on the role of rival apothecary shop owners from the renaissance period in Apothecary: Plague Doctors.

In this 2-4 player card game you’ll draft ingredients and actions to help you complete orders, hinder your opponents, and distract the guards (if you’re planning on selling some poison on the side). The player with the highest combined value of orders at the end of the game wins and just might survive the plague.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Finale Ending, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That

name: Huddle Up: Master the plays, dominate the field
description:
Huddle Up is a board game implementation of the popular sport American Football. In 1 vs. 1 you compete on the football field. First select your favorite playbooks and unique teams, the latter you can then improve in the draft and get new players with special skills in your team.

By playing your offensive plays you try to manipulate the dice in your direction and score points by touchdowns or field goals. The defense, of course, wants to prevent this by picking the right defense. Both sides have to keep an eye on the time and the referees. Play your timeouts and your challenge flag skillfully to lead your team to victory.

Whoever could score better after four quarters wins.
mechanics: Action Drafting, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Revelations: Skirmish
description:
Revelations: Skirmish is a fast-paced, reactive table-top combat game. Each player builds their force of infantry, drones, vehicles, and powerful WarMechs to achieve victory on the battlefield.

Every game of Skirmish allows players an intense and enjoyable tactical experience, filled with destructive combat. All of the rules and stats are available for free.

—description from the publisher

Revelations: Skirmish is a game for 2 players using small army sizes (up to 12 miniatures per side). An expansion (available to download for free) makes the game enjoyable as a solo experience.

The game sets itself apart from many others by making everything available to print at home. The rules are free and the miniatures needed to play are available to buy as STLs for 3D printing at home.

—user summary
categories: Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Pitch Battles: City v United
description:
Whether it is Inter v. Milan, Madrid v. Athletico or Colchester v. Southend, nothing can match the passion and excitement of a derby football game. With a third of the season played and performances so far nothing to cheer about, old rivalries are rekindled as the days tick by to the biggest derby in the calendar – it is City v. United.

As manager of one of the two teams, pick your starting line up from your squad and chose your formation. Using you own deck, you will be playing cards from your hand to direct players, moving their tokens to tackle, gain possession, pass your way through the opposition’s defence and shoot for goal. You will look to your assistant coach to provide tactical guidance, whilst your team captain will try to inspire and rally the troops. Get the ref on your side and encourage your supporters to cheer and spur your team on. Maybe a bit of intimidation from the fans will sway things your way, encouraged by some dubious challenges. To win the beautiful game you may need to play ugly. This is the local derby and winning is all that matters!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck Construction

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Xenocyte Impalers Enemy Pack
description:
The cold dark halls of the derelict ship are home to more than just stumbling undead Necronauts and jittering robots that have been corrupted by the power of the Void. Vile alien creatures also lurk within the dead ship, nesting in the bowels of the hulk, and swarming any explorers that wander too far into the dark. The Xenocyte Impalers crawl on viciously sharp legs, with a whipping tail to impale their foes. Deadly fast, they fade into the shadows before descending on their targets for the kill.

Shadows of Brimstone: Xenocyte Impalers Enemy Pack contains everything you need to encounter the deadly Xenocyte Impalers: six Xenocyte Impaler models, 6×30 mm bases, the enemy record sheet, and all of the threat cards needed to add these vicious alien enemies to your games of Shadows of Brimstone.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Cupset
description:
Cupset is an unpredictable four player strategy game filled with upsets and underdogs!

Each player tries to eliminate their opponents' pieces by engaging in battle, winning, and stacking on top of them and becoming the Top Dog!

Each player starts with ten cups. Each turn you may choose to move around the board or declare a fight with an opponent's adjacent piece. The winner of the battle stacks on top of the loser, eliminating their piece and growing their own stack.

To battle, the attacker rolls the die to determine the winner, but the odds on the die change according to the size of the cup stacks. Even stacks have even odds, but taller stacks have better odds, with the Top Dog stack having the best odds of all! But watch out, even the smallest stack can upset the odds and become the new Top Dog!
But that's not all! Each player controls two secret "underdog" pieces that can quickly change the course of the game!

The last surviving player wins the game and reigns as Top Dog of the yard!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hidden Roles, Player Elimination, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Tavern Tumult
description:
Duke it out as root beer swilling gnomes in this raucous tavern showdown!

Tavern Tumult is a 4-player fighting game set in a whimsical tavern full of rowdy, tough-as-nails, root beer swilling, gnomes. Weather the barrage of tiny fists, dish out some damage of your own, and don't forget to raise a frothy mug and toast to friendly carnage!

The goal of the game is to be the last gnome standing. You accomplish this by moving around the board, drawing/playing action cards, and finding root beer barrels. If you run out of health points at any time during the game, you have been eliminated. Remove your gnome from the board and decide which one of the remaining players you're going to root for.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Player Elimination

name: Dragon Eclipse: #NoMystlingLeftBehind
description:
This add-on includes all 6 Mystlings and their cards (Aquakin, Bluemane, Cloudyne, Crystail, Cthonid, and Lear) that haven’t won the polls during the Gamefound crowdfunding campaign.

Every Mystling pack includes: 3 Mystling action cards, 2 study cards, 4 sheet cards, and 1 quest card.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Squid Game: Marbles
description:
For fans of the Squid Game series on Netflix, play this marbles game like your life depends on it! Players, welcome. For this game, you will be playing in teams of two. Find someone you wish to play the game with. Each player will take one bag. Each bag has a set of ten marbles. Using your set of marbles, you will play marble challenges of your choice against your partner. The player who manages to lose two challenges is eliminated. Let the game begin! This game is for 2 players, ages 18 and up- perfect for drinking games for adults party and college dorm room essentials. The game includes 6 exclusive marble challenges inspired by the show in easy, medium, or hard levels. “Find someone you wish to play the game with.” Simple But could you choose knowing the stakes were your opponent’s life- or your own? Children’s games take an ominous turn in Squid Game. While the stakes of these games aren’t so extreme, try playing with the intensity of a show contestant. Attention! The next game is about to begin.

SQUID GAME MARBLES: Play 6 exclusive marble challenges inspired by the jaw-dropping Netflix show. Choose from games in easy, medium, or hard levels. Perfect for parties- adult games for game night, board games for adults & more.

HOW TO PLAY: For this game, you will be playing in teams of two. Find someone you wish to play the game with. Each player will take one bag. Each bag has a set of ten marbles.

HOW TO WIN: Using your set of marbles, you will play marble challenges of your choice against your partner. The player who manages to lose two challenges is eliminated. Let the game begin!

Contents: 20 Marbles, 2 Bags, 4 Punch Sheets, Instructions.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Bluffing, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Flicking, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game

name: Creatures of Rock
description:
Creatures of Rock is a exciting and easy-to-learn strategy card game for players of all ages and all levels of strategic skill.

Creatures of Rock is a fast-paced strategic card game where players try to form a 4-member band with the most Star Power whilst disrupting their opponent’s band. During the game you can collect or steal opponents’ equipment to earn bonus Star Power. Watch out for Wild Cards as these allow players to disrupt other bands carefully laid out plans. Make sure you play strategically, as the game can end at any moment once 3 stage call cards are played.

Object of the Game:
To win you must form a 4-member band with the most Star Power before the final “Stage Call” & the game ends.

Card Types:
Band Member Cards: There are 4 types of Band Members: Singer, Guitarist, Bassist, and Drummer, each with different base Star Power and Combo Bonus. There are Multi-Talent Band Members who can be 1 of 2 Band Member Types when they take to the stage.
Equipment Cards: Can give bonus Star Power at games end.
Wild Cards: Make the game a little crazy.
Stage Call Cards: Decide when the game ends.

Setup:
Shuffle the deck & deal 4 cards to each player. Keep your cards secret.
Place the remaining cards in a Pick-Up Pile face down.
The Player with the next birthday goes first.

How to Play:
At the start of your turn, you can do 1 of the following:
-Take the top card from the Pick-Up Pile to your hand
-Take 1 card from the top 2 cards on the Discard Pile to your hand
-Take 1 equipment card from another players “Stage Setup” to your hand

Next, you can place any Equipment Cards face down in front of you, this is your “Stage Setup”. Your Band Members will combine with the Equipment on your “Stage Setup” at the games end. Your “Stage Setup” can have a maximum of 5 pieces of Equipment. You can’t discard or take back to you hand any piece of equipment once it is on your stage.

At the end of your turn, you must only hold a total of 6 Cards. Discard cards into the Discard Pile until your hand only has 6 cards. “Stage Call” Cards cannot be discarded at this time. Discard cards face up.

It is now the next players turn.

Wild & “Stage Call” Cards can be played at any time during the game. When played Wild Cards go onto the Discard Pile. When played “Stage Call” cards go onto a separate pile.
Ending the Game:
A game ends when 3 Stage Call cards have been played, or at the end of the turn of the player who drew the last card from the Pick-Up Pile. Once the game ends no more Wild Cards can be played.

When the game ends, place any Equipment Cards from your hand onto your Stage Setup until it contains a maximum of 5 pieces of Equipment.

Each player selects 4 Band Members from their hand to take to their Stage. A Band Member does not need an Equipment Card to take to the stage.
Get the total Star Power of your band by adding the Star Power of each member (the number in the blue star).

Then add on any bonus from Equipment and/or Band Member combinations.
The Player with the band with the highest Star Power including any bonus power wins the game.

Creatures of Rock is made by small game designer Funable Games
mechanics: Take That, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Path of Civilization: Mata-Eva Promo Card
description:
An additional level I Leader card

Promo card GL-48

Level I Leader Card: Add two cubes on event wars 9b.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Path of Civilization: Super Spy Promo Card
description:
An additional level I Leader Card

Promo card GL-46

Level I Leader Card: Immediately gain one military cube and one philosophy cube.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Mouni: Taktika, szoctám, élet
description:
Mouni is a board game that combines the challenges of survival and strategic thinking with a humorous and exciting gaming experience. The goal of the game is for players to collect 60 points and pass the Municipality field, while using various cards to gain an advantage or make it more difficult for their opponents.

There are four main types of cards in the game: event, object, instant, and crunch. Event cards give one-time tasks that must be completed immediately. Object cards help players in different ways, such as giving extra steps or other benefits. Instant cards can be played at any time and have an immediate effect on the game. Crunch cards help players with various properties on their journey.

During the game, players can roll, move, and complete various tasks on the fields they step on. There is also the possibility of fighting, where players compete against each other for points or cards.

Mouni is an exciting and varied game where players need to think strategically and find the best method to win. The humorous elements and varied cards of the game guarantee that every game party will be a unique and memorable experience.

—description from the designer

A "Mouni" egy társasjáték, amely a túlélés és a stratégiai gondolkodás kihívásait ötvözi egy humoros és izgalmas játékélménnyel. A játék célja, hogy a játékosok összegyűjtsenek 60 pontot, és áthaladjanak az Önkormányzat mezőn, miközben különböző kártyákat használnak fel, hogy előnyhöz jussanak, vagy megnehezítsék ellenfeleik helyzetét.

A játékban négy fő kártyatípus található: esemény, tárgy, instant és krícsör. Az esemény kártyák egyszeri feladatokat adnak, amelyeket azonnal végre kell hajtani. A tárgy kártyák különböző módon segítenek a játékosoknak, például plusz lépéseket adnak, vagy más előnyöket biztosítanak. Az instant kártyákat bármikor ki lehet játszani, és azonnali hatással vannak a játékra. A krícsör kártyák pedig különböző tulajdonságokkal segítik a játékosokat az útjukon.

A játék során a játékosok dobhatnak, léphetnek, és különböző feladatokat teljesíthetnek a mezőkön, amelyekre lépnek. A játékban lehetőség van verekedésre is, amely során a játékosok egymás ellen küzdenek a pontokért vagy a kártyákért.

A "Mouni" egy izgalmas és változatos játék, amelyben a játékosoknak stratégiailag kell gondolkodniuk, és meg kell találniuk a legjobb módszert a győzelemre. A játék humoros elemei és változatos kártyái garantálják, hogy minden játékparti egyedi és emlékezetes élmény lesz.

—description from the designer (Hungarian)
mechanics: Action/Event, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Events, Finale Ending, Map Reduction, Modular Board, Race, Trading

name: Fame & Fortune
description:
In a realm threatened by an evil wizard known as the Monster Master, the fate of the land hangs in the balance. The Monster Master has started his sinister summoning ritual, raising legendary monsters from the phantom plane to spread darkness across the land. As a skilled leader, you've assembled a diverse party of adventurers to quell this malevolent force. Your party ventures into the depths of the Whispersong Glade, only to discover that you're not the only ones on this treacherous quest. A fierce competition ensues as you race to collect loot from legendary monsters, steal their gold hoard, and eliminate any foes standing in your way. Will you be the ones to thwart the Monster Master's sinister plan, or will you bring darkness to the land?

Fame & Fortune is a captivating and intense strategy RPG set in a fantastical world where you and your party must outwit both mythical monsters and rival adventurers. Your primary objective is to accumulate a combination of Fame and Fortune Points by defeating legendary monsters and seizing their coveted treasures. As you engage in epic battles and navigate treacherous dungeons, you'll need to defeat any rivals who stand in your path. But beware, if the Monster Master finishes their ritual, only they win the game.

Fame & Fortune promises 20-30 minutes of heart-pounding excitement per player, as you strategize, battle, and race to emerge victorious in this gripping, fantasy-filled RPG adventure... & One lucky player gets to be the bad guy.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Adventure, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Advantage Token, Alliances, Die Icon Resolution, Drawing, Events, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Interrupts, Kill Steal, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Negotiation, Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Take That, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Space-Off
description:
Two stranded teams of astronauts face off in a tournament of mini-games that's scored like a tug-of-war. Players fight over the remains of their landing craft, held ransom by the local aliens. Through brain teasers, social manipulation, dexterity challenges and more, one team will earn the right to put their ship back together and blast off for Earth! The other team will get ritually sacrificed.

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Party Game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Acting, Action Timer, Action/Event, Advantage Token, Betting and Bluffing, Chaining, Chit-Pull System, Deduction, Dice Rolling, Drawing, Finale Ending, Flicking, Grid Movement, Hot Potato, Income, Ladder Climbing, Matching, Measurement Movement, Memory, Negotiation, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Recognition, Player Judge, Push Your Luck, Race, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Roll / Spin and Move, Singing, Slide/Push, Team-Based Game, Tug of War, Zone of Control

name: Roost
description:
Roost is a card game about strategy, memorisation, alliances and, most importantly, birds. Players must avoid being at the bottom of the pecking order and stay aligned with the flock to fly away to overall victory.

Your goal in Roost is to have the lowest score at the end of the game. Players start the game by only knowing half of their hand and must use abilities, alliances and memory to ensure they win each round. On each turn, a player can either pick up a card from the:

Unknown Pile - the player may view it privately. Then, they must choose to either place it directly onto the Discard Pile OR replace 1 of their own cards with it OR place it on top of an opponent's face-up card.
Discard Pile - the player must replace 1 of their own cards with it.


At any time, players can match cards onto the top discard pile card.

Most birds contain abilities where you can switch, steal, discover, enact revenge, boost your final score or FLIP cards. Flipping cards means that players can now, at any point, stack birds onto the face-up cards of an opponent, creating some massive point hauls if not dealt with promptly. Some other abilities involve play direction changing, collecting specific bird breeds, and even taking a significant point hit to enact an ability in the following round.

Event cards introduce one-time game cards, which can be extraordinarily crucial in certain circumstances and give players who are losing miserably a chance of a comeback. A round of Roost ends when a player calls 'Roost', with all other players getting one more turn. If the player wins the Roost, they get a point deduction bonus; otherwise, they get harshly penalised. Beware of Roosting too early, as some cards specifically penalise jumping the gun. Roost is played over multiple rounds, with the game ending when a score threshold is reached for the amount of players playing.

Roost features a modified rule set for 2-3 players and comes with 36 additional cards that can be swapped in to bring new dynamic twists to the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Alliances, Deduction, Hand Management, Matching, Memory, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Set Collection, Track Movement

name: Fortify
description:
Set on a 4x5 grid featuring land, water, and shore terrain, Fortify presents a dynamic battlefield where you must outwit your opponent. Command three unique unit types: Tanks, Infantry, and Battleships. As you take turns, you'll enlist new units, skillfully maneuver them into advantageous positions, fortify your formation for added strength, and launch fierce attacks on enemy units.

But Fortify is not just about tactics; it's about strategy. Tanks are lightning-fast, Infantry enlists at double speed, and Battleships fortify on the shores. These special abilities add depth and excitement to every move you make.

To emerge victorious, you must fortify four strategic squares on the grid, creating intense moments of surprise and anticipation! And for advanced players, two additional units—The Chopper and the Artillery—are included, offering a multitude of strategic possibilities.

With two map options and 5-10 minute fast game sessions, will you outmaneuver your opponent and claim victory in this thrilling war of wits?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Coverage, Grid Movement, Pattern Building, Pattern Movement, Square Grid, Track Movement

name: Gunpowder, Treason and Plot
description:
A real time social deduction game for 4 - 8 players that last 10 minutes.

Players take on a hidden role at the beginning of the game: either as one of the plotters who seek to blow up the houses of parliament, or as a secret agent, working against them from the shadows in this fast paced game of subterfuge.

At the beginning of the game, one bomb card is drawn and placed face up per player. These cards will have a list of components that must be attached to that card in order to prime the bomb.

For the plotters, the primary focus is to draw and play cards from the component deck, matching the symbols on the bomb cards. These are played face down, and once four have been placed, these cards are shuffled and revealed. If even one component doesn't match then those components are discarded and the bomb resets.

The role of the agent is to act like a plotter but to spoil the priming of bombs by placing components that don't match. Subtelty and deception are paramamout as careless agents will be easy to spot.

All players begin the game with access to a pool of suspicion tokens. These can be given to players who are suspected of being agents. Three or more will see the receiving player eliminated from the game.

in a way that As the game progresses, players will arouse suspicion and are voted out if they have three or more suspicion tokens.

Players can also draw from the investigation deck. These cards are designed to help root out the agent but come at the expense of precious time that could be otherwise spent priming the bombs.

Featuring a 10 minute sand timer, once the game begins it doesn't stop until the plotters achieve victory or time runs out and they're caught.

-description from publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Medieval, Party Game, Real-time, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Roles, Real-Time, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game, Voting

name: When Thunder Rolled
description:
When Thunder Rolled (WTR) is a solitaire simulation of the United States Air Force's contribution to Operation Rolling Thunder during the Vietnam War. Rolling Thunder began on 3 March 1965 and concluded on 31 October 1968. During the campaign the USAF and United States Navy bombed targets throughout North Vietnam. The area around Hanoi and Haiphong was the most dangerous area and was split between the USAF and USN. WTR simulates the USAF campaign using the F-105D as the primary bomber.

WTR gives you the opportunity to assume the role of a USAF F-105D pilot, attempting to survive 100 missions over North Vietnam. The game is based on the format originated by the Korean War simulation Able Dog.

A few things I want to say before you take a look. The first is that the counters are...well, let me say I'm not a graphics guy. They're the best I can do but they allow you to play the game. The second is that, as are other games of this genre, When Thunder Rolled is a dice-roller. If you hate this type of game, you'll hate this one, too. The third is that I have taken some shortcuts that make parts of the game somewhat abstract (air-to-air combat is an example). Lastly, if you have comments, positive and negative, please PM me. I'm happy to adapt things that will improve the game. If you love the game, I'm glad. If you hate it, I understand that, too. But I hope you'll at least try it, even if you don't want to fly a full 100 mission tour.

—description from the designer
categories: Aviation / Flight, Print & Play, Vietnam War
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Dungeon Fighter: Second Edition – Promo Hero: Tucker Blackfoot
description:
Originally available as part of Pack Druid from the Dice Tower 2023 Kickstarter campaign.

"Digging up great treasure is well worth a brawl with a puny Bullrog."

Piercing Damage: If you Hit, deal +2 damage to the Monster.
Self Healing: Heal 3 life points.
Earthquake: If you Hit, you can quickly shake the Target board once to make the die slide and change its landing position.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Doom Guard
description:
Doom Guard is a cooperative board game for one to five players, who don the mantle of Earth's mightiest heroes and villains as they are forced to work together in order to protect Earth from total annihilation!

Defeat the minions of Cthulhu, fight the spread of corruption, and beat back the forces of evil through 45-60 minute scenarios that can be played individually or as part of a complete campaign.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Dice, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Events, Interrupts, Map Deformation, Point to Point Movement, Re-rolling and Locking, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Tags, Variable Player Powers

name: Avalanche Card Game
description:
Hello and welcome to Avalanche Card Game, the ultimate skiing card game! Easy to learn and quick to play, Avalanche Card Game brings the excitement of the slopes right to your fingertips. Whether you're a seasoned skier or a winter sports enthusiast, Avalanche Card Game offers a thrilling Alpine adventure for all ages. Discover the thrill of navigating the mountains, mastering your strategy, and outsmarting your fellow skiers.

Collect points by skilfully connecting ski runs to outpace your fellow skiers and snowboarders. However, be wary of potential Avalanches and other challenges that await you on the slopes. A game of strategy and courage, may the best skier win!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Highest-Lowest Scoring

name: Le Val III: Le Maître des Sphères
description:
Le Val III : Le Maître des Sphères (The Master of the Spheres) is the second extension of "Le Val"

Its form is one book of 126 pages.
It complete the game rules with new elements, some variantes and strategic tips (overture, classic formations,...)
The narrator is Helios (the Sun, the big bad guy) of the story.

You have to get Le Val II (the first extension) to play The Val III
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Book, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Storytelling

name: Attack on R'lyeh
description:
Great War is in its last stages, after almost five years of unnecessary bloodshed nations in the conflict found out their plight was orchestrated by a dark cult. From the shadowy island of R'lyeh that was risen from the deep and obscured by magical fog, humankind was puppetered into war that took millions of lives for nothing. True face of the enemy has been revealed by a group of investigators and without any doubt presented to leaders of once mighty empires. Now, time is almost night for the old god to awake from its sleep that took eons, great Cthulhu will bring madness and destruction to the whole world. But, there is still slim hope - a powerful relic from the past, Scepter of Hypnos would be able to put the old god back into his eternal slumber.
This is the story of humanity's greatest challenge, where all nations were brought as one to strike a blow into the very heart of evil. Mission is simple: land forces onto R'lyeh beaches and push trough horror and madness all the way to Necropolis, where group of investigators will perform a ritual with the scepter and save the world.
But, no one knows what terrors await human forces...

SEQUENCE of PLAY

Each turn is consistent of 6 phases: Expedition phase, Event phase, Supply and Support phase, Combat phase, Counter-Attack phase and Morale phase.

Main Mission and Objectives

Capture at least 2 black areas. Hold an area with Tomb of Cthulhu with a brigade that has Investigator's unit attached to it till the end of a turn.

National plan – Secondary Objectives
Roll one d6 to get a random secondary objective or use one of your choice.


French Republic – Capture all areas of the central peninsula (small island connected with bridges to the main landmass).
German Empire – Hold both areas with Portals.
Ottoman Empire – Hold Fort Marsh and Fort Barnabas.
United Kingdom – Finish the game with at least 3 Relics or Artifacts in your possession.
American Forces – Capture all green colored areas.
Russian Empire – Capture all areas with +4 terrain bonus.


Important: if objective of secondary mission is to hold an area, during the turn when you are finishing a Main mission and objective, you also must hold areas as stated for the secondary objective. This means that in that last turn when you are winning the game, those areas must be held (there must be at least on friendly unit in that area that is not exhausted).

Winning and Losing a game

To win a game you must fulfill Main and Secondary mission objectives.

You lose the game if turn counter reaches a space with Cthulhu icon on it and you still didn't finish Main and Secondary mission objectives, or if a special Investigators counter is destroyed. You may also choose to resign a game if you see that due to the loses to your units it is not possible to finish mission parameters anymore.

—description from the designer
categories: Horror, Print & Play, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Unspecified

name: A&A Blitzkrieg '40: The Battle for France
description:
Blitzkrieg '40 -The Battle for France is the second in our Armies & Alliances WWII series. If you liked Arnhem '44, then you will really like Blitz '40: 221 minis including separate infantry figures, tanks, artillery, mechanized, recon, fighters and bombers made for each nation. Two big, beautiful map sections that fit together to create a truly impressive campaign area - from the German frontier with fortress Holland all the way to Paris at 9 miles/hex! Event cards introduce aspects from the historical contest and add to the re-playability and "fog of war". The combat system is similar to Arnhem '44 but adjusted for division vs. battalion scale, and the air rules include Air Superiority, Interception, Interdiction, Close Air Support, Combat Air Patrol, and Ground Attack missions. This game may use minis and big maps, but make no mistake, it is a REAL wargame, not just a great-looking one. Players can even choose to use counters instead of minis - both are provided to fit your personal preference!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Gorbino's Quest
description:
Gorbino's Quest is a strategy game of economic development and civilization building in a fantasy setting for 2-6 players aged 13 and up.

Inspired by Concordia (2013), Mosaic: A Story of Civilization (2022), and Brass: Lancashire (2007); Gorbino's Quest combines the elements of tag collecting, hand management, resource management, income, loans, market, investments, resource production and area control. GB is an action selecting game. On your turn, first gain income marked by the income marker, then choose between 6 actions. Actions include:

Loan
Lose income, but gain Talents (the currency in the game)

Production
Produce resources at the providence of your choice

Trade
Buy and sell up to two different resource types

Development
Purchase Technology cards that contain tags as well as upgraded actions

Reset
Place all your discarded cards back into your hand and gain income

Build
Build at certain providence with Build Distant cards. Build with a certain resource with Build Adjacent cards. Or just build normally by building next to one of your current cities.

Choosing a wise sequence of actions will have the player gain their desired income, actions, resource production, cities and tags.

Game End
The end of the game is triggered after the last Technology card is purchased. Players receive Victory Points from Tags and Achievements. The player with the most Victory points is the winner. Tag VPs (victory points) are shown below:

Yellow Tags: Polycentric
VPs = Number of cities times number of yellow tags

Green Tags: Metropolis
VPs = Number of providences times number of green tags x2

Blue Tags: Abundance
VPs = Number of resource types times number of blue tags x2

Red Tags: Dominance
VPs = Number of providences where you have the most cities times number of red tags x3

Pink Tags: Consistency
VPs = 8 times number of pink tags

Purple Tags: Wealth
VPs = Number of 20 Talent coins times number of purple tags

Achievements
Worth 6 VP each and gained by being the first to accomplish certain objectives:

4 Yellow Tags, 4 Green Tags, 4 Blue Tags, 4 Red Tags, 4 Pink Tags, 4 Purple Tags
5 Cities
4 Providences
3 Providences where you have the most cities
4 Production Types
50 Talents (currency)
Buy last Technology card and trigger end of game

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Income, Investment, Loans, Market, Tags

name: Vastuz
description:
Introduction:Vastuz (from Proto-Germanic: Wahstuz, meaning "size, growth") is a board game for two players: White and Black. It is played on the intersections (points) of a initially empty hexagonal board with triangles. It can be played on a 7–sized board for long games or a 5–sized board for short games. Each player has access to a sufficient supply of stones of their own color.



Definitions:– A group is a set of connected stones of the same color. A single stone is also a group.
– The size of a group is the number of stones it contains.



Turns:Black plays first and then turns alternate. On your turn, perform these actions in the following order:

1. Place a stone of your color on an empty point. You can start a new group or grow one of your preexisting groups by adding a stone, as long as you don't merge groups. If you cannot place a stone, pass your turn, otherwise passing is not allowed.
2. Steal a stone from each adjacent enemy group to your group, as long as the groups have the same shape (even if they are rotated or reflected). You can only perform this action if the newly placed stone is adjacent to a friendly stone. The stolen stones are placed adjacent to your group simultaneously, allowing for further growth.

After growing your group, you must continue stealing stones from adjacent enemy groups that have the same shape. Additionally, if you steal a stone from an enemy group that acquires the same shape as one of your adjacent groups, that group will also steal a stone in response and place it next to it to continue growing. These processes continue as long as your groups can keep growing. If your groups can no longer grow, you can no longer steal more stones.



End of the Game:The game ends when neither player can place more stones on the board. At that point, points are counted to determine the winner. Points are obtained by summing the total number of stones in groups of different sizes, without counting repetitions. Additionally, half a point is awarded to the player with the largest group, and each player receives one point for each group of a different size.

The player with the highest score in the final position wins.

To ensure fairness, before the game starts, the first player places an initial stone, one black and one white, on any empty point of the board, and the second player chooses a side. This balance method is called the pie rule.



Notes:Vastuz is based on Nick Bentley's game Bug, which involves capturing enemy groups with identical shapes. However, Vastuz implements it differently. Instead of capturing the entire enemy group, the player chooses a specific stone from the enemy group with the same shape and adds it to their own group. Additionally, unlike Bug, Vastuz does not impose limits on group growth.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Pattern Building

name: Dendria
description:
Introduction:Dendria (from Greek: Dendron, meaning "tree", combined with the suffix –ria used in many geographical names) is a board game for two players: Light and Dark. It is played on the hexes (soils) of an initially empty hexagonal field (board). It can be played on a 8–sized board for longer games or a 6–sized board for shorter games. Each player has access to a sufficient supply of stones in their own color, divided into three categories: Seeds, trees, and dendrids.

To facilitate the physical game, light brown and dark brown stones can be used. Light and dark brown stones would represent seeds and trees, with seeds on the front and trees on the reverse. In addition, light brown and dark brown pawns can be used to represent dendrids.



Definitions:– A seed is planted by placing it on an empty soil.
– The root of a seed is a set of one or more connected empty soils in a straight line without interruption from that seed to the edge of the board, and a seed, dendrid, or tree of any color is said to provide nutrients to that seed through N uninterrupted empty soils (where N can be zero), as long as it is placed on one of its roots.
– A nourished seed is a seed that has all its roots with nutrients, and it is said to be nourished by a seed, dendrid, or tree of any color located on one of its roots.
– A dendrid sprouts from a nourished seed by more seeds, dendrids, or trees of the same color rather than the opposite color.
– A dendrid fertilizes all connected empty soils in a straight line without interruption.
– A seedbed is a set of one or more seeds of the same color connected together.
– A forest is a set of one or more trees of the same color connected together.
– A fertile soil is an empty soil adjacent to a seedbed or a forest.
– A forest grows from a seedbed whose fertile soils have been fertilized by dendrids of the same color.
– An enemy forest can optionally become a friendly forest if all its fertile soils are fertilized by friendly dendrids and at least one of those fertile soils is not fertilized by enemy dendrids.



Turns:Dark plays first and then alternate. On your turn, perform one of the following actions:

– Plant a seed on an empty soil with at least one nutrientless root. Then, optionally, let one or more dendrids of the corresponding color sprout from it, according to the aforementioned rules. If a seed is planted on an empty soil and all its fertile soils are fertilized by dendrids of the same color, it can immediately grow into a tree of that color.
– Move a dendrid through connected empty soils in a straight line to another empty soil, being able to jump over friendly or enemy seeds, as well as friendly dendrids, but never over trees. Then, optionally, let one or more forests, whether friendly or enemy, grow according to the aforementioned rules. A dendrid can stop at an empty soil to nourish the seeds or make them grow into trees and then move to continue doing so with others during its journey repeatedly, as long as it moves in a straight line.
– Pass your turn.

It is important to note that it is not allowed to make a move that results in an exact repetition of a previous game state. This means that the same moves cannot be repeated in a loop indefinitely.



End of the Game:The game ends when both players pass their turn consecutively. At the end of the game, each player receives one point for each forest of different size without counting repetitions, one point for each forest size in which he has more forests than his opponent and half a point for the player with the largest forest (or the second largest in case of equality).

The player with the highest score in the final position wins.

To ensure fairness, before the game starts, the first player places an initial dark seed anywhere on the empty board, and the second player chooses a side. This balancing method is called the pie rule.

Finally, to prevent possible stalemate tactics where players simply move their dendrids without making significant strategic decisions, at the beginning of the game, players agree to set a limit on the number of dendrid moves in consecutive alternating turns (both with the same number of turns) before considering the game over, which ensures that the game does not extend too long.



Note:In Spanish, I use the word "déndride" for the English version I made: dendrid.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Enclosure, Line of Sight, Pattern Recognition

name: Black Spirits: Combat Cards
description:
Black Spirits: Combat Cards is a card supplement for board games based on extremely popular dark fantasy action RPG video games. It replaces those board games' dice components to enable tactical combat that forces players to make difficult trade-offs, leaning in on the delicate balance of aggression and preservation in a way that is faithful to the ethos of the video games they are based upon. The set is backwards compatible with all aspects of the board games it's suggested for and truly drop-in; no house rules, no component errata, no additional tweaks necessary.

Lean in on the clever strategies that those beloved action RPG games demand. The engine this set includes lets players make careful choices about when to extend their offensive strategy, when to take a conservative approach, and choose which critical moments they're willing to leave in the hands of fate.

Use the enemy's offense to your advantage! Among the cards that allow players to customize their approach toward battle, a brand new parry/riposte mechanic that rewards careful planning and positioning is featured. The set also features a collection of cards that are exclusive to player classes, highlighting a unique playstyle for each class. Using a class card in your deck rewards you for drawing on that class's strengths, and colors gameplay in a way that truly sets each class apart. Finally, Black Spirits: Combat Cards includes several difficulty modes to cater to both brand new players, as well as veterans. Each player can separately choose what difficulty to align to, and players within the same party can even choose not to use cards at all if they prefer chucking dice.

So all players need to do is create their decks, plan carefully, and steel themselves for death.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Fiodar
description:
Introduction:Fiodar (from Old Irish: Fhíodair, meaning "weaver") is a drawless game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the intersections (points) of an initially empty hexagonal board with triangles. It can be played on a 7–sized board for long games or a 5–sized board for short games. Each player has access to a sufficient supply of stones of their own color.



Definitions:– A thread is a set of connected stones of the same color in a straight line. A single stone is also a thread.
– A weave is a set of connected threads of the same color. A single thread is also a weave.
– A cut is a configuration in which two friendly stones are on both sides of a single thread of a weave, crossing it with an imaginary straight line along the line of the thread.
– A cut weave is a weave where each stone it contains is part of at least one cut thread.
– A territory is one or more connected empty points. You own a territory if all the stones connected to it are of your color.



Turns:Black plays first and then turns alternate. On your turn, perform one of the following actions:

– Place a stone of your color on an empty point, then remove all cut enemy weaves from the board. At the end of your turn, there must be no cut friendly weaves left, unless enemy weaves left cut. After this action, the board position must be different from the board positions at the end of all your previous turns.
– Pass your turn.



End of the Game:The game ends when both players pass their turn consecutively. At the end of the game, points are counted by adding friendly territory and captured enemy stones, plus awarding half an extra point to the player who passed his turn first.

To make the game fair, before the game starts, the first player places a black stone on an empty point and the second player chooses a side. This balancing method is called the pie rule.

–description from designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Connections

name: Haugaz
description:
Introduction:Haugaz (from Proto-Germanic: Haugaz, which means "height, hill") is a board game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the intersections (points) of a square board with diagonal lines marked, with the board initially empty. The recommended board size is 8 points per side. Each player has access to a sufficient supply of stackable pieces of their own color.



Definitions:– A stack is a set of pieces stacked on top of each other. A single piece is also a stack.
– The height of a stack is the number of pieces it contains.



Turns:Black plays first and then turns alternate. On your turn, you can either pass your turn or perform the following actions in the following order:

1. Place a stack of height 1 on an empty point (called a 1-stack).
2. Move a stack to an empty point in a straight line, either orthogonally or diagonally, at a distance equal to its height. You cannot move a stack that was just placed on that same turn.
3. Increase the height by 1 of all friendly and enemy stacks that are at the same distance as the height of the stack you just moved, by placing an additional piece of the opposite color on these stacks.



End of the game:The game ends when a player runs out of possible moves. The player with the highest stack on the board is declared the winner. In case of a tie between the highest stacks, the next highest stacks are compared.

To ensure fairness in the game, before the game starts, the first player places a black stack of height 1 and a white stack of height 1 on any empty point, and the second player chooses a side. This balancing method is called the two-stack pie rule.

–description from designer
mechanics: Stacking and Balancing

name: Saving Mankind
description:
Saving Mankind is an engaging and fully cooperative board game that requires all players to collaborate and unite their efforts in a race against time to rescue humanity from the brink of extinction.

Saving Mankind aims to educate and entertain players while promoting awareness of resource conservation and the fight against global warming. It encourages players to take action for a more sustainable future, making it suitable for players of all ages, from pupils to families and friends. Each round offers an engaging and enlightening gaming experience.

Players must strategically select their role cards from a diverse set, including Scientist, Programmer, Movie Star, Politician, and more. Each role provides distinct initial resources, prompting players to make deliberate decisions and contribute to the shared objective.

The board of this space-themed board game is a mesmerizing blend of modern artistry and realistic cosmic imagery, making every move feel like a captivating journey through the cosmos.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Team-Based Game

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Dicefest 2023 Event Promos
description:
These 5 cards were initially exclusives for those that attended Dicefest 2023, and these are not the same cards included in the goody box. They can now be obtained randomly as inserts in bits box orders from Flying Frog’s website. These cards include:

Doctor Benning’s Skull (#1069),
Aztec Eagle Helmet (#1070),
Dead Man’s Cards (#1071),
Sweet Perfume (#1072),
Tentacles from the Void extended art (#art-02)
mechanics: Unspecified

name: BYŌDŌ
description:
Byōdō helps people learn and develop mathematics through games and emotions. It is based on a Game System of numbered hexagonal tiles and polyhedral dice that aids in visualizing and manipulating mathematics in an entertaining and social way.

A Unique Hexagonal Universe
The hexagonal tiles of Byōdō are not just game pieces; they are gateways to a mathematical universe without end. With their unique shape, each tile can connect in countless ways, allowing you to create and solve mathematical challenges in ways you never imagined.

Awaken Your Mathematical Creativity
From simple sums to complex equations, Byōdō invites you to explore mathematical concepts in an entirely new way. There are no strict rules; you decide how to use the tiles to create patterns, solve problems, and develop your mathematical skills in an exciting manner.

Perfect for All Ages and Levels
Whether you're a student beginning your mathematical journey or a lover of numerical challenges, Byōdō caters to all levels. As you progress, the game grows with you, offering an educational and entertaining experience for the whole family.

Connect with the Byōdō Community
Join a global community of creative minds passionate about mathematics. Share your creations, participate in challenges, and discover new ways to play with Byōdō. The possibilities are truly endless when you join our community!

Take Byōdō Worldwide'
Thanks to our focus on quality and innovation, we've created a game that transcends borders. Take Byōdō everywhere and share the excitement of a unique gaming system with friends, family, and colleagues worldwide.

Your Mathematical Journey Begins Here
Get ready for an unparalleled gaming experience. Byōdō is not just a game; it's your gateway to a universe of limitless mathematical possibilities. Explore, create, and challenge your mind with Byōdō today!
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Game System, Math, Memory, Number, Puzzle
mechanics: Connections, Cooperative Game

name: Wacronyms
description:
Wacronyms is a quick-thinking party game designed for adults, focusing on creativity and humor. The game's theme revolves around forming witty and wild acronyms, abbreviations, and initialisms from given letters, often leading to hilarious and unexpected results. Players are presented with a variety of topics, ranging from familiar situations to wacky concepts and emotions, and are challenged to create acronyms using specific letters provided in the game.

The gameplay involves drawing Topic and Letter cards and using these letters to craft an acronym (referred to as a Wacronym) that relates to the given topic. Players have the freedom to choose the order of the letters, which adds a layer of strategy and creativity to the game. For instance, given the topic "A government agency or job that should exist" and the letters "BTC", players might come up with acronyms like "The Candy Bringer" or "Ban Corporate Taxes."

The goal of the game is to win rounds by impressing the judge with the most creative or amusing acronym. The first player to win five rounds is declared the champion. The game also features Special Round cards to vary the rules, adding an element of unpredictability and fun. "Wacronyms" is suitable for 3-12 players and can be played for as long as desired. The game's content, designed for adult players, encourages spontaneity and laughter, making it an ideal choice for parties and social gatherings

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Player Judge, Storytelling

name: Galaxy Children: Explorers
description:
Race to collect a winning hand of colorful Galaxy Children and Dracos in this all-ages card and dice game. But Explorers beware! There are dangers lurking in the depths of space, and your decisions – combined with fate – may save or doom fellow players.

Created, developed, and illustrated by Sarah Rebecca, this 80 card, tarot-sized deck comes ready to play with instruction booklet and one D10 with no deckbuilding required. This is the 2nd edition of the game, which features a beautiful and sturdy game box that can hold the original 80 card deck, instruction booklet, dice, and up to 2 expansion packs (sold separately).
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Space Exploration
mechanics: Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Events, Interrupts, Take That

name: Falcon Tactics
description:
Welcome to the tense and strategic world of Falcon Tactics! In this tactical board and card
game, you will be transported into the heart of tactical operations involving police forces and
terrorists in exciting confrontations.
In Falcon Tactics, you will experience the adrenaline of covert operations, the need for team
coordination, and the importance of making quick strategic decisions. Each match is a battle
for control, where military police officers must defend against terrorists determined to plant
deadly bombs.

Get ready to dive into a world where every move can make the difference between victory
and defeat. With deadly weapons, tactical grenades, and strategy cards at your disposal, you
will have to overcome obstacles and challenges on a modular map that offers countless
possibilities.

In this rulebook, you will find all the information you need to dive into the gameplay of Falcon
Tactics. From map building to team combat, we’re here to guide you every step of the way.
Get ready for action, for drama, for relentless strategy. In Falcon Tactics, only the most
cunning and coordinated will emerge victorious. Do you have what it takes to lead your team
to victory?

Get ready to become a true Falcon Tactics!

To play, in addition to the deck, you will need 2 (two) 6 (six) sided dice, 8 markers to
represent your Terrorist and Counter-Terrorist characters, with a pencil or Pen, and print the PDF
sheet for each captain and 72 Small Tokens for the sheets of Terrorists and Counter-Terrorists.

6-sided dice(D6): They are commonly found in other games, or even in convenience stores,
but can also be replaced by cell phone applications.

8 Tokens: You can represent your characters with miniatures from our collections of the
the featured card that comes with every edition of “Falcon”, or specific miniatures (sold separately),
or with any other miniature, or small object, that fits on top of a quadrant of cards, such as:
game pins, coins, bean berries, etc.

Pencil or Pen: Use to mark on the captain’s sheet.
Printable PDF Captain Sheet: In the manual, there is a very important printable sheet for
playing and marking the crucial notes for the game to work. (The form can be found at the end
of the Manual in the extra items for printing.*

72 Small Tokens: You can use any object that fits the markings on the Counter-Terrorist or
Terrorist sheets with these markers
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Dice, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action/Event, Cooperative Game

name: Showdown
description: Showdown is an original two-player battle board game. Players can play the roles of samurai, swordsman, stick monk, ninja, and knight Spartan. They advance and retreat on the board, use skill cards to attack and defend, and use tricks and tactics. Enjoy the thrill of the clanging collision between cold weapons.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Car Wars (Sixth Edition): Weather Dice
description:
This set of six 16mm dice can be used to randomly determine the weather for your game.

Each die represents a different region, with unique faces on each.

Black ("Chicago") – mostly sunny or windy or both.
Dark blue ("Tierra del Fuego") – cold, no sun.
Gray ("Seattle") – usually cloudy or rainy.
Green ("Miami") – usually sunny.
Orange ("Austin") – very changeable.
Red ("Phoenix") – usually hot.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Racing, Science Fiction, Sports, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Impulse Movement, Race, Simulation, Square Grid

name: Tornado
description:
We are receiving reports of strong and unusual tornado activity never seen before. Meteorological satellites are unable to provide the information necessary to understand this disaster, which is why the government has launched the G.A.L.E. emergency protocol. (Gigantic Air Loop Extermination), in which several teams of tornado hunters will enter risk areas to obtain reliable information by taking photos.

Secretly program your jeep's movement and your action this turn. In order, move the jeeps around the map trying to get the best position to take the best photos of the tornado and prevent the other players from falling into your square.

Then carry out the action, if you can, take a photo of the tornado or take the opportunity to buy new skills.

The best tornado chaser will win the game.
mechanics: Simultaneous Action Selection

name: The Warrior Within Underground
description: The Warrior Within is a fast paced card game with a focus on boxing first turn you draw 7 cards and face off with your opponent, using defensive, attack and utility cards to knock your opponent down. After the opponent is knocked down the opponent has to roll d6 according to their heart score. If the fighter rolls a 6 on any of the heart rolls the opponent gets off the canvas to keep fighting with a penalty to the fighters heart score. No judges no decisions you brawl till you fall.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Tåg till Rydberg (fan expedition for Ticket to Ride)
description:
Tåg till Rydberg ("Train to Rydberg") is a fan expansion for the small box Ticket to Ride games (e.g. New York, London, San Francisco).

Tåg till Rydberg is a joint celebration of the brilliant Alan R. MOON designed board game series, and a lot of fantastic fiction that has made its mark on us over the years. All the stations in Tåg till Rydberg (except Rydberg itself) are based on fictional moonbases from books, TV or film.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play
mechanics: Network and Route Building

name: Gudnak: Rotborn Expansion
description:
An expansion of Gudnak that adds a new faction called the Rotborn, as well as new cards for the core factions, and a new card type: Constructs.'

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Action Points, Square Grid

name: Gudnak: Auroxi Expansion
description:
Expansion for Gudnak that adds a new faction called The Auroxi, as well as additional cards for the core factions, and a new card type: Attachments.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Action Points, Square Grid

name: Nightwatch: Blood and Bone
description:
Nightwatch - Blood and Bone is a game about killing monsters. All kinds, anywhere, any time.
You and your friends are members of the NIGHTWATCH: an ancient order of warriors, trackers, wizards, and alchemists dedicated to hunting the malevolent creatures that terrorize humanity.

Nightwatch: Blood and Bone is a tabletop adventure game set in a dark fantasy world where players band together to hunt monsters. Designed with 28mm miniatures in mind, Blood and Bone is a cooperative, open-world, miniature-agnostic rule set that combines miniature war gaming with a rules-light, role-playing system.

Suitable for most fantasy settings from the Dark Ages to the Black Powder era, Blood and Bone is a stand-alone rule set that offers expanded character classes, a menu of mix-n-match traits to flavor your enemies, along with new weapon, equipment, and magic rules, to bring more depth, detail, and danger to your game sessions.

Gather your friends, grab your cool miniatures, and gear up. You've got monsters to kill.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Return of the Tripods: All Quiet on the Martian Front
description:
Introducing the Return of the Tripods where you will fight mighty battles between invading Martian forces and the Earths human defenders in this fully revised 15mm tabletop wargame.

The year is now 1917 and in the midst of the largest and most widespread conflict in human history the skies are once again lit up by pillars of fire heralding the Return of the Tripods.

A fully revised game system developed by David Pearce and the team at Abby Normal. This Initiative based scalable game system allow players to start out with a few tripods and tanks with the ability to progress to play truly massive conflicts.

Rules are designed to suit all previous versions models.

In June 1904 Earth was forever changed when the skies were lit up by Martian drop pods streaking through pillars of fire into the ground. Emerging from these pods, Martian war-machines rapidly spread out destroying and killing everything in their path. Despite humanities best efforts, the Martian Tripods were unstoppable. It was not until the invading Martians succumbed to infections and disease was their rampage halted. The year is now 1917 and in the midst of the largest and most widespread conflict in human history the skies are once again lit up by pillars of fire heralding the Return of the Tripods™.

Having learned from their previous incursion, the Martians have returned with improved war machines, new weapons, and biological immunities. Humanity has not been idle either. Scavenging the remains of the Martian's previous attacks humans too have learned. While most of the secrets of Martian technology remain unfathomable, human ingenuity have enabled mankind too to invent new weapons of war and improve existing ones. In this heroic 15mm scale tabletop wargame take control of either Human or Martian forces in a battle for control of Earth.

Leveraging the advances in 3D printing technology and the increasing availability of 3D printers Abby Normal are making all of their models available to anyone with a printer to print their own armies at their convenience. For those gamer's who would prefer to not worry about diving into the world of 3D printing they will also offer pre-printed physical models.

—description from the publisher
categories: Science Fiction, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hidden Movement, Measurement Movement, Order Counters

name: Gnomes In BURANO
description:
いたずらこびととしましまの島 (Itazura kobito to shimashima no shima) is the Japanese title of this game, meaning Naughty Gnomes on Shimashima Island. しましま is Shimashima, meaning Striped, 島 is Shima (sounded like しま) meaning Island. But the publisher has given it a simpler English title 'Gnomes in Burano'. The theme of the game is the rows of coloured houses that need swapping about.

The theme of the game is shown by the Striped housing cards. Each player has a total of 12 house tiles, (4 tiles of 3 different colours), and the aim is to complete the pattern in as few moves as possible.

You can only turn over two Gnome cards at a time. Each player is free to choose which card to use first, which to remove, and which to move left or right. When everyone has moved their two Gnome cards, a new Gnome card is flipped over and the rearrangement continues.

The game ends when someone completes the pattern of the theme card, and the player who completes the pattern wins. the game can be played solitaire.

しましまカードによって、お題のしましま模様が示されます。
各プレイヤーはおうちタイル３色x4枚の計12枚を持ち、こびとカードで決められた数字の枚数だけ抜き出して左右のどちらかにつなげることで並びかえていき、できるだけ少ない手数でお題のしましま模様を完成させることを目指します。

一度にめくるこびとカードは2枚です。
「どちらの数字を先に使うか」「どこを抜き出すか」「左右どちらに動かすか」は各プレイヤーが自由に選びます。
全員がこびとカード2枚分を動かし終わったら、新しくこびとカードをめくって並びかえを続けます。

誰かがお題の模様を完成させたらゲームは終了で完成させた人の勝ちです。
--description by publisher
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Pack-Lash
description: Packlash is a card game where two players have a 15 card deck with a different way to win. Each deck is filled with cards that either win you the game, get you closer to winning the game, or prevent your opponent from getting closer to winning. Items are your win condition or a static ability that changes the game until they are removed. On your turn you can play items and actions to get closer to winning; whereas your opponent can play reactions to piggy back off of your progress. Be the first to fulfill your unique win condition to succeed!
mechanics: Interrupts, Multi-Use Cards, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Crawler's Grimoire: The Undead Merchant (fan made expansion)
description: A new fan made expansion in the Crawler's Grimoire line for DungeonQuest Third and Revised editions. This expansion consists of a deck of 38 cards that allow players to purchase powerful items from the mysterious Undead Merchant. These items may increase your chances of making it out of the dungeon, however it allows for a lot of new player interaction... better watch your back! These items will help you to survive monster encounters, harm your fellow players, heal yourself, control the Sun Track, choose your dungeon tiles, et-cetera, allowing for a whole slew of new fun!
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Crawler's Grimoire: Events Deck (fan made expansion)
description: This custom expansion for DungeonQuest features a deck of 52 brand new cards for use in DungeonQuest Third Edition and Revised Edition. This expansion adds a ton of variety to your game as you progress along the Sun Track and go deeper into the dungeon. Will you have good luck or terrible luck? Either way, the journey will be a very memorable one as you encounter all sorts of beings, woes, treasures, and events.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Crawler's Grimoire: Haunted Halls (fan made expansion)
description: This custom expansion for DungeonQuest features a deck of 64 brand new cards for use in DungeonQest Third Edition and Revised Edition. This expansion allows you to continue playing as a ghost after you have died, haunting your fellow players and trying to drag them into the afterlife! Alternatively, it allows for an automated ghost to track you down and slay you if you are playing solo!
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Tankball
description:
Two teams of four tanks play football on a field that consists of a grid of hexes. Pieces' movement is determined by dice, and it is a combination of turns in place and forward moves to the hex in front. A Super Heavy Tank (a "Heavy Tank" for the purpose of this game) can move in each turn for the number of steps shown on the die or less, and a Recon Tank (a "Light Tank") is faster, so it can move maximally for two steps more than the number on the die (or again, less, if it suits the player). In each turn, a player chooses which two pieces to move; in some cases, it is possible to move 3 or all 4 pieces in one turn.

Each piece can push the ball during its movement. Due to their higher speed, Light tanks have an advantage when pushing compared to Heavy tanks; however, Heavy tanks can hit the ball with their large cannon barrel when turning the turret. The length of the ball movement is determined with a red-dotted die, which is rolled at the same time as the movement dice. The ball bounces off the borders of the field according to a very intuitive rule, and if it reaches another tank on its trajectory, it stops on the last empty hex. When the ball is hit or pushed in such a way that it ends up on white hexes on the opposite side of the board, a goal is scored.

Although the length of movement of the pieces and the ball is determined by the dice, luck does not play a huge role. To win, it requires a lot of thinking in order to plan and coordinate your team both in attack and defense, so you get into many favorable positions for execution, while allowing your opponent as few opportunities for counterplay as possible.

Tankball is in some way a Tank Chess derivative, as it uses some of the Tank Chess pieces, and it was conceived right after Tank Chess became a reality thanks to a Kickstarter campaign.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Misphère
description:
MISPHÈRE RULES

Game Overview:
Misphère is a unique and engaging stacking game designed for one or more players. The goal is to skillfully stack pieces on a half-sphere without causing the structure to collapse.

Components:
-One 6-sided dice with colored faces: Red, Green, Blue, Yellow, Orange, Purple.
-30 tetracube pieces in six different variations: Red, Green, Blue, Yellow, Orange, Purple. There are 5 copies of each tetracube variant.
-One half-sphere.

Gameplay:
In a regular 2-player game, each player chooses a color from the dice faces and rolls the dice until one of the chosen colors is rolled. The player whose color appears first goes first. If you are playing alone, skip this step.
The starting player selects a tetracube piece of their chosen color and carefully places it on the half-sphere.
The other player (or the same player in a solo game) rolls the dice and selects a tetracube piece of the rolled color to place on the half-sphere.
Players take turns rolling the dice and placing tetracube pieces of the rolled color onto the half-sphere.
When all 5 copies of one color are stacked on the half-sphere, players no longer need to roll the dice. From that point, they can choose their pieces to place.
The game continues until the structure collapses due to an unstable placement of a piece.

Winning Conditions:
The player responsible for causing the collapse of the structure loses, and the other player is the winner of the game.

Variant Rules:
-Solo Play: In a solo game, the player attempts to stack as many tetracube pieces as possible before the structure falls. There's no need to determine a starting player; simply enjoy stacking for personal achievement.
-3 to 6 Players: Play clockwise.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Single Loser Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Game of HAM: Expansion – Superhero Pack: Volume 1
description:
As the name suggests, we take a heroic approach to this expansion, but with a twist. Instead of doing pop culture content, we make up our heroes and powers, including things that should be superpowers. Ready to power up that game night?

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Trick-taking

name: Game of HAM: Fairytale Endings – Volume 1
description:
Here we dance in the realm of fairies and princesses in a semi-thematic pack. All cards here tie into fairytales in some way, or just poke fun at tropes and cliches with a unique new flavor… ready for your fairytale ending?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Game of HAM: Gazing at the Abyss – Volume 1
description:
Evil… psychopathic… cruel… horrible violence… this is what you’ll find here. There is nothing sweet… nothing caring… just hatred. Be careful when you face monsters because when you stare at the abyss, it stares back at you…

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Game of HAM: That's Offensive. – Volume 1
description:
Some might say the cards in this expansion are spicy, while others will just say that’s offensive. Most of the cards in this pack are the kind you wouldn’t break out in polite society, and the cheeky stuff you’ll find here won’t leave you surprised why…

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Trick-taking

name: Zombicide: La Compagnia della Forca
description: This exclusive character pack for Lucca Comics & Games 2023, inspired by the famous Italian comic book "La Compagnia della Forca" by Magnus & Romanini, includes 13 miniatures and 28 cards to expand the fantasy Zombicide game.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Fablefall
description:
Fablefall is an Asymmetric Euro War Game with inspirations from Root and Rising Sun. Within the game, Forces (Order, Industry, Myth, and Rebellion) vie for control of the narrative by gaining victory points called Fable Points.
