As you recruit soldiers, invade and defend territories, and battle opponents, you must also learn to achieve objectives that influence certain narrative arenas - the lore of your exploits, the art produced concerning your deeds, and the people’s respect for your actions. All of these give you points each round and whoever has the most points at the end, wins the game. Excel at determining the Fables told of you and your deeds, and you’ve controlled not just a region on a map, but the hearts and minds of its people. Wars will either see the combatants' efforts forgotten to time, or cemented in stories.
mechanics: Action Drafting, Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Hexagon Grid, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Trading, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers, Victory Points as a Resource, Zone of Control

name: Frosthaven: The Time Vessel (Promo Scenario)
description: A single-scenario promo that was available during The Dice Tower's 2023 Kickstarter campaign.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Le Squad: Le livre jeu
description:
The Squad, the gamebook, offers a captivating single-player gaming experience, inviting you to immerse yourself in the tactical world of a (fictitious) elite police team. Play as one or more members of this specialized unit's Operators, also called "OPS". Their mission: to confront the hostile hordes threatening the city. Each OPS is crucial, providing specific skills necessary for the team to progress. Strategic collaboration between them is essential to succeed in the varied missions that arise. The game passively handles the management of enemies and events that this elite team faces.

The Squad is much more than just a book, it is a complete board game. Dice and tactics play a central role in this immersive adventure. Everything you need, except the 6-sided dice, is included in the book: game rules, tokens and ready-to-cut cards.

The game evolves within a campaign, retracing the assaults of this elite police team.

Stay focused, sharpen your senses, complete your missions, and above all, learn to master your skills, weapons and equipment!

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Book, Dice, Fighting, Modern Warfare
mechanics: Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Multiple Maps, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Special Military Operations Against Taiwan 202x)
description:
Special Military Operation Against Taiwan 202X is a simulation of an armed conflict between the U.S. military and the Japanese Self-Defense Forces against the People's Liberation Army of China in the event of a Taiwan contingency in the late 2020s. It uses a card-driven system with regular playing cards, and reproduces the complexity of modern warfare with various events. Compete to see how you can create an advantageous situation before the ceasefire negotiations.

Ordeal in the Pacific is a 1942 Pacific War campaign game. Fight for control of air bases in the Pacific Ocean. This game was the basis for the tablet game "Komapu" "Aircraft Carrier Battle 1942".
mechanics: Simulation

name: The Ziggurat
description:
The great stone lattice of the Ziggurat holds back the encroaching void; the structure as much a mystery as the solitary Monolith at its heart. An eternal champion, reborn across eons, is drawn inexorably to this enigmatic nexus, a seal at the very centre of the multiverse.

The Ziggurat's colossal granite edifices exist simultaneously across countless worlds, its glyphs flickering with eldritch energy. From the dense, dragon-haunted jungles of the Viridian Expanse to realms uncharted, it beckons; home to countless civilisations both human and alien, thriving and decaying in its shadow.

Our hero's countless lives navigate the Ziggurat’s ancient halls and labyrinthine caves to bear witness to the emergence of an ancient sentience and a battle between existence and the relentless, life sapping nihilism of the Void.

Each life an incarnation of the eternal champion and scion of fate. Each quest, unique in its objectives draws you deeper into this eternal struggle.

Will you shape the fate of the multiverse, or simply bear witness as the wheel of time turns? Your eternal journey awaits.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Multi-Use Cards, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Perfil Express: Harry Potter
description:
ENGLISH DESCRIPTION

With the Express Harry Potter Profile, you will be able to test your knowledge in four categories inspired by the films that enchanted fans around the world.

Each card has 10 tips worth up to 10 points each, with the first tips being less “revelio” and the following ones having more chances of being correct.

This version has a unique marker and is designed for two people or two teams to play. The big winner will be the one who accumulates the most points over five exciting rounds.

Challenge your friends and family who love the Harry Potter saga to a competition full of magic and fun!


PORTUGUESES DESCRIPTION

Com o Perfil Express Harry Potter, você vai poder testar seus conhecimentos em quatro categorias inspiradas nos filmes que encantaram fãs do mundo todo.

Cada cartela possui 10 dicas que valem até 10 pontos cada, sendo as primeiras dicas menos “revelio”, e as seguintes, com mais chances de acerto.

Esta versão possui um marcador exclusivo e foi desenvolvida para duas pessoas ou duas equipes jogarem. O grande vencedor será aquele que acumular mais pontos ao longo de cinco emocionantes rodadas.

Desafie seus amigos e familiares que amam a saga Harry Potter para uma competição cheia de magia e diversão!
mechanics: Questions and Answers, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Vampire: The Masquerade – Rivals: Month of Darkness 2022 Card Pack
description:
This 5-card promo pack for Vampire: The Masquerade Rivals features the cards available in the Month of Darkness 2022 Promo Pack.

Vampires included:

Carmina Magnus, Ventrue
Reina De La Vega, Tremere
Luviere Bataille, Toreador
Giselle della Scala, Lasombra
R.T Thassos, Gangrel
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Vs System 2PCG: Marvel Zombies
description:
Marvel Zombies have come to Vs. System 2PCG! Join Magneto and Black Panther as they fight off the Hunger! Play as or against the Zombie hoards for the first time. 10 new Main characters to play as! Epic competitive gameplay to pit your team of Allies against your opponents!

This is not a stand-alone game. A copy of Vs. System 2PCG: The Marvel Battles is required to play.

Contents:
55 Cards
Rulesheet
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Gnome Nabbing Grannies
description:
Two teams of Grandmas will go head-to-head, trying to steal all 5 of their opponents’ garden gnomes that are hidden in their garden. Each Granny takes an individual turn as turns rotate back and forth between teams.

Each Granny has a special ability, but watch out! There are dangers lurking in the garden that will slow your already slow Grandma as you search for gnomes.

Assistance cards could come to rescue from the assisted-living center to either help you or hinder your opponent. The first team to collect all 5 of the other teams’ gnomes, win!

Designed to play 2 -8 players. Including odd numbers of player. If you can read you can play!

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Children's Game, Humor, Memory, Party Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Lose a Turn, Memory, Modular Board, Paper-and-Pencil, Take That, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Pass Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Tiny Epic Cthulhu: Deluxe Edition
description:
The Deluxe edition of Tiny Epic Cthulhu includes Tiny Epic Cthulhu: Astral Artifacts Mini Expansion packaged inside of the base game's box.

The Astral Artifacts mini expansion is a captivating addition that unveils long-forgotten relics from the past, offering invaluable assistance to our valiant heroes in their ongoing struggle. Imbued with cosmic energy, these artifacts were skillfully crafted by artisans of ancient times, only to be lost and concealed from the world for countless centuries. However, as the forces of the Old Ones began to stir, a courageous band of Heroes embarked on a perilous quest to recover these five extraordinary artifacts.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Matching, Multi-Use Cards, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Twinkle Twinkle *
description:
A fast-paced tile-drafting game for two to infinite players (4 players per box). Players are placing 4 tiles each round to build a deep-space star chart.
The game is designed to have up to 4 players per box. Add another box, and add 4 more players. Play is simultaneous, so the game lasts 15-20 minutes no matter how many people are playing.
Tiles include: star constellations, comets, planets, technology, asteroids, galaxies, black holes, space invaders and wormholes.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Tile Placement

name: War Story: Occupied France
description:
Darkness covers your approach as you alight on the riverbank. Swiftly, you hide the boat and shoulder your gear. The mission is clear: capture or kill your target; rendezvous at the extraction point; get out. You have two days. Nodding to your team, you set off toward the glowing lights of Vaillant.

War Story: Occupied France is a co-operative narrative game for one to six players set in World War II occupied France that captures the stakes and tension of espionage and resistance warfare. Your team of covert operatives is all that stands between the infamous German officer Heidenreich and the systematic destruction of French Resistance forces in Morette.

Through three replayable story missions, you must exploit the specialties of your chosen agents to uncover information, enlist allies, and obtain weaponry. Engage occupying forces on tactical encounter maps where careless positioning could cost your agents' lives. Remember, no plan survives contact with the enemy...and time is running out.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Minimap Resolution, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Stat Check Resolution

name: DCeased: Arkham Asylum
description: Arkham Asylum is an expansion that brings Batman’s legendary rogues gallery to the game, in the form of both Super Heroes and Zombie Heroes. These Super-Villains will have to make use of their most devious tactics in the fight against Anti-Life, especially since it’s not only their former accomplices that are now undead, but also the hulking Titan-infused inmates.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Chunky Fighters: Squit Squit Squad
description: A horde of angry rats is added as a playable character. They don't have any weapons, but they attack in such numbers they can reduce a man to a skeleton in a minute.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Aniversus
description:
In the universe of Aniversus, players become coaches of animal teams representing their civilizations. Due to limited resources, they rely on the Animania League, similar to human football league, to resolve conflicts. These matches happen in space stadiums where animals with special abilities compete for victory. To succeed, coaches must make smart choices and use strategies tailored to their animals.

You're the coach of your very own team in Aniversus (Cats vs Squirrels). It's a big deal – you call the shots, come up with sneaky game plans, and help your animal buddies level up, get energy, and show what they're really made of. During each turn, a maximum of 3 card-playing actions can be performed. You must draw and play cards to make strategic moves, enabling your team to generate greater productivity, gain powers, and use skills to interrupt the opponents. The team who accumulates 10 powers on their field first can attempt a shoot by rolling a die. Victory in the game is achieved when each team successfully scores twice.

Here's what you'll get up to in Aniversus:

1. Use your resources smart so your team can come out swinging when it's game time.
2. Dive into battles that make you think ahead, switch things up on the fly, and use your animals' special moves in smart ways.
3. Watch your crew get tougher, smarter, and cooler as they win more and get ready for the big leagues.

In Aniversus, every game is your chance to outsmart the other coaches. Can you climb to the top and make your team the legends of the Space Arena? It's all in your hands.

— description from the creators of Aniversus
mechanics: Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Multi-Use Cards

name: factovillage
description:
factovillage is a two-dimensional card placement engine-building game based on your own village building.

Cut trees, process them into boards, cut out stones, sharpen them into blades, and make axes.
Chop more trees with the axe and start mass papermaking.
Distribute leaflets with paper. More workers.
Bind books from the paper produced in large quantities by the increased number of workers, and build a library!

It is a game like this, but it is not so easy.

In short, all you have to do is to place a few cards each round and resolve card effects in any order you like, but the cards in the field can only interfere with each other if they are adjacent to each other, up, down, left, or right.

Therefore, it is necessary to imagine the final shape of the game to some extent from the beginning and to place cards systematically.

This is not a game where you can do some things at random, or where you have few options in the game because of the small number of engine parts you can obtain. Therefore, the pleasure you feel when you get it right is supreme.

This is the best 2D placement engine build that asuno-labo brings to you so that you can enjoy the process of planning → execution.

╠description from the publisher (translated)
categories: Card Game, City Building, Economic, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: Hand Management, Race, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks

name: Remember Everything! Ukraine
description:
All the cards are placed on the table with the yellow and blue side of the "Rivet" facing up, mixed thoroughly and laid out in 10 rows with 10 cards in each row.

Any other number of rows and number of cards in each row is allowed at your discretion. The main thing is that the cards on the table must resemble straight rows of beets in the garden....

We recommend that you give the right to make the first move to the youngest player at the table, but age is a very conditional thing, so players have the right to determine in a convenient way (but within the framework of the current legislation) who will go first, second, third... and who will go for pizza.

Each player has the right to turn over any two cards in his turn. If the images on them match, the player takes them for himself and has the right to take another turn.

But as soon as the images on the two open cards do not match, the player turns them back over face up and places them in the same places where they were.

The other players try to memorize the location of the shorts they saw. The turn passes to the next player.

The game ends when there are no cards left on the table. The winner is the one who has collected the largest number of cards or the one who has recognized all the symbols of Ukraine depicted on all the cards of the game.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Memory

name: Remember Everything! Football
description:
Board game "Remember Everything! Football" will finally unite ardent fans with those who only know that the ball is round (but that's not accurate!). And it's still unclear who will assemble a cooler team - a fan with experience or his grandmother.

88 almost collectible cards with the top players of the season and football legends, 2 yellow cards, 1 red card, VAR cards, "play the match" action, quick entry into the rules - a fun and exciting evening is guaranteed. Even those who have never been interested in football before will not stay away.

We advise granting the right of first move to whoever was the last person to watch a soccer game in the stadium, but players may otherwise legally determine who goes first.

All cards are placed on the table with the lawn labeled "Rivet" facing up, mixed thoroughly and laid out in 10 rows of 10 cards in each row. Any other number of rows and cards in each row is allowed at your discretion.

The main thing is that the cards on the table should resemble even rows of spectator seats at a soccer stadium.

Each player has the right to turn over any two cards in one turn. Depending on what is shown on these two cards - the player acts as follows:

If two open cards show the same player, the player takes the cards and has the right to another turn.
But as soon as the images on two open cards are NOT the same - the player acts as follows:

if the card has a picture of a player - the player turns it back over with the turf up and puts it exactly where it was. The other players try to memorize its location.

If the card is yellow, red, VAR or PLAY GAME - the player takes the card as a prize card and takes it for himself.

The game ends when there are no cards left on the table. The winner is the player whose players have the highest sum of points. If two players have the same sum, the winner is the one who has collected the greatest number of all cards, including unused prize cards that did not go into the rebound.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Memory

name: Remember Everything! Words
description:
Each player's turn consists of two actions:

The first action of the turn is the right to compose from their already collected cards any words that exist in the Ukrainian language. Each compiled word the player writes down on the sheet with the sum of points of used letters and this word. The player's cards that were used to make words are discarded and are not used anymore. When a player can no longer make words from his cards or has no cards at all (as at the beginning of the game), he proceeds to the second action of his turn.

The second action of the turn is the right to turn over any two pairs of cards laid out on the table. The number of flipped cards must be one more than the player made words in the first action of his turn. For example: during the first action of his turn the player made 1 word, then accordingly the player turns over 2 pairs of cards (i.e. 4 cards at the same time).

The game ends when there are no cards left on the table and no player can make a word from his cards. The winner is the player who has the highest sum of points for the words made during the whole game. If players still have unused cards that have not been discarded, each card counts as 1 point regardless of whether they are prize or letter cards and how many points are indicated on them.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Action Retrieval, Memory, Spelling

name: Remember Everything! English
description:
Each player turns over any TWO cards in one turn. Depending on what is shown on these two cards, the player acts as follows:

If there is a match of a WORD and its corresponding PICTURE on the two cards opened in turn, the player collects these two cards for himself and has the right to turn over any two cards on the table again.

But if there is no match between the WORD and its corresponding PICTURE on the cards opened in turn, the player acts as follows:

If the first card revealed was a PICTURE and the second card revealed was a WORD that does not match the picture, the player turns both cards back over with the word "Klepka" facing up and places them on the table exactly where they were. The other players try to memorize their locations.

If the first card revealed was a WORD and the second card revealed was a PICTURE that does not match the image, the player flips both cards back "Klepka" up and places them on the table exactly where they were. The other players try to memorize their locations.
if the first or second card revealed is a Syncopus prize card - the player takes the Syncopus card for himself, and the other card, regardless of what was depicted on it, turns it back "Klepka" up and puts it on the table exactly where it was. The other players try to memorize their locations.

If the first card and the second card opened were PICTURES, the player turns the second card back over with "Klepka" facing up and places it on the table exactly where it was and opens any other card instead, trying to find the corresponding WORD to the first card (which is still lying open on the table). This is repeated until the player finds any WORD.

Once there are no face-down cards left on the table, each player must make a chain using only their word cards. The chain is made by matching the last letter of the previous word with the first letter of the next word.

The winner is the one who builds the longest continuous chain of word cards. The length of the chain is determined as the sum of letters of all the words in the chain.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Memory

name: Remember Everything! Arithmetic
description:
Each player has the right to turn over any two cards in one turn. Depending on what is shown on these two cards - the player acts as follows:

If the images on both open cards match - the player takes these two cards and has the right to turn over any two cards on the table again.

But as soon as the images on the two open cards do NOT match - the player acts as follows:

if a card has a number image - a player turns it back over with "Klepka" written on it upwards and puts it on the table exactly where it was. The other players try to memorize its location.
If the card is a mathematical sign, or a variable, or chaos - the player takes such a card as a prize and immediately takes it for himself.

The turn passes to the next player.

Once there are no face-down cards left on the salt, each player must make an arithmetic expression using only their cards obtained during the game to get as large a number as possible.

The winner is the one who has the largest number of complex arithmetic expression from all his cards.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Memory

name: Trim the Tree
description:
All square cards with the elements of the New Year's puzzle are placed face down on the table, thoroughly mixed and laid out in even rows of eight cards in each row tightly together so that a large square of the hidden picture is formed. All rectangular cards are thoroughly mixed and laid out back side up on the table in a stack.
Each player in one turn has the right to turn over any one unopened square card from the hidden drawing laid out in rows and looks for exactly where that card should be.

If a card revealed by a player should be on a spot that does NOT share a border with any already revealed card on the table, that move is considered unsuccessful. The player returns the card back to its place face up. All players try to memorize its location. The turn passes to the next player.

Attention! Only the cards that are touching by the sides are considered to be cards that have a common border. Touching cards with corners is not considered to have a common border!
If a card opened by a player should be on a place having a common border with some already opened card on the table, such a move is considered successful. The player puts it on this necessary place on the principle of a puzzle according to the pattern instead of the unopened card on this place, which in its turn without opening moves to the empty place where the card opened by the player was earlier. For each successful move the player gets three privileges:
a) to take from the stack one top prize card with accrued points;
b) the opportunity to increase the points accrued (if it is provided in the text of the prize card received);
c) make another move (if it is not prohibited in the text of the received prize card).

Use of Prize Cards:
A prize card contains a number of points gained or lost by a player during a turn.
A prize card may contain a prohibition on taking another turn, even if the turn was successful.
A prize card may contain additional conditions that a player must read and, if possible, fulfill in order to increase the number of points he has gained or decrease the number of points of other players.
The game ends when the hidden picture puzzle is completely assembled on the table. The winner is the one who has collected the most points in their prize cards including extra points for fulfilling the condition that are indicated on them.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Matching, Memory

name: Stock Car Race Day
description:
Choose your car, tire type, and rev up the engines in a race full of strategy and a dash of luck.

Between fuel management, car collisions, pit stops, and weather changes, you'll need to handle various unexpected events to outsmart your opponents.

The realistic board game, packed with all the excitement of Stock Car racing, accommodates 2 to 6 players per match and includes a simplified mode for playing with kids. Get ready for a thrilling race from start to finish, with plenty of twists and an unexpected podium!


Plot the best course to gain speed;
Pay attention to the weather forecast;
Outperform opponents with the help of the radio, drafting, brakes, and fuel;
Raise the trophy by winning the race at the checkered flag!


—description from the designer
mechanics: Catch the Leader, Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, Events, Hand Management, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Racketeers
description:
Racketeers is a strategic game that blends worker placement, area majority, negotiation, and push your luck mechanics to create an exciting criminal experience.

Players will step into the shoes of cunning Racketeers and lead a gang of goons in taking control of illicit rackets, gaining cash, booze, guns, and notoriety!

In every round, players strategically position control markers to secure their dominance over rackets, enabling them to obtain the highest and most lucrative rewards by gaining majority control over their businesses.

Alternatively, players may decide to partake in clever negotiations with fellow players, creating temporary alliances that can be mutually beneficial and profitable.

Players should also be cautious about attracting unwanted attention, as excessive heat could lead to a raid and the potential loss of both stock and goons.

The player who gains the most notoriety at the end of the game wins!

-description from designer
categories: Bluffing, Comic Book / Strip, Fighting, Humor, Mafia, Negotiation, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Betting and Bluffing, Bribery, Events, Income, Negotiation, Push Your Luck, Take That, Worker Placement

name: 커피 러시 프로모: 크리스마스 (Coffee Rush: Christmas Promo Cards)
description:
Coffee Rush has released two Christmas season promo cards in December 2023.

When setting up the game, return two random order cards to the box, then shuffle the promo cards together with the order card deck for the base game.

Have a warmer and sweeter Christmas with Christmas season promo cards of Coffee Rush!
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Kabula: Conspiracy Expansion
description:
This add on increases player count to 5, adding a new player mat and tokens to support an extra player!

One additional playable hero, Gotzo, the conspiracy theorist and 2 new Guardians, with their miniatures, cards and mats.


1 Extra hero, Gotzo the conspiracy theorist, including 5 cards, 1 miniature and tokens.
Player Mat and tokens to bring player count to 5.
Double sided mat for 2 extra guardians, Shaggy the rabbit and Bibi&Bobu the tomb rider siblings. Each Guardian comes with 10 cards, tokens and detailed miniature.


Extra content to add to the core game (cannot be used on its own).

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Kabula: The Outrageous Expansion
description:
You know all that content that you wanted to be in the game but our grandmas forbid to put in the core box?

It's all here.

25 Encounter cards (poker size)
5 Dungeon cards (poker size)
24 Item cards (mini size)

Additional content to add to the core game (cannot be used on its own). Some of the cards contain mature content, this expansion is recommended for 18+.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Manhattan 1929 (fan expansion for Age of Steam)
description:
Manhattan 1929 is a fan-made Print & Play Age of Steam expansion map for 3-5 players, designed by Clef Haworth.

To simulate the stock-market crash of 1929, the game features "crashing" cities, which effectively become colorless Cities devoid of cubes once its empty column is rolled during the Goods Growth phase. Each time this occurs, all players immediately lose Income equal to half that of their current Income Reduction tier. Once a number of Cities equal to the starting player count, Wall Street will also crash, doubling all Income Reduction amounts going forward and preventing further issuing of Shares.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Catch the Leader, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Income, Loans, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Player Elimination, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Auction, Victory Points as a Resource

name: CasiNoya
description:
CasiNoya is an innovative card game that seamlessly blends the worlds of traditional casino card games and strategic combat. In this unique game, players use specially designed decks of cards to engage in thrilling duels, combining the rules of classic games like Poker, Blackjack, and War with combat card mechanics such as healing, poisoning, shielding, and dealing damage. The objective is to be the last player standing, and winning a traditional casino hand can sometimes lead to unexpected defeat as you face off against other players in one-on-one duels.

CasiNoya sets itself apart by eliminating any real-money or gambling elements, focusing solely on the strategic aspects of card gameplay. Players can choose from a variety of well-known card games, each with its own strategic nuances, including Five-Hand Poker, Blackjack remastered without the need of a house, Chinese Poker, War with an actual army of up to 7 cards, and way more!

With its emphasis on strategy over luck and its dedication to providing an alternative to traditional gambling games, CasiNoya aims to appeal to card game enthusiasts, competitive gamers, and individuals seeking a fun and safe gaming experience. It's a game that offers a fresh take on age-old card games, making it accessible to a wide audience while promoting skillful gameplay over chance.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management

name: Hippo Crates
description:
Play as Hungry Hippos who are not willing to eat anything other than the Fruit they want or meddle with other Hungry Hippos by feeding them everything other than their desired Fruit by being a hypocrite.

Aim of the Game:
Collect the most points by collecting and locking spaces in the buffet before the Draw Pile runs out.

How To Play:
1. Draw 3 cards from the draw pile to create an buffet space.
2. Play 1 card from your hand face-down.
3. Simultaneously reveal the card with other players.
4. Lowest revealed number plays first on the buffet and draw a new card from draw pile.
5. Lock spaces in the buffet to force opponents into collecting fruits prematurely.
6. Replace the buffet row of cards with your card if you cannot play it anywhere.
7. Player with the highest points wins.

Contents:
1 deck with a total of 108 playing cards + 2 Keychains (mementos).

Benefits of Game play:
Think Fast and Out-Smart Your Opponents.
Challenge Others By locking their points.
Family Friendly Fun for Kids and Adults Alike.
Spatial Awareness and Recognize Deception.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Number, Party Game
mechanics: Market, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Kabula: Chastity – The Battle Nun Expansion
description:
Chastity: The Battle Nun - additional playable hero:
5 cards + miniature.

Once she arrived on the Island, Chastity immediately realized she was sent to Hell with the goal of butchering demons. Equipped with a massive sword that gets more powerful the more it's used, Chastity offers a unique and engaging gameplay experience.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Let's Dance
description: You've seen the TV show, now become a part of it. ("Let's Dance" is the German version of Strictly / DWTS) Get as many points as possible to become Dancing Star. You can gain points in six categories, e.g. by performing dances (solo or as couple; judged by the other players), or by answering trivia questions. Best two players battle in the final, best of five.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Acting, Player Judge, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Apex Legends: The Board Game – Squad 1 Expansion
description:
The Squad 1 Expansion introduces 6 new Legends into the roster of Apex Legends: The Board Game with all the necessary components for each, including miniatures for the Legend and their powers, cards, and storage tray.

The poisoner Caustic uses poison traps and gas grenades, creating hazard zones on the battlefield and weakening enemy Legends before closing in for the kill.

The hacker Crypto utilizes his surveillance drone to scout and loot the area, as well as drain the shields of his enemies with EMP attacks.

The trickster Mirage uses Hologram decoys to confuse his opponents, shield himself from harm, and conceal his location.

The daredevil Octane outsmarts other Legends with spectacular stunts and pure speed.

The simulacrum Revenant uses his Silence Device to prevent his foes from using their abilities, while his Death Totem serves his squadmates in cheating death.

The voltaic inventor Wattson helps out allied Legends by recharging their shields and creating fortified safe zones on the battlefield.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Interrupts, Line of Sight, Multiple Maps, Square Grid, Sudden Death Ending, Team-Based Game, Three Dimensional Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Apex Legends: The Board Game – Loba Expansion
description:
This expansion offers a wealth of new content for Apex Legends: The Board Game, most importantly adding the notorious loot scout Loba into the game’s Legend roster. Loba uses her Burglar’s Best Friend bracelet to escape from perilous situations and makes sure her squad has access to the best equipment available by deploying her Black Market Boutique directly onto the battlefield.

The expansion grants access to the optional Nessie Special Feature for use in all game modes, introducing the loveable character of Nessie into Apex Legends: The Board Game as an interactive component, and spicing up each session through the use of Nessie Feat cards, which grant the players access to powerful and subversive gameplay effects, encouraging them to diverge from their usual strategies.

Also included are plastic miniatures for the Control Beacon and Heat Shields game modes, which replace the cardboard ones found in the Core Box.

—description from the designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Interrupts, Line of Sight, Multiple Maps, Square Grid, Sudden Death Ending, Team-Based Game, Three Dimensional Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: CyberQuest: The Game of Cyberpunk Adventures
description:
You are in the year 2081. The Black Chip agency, formed by members who participated in the Second Corporate Conflict on both sides, try to avoid a third conflict between Nakaware and Biosync.
Max, an employee at Nakaware, discovers a confidential file that could spark a war. He contacts his sister Raven and meets her in an old warehouse, away from Neon City, to explain her what he is up to.

Cyberquest is a narrative cyberpunk adventure game for 1 to 5 players. You play in 3 different phases: Mission phase, chase phase and den phase.

Mission Phase: Advance with your runner through a dungeon crawler-style scenario in which anything can happen in every room.

Chase Phase: Escape the site driving your car into den. A mini-game in which you draw event cards with the objetive to finish the route.

Den Phase: Heal your wounds, upgrade your cyberware, get jobs and repair your car. A little maintenance to prepare you for the next mission.

Gamefound Campaign ON: https://gamefound.com/en/projects/infinity-darkness-games/cy...

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Events, Modular Board, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: How Am I Weird: Square Edition
description:
How Am I Weird is a simple, fun party game to play with family and friends, in a group of 3 - 10. There are LIFE cards, COMEBACK cards and blank WEIRDO cards. LIFE cards present situations, sometimes awkward or embarrassing, sometimes annoying or familiar. COMEBACK cards present responses that are weird and wonderful. One person is nominated the Big Weird Chief, and the rest of the players each take 8 COMEBACK cards and one blank WEIRDO card. The Big Weird Chief reads a LIFE card. Each player chooses the weirdest and funniest COMEBACK response, or comes up with their own answer using their WEIRDO card! The person who gives the weirdest and funniest answer wins that round. At the end of the game, the player who has won the most rounds wins the game, and becomes ruler of the universe. Then you should WEAR THE CROWN!

—description from the publisher

The square edition contains 300 new cards and can be played either as a stand-alone game or as an addition to the standard version of How Am I Weird.
mechanics: Storytelling

name: JeMiWar
description:
Universal miniature wargaming rules for sci-fi, fantasy, and historical settings.

JeMiWar was designed to create an wargaming experience that adds some elements of tabletop roleplaying games, with the players controlling multiple units instead of a single character. Play is scenario driven, with a gamemaster running the opposing forces and the odds stacked in the players' favor. Units gain in experience after each battle, and the loss of an experienced unit in an ongoing campaign stings more than a similar loss in a single isolated game.

JeMiWar is a simple system, with no charts and no mathematic modifiers used. The intent is to appeal to both young players new to the hobby and to older players who have grown tired of complex time consuming rules.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Ultimate Mafia
description:
Ultimate Mafia is a game of social deduction, role-play, and storytelling. Set in a town where the Mafia are trying to kill all of the townspeople and the townspeople are trying to identify and root out the Mafia, the game alternates between day and night phases. During the night, the Mafia decide who to kill and during the day, everyone accuses others of being in the Mafia and are voted out.

The game ends either when all of the Mafia are identified and voted out, or when all the townspeople have been eliminated from the game, either from being killed or voted out.

In addition to the roles that the players receive, each player also is provided with random power cards, such as providing an extra vote during the day to vote out players, saving the player once from death, protecting a specified player from being voted out for one round, etc.

There is one game master who facilitates the game and the various powers that the players use without revealing information to the other players. The game master is also responsible for the storytelling, creating a narrative to reveal the actions of that each of the players performed in the past round.
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Roles, Role Playing, Storytelling, Team-Based Game, Voting

name: Gamarra: The Card Game
description:
You're running late for the Christmas family reunion, and you still haven't purchased their presents. Opting for clothing seems like the easy choice, but everyone's facing the same dilemma right now, so going shopping is chaotic!

Welcome to Gamarra, Peru's most bustling and expansive clothes market, where you'll find everything you need and encounter stereotypical characters from Lima's streets like 'el pituco' (the rich guy), 'el guachiman' (the security guard), or 'el choro' (the robber), among others, who will assist you with your shopping list.

In Gamarra, each turn involves buying an item, summoning a character, or discarding any number of cards to replenish your hand. The objective is to be the first player to purchase between 3 to 5 items, with the winning number depending on the total number of players.

Furthermore, each time a player makes a purchase, it triggers an event from the Events Deck. These events cause random occurrences that affect all players' hands or characters, such as 'Sismo de 8 grados' (Earthquake), 'Hora Punta' (Rush hour), or 'Fin de mes' (Payday), among others.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Events, Hand Management, Take That

name: Planet Zad
description:
Planet ZAD is a cooperative strategy game on an alien world!
Asymmetrical alien tribes band together to stop an enemy polluting the planet.
Harvest and share resources to upgrade abilities while fending off an enemy determined to expand its toxic control of the planet. Can you save the planet?


Easy to learn -- good for wide age range, from ages 10+
Very interactive... trading resources and working to build strategies and attack together.
NO downtime! Player phase is all simultaneous.
Coop, 1 V All, Solo, and Semi Cooperative variants included
1-6 Players!
Many maps and new tribes on the way.


A bright light raced across the sky, ending in a thunderous crash that echoed across the land. Weeks later, rivers started to dry up, the air developed a rancid smell, and the tribes of Zad discovered strange aliens building monstrous structures. It became clear that these new visitors were harming the planet. Some Zad tribes tried to communicate and plead with the strangers to cease their destruction. Those tribes were annihilated. The remaining tribes of Zad set aside their differences and banded together to confront this new Enemy of Zad. And so, the war began.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Retrieval, Alliances, Area Movement, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Command Cards, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Coverage, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Income, Market, Moving Multiple Units, Multiple Maps, Negotiation, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Open Drafting, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Semi-Cooperative Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Trading, Variable Player Powers, Zone of Control

name: Rebuilding Chicago
description:
In Rebuilding Chicago, a standalone successor to 2021's Rebuilding Seattle, you're responsible for managing the zoning and expansion of a major neighborhood following the "Great Chicago Fire" of 1871.

Each round, your population grows, then you can either build a new building, expand into a new suburb, activate an event, or build a landmark, after which you earn profit based on your neighborhood's commerce. You'll buy building types from a shared market — looking to find shapes that fit your grid and types that fit your strategy — and construct landmarks on the right tile combinations. Suburb tiles connect to your grid however you like, creating uniquely shaped neighborhoods. Triggering citywide events can change the tide of the game, offering points, money, and expansions for the players ready for it. You can even enact laws to give yourself the advantage!

You earn points for building types, upgrades, landmarks, events, and remaining cash, and at the end of the game, whoever's neighborhood has earned the most points wins.

Rebuilding Chicago also comes with a solo player deck so that you can compete to build the best version of Chicago even with just one player. Enjoy gameplay against a deck designed to simulate the actions of a second player to discover strategies and configurations you can use to improve Chicago.
mechanics: Grid Coverage, Income, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: This Game Is Shit
description:
This Game Is Shit is a humorous party game where your objective is to make your opponents shit their pants and be the only one with clean underwear.
The simple and accessible rules make it the perfect game for entertaining party with your friends, even those not keen on board games.

This Game Is Shit combines luck and skill, requiring you to make hard choices. At the beginning of each turn, you'll deal with a unique mechanic: draw two cards and choose only one. With this small variation in the drawing phase, you'll be able to develop your strategies, hoping not to regret your decisions.

Use intestinal attacks and viruses to unsettle your opponents' digestive systems, handle bathroom breaks in a publicly acceptable manner using evacuation cards, and defend yourself with remedy cards. Lastly, employ tools to gain advantages and disadvantage your enemies.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Drawing, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Quaeleon's Quest
description:
Defeat your opponents by depleting their health in a strategic, chaotic battle. Build stacks of 5 cards, which then simultaneously play out in sequence. Each card has unique artwork and effects, which combine to give endless chances for strategy. But has your opponent already predicted your next move?

The game’s unique format gives ample time for socialisation, and combines strategy with memorable moments, unexpected experiences, and snappy gameplay.

Quaeleon’s Quest is a strategy card game in a fantasy setting for up to 6 players, lasting 20 minutes.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Delayed Purchase, Events, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tags, Take That, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: Apothebakery: The Culinary Alchemists
description:
In a land filled with perilous dungeons and treacherous monsters, take on the legacy of an Apothebaker — an ancient lineage of culinary alchemist healers. Sought after far and wide by adventurers in desperate need of salvation.

With the help from your trusted Forries, collect ingredients and valuable resources from the wilderness. Brew elixirs and bake cakes of salvation to heal and rejuvenate adventurers on the brink of doom.

Over the course of 6 rounds, players compete for the most reputation by strategically achieving objectives, healing adventurers and casting powerful spells. There are 3 phases per round; Foraging, Alchemy and Healing.

Embrace the role of an Apothebaker, accumulating reputation for each adventurer you heal and every bake you undertake. The player who gains the highest reputation by day’s end will claim victory!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction: Sealed Bid, Contracts, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Events, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Turn Order: Auction

name: Chocolatier
description:
Chocolatier is a 2-5 player game of making and selling chocolate.

Each player takes on the role of the owner of a chocolate factory competing with other Chocolate factories.
The Object is to make the most chocolate, sell if for best profit and so make the most money at the end of 8 rounds.
Each player starts the game with £150K, a plain chocolate machine and a wrapping machine.
Chocolatiers select ROLES, purchase sugar, cocoa and milk from a resource market, produce chosen brand of chocolate in their factory and get it to market. Innovation involves bidding for new machines and accessories to corner your niche market and use advertising to make the most popular chocolate!

Mechanics include:
Role selection (Lead and follow)(aka PuertoRico/Twilight Imperium)
First to Purchase, first to Market, supply and demand
Bidding and bluffing
Management of resources

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction: Turn Order Until Pass, Events, Follow, Investment

name: Rogues Gallery
description:
Rogues Gallery: Unleash Your Inner Rogue!

Build the most powerful thieves guild and rule the city in this portable tabletop card game for 2-4 players from Bezu Games!

You take the role of a thieves guild leader who is gathering their team of six rogues to complete up to nine jobs. The game is played on a grid with your rogues placed along the top row and left column, and the jobs are placed in the 9 spots below and to the right of your rogues. Complete jobs to score points at the end of the game by matching the colors and numbers of rogues vs. the colors and numbers of the job.

On your turn, you draw a card and then take an action. Actions generally consist of playing a card from your hand, or discarding your entire hand to redraw three cards.

Use magic items to give your guild an edge with completing jobs. Place hideouts to save a job space and protect your rogues. Play action cards to disrupt other players or give yourself a bit of an edge. Fire and Hire rogues to strategically complete jobs.

The game ends when one of two things happen: A player fills their nine job spots with completed jobs and hideouts, OR the City Guard card appears for the second time.

Points are tallied using completed jobs plus your hideouts plus any bonus points for completed jobs matching your guild leader's color. Whoever has the most points becomes the most powerful guild in the city!

-description from designer
mechanics: Contracts, Drawing, End Game Bonuses, Grid Coverage, Matching, Modular Board, Move Through Deck, Square Grid

name: Neuroscape TCG
description:
Neuroscape is a cyberpunk trading card game set in the gritty, neon glow of the not so distant future.

Boot up and dive in to a high stakes digital battleground! Master your arsenal of characters, cyberware, and programs to dominate the digital realm and annihilate your adversaries!

Enter a simulated world where every action has consequences, every program holds power, and every choice could be your last.

Do you have what it takes to become the champion of the digital underground?

Neuroscape's Genesis Set includes 250+ cards and 4 pre-constructed starter decks.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Science Fiction
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Closed Drafting, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: House of 1000 Corpses
description:
In House of 1000 Corpses, an officially licensed co-operative board game based on the movie of the same name, players take on the roles of the Firefly family. They must scour their house, looking for the people hiding there, and bring them to Dr. Satan before too many rounds pass. They do this using an action system that penalizes the players for doing too many of the same action in a row.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game

name: What the Bug
description:
Imitate creatures with unique characteristics. Some creatures have personality issues, and others are merely caught up in a particular circumstance. Roll the dice, imitate a creature and their description. You get points for guessing the right combination, but also when others guess yours correctly. Imitate a duck faced maggot, a cicada caught in the act, and other ridiculous combinations!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling

name: Black Swan: Dark Black
description:
Dark Black allows players to influence neutral Countries. The Expansion adds diplomacy to influence neutral Countries and allows players to attack almost any neutral. There are some Stretch Goals that add new units, such as Wunderwaffen, Italian Special Forces and more.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Orange Swan: Dai Tō-A Sensō
description:
Dai Tō-A Sensō offers the possibility of playing the scenarios and the campaigns, granting some advantages to the Japanese.
It adds Japanese Paratroopers, Transport and more.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Movement Points

name: Desi Feud
description:
Desi Feud is an easy to learn, fun to play game-show style party game that is equally fun for all age groups. Below are the 5 quick steps to learn, master, and play this game

[Premise] We surveyed hundreds of desi people and asked them interesting questions. We aggregated their responses and created 125 interesting question cards with top 6 answers.

[Objective] Your goal is to guess answers that match the desi janta's (desi population) top 6 answers for a given question. There is no factually correct answer here, all that matters is "Can you think like an Aam Aadmi ?"

[Setup] Select one person to be the host, just like a gameshow. Divide the remaining players in 2 teams

[Gameplay] Host shuffles the cards, picks one and asks the question on the card to the teams. The two teams take alternate turns to guess a popular answer. Each incorrect answer gets that team a strikeout card. The first team to get 3 strikeouts loses the round.

[Winning] First team to win 5 rounds, wins the game!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Of Knights and Ninjas: Medieval Legends
description: Another mini-expansion trilogy for Of Knights and Ninjas: Medieval Legends, adding ten personages from legend, from Beowulf to King Arthur, each with a special ability. Eastern Warriors: adding four characters to deflect attacks or steal cards. Events: four events from the glorious crusade to the horrible plague, that affect all players. A bonus card, the Torch, to burn down those pesky ladders and catapults. Plus ten cards to add to the base game to keep the deck balanced.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution

name: La Fallera Calavera: Tio Canya
description: This character, inspired by the homonymous song by Al Tall, has the ability "Rebound." Despite having only one point of attack and defense, Tio Canya always returns to the hand of the player who used it, whether they win or lose the battle. Therefore, the player who has it always has at least one point of defense. No more losing to "cagallons"!
mechanics: Unspecified

name: La Fallera Calavera: Ausiàs March (Promo Card)
description: This 15th-century poet cultivated various themes in his literature, especially love. That's why this extraordinary card will spread love among the players of La Fallera Calavera. When a player has Ausiàs March in their display, all rivals who want to battle for the treasures of this player must say "amor, amor" to him. If they don't, the player with Ausiàs March in the display can randomly steal a card from their hand!
mechanics: Unspecified

name: La Fallera Calavera 2: Dj Ximo
description: This celebrated Valencian DJ, musician, and producer became popular in the 1990s thanks to his techno music. He will be remembered for lyrics of songs like "Exta sí, exta no." This special level 1 card, to be used with La Fallera Calavera 2, pays homage to that song. When you use it, you can have +7 points of attack and defense if the coin lands on heads ("exta sí"), but if it lands on tails ("exta no"), nothing will happen.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: La Fallera Calavera: Rata de marjal (Promo Card)
description: Also known as a water rat or irrigation rat. Did you know that in the past, paella was cooked with this animal? In the game, it is a treasure that will transform into an ingredient when there are 7 or more conventional ingredients on the displays. That is to say, at the beginning of the game, it won't be useful for anything, but at an unexpected moment, it will transform into an ingredient!
mechanics: Unspecified

name: La Fallera Calavera: María Abradelo
description: Maria Abradelo, queen of Valencian television in the 90s and 2000s. Her power is "Mortal Song," and it will make her attack 6 whenever you initiate a battle by singing. But keep in mind that nothing prevents you from initiating a battle by singing... with a "cagalló"!
mechanics: Unspecified

name: La Fallera Calavera: La Paella Russa (Promo Card)
description: The paella russa, which refers to the mythical roulette in the form of paella from the Valencian television program "El show de Joan Monleón". With this card, if you're lucky, you can get 2 ingredients! But if chance penalizes you, you will lose all your ingredients. A daring move!
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Alakazum: Gripau Caòtic
description:
Initial and multicolored character with the "chaotic" trait. Whoever has this character in their team can, in each turn, introduce a bit of "chaos". Before starting the forest phase and before applying the thrifty character, you can:


Shuffle the market stack, or
Shuffle the forest battle stack.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Xing Ling Wang: Trading Card Game
description:
Xing Ling Wang is a TCG (Trading Card Game).
The background story is as follows:
One day, extraterrestrial goats invaded the entire universe.
The fearsome goat clan consumed the spacetime lines, causing chaos in time, space, and reality.
Xing Ling Wang, the supreme guardian of universal peace, exerted all efforts to sacrifice himself, sealing these spacetime goats within the Xing Ling Cards.
However, time, space, and reality are irreversibly disrupted!
This led to a universal war, and you will become the successors of Xing Ling Wang, using your exclusive skill "Xing Ling Cards" to rule over your own race, vying for the next era of Xing Ling Wang.

PS: "星靈王" is pronounced as "Xing Ling Wang," directly translated as "Star Spirit King."

PS2: The game is primarily a 2-player TCG, but will also have solo mode, 2v2, and 3v3 modes in the future.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Late to the Fight:  The Battle of Palmetto Ranch, May 13, 1865
description:
Late to the Fight is an historical simulation of the battle fought on May 13, 1865 just east of Brownsville, Texas along the Rio Grande River. Although the Confederate forces and their leaders knew of the surrender of Confederate forces in the east, as well as the assassination of President Abraham Lincoln, die-hards in state government and the remaining forces in Texas remained defiant. Union forces had occupied Brownsville, Texas in November 1863, but most of the Union forces there were withdrawn in November 1864 to where the Rio Grande emptied into the Gulf of Mexico at Brazos Island, Texas to guard against smuggling by pro-South Mexicans. A “gentlemen’s agreement” between the Union and Confederate forces in the area meant a relative calm had prevailed since then. However, when Union General Lew Wallace’s attempts to negotiate a surrender of all Confederate forces and the state of Texas were rebuffed in March, tensions grew. When General Wallace learned of a large Confederate force assembling at Brownsville, orders were issued for the 34th Indiana Infantry Regiment and 62nd United States Colored Troops Regiment to retake the town and disperse any rebel forces found there. What ensued as the last battle of the American Civil War, fought nearly a month after the surrender at Appomattox Court House. Can you do as well or better?

Each turn in Late to the Fight represents one hour of time. Infantry and Cavalry units represent Companies. Artillery units represent 2-4 guns. A hex on the map is approximately 250 yards across.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Unmatched: Steel and Silver
description:
In battle, there are no equals.

Unmatched is a highly asymmetrical miniature fighting game for two or four players. Each hero is represented by a unique deck designed to evoke their style and legend. Tactical movement and no-luck combat resolution create a unique play experience that rewards expertise, but just when you've mastered one set, new heroes arrive to provide all new match-ups.

Unmatched: Steel and Silver features three characters and two battlefields from the Witcher series.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Novel-based, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Line of Sight, Point to Point Movement, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Unmatched: Realms Fall
description:
In battle, there are no equals.

Unmatched is a highly asymmetrical miniature fighting game for two or four players. Each hero is represented by a unique deck designed to evoke their style and legend. Tactical movement and no-luck combat resolution create a unique play experience that rewards expertise, but just when you've mastered one set, new heroes arrive to provide all new match-ups.

Unmatched: Realms Fall features three characters and two battlefields from the Witcher series.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Miniatures, Novel-based, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Line of Sight, Point to Point Movement, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Beyond The Edges of The Maps
description:
Beyond The Edges of The Maps is a two-player territory exploration game inspired by the fictional world of The Wingfeather Saga by Andrew Peterson. Players sail their ships and explore land in order to surround and discover more territory than their opponent.

Each turn, a player moves their ship to discover more land and also adds more land pieces to represent exploring uncharted territory. While players take turns moving and adding land pieces to the board, each player will try to discover more territory and overtake their opponent, eventually surrounding their opponent and claiming victory.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Enclosure, Grid Movement, Square Grid

name: Catacombs: Fortress of Nazemoor
description:
Catacombs: Fortress of Nazemoor is a core, standalone dungeon crawler that uses the same rules and Dexterity Game System as Catacombs Third Edition (3E). As a result this game both re-implements and expands Catacombs 3E. All Catacombs 3E expansions are compatible with Fortress.

In the Catacombs related games, players must skilfully flick wooden discs that represent one of the characters under their control. Usually this is a hero or a monster, if playing as the Dungeon Master or "Overseer". Flicking a disc represents a "shot". The basic shots are rush (for moving) and melee (for both moving and attacking). When performing a ranged shot, a separate disc is used instead of a hero or monster's disc. Ranged shots include fireballs, ice boulders, missiles and hook shots. Some shots inflict damage while others enable special effects. When all of the monsters in a room have been cleared, the heroes can advance further up the fortress.

New features: Crates (treasure chests) that contain both rewards and traps appear on runes during the Battle Phase. Assistants can be rescued that will help the heroes in their quest through the Fortress. Items may be purchased during the Battle Phase.

This is expected to be the last entry in the Catacombs 3E series of games.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Flicking, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Zombicide: White Death – Dice Tower 2024 Promo Cards
description:
Available as part of the 2024 Dice Tower Kickstarter Pack D.

Two new item cards with a special power when both are equipped:

Aegis of the Tower
Gavel of Approval
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Medieval, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Turn Order: Progressive, Variable Player Powers

name: Custodia
description:
Guard the museum and catch the thief. Or try to steal the Diamond. In this "Cat and mouse game", you compete against each other, to be the first to either steal the diamond or catch the thief.
As the Guard you start designing the map of the museum, using the different tiles available. When the museums new blueprint has been made. You make a copy of the map, with the tiles bottom up. This is given to the thief who now have to explore the museum to locate the diamond. First the thief have to find the control room, to disable the alarm system, and find the daily code in the security office. The guard is making noise with his key, and the thief therefore always know which room the guard is in. The thief can on his turn explore a new room adjacent to the one he is in, or move through to rooms he has already explored. But watch out, there can be traps. The Guard, can on his turn either move two time (since he already has explored the whole map) or he can check his cameras checking if the thief is located in some of the rooms.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Marine Invaders
description:
Marine Invaders is a New Zealand based Educational Marine Card game. Encouraging players to learn to identify what is a New Zealand native species, and what is a pest invasive species, try to survive the longest when facing real world scenarios that effect your population and habitat. Players split the deck into "species" cards (blue) and "Interaction" cards (white), and shuffle both decks. Then, each player chooses a single species card. Players record the HPP and Habitat points from their species card. Each player will pick up from the "Interaction" deck, and read it aloud. Players use simple mathematics to keep score of HPP and Habitat points to stay alive the longest. If either set of HPP or Habitat points gets to zero, then their species card is out of the game.

Designed by marine scientists at The University of Waikato to be scientifically accurate and support reporting of invasive species in New Zealand.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Drawing, Player Elimination

name: Fashion Cents
description:
The World's Most Fashionable Deckbuilder!

2-5 players take turns expanding their Wardrobe (aka building their deck) as they buy better and more fashionable clothing items from the Storefront. But there's a twist: Each turn, players must be conscious of which types of clothing they add to their deck, because NO SHOES, NO SHIRT, NO SERVICE!

The goal of the game is to attract a Fashion Sponsor. And to do that, they'll need to get fully dressed with a Hat, a Shirt, Pants, and Shoes. Each Sponsor gives you a unique way to earn Victory Points and ultimately win the game!

Puns, cute outfits, customizable characters, puns, fashion contests, and puns. There's something here for the whole family... But especially Dads.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Drawing, Sudden Death Ending, Turn Order: Progressive, Voting

name: And the War Came
description:
And the War Came is a strategic level card driven block game of the American Civil War, 1861-1865. One player plays the United States and the other the rebelling southern Confederate States of America. The objective is to gain enough points to win the scenario.

The game is “We Go” turn based. In the same seasonal turn, both players perform tasks and use orders cards to activate corps sized unit (blocks) for area movement followed by combat. Through movement and/or combat, players gain points for areas or take them away from the opponent. Generals (also blocks) may command units for combat and movement, with higher ranked generals commanding more units.

There are four short scenarios (1861, 1862, 1863 and 1864), two multi-year campaign scenarios, (1861-1863, and 1863-1865) and the entire war scenario.

—description from the designer
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Command Cards, Dice Rolling

name: Warhammer: The Old World – Ravening Hordes
description:
It is a dark age, a bloody age, an age of strife and war, of Chaos and sorcery. Yet amidst all the fire and fury it is a time too of arcane magic, undead forces, and vicious warriors.

Warhammer: The Old World – Ravening Hordes is your indispensable guide to the forces of evil in the World of Legend.

This book, used in conjunction with the Warhammer: the Old World Rulebook, provides you with all the information required to command your collection of miniatures on the field of battle.

Inside this 160-page hardback book you will find army lists containing profiles and special rules for every model available for the following factions, alongside magic items and unique spells:


Orc and Goblin Tribes
Warriors of Chaos
Beastmen Brayherds
Tomb Kings of Khemri


Each army list includes the Grand Army composition list for that faction, along with an introduction to the faction and a full description of each of the many characters and units it contains. Alongside this is a showcase of beautifully painted armies from the talented painters of the world-famous ’Eavy Metal team.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Conan: Frazetta Guest box
description: This expansion contains 2 alternative Conan models, 2 character sheets (English on one side, French on the other), two Overlord tiles (non-lingual), a new tile for Bossonian Guards and a brand new Adventure scenario.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Novel-based
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Conan: Versus Mode
description:
Enter a whole new mode of play for the original Conan: The Boardgame to battle 1vs1.

This special playing mode requires the Core box and Stretch Goals box to be able to play all the scenarios.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Novel-based
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight

name: Conan: Worms of the Earth
description: This expansion is based on the short story 'Worms of the Earth' where Picts get their vengeance against the Roman empire. It includes 10 new miniatures, 4 hero sheets and 3 Solo/Coop scenarios.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Novel-based
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Mad Hatter
description:
Join today to an odd, but fantastic and exciting experience in Wonderland. The Mad Hatter has gone really crazy and has decided to give away his entire collection of hats to the one with the best skills of snatching them from others, of course, while drinking a fine and elegant cup of tea.

During the game you snatch cards according to the number of the hat by paying with higher ones, because you want to collect groups of the same type of hats. For example: you can snatch a "red hat #5" by paying with a "black hat #6", and add it to a group you already have. Bigger groups allow you to drink more cups of tea. When the dinner ends, the guest who deserves the unvaluable prize is the one capable of drinking the most "Victory Cups of Tea" (that is how they called victory points in Wonderland, didn’t you know?)

—description from the publisher
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Ladder Climbing, Set Collection, Take That

name: The Profiler: A Social Deduction Game
description:
Embark on a cerebral journey with The Profiler - a social deduction game. A masterpiece crafted for the true social deduction connoisseur. Delve into the art of deduction, strategic bluffing, and unraveling the human psyche.

Gather your group of 6-15 players, divide the roles of the townsfolk and the killer, and begin your quest of investigating the crime scenes to discover the killer in your midst.

The Profiler is played in day and night phases. During the day the players can investigate the evidence found left by the FBI Agent, Medical Examiner, and Lab Analyst. They can question the suspects and arrest a suspect. During the night, the killer will be able to draw a killer opportunity card to determine if they will kill and when. The FBI Agent, Medical Examiner, and Lab Analyst will have the opportunity to review the case file and extract some evidence.

The Townsfolk will win if they can arrest the killer and correctly identify their killer profile in 60 mins or less. The killer will win if they can outlast the 60 mins, deceive the townsfolk into getting their profile wrong, or by killing everyone in the town.

—description from the publisher
categories: Deduction, Mature / Adult, Murder/Mystery, Party Game
mechanics: Deduction

name: Star Wars: Trench Run
description:
Objective: Destroy the death star by launching proton torpedoes at exactly the right time. To do this you will adjusting the position of one of your attack leaders in the trench as they approach and when the launch display is at 000000 Both aiming markers up-down & left-right need be on the green centre spaces on target tracks to be on target.
Will you risk making small adjustments and make it easier for your escorts and leaders to be hit or make big adjustments and make it harder to be hit.
You will have to decide to take HIGH or LOW risk roll for each roll.
HIGH RISK: Will get you a lower numbered small adjustment counter but there is more chance of an escorts or a leader being Objective: Destroy the death star by launching proton torpedoes at exactly the right time. To do this you will adjusting the position of one of your attack leaders in the trench as they approach and when the launch display is at Both aiming markers up-down & left-right need be on the green centre spaces on target tracks to be on target.
Will you risk making small adjustments and make it easier for your escorts and leaders to be hit or make big adjustments and make it harder to be hit.
A hit result will destroy the waves escorts 2 first then the waves leader, remove then and marker and roll again.
When a wave has attacked or been destroyed remove any remaining markers and setup again for the next wave as in the setup phase.
Waves: Gold Leader, Red Leader then Red 5 “Luke”
will attack 1st. will attack 2nd. will attack last. destroyed.
LOW RISK: Will get you a higher numbered adjustment counter and less chance of an escorts or a leader being destroyed.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Math, Print & Play
mechanics: Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Rum & Rumors
description:
You start out as an unknown, unequipped, inexperienced and lonesome pirate with one mission: becoming the most notorious pirate and win the game.

You earn notoriety every time you triumph. To achieve this, you need to expand your treasure- hunting abilities and crew strength to conquer in battle. This is done by acquiring crew
members, items (like a pistol) and ship enhancements (like additional sails). There are also opportunities to trigger happenings and events your way. These assets come in the form of
pirate cards, which you lay next to your player board to visualise the expansion of your crew and ship. Then you will:

1.gather rumors that will enable you to unfold the location of treasures;
2.sail the seas with enough strength or speed to prevail in battle while hunting
treasures;
3.collect treasures by going ashore on islands that you know hide a treasure.

While treasure hunting you encounter ships of other players. Defeating them is a triumph that gains you notoriety. Defeating the ghost ship also gains you notoriety.

And then there is rum, a scarce resource that motivates
your crew into additional actions and special moves.

Will you lead your crew to triumphs and adventure the fastest
to become the most notorious pirate and win the game?
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Turn Order: Claim Action

name: Three Lil Birdies
description:
Three Li'l Birdies is a hand-crushing, chaos-creating, family-friendly card game that is a little like Snap and can leave you in similar positions to those found in a rugby scrum. The aim of the game is to collect sets of 3 identical bird cards. When someone does, everyone must try to grab a wooden egg that is in the middle of the table. If you grab the egg first, you win the set. But just because you win the set doesn't mean you keep it...

Gameplay: Players take turns to draw cards away from themselves from the middle of the table. If a player draws a bird card that is identical to one that they already have, the player can make a pile of the matching cards in front of them. If a player collects * 3 identical bird cards * everyone must try to grab a wooden egg that is in the middle of the table. Whoever gets the egg first, wins the set of cards too.

HOWEVER, there are some sneaky cards called consequence cards. These cards can make players lose, gain, swap and steal entire sets of bird cards from other players, meaning that no set is safe!!! If a player draws a consequence card, they must follow the instructions on the card, and then place the consequence cards and any other relevant cards in the discard pile.

The player who collects 5 sets of bird cards, wins the game.

Simple!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Set Collection, Take That

name: RAID: Random Adventures in Dungeons – Expansion #1
description:
The first Expansion for RAID Random Adventures In Dungeons is here!

This Expansion Includes:
All new event rooms to explore.
New magical items to find and use
Random dungeon encounters
EXTITING FOOTWEAR!
2 new characters classes, a new race, and bonus card.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Math
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Random Production, Role Playing

name: Bots!
description:
In a dystopian future, a once fertile planet has been reduced to nothing but junk and waste. As the head of a robot branch for the mighty RoboBotCorp you're tasked with constructing bots and sending them off to prep and construct buildings, clean up the junkyard, and turn in data to the head Data bot.

Bots! is a worker placement game with a fun bumping mechanism as bots are pushed along conveyor belts and eventually recycled. Play continues until enough bots have been recycled to push the data bot to the end of it's track.
mechanics: Contracts, Ownership, Worker Placement

name: Arkanum: Skirmish Game of Wizard Duels
description: Arkanum is a fast-paced and dynamic miniature tabletop wargame that challenges you to adapt to ever-changing situations. In a dark and grim world of wizardry, power is the only thing that matters. Choose from different magic schools, each with its own strengths and weaknesses, and create your own Wizard character.
