At the end of the game, points are scored based on the number of friendly stones in the perimeter loops adjacent to at least one enclosure within the corresponding group, minus the number of surplus stones on the board. Additionally, half an extra point is awarded to the player who passed their turn first.

To make the game fair, before the game begins, the first player chooses an integer as the komi value, and then the second player chooses a side. This balancing method is called pie komi.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Connections, Enclosure

name: Goblin Plunder
description:
A quick and dirty 15-30min card game for 2-4 players. Inspired by fantasy adventures, the card game sets players as goblins plundering treasure from a dragon's cave.

Each turn the cave refreshes with new treasure cards. Player goblins can take a treasure from the cave, steal from another player, turn a card in their hand, or stash a card safely in their hoarde.At the end of each round, the dragon hoards the most valuable treasure left in the cave.

When the dragon can't take an action, the last round triggers! Create the best hoard of treasure to score for sets of matching treasure types and value of each card.

Set collecting mechanics, with drafting and stealing, and hand management to create the best treasure sets. Competitive game with players working against each other plus the automated 'Dragon' player - and the Dragon could win!

Competitive with a touch of reluctant cooperation. Two decks can be combined to play with 5+ players.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That

name: Muamba
description:
Be the cleverest smuggler in Muamba.
Players have returned from vacation abroad and bought a few things above the customs limit of their country (along with some illegal items), now you need to deceive the customs officials at the airport, passing with these smuggled items hidden in your luggage, hoping it won't be searched. Muamba is a very fun card game with climbing mechanics and a lot of bluffing.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Ladder Climbing

name: Дуболомы (Dubolomi)
description:
The board card game Stupid Boys was conceived with the idea of making the best dueling game, with easy entry for beginners and great replay value for advanced players.

The rules of the game are simple: players alternately use attack and defense cards in the amount indicated on the character card, I take into account the sum of the value of the cards, if the sum of the attack exceeds the sum of defense, then the attack passes and the player receives damage equal to 1 heart token, and in addition, players can use cards " prestige" - modifiers, enhancements and extra actions that will add unpredictability to the progress of the battle!

The winner in the game is not only the one who has the coolest cards, but the one who can use them correctly - tactics and strategy will become your allies in battle!

—description from the designer

Настольная карточная игра «Дуболомы» придумывалась с идеей сделать лучшую дуэльную игру, с легким входом для новичков и большой реиграбельностью для продвинутых игроков.

Правила игры простые: игроки поочередно используют карты атаки и защиты в количестве указанном на карточке персонажа, учитываю сумму значения карт, если сумма атаки превышает сумму защиты - то атака проходит и игрок получает урон равный 1 жетону сердец, так же дополнительно игроки могут использовать карты «престижа» - модификаторы, усиления и экстра действия которые будут добавлять непредсказуемости продвижению боя!

В игре выигрывает не только тот у кого самые крутые карты, а тот кто может их правильно использовать – тактика и стратегия станут вашими союзниками в бою!

—description from the designer (Russian)
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Umbral Knights
description:
Umbral Knights is a 2-4 player cooperative exploration Board Game in the astral realms of Umbral.
Play as a Knight rescuing lost souls from oblivion, testing yourself during combats and encounters, choosing among the various paths presented, which will lead you to glory.
Choose your blessing, develop your skills, conquer better items, and delve into this incredible and dark adventure.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Command Cards, Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Finale Ending, Grid Movement, Line of Sight, Map Addition, Market, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Time Splicers
description:
Time Splicers: In the near future, humanity faces its greatest challenge: The Singularity. This event sees Artificial Intelligence becoming self-aware, pushing humanity to the brink of obsolescence. Despite dire warnings from scientists, it's too late to turn back. In this critical hour, a glimmer of hope emerges time travel—our last chance to reclaim our destiny. However, in a bid to thwart human efforts, the AI begins to fracture time itself, steering us towards paths eerily familiar yet dangerously unknown. Enter the Time Splicers. Entrusted with the monumental task of mending the splintered timeline, your mission is to prevent The Singularity from ever taking root. The key lies in rare Time Crystals scattered across the ages. These crystals hold the power to stabilize humanity's future.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Seven Kingdoms
description:
Seven Kingdoms is a fast and deep board game where four powerful factions battle it out for control of the Kingdom. Using the five most influential characters you can bribe, dispense Papal favors, start riots and wars and fight to conquer control of the regions. Be careful not to leave the provinces unguarded or the invaders will take advantage of it. Each player will be able to do only one action from those available and must be particularly careful which one to do because at the end of the turn the characters on the map will perform an automatic passive action that will radically change the balance in the game. It is a game with ZERO luck, only the most skilled will be the winner at the end of the game.

Each game turn has three phases:
Player action phase
Characters Passive action phase
End Turn phase.

Starting with the first player and then clockwise each player can only do ONE action among the available characters.
The action can be Normal or Enhanced, the enhanced action can only be performed if the player who intends to perform it has a Pope’s Favor which must be discarded immediately.
Characters must take the action ONLY after moving
Once a character has been chosen, he can no longer be chosen for that turn, the only exception being the army for whom two actions can be performed, one for the infantry and the other for the chivalry.
after all players have chosen their character and taken the relevant action, all passive actions of the characters are resolved.
finally in the final phase of the turn, the effects of the war are applied, it is checked whether the game is over and finally the invader's move is made.

Character actions (simplified)

The king
Basic action: place two of your own cubes and one of an opponent's
Advanced Action: Place two of your own cubes
Passive action: the player with the majority chooses the first player

The Pope
Basic Action: Place a Papal Influence
Advanced Action: square papal influence and a bishop
Passive action: the player with the majority obtains a papal favor

The Merchant
Basic action: Place a cube in the market
Advanced Action: Place two cubes in the market
Passive action: increases the economic value of a region

The spy
Basic action: Swap two cubes
Advanced Action: swap places of two cubes also in the market or between Governors
Passive action: places an invader cube

The army
Basic action: Converts an invader into its own cube
Advanced Action: Convert two invaders into two of your own cubes
Passive action: fights a war
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Turn Order: Claim Action

name: Raja Mantri Chor Sipahi
description:
In this modern day re-imagine of the classic game Raja Mantri Chor Sipahi, you compete with your friends to become the richest person of Rajasthan, India.

You get 2 secret characters and each turn you can either play the character’s abilities or bluff. But be careful, if others catch your bluff, you must pay the price!

Gameplay
Players take turns in a clockwise order. During each turn, a player selects a single action. Action is considered successful unless challenged or blocked by other players. Players could be telling the truth about their actions or bluffing! If their lie is caught with a challenge then they must pay the price of 3 Golds!
The game concludes instantly when a player accumulates 20 gold.

Easy 2 Learn
Raja Mantri Chor Sipahi is a super fun, fast-paced game that is simple to learn and easy to play! Only takes 5 minutes to set up and each round lasts about 15-30 minutes.

Play Everywhere
Compact, travel friendly game that can be played at your house, office, parties and even road trips!

Perfect for Gifting
Family friendly fun game with elegant, high quality material & packaging makes it perfect for gifting.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deduction

name: Gardlings
description:
Cleverly build your garden. Harvest gems and enrich your seed bag with new, amazing creatures so your next garden can grow even more abundant. Combine the unique abilities of your creatures, and be the first to acquire the victory trophy.

Each round in Gardlings, all players simultaneously build their garden in front of themselves. You do this by drawing and placing tiles from your bag. You may stop drawing tiles at any time because if you draw too many gnomes, they will steal gems from you. At the end of the round, use any gems you matched in your garden to buy a new tile, then return all of your tiles to your bag to prepare for the next round. Each tile features potential ways to match gems, as well as a creature with a special ability. Your garden will grow larger and better each round, and the puzzle of placing tiles will become increasingly complex.

The goal of the game is to match enough gems to buy the victory tile.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Tile Placement

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Onslaught – Tendrils of the Lichen Lich Starter Set
description:
Dungeons & Dragons: Onslaught is a competitive skirmish game in which each player controls an adventuring party from one of the powerful factions of the Forgotten Realms. Parties delve into dungeons, battle rival adventurers, and confront fearsome monsters on a quest for treasure and glory.

Two new factions join Onslaught with the Tendrils of the Lichen Lich Starter Set: the Lord's Alliance and the Emerald Enclave. Battle for control over the city and forests, which is represented by a new tile system that allows each scenario's map to be unique. Over the course of six scenarios, you'll fight each other as well as more and more powerful monsters, leading up to a final confrontation with the horrifying lichen lich...

This starter set is playable on its own, or it can be combined with other Dungeons & Dragons: Onslaught starter sets or expansions.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid – RPM Ranger Pack
description: The RPM Rangers are here! This expansion adds the RPM team to Heroes of the Grid! Add the 5 RPM rangers (Red, Blue, Yellow, Green, Black) to your game. Includes 5 Zords and 2 Megazords.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid – Arsenal Pack
description:
Introducing a brand-new type of card: Arsenal Cards! This expansion incorporated some of the larger ranger equipment such as Battilzers.

Also included are four new characters, Void Knight, Izzy Garcia, Trini Kwan, and Tyler Navarro, each with a figure, character card, Zord card, combat deck, along with an array of the new Arsenal cards.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Dutch Resistance: Dare to Strike!
description:
An expansion for Dutch Resistance: Orange Shall Overcome!

This expansion adds 2 extra scenarios, extra cards for the different decks in the game including one extra character card for each character, and many modules to adjust the game to your liking. These modules include different upgrades, for example, stronger Morale Action tokens, a higher maximum Alibi or Morale, as well as ways to make the game tougher to win such as the officer that can be added to any scenario and other more dangerous Occupiers on the roads.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Multi-Use Cards, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Pick-up and Deliver, Push Your Luck, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Shifting Shadows
description:
Welcome, brave adventurer, to the Shadow Dimension, where the Skeleton King rules supreme. As the God of all Concepts and Ideas, the Skeleton King can grow quite board. Ironic that the power behind all ideas is fresh out of ideas for ways to spend his time. So like many powerful figures throughout history, he simply enjoys a clash between heroes.
​
In Shifting Shadows 8 mighty heroes, well seven mighty heroes and a stray accountant named Dave are called to fight in a mighty battle for the entertainment of the Skeleton King. Players take on the role of these heroes from different multiverses and enter the battle royal. The last person standing is the victor.

Shifting Shadows is a deck builder game where players use an in game currency called power to buy more cards to deal damage, gain power, and use magical effects. Players also have a hero power, action and bonus action, so every round offers some way to improve. This fast paused game has over 300 cards that can be added to you deck in the fight before the skeleton king.

Win and gain eternal glory, a lifetime supply of fictional fantasy Applebees, and a Boon from the Skeleton King. But beware, the consequences of losing are dire, as the Mighty Skeleton King will turn your hero into his little Skeleton Servant. Will you become a legend in your realm or be transfigured into a tiny little guy?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck Construction, Variable Player Powers

name: Plant the Evidence
description:
Plant the Evidence is a party game of finesse and deception where you both keep a watchful eye and avoid detection as everyone simultaneously tries to hide poker chips around the play space without getting caught.

Like all good party games, it’s very simple. Each player has 6 chips of their color, and 1 card at a time. The card has a word on it that describes where to hide one of the chips. The goal is to hide a chip in, on, or around the word on your card. Once you’ve done that, you draw a new card and hide another chip.

While you’re hiding your own chips, you’re also on the lookout for those of other players. If you come across any or spot someone in the act of planting one, you call them out and they have to take the chip back and draw a new card. This means you have to be subtle and smart about how, when, and where you plant your chips to avoid detection.

The best parts of the game are when you get a really sly plant just behind someone's back without being spotted, or when you catch another player’s subtle move out of the corner of your eye and call them out and make a scene. You get to feel really slick, like a spy or secret agent outplaying the opposition in moments like that throughout the whole game.
categories: Party Game, Print & Play, Word Game
mechanics: Real-Time

name: Itamae San: the Sushi Game
description:
Itamae San is a tabletop memory-style game for kids and grown ups featuring colorful, minimalistic illustrations, iconic shapes and patterns, and easy-to-learn gameplay.
In Itamae San you play as a sushi chef (itamae) creating beautiful sushi orders for your customers. On your turn you try to turn over only the ingredients needed for any face up sushi order on the table. If you do it without making a mistake, you get to take the Sushi Order.
Every sushi order you collect is worth a certain amount of money. Earn the most money by the end of the night to become the most revered chef behind the board.
Ingredient tiles never leave the table, and are used for multiple Sushi Orders, creating a completely unique take on the classic memory game genre.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Matching, Memory, Multi-Use Cards, Variable Set-up

name: Akhedena
description:
Akhedena: Destiny of The Throne

This board game can be played with 2-4 people.

Akhedena is a medieval strategy board game that requires clever tactics to complete with opponents. Each player owns generals and armies with a variety of strengths and abilities, building their own force to be the ruler of the lost kingdom.

A dragon flies overhead, making things unpredictable. While its fiery breath could destroy your lands or shatter your legions, with cunning and courage, you might be able to bend this winged beast to your will, and claim its dominion as your own.

Victory in Akhedena hinges on strategic planning. Players must carefully choose locations for their castles, determine the right moments to fortify with walls, and meticulously craft a powerful and well-balanced army in order to dominate the battlefield.

Akhedena is approachable for new players, thanks to its intuitive rules that capture the essence of combat. But don't be fooled by its easy-to-grasp core. Mastering the battlefield requires strategic cunning, as true victory hinges on outmaneuvering your opponents.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Political, Wargame
mechanics: Action/Event, Advantage Token, Alliances, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Area-Impulse, Automatic Resource Growth, Betting and Bluffing, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Catch the Leader, Closed Drafting, Command Cards, Commodity Speculation, Connections, Contracts, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Different Dice Movement, Enclosure, Events, Finale Ending, Grid Coverage, Grid Movement, Hand Management

name: Secret Slasher
description:
Secret Slasher is a murder mystery board game where players have to use clues, deduction, and strategy to figure out who the Slasher amidst them is, before they get slashed.

A player can participate in the game as either an everyday Citizen or a Slasher (Killer). No one knows who the Secret Slasher(s) is or who the Citizens are, this is assigned randomly and discretely at the start of the game.

The objectives are simple, if you are an innocent Citizen, you need to complete your list of errands or figure out who the Secret Slasher(s) is to win the game. If you are a Slasher, you need to attempt or pretend to complete your Errands, all while discreetly and secretly Slashing the other players to eliminate them from the game, just don't get caught!
mechanics: Deduction, Dice Rolling, Targeted Clues, Traitor Game

name: Warhammer: The Horus Heresy – Campaigns of the Age of Darkness: The Siege of Cthonia
description:
The planet of Cthonia, once home of the Sons of Horus, is consumed by a rolling war and under siege by the Imperial Fists. The True Sons of Cthonia vow to retake their world before the Warmaster claims Terra, with the aid of the Word Bearers and the Alpha Legion.

Standing between the traitors and victory is a garrison of Imperial Fists, reinforced by warbands of the Shattered Legions and even a cadre of Loyalist Thousand Sons.

This 240 page hardback rulebook includes eleven new missions based on the events of the siege of Cthonia, and campaign rules to fight the siege from beginning to apocalyptic end.

Also included are rules for new loyalist and traitor characters, and for new units including Astartes Inductii, Legiones Decurions and Cults Abominatio.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement

name: The Legend of Aquiny
description:
The Legend of Aquiny is a cooperative, evolving campaign with 10 chapters. Two to four players can play as one of the four heroes and advance through the Adventure Book to solve the mystery of the Legend of Aquiny.

Each chapter requires you to achieve several objectives in order to succeed. If one of the objectives is not achieved, you will have to start the chapter again until you have achieved all the objectives in order to move on to the next one. Some chapters are in two parts. You will be invited to read the next section once you have achieved specific objectives.

The material is evolving! When you successfully achieve a chapter, you can open a new envelope to unlock new materials... and new rules!
The number of players can vary from one chapter to the next. So you can start the adventure with four players, move up to two, and finish the story with three.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Majority / Influence, Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, End Game Bonuses, Events, Legacy Game, Market, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Programmed Movement, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Intrigues and cabbage
description:
Intrigue and Cabbage is a fun game with a lot of interactions between players. The goal of the game is to gather the best villagers in your castle. The villagers are animals, so make sure to keep an eye on population and don't forget to snatch yourself some guards. Or else, they just might eat all your food supplies or even worse - each other.

Intrigues and Cabbage is a push your luck game with a goal to collect best set of cards. The game is quick, dynamic, unpredictable and fun.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Medousa
description:
Boardgame rules: Each player draws a snake from Cyclops' Cave and places it on the board to match the dark snake figuers. A player scores by matching color segments on snakes.

As noted, instead of a dice, the unique Cyclop's Cave is used to pick up randomly the snakes. The other interesting and novel part is that the snakes may be placed in two different ways adding to a combination of memory and strategy game. There are also special snakes that have special mathematical actions.

Solo rules: Place all 24 snakes on the outlines of medousa’s head by matching the color segments on the snakes when they overlay another snakes. Depending on how many colors are matched, the player reaaches a corresponding score.
mechanics: Matching, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: What Is This Sorcery TCG
description:
WITS (What Is This Sorcery) is an immersive digital trading card game (TCG) that brings together the classic appeal of card collecting with the dynamic interactivity of online gaming. Set against a backdrop of enchantment and strategy, WITS challenges players to master the art of magical combat, using a diverse array of cards that represent mythical creatures, arcane spells, and cunning tactics.

The heart of WITS lies in its strategic gameplay, where players build personalized decks from their collection of digital assets. Each card is a key to new strategies, offering unique abilities that can turn the tide of battle. Players engage in turn-based duels, where smart planning, anticipation of the opponent's moves, and adaptability are crucial to securing victory.

How to play? The unexpected child of Hearthstone, Yu-Gi Oh, MTG and other favourites. Turn based battle against your opponents Hero, getting them to 0 HP to win the game utilizing your deck of 40 cards crafted by oneself.

Each Physical card has chip technology embedded into the card itself allowing players to claim their physical cards in the digital game to compete and use in competitive game modes to become the #1 ranked player in the world. Digital Rewards versions of the cards will live online and enable players to earn rewards for every game that someone uses their digital rewards version card. EXAMPLE, User 1 owns card abc, User 2 collects card abc in the game and adds it to their competitive deck, User 2 wins the competitive game and earns ELO and rewards, some of those said rewards are given to the owner of the digital rewards card version.

Beyond the thrill of the duel, WITS aims to foster a strong community of enthusiasts. Players are encouraged to trade, collect, and compete in a vibrant ecosystem. The game rewards participation and achievement, offering players the chance to earn exclusive cards and other digital rewards through gameplay, tournaments, and special events. This system of rewards adds an extra layer of strategy, as players must decide how best to use their earned assets to enhance their decks or trade with others for the perfect strategic addition.

WITS is more than just a game; it's a continuously evolving adventure that grows with its community. With a focus on strategic depth, player ownership, and a rewarding ecosystem, WITS offers a rich and engaging experience that appeals to both competitive gamers and collectors alike, promising endless possibilities for exploration, strategy, and competition.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Stalagbite!
description:
Stalagbite! is a fantasy quest game for 1-6 players.
You take on the role of a Dwarf, hunting for Gold and Glory in the caverns, beset by hazards, vicious creatures and Goblins. You will strive to discover new caverns, battle for glory and challenge your fellow Dwarves for the greatest hoard of treasure!

Recruited from the taverns of Alberon, YOU and your fellow Dwarves have journeyed to the Lost Mountains to quest for Gold and Glory! There, in the deepest depths of the mountains, you trespass caverns untrod for a thousand years. Armed only with your wits and your axe, you discover treasures, hazards and the vicious Stalagbite which infests the caverns. But the Goblins of the Lost Mountains are aware of your presence and have sent a hunting party after you.

Will your expedition triumph and leave laden with gold, or will the caverns of the Lost Mountains become your tomb?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Events, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Esgrad
description:
Introduction:Esgrad (from Scottish Gaelic: Sgaradh, meaning "partition") is a drawless game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the intersections (points) of an initially empty hexagonal board with triangles. The recommended board size is 9 points per side, but it can be played on a 11–sized board for longer games or a 7–sized board for shorter games. Each player has access to a sufficient supply of stones of their own color.



Definitions:– A group is a set of stones of the same color connected to each other. A single stone is also a group.
– A partition is each of the areas separated by a group that cannot be connected to each other except through said group.
– The value of a group is the number of partitions it contains based on triangular scoring, which is calculated by summing consecutive natural numbers from 1 to the number of partitions in the group.



Turns:Black plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, do one of the following actions:

– Place a stone of your color on an empty point.
– Pass your turn.



End of the game:The game ends when both players pass their turns consecutively. At the end of the game, points are counted by summing the value of all friendly groups, plus an extra half point to the player who passes his turn first.

To ensure fairness, before the game begins, the first player chooses an integer number as the komi value and then the second player chooses the sides. This balancing method is called komi pie.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Connections, Enclosure

name: Fantasy Tavern Brawl
description:
What would a tavern be without a good old brawl?

Fantasy Tavern Brawl is a fast-paced game where players fling, slide, or drop their cards towards the tavern and then place or remove meeples based on the card’s ability. Every card that touches an existing card enlarges the tavern.

Some cards will allow you to create additional floors to the tavern by placing the card on top of existing meeples, eventually creating a three dimensional chaotic puzzle of cards and meeples. At the end of the game, players count the number of meeples still on top of the cards forming the tavern, with those on higher floors scoring more points.

Included are rules for a variety of scenarios to play, each with different combinations of cards and rules for drafting them.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move, Slide/Push, Worker Placement

name: Critical: Foundation – Season 2
description:
2036, the American elections are approaching. Thanks to you, Mars Inc. has fallen. But another enemy awaits you: the Foundation. A tentacular organization that influences the highest spheres of the States.

Once again, Colonel Jackson calls upon your team to face this new challenge. Travel the world, investigate discreetly, and prepare for the worst. Humanity needs you!

Features:

8 episodes of 30 minutes
Two different endings
A new career: the Corporatists
Enhance your character with Nanotech cards


—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Science Fiction
mechanics: Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Finders Creepers
description:
Finders Creepers is an AR-enhanced hybrid board game. The mid-weight pick-up & delivery game has players taking on the roles of monster hunters from the paranormal society, Invisible, Inc. Guided by your helpful and often maniacal AI assistant, Boogle, the hunters search a haunted house for the AR monsters lurking in the various rooms. It’s their mission to find the correct gear and capture three monsters first. But if the house gets overrun by Haunted Objects, the monsters escape the board and HAUNT YOUR HOUSE in a real-world AR monster hunt!

On your turn, a player takes three actions from seven potential actions. Players must move through the house collecting the specific gear they need to catch the monsters hiding in the house. Using the Boogle app, players can scan the house to find the monster and ultimately catch them. But beware of Haunted Objects lurking in the house that will scare you back to the starting gate.

At the end of each player’s turn, it’s the monster’s turn, having the players roll the Monster Dice, which often brings new challenges but can bring rewards, too. If three Haunted Objects are unveiled in the house or the Grand Escape icon is rolled, the house becomes unstable and the monsters escape the board in an AR monster hunting event. The player who blasts the most monsters in the Grand Escape is rewarded two gear tiles and the chance to rid the house of one Haunted Object. The first player to capture three monsters is the winner!

The game can be played with or without the AR app.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver

name: House Climber
description:
House Climber is an original climbing/shedding game system.

There is a basic game for 3 players that operates as an introductory climbing game that is still satisfying for climbing game veterans.

Following the basic rules are a series of variant ways to play that apply the base game rules to different types of traditional climbing game. There is a bidding game, a partnership game, a social game, and other ways to play. Each game is intuitive and easy to learn once one has learned and mastered the basic game.

The basic gameplay is simple and standard for a climbing game. One player leads with a combination. The other players must follow with a higher version of that same combination, play a bomb (a special combination), or pass.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Ladder Climbing

name: Onstage
description:
Onstage is a trick-taking game where you play as a theater company competing for the best performers to join your troupe. It is a must-follow style trick-taker, where you claim the performers onstage when winning tricks. The trump suit is determined by the most valuable performers currently onstage and will change throughout the game as you recruit & manipulate the line of performers.

The deck consists of 36 cards, numbered 1-9 for each of the 4 suits. There are 3 performers for each suit, for a total of 12 performer tokens. Each suit has a 1-, 2-, & 3-point value performer token representing the Featured, Supporting, & Lead actors respectively.

The values 1,4, & 7 of each suit have effects to manipulate the performers onstage & in line, which can change the current trump and scoring opportunities each hand.

If at the end of the round you are the only player with no performer tokens, you claim all the performers currently on stage as your score for the round. Keep 1 card between each round and put all used performers back in line behind the current line before starting the next hand in the new turn order.

Play equal rounds per player, high score wins. In the 2 vs 2 teams’ variant, you add your partner's score at the end of each round but may not discuss your hand during play.
mechanics: Trick-taking
publishers: Ngũ Hành Games, Rolling Wizards Studio

name: Plato's Cave
description:
This Board Game/Puzzle is built on Plato's Cave Allegory and the diagram from Carlo Cipolla's essay "The Basic Laws of Human Stupidity".

It is about gaining experience of the human nature, becoming a better person, to then escape the cave and become enlightened. In the process, each player must help others to become “enlightened enough” and accumulate an accepted number of Brain-Cells to also gain applied intelligence. That way, everyone becomes efficiently useful, for the whole society to benefit.

This game was not created to target or to mock people with the words Nifty, Stupid, Egoist, Warm-Hearted, Super-Genius or King of Fools or other stereotypes. The behaviors have been already experienced by us (especially by the creator of this game) and by playing Plato’s Cave, we get to experience them again to think critically and creatively.

The IQ scale used in this game is a playful one and has nothing to do with other (subjective) IQ scales used around the world.

And in contrast to some other games, where we are taught to harm others in order to win, in this game we win by helping others.

Experience and knowledge are combined to become intelligence.

The game is played by 2 to 4 Players, while there is also a 1-Player Puzzle.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Catch the Leader, Communication Limits, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Negotiation, Single Loser Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Voting

name: Dehil
description:
Introduction:Dehil (from Irish: Deighilt, meaning "partition") is a drawless game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the intersections (points) of an initially empty hexagonal board with triangles. Each player has access to a sufficient supply of stones of their own color.



Definitions:– A group is a set of stones of the same color connected to each other. A single stone is also a group.
– A partition is each of the areas separated by a group that cannot be connected to each other except through said group.
– The value of a group is the number of stones it contains.



Turns:Black plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, do one of the following actions:

– Place a stone of your color on an empty point. You can create a triangle pattern if exactly one of its stones is on the edge of the board and the rest or all of them (not on the edge) are adjacent to (i) a friendly stone that is not part of a triangle pattern or to (ii) a center stone of an hourglass pattern.
– Pass your turn.

It should be noted that the above restrictions apply to all triangle patterns.



End of the game:The game ends when both players pass their turns consecutively. At the end of the game, points are counted by adding the value of all friendly groups with partitions minus the value of all friendly groups without partitions, plus an extra half point to the player who passed their turn first.

To ensure fairness, before the game begins, the first player chooses an integer number as the komi value and then the second player chooses the sides. This balancing method is called komi pie.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Connections, Enclosure

name: Sammich Time
description:
This game was created by two teen entrepreneurs who wanted to make a game for kids that was more than simple "roll-and-move" along a linear path and also had some basic decision-making and strategy elements. After 2-3 years of testing, refinement, and two Kickstarter campaigns, Sammich Time was born!

Sammich Time is an EASY to learn and FUN to play board game that is sure to bring smiles and laughter to your families table! Players move around the game board building their sandwich layer-by-layer until complete with bread, meat, cheese, and lettuce. Watch out for pitfalls on the board and for other players who may try and steal layers from your sandwich! Once your sandwich is complete, add a drink to complete the meal and then race to the picnic table to enjoy the taste of sweet victory!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Impulse Movement, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: If These Walls Could Talk
description:
Saturn Hills Asylum has a long and varied history in Valley Falls. Like the town within which it resides, the asylum is also the source of its fair share of mysteries such as the fire in 2002 that led to several deaths. Now, more than 20 years later, new evidence has come to light that seems to indicate the fire may have been used to cover up something sinister. With this new evidence in hand, you enter this notorious mental health facility to get to the bottom of what really happened all those years ago. To your surprise, there are still workers on site who were employed at Saturn Hills at the time of the fire. There are also patients who were housed there in 2002. With a host of witnesses-both reliable and unreliable-who may be able to help you determine what really happened, can you find the proof needed to bring a killer to justice? Saturn Hills has lots of secrets it might whisper to you should you choose to listen. So, step inside, place your ear to one of the soot-stained walls, and determine what you can learn about those dark secrets from the past If These Walls Could Talk.

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided, visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find what's missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Blood Diamonds
description: Blood Diamonds is a game of land, natural resources, wealth and bankruptcy. The game board depicts a large property with a river running through the middle of it. The property is partitioned by a 6x6 grid into 36 sectors. Each of the sectors is divided into 16 parcels of land, or less if the sector includes part of the river. Blood Diamonds is presented as a two player game for ease of explanation, but is easily adapted to more players.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Connections, Network and Route Building

name: Odalin: Dungeons of Doom
description:
Experience the thrill of classic dungeon crawlers, infused with great strategic depth, in a unique dark desert fantasy setting. Find immersion and nostalgia in the intense battles that only the bravest souls dare to explore. With straightforward rules and innovative mechanics, every encounter is unique—you will never know what lurks within the shadowy pits of the dungeons.

Make a pact with a demon lord and combine your attacks with the demon’s, creating a unique combinations and gameplay for each hero. There are dice rolling, but the powers allow to mitigate the luck with good strategy.

Explore the dungeons to find artifacts and hidden secrets, with an exciting loot system. Many items are unusual and make real impact on the hero’s powers. With luck, you can find the set collection for your hero and become much more powerful.

Make tough choices, including moral dilemma and shape the campaign. Your choices will shape the world and determine the ending.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: Mythwind: Friends & Family
description:
The Friends & Family expansion introduces you to the varied townsfolk of the growing village in Mythwind. Players can now visit other characters to benefit from their expertise and perform the socialize action to increase friendship with local villagers, unlocking new and exciting story elements.

Character Interaction
Each playable character gains a unique way to interact with every other character in play!

The Villagers
Villagers start as acquaintances and then progress to friends, best friends, and finally, the opportunity to become life partners with unique stories along the way.

Alternative Buildings
Each of the villagers join the town when their associated building is constructed. When the Printing Press is built, Aidan shows up on the Community Board!

Socialize
Characters can now perform the socialize action when they use buildings associated with Villagers. To socialize, all characters may contribute hired workers to a combined dice roll to see if they increase their friendship status with the villager.

Partners
When a villager’s friendship level increases to partner, this community member now unlocks a special ability. Characters also have the opportunity to pursue certain villagers for a lifelong partnership of marriage and even children!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Floristry
description:
Floristry is a 2 player, tile-laying game. Players compete at the historic Aalsmeer Dutch Auction to win the best flowers and then use them to create the most charming window display.

Each round features a Dutch auction, where the clock counts down from 15 seconds while the price drops every 3 seconds. The unique web app runs your auctions, so you have to think fast, bid carefully, and pay close attention to get what you want at the right price-- but also keep an eye on what your rival needs.

Players simultaneously and strategically place their new flowers into their storefront frame. At the end of the game, players will earn Charm from their largest patch of each flower type, and whoever has the most Charm wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction: Dutch Priority, Tile Placement

name: Smooth Operations: The Card Game
description:
In Smooth Operations, you play the role of an engineer trying to keep your service reliable and your customers happy. As you work to ship new features and keep things running smoothly. You'll encounter a number of issues along the way, which you better fix or your deployment will suffer! Who will be the first to hit 500 points and win the game?

Play one of 4 types of cards: issues, fixes, best practices, or points cards. Ruin your friends releases, secretly hold your dice, or focus on points. Use strategy and cunning to get your service running.

Setup:
First to 500 points wins.

All players begin the game with four cards dealt to them.

Draw a card from the draw pile or top of the discard pile.

Play one card or discard one card so you end your turn with four cards in your hand.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Take That

name: Criocha
description:
Introduction:Criocha (from Irish: Críoch, meaning "territory, boundary") is a drawless game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the intersections (points) of a initially empty square board. The default board size is 17 points per side, but it can be played on a 15-sized board for intermediate players or a 13-sized board for beginners. There is also a location outside the board called prison. Each player has access to a sufficient supply of stones of their own color.

This game is based on Anda.



Definitions:– A group is a set of stones of the same color connected orthogonally. A single stone is also a group.
– A supergroup is a set of groups of the same color connected diagonally. A single group is also a supergroup.
– A liberty is an empty point adjacent orthogonally or diagonally to a group.
– A smothered group is a group where all its liberties has a path of N empty points connected to exactly one enemy supergroup, where N can be zero.
– A territory is a set of connected empty points. You own a territory if you are the only one who can place stones on those points.
– To annihilate is to place a stone on an empty point that smother all enemy groups, leaving the board with stones only of your color. You cannot annihilate if your opponent also annihilated in a previous turn.



Turns:Black plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, perform one of the following actions:

– Place a stone of your color on an empty point, then move all smothered friendly and enemy groups to prison. If it's your first turn, do this twice on non-adjacent empty points.
– Remove an enemy stone from prison.

At the end of your turn, the group of the stone you placed cannot be left smothered.



End of the game:– The player who made the last move wins the game.
– A player has the option to "propose end" of the game and the other player must accept it or not. In case of acceptance, points will be counted by adding the friendly territory and enemy prisoners, and also awarding an extra half point to the player who made the last move.

For the game to be fair, before it starts:

– Player 1 places two black stones.
– Player 2 either (i) swaps or (ii) places two white stones.
　– If (i), Player 1 places two white stones and Player 2 either swaps or accepts.
　– If (ii), Player 1 either swaps or accepts.

Then, the player with the black stones offers a komi pie, where the first player places several black stones in the prison and the second player chooses a side. The player with the white stones either swaps or accepts. I have called this balancing method dual pie rule.



Variant:For a simpler option, each player places two stones of their color on non-adjacent corners during game setup. Then Black starts the game by playing the first normal turn. The komi pie can also be used for balance.

Additionally, for better visual clarity it is recommended that beginners start playing with optional captures.



Notes:Special thanks to Christopher Field for his contribution to a simpler alternative balancing method. The prison mechanism was introduced by David Wolfe and Elwyn Berlekamp in their book "Mathematical Go: Chilling Gets the Last Point".

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Enclosure, Square Grid

name: The Dawn of Revolution: The Battle of Edgehill, October 23, 1642
description:
The Dawn of Revolution is the debut game in Roberto Chiavini's series of games set in the English Civil War. Like the others, Dawn of Revolution uses a chit pull design to activate leaders and their in-command subordinate units. The game is very easy to teach/learn.

This new edition of Roberto's Edgehill game features totally new graphics, highly revised rules with new variants and units, and new units that were missing in the older edition.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Nancy Drew Collector
description:
It's the premier auction of Nancy Drew novels! Book collectors of all kinds have gathered to bid on their favourite editions of classic Nancy Drew novels. As you mingle at the pre-auction cocktail party you try to figure out which titles they are here to collect.

The goal of the game is to discover the target books of your competitors - before they figure out the books you are after! Ask "Yes" or "No" questions of your fellow collectors to uncover the mystery of which book they want to outbid you on. Can you suss out the situation?

Players will enjoy seeing all the illustrated cards featuring most vintage Nancy Drew covers from 1930 - 1979.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Questions and Answers

name: Boop the Halls
description:
A deceptively cute, deceivingly challenging abstract strategy game for two players.

The Mensa award winning, Game of the Year, boop, is back with a new Holiday edition and has really leveled up game play (literally!!).

The hoomans are hanging ornaments on the highest boughs of the tree, but those clever cats are leaping up and boopin’ them right off. You can win “Naughty” by knocking off 3 of your opponent’s ornaments or “Nice” by lining up three cats in a row!

The 4-tiered game board ‘tree’ presents a surprisingly mind-bending 3D challenge for players. And the alternate win condition of knocking off 3 of your opponent's ornaments creates new strategic problems to solve, elevating the play experience to a new high!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Building, Slide/Push

name: The Dead Keep: Troll Rider
description:
The Troll Rider is a pre-order exclusive product. It contains the Troll Rider Monster to add into your games:


1 Miniature
6 Spawn Cards
1 Reference Card
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: The Dead Keep: Secret Alcove
description:
The Secret Alcove Box is a pre-order exclusive expansion. It contains additional Adventurers and Enemies to include in your game:


4 Adventurers & their ID cards: 2x Crushers (Brother Adrian and Paolo) and 2x Fighters (Anita and David)
28 Enemies and their Spawn cards: 25x Undead (Arquebus Dwarves, Zweihander Dwarves and Powderkeg Thug) and 3x Notables (Arquebus Lord, Zweihander Lord and Knight Lord)
Abilities sheet
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: The Dead Keep: Goblin Chaos
description:
An expansion for The Dead Keep introducing the unpredictable antics of Goblin Adventurers and Goblin Enemies. It also contains 10 all-new quests with special Objectives and Treasures:


7 Adventurers & their ID cards: 3x Crushers (Childebert, Sigebert and Thibert), 3x Fighters (Clodomir, Clotaire and Pascal) and 1x Magician (Bathilde)
21 Enemies and their Spawn cards: 20x Undead (Goblin Minions) and 1x Notables (Goblin Lord)
1 Rulebook
6 Abilities Cards
5 Enemy Cards
15 Treasure Cards
38 Red Objectives Cards
20 Colored Objective Crads
10 Quest Selection cards
10 Difficulty Selection Cards


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Towers of Ra!
description:
Towers of Ra! immerses you and up to eight players in a mythic struggle to regain control over the god of Chaos, Apophis and aid the fallen god of the Sun, Ra. As the gods of ancient Egypt, you wield unique abilities to shape gameplay and tactics in this cooperative experience. Your ultimate goal: building a magnificent tower to Ra, granting him the strength to ascend once more and thwart the collapse of creation.

Drawing on elements of dexterity, cooperation, and unwavering resolve, you’ll utilise statues, temples, and card components to build a structure capable of supporting all four of Ra’s temples. But beware: should a single component falter, Apophis claims victory, plunging the world into darkness.

Can you and your fellow deities aid Ra in time to preserve existence itself?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: A Most Frustrating Fight: The Battle of First Newbury, September 20, 1643
description:
A Most Frustrating Fight is the second game in Roberto Chiavini's series of games set during the English Civil War. The game is very easy to learn/teach and true to the history.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Coral Gardens
description:
In the depths of the ocean lies a world where coral gardens flourish. These underwater paradises, teeming with life and color, captivate anyone lucky enough to witness their beauty… but that beauty is in danger of fading forever. Reef Architects brave the depths of the oceans in order to protect and cultivate the growth of a once great coral ecosystem.

In Coral Gardens, players take turns drafting coral discs to populate different coral tiles. Then based on the undersea currents at the start of their turns, players place these tiles into the underwater garden. At the end of the game players receive points based on restoration goals nd private objectives that have helped to repopulate the reef. The player with the most points wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Grid Coverage, Layering, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Knucklebones: Cult of the Lamb Dice Game
description:
Knucklebones is a dice game of risk and reward, created originally within the videogame 'Cult of the Lamb'. It has since been adapted in limited-run official sets as well as fan-made boards to keep the dice-rolling fun going!

How to play:
The game consists of two 3x3 boards, each belonging to their respective player. On a player's turn, they roll a single 6-sided die, and must place it in a column on their board. A filled column does not accept any more dice.
Each player's score, which is the sum of all the dice values on their board. If a player places multiple dice of the same value in the same column, the score awarded for each of those dice is multiplied by the number of dice of the same value in that column.
When a player places a die, all dice of the same value in the corresponding column of the opponent's board gets destroyed. Players can use this to destroy their opponent's high-scoring combos.
The game ends when either player completely fills up their 3x3 board. The player with the higher score wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Here to Slay: The Rhythmic Archer Promo Card
description:
2024 convention-exclusive promo card.

Card Text: "At the beginning of your turn, you may switch the Rhythmic Archer between Bard and Ranger. Each time any player (including you) unsuccessfully rolls to ATTACK a Monster card, you may DRAW a card."
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Treasure Mansion
description:
A solo game in which the player will be envolved in the exploration of an old house in search of clues that will reveal where a precious treasure is hidden.
Only by collecting enough clues and useful objects it will be possible to successfully reach the goal.
However time is limited so the player has to find the treasure before the night is over.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: Imperial Borders
description:
With Napoleon's abdication in 1815, the major powers of Europe convene the Congress of Vienna in Austria.

Explore an alternate history with each player taking the reins of a great European nation of the period. It is now up to each of you to decide how the borders of Europe will be redrawn.

Establish a dominating presence of power and wealth through clever diplomacy and strategic warfare.

Features include:

Simultaneous & secret plotting of movement orders on a dry-erase planning map
Free-form diplomacy, negotiations, and backstabbing
Dice-based combat system with tactical stance choices
Battle with cannons, cavalry, and infantry columns on land
Battle with frigates and ships of the line in ports or at sea
Purchase new forces with gold taxes collected from territories
Earn prestige points by winning battles, earning elite forces, and controlling territories
Earn and then clip shiny medals to your lapel that indicate your sublime grandeur (and offer in-game bonuses)


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Alliances, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Force Commitment, Moving Multiple Units, Negotiation, Ordering, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Droched
description:
Introduction:Droched (from Irish: Droichead, meaning "bridge") is a board game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the hexes (cells) of an initially empty hexagonal board. The default board size is 9 points per side, but it can be played on a 11–sized board for longer games or on a 7–sized board for shorter games. There is also a location outside the board called the prison. Each player has access to a sufficient supply of stones of their own color.



Definitions:– A group is a set of stones of the same color connected to each other. A single stone is also a group.
– It is said that a group is on a bridge if any of its stones have paths through empty cells connecting it to at least two board edges, two corners, or one board edge and one corner. If none of the stones in a group have those paths, the group is on a broken bridge. The corners are not part of the edges.



Turns:Black plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, perform one of the following actions:

– Place a stone of your color on an empty cell. Then, in the following order, move to the prison (i) all enemy groups on broken bridges and (ii) all friendly groups on broken bridges.
– Remove an enemy stone from the prison.

At the end of your turn, the stone you placed must not be the only dead stone, and the board position must be different from the board positions at the end of all your previous turns.



End of game:The game ends when a player takes the last action, in which case they are declared the winner.

To make the game fair, before it begins, the first player places several black stones in the prison and then the second player chooses a side. This method of balance is called the komi pie. For handicap games, the weaker player takes black and starts by placing on the board a number of black stones proportional to the difference in skills between the players.



Notes:The prison mechanism was introduced by David Wolfe and Elwyn Berlekamp in their book Mathematical Go: Chilling Gets the Last Point.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Enclosure, Hexagon Grid

name: Rolling Spells
description:
You become a wizard who writes a magic book.

Roll the dice and record the remaining numbers in the magic book according to the pattern shown.

Once the magic spell is complete, activate the magic and attack your opponent or gain points.

The wizard with the most points wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil

name: Scribble Diggers
description:
Use polyomino shapes to dig! Discover ruins sleeping deep underground!

Discover relics, sell them to the museum, and earn points!

The digger with the most points wins!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Щур де Франс (Rat de France)
description: Щур де Франс ("Rat de France") is a racing game in which 2 to 4 representatives of the rat kingdom will try to outsmart and outwit all their opponents! Rat racers are very smart strategists, so they plan all their actions in advance. A quick dash along the line, a small step to the side, a quick jump over an opponent or generally a cunning exchange of places with another rider - all this needs to be neatly and quickly put on the shelves in your head in order to become a winner!
mechanics: Grid Movement, Race, Take That

name: Crew: Fix For Survive
description:
While three research ships proceed to complete their mission, for an unknown reason, two of the ships explode and one is seriously damaged. The heavily damaged ship managed to remain in one piece. When the crew on the ship comes to their senses after the explosion, they realize that their only chance is to repair the ship as soon as possible. They must do their best to survive and complete their mission.

Crew / Fix For Survive is a survival game for 4-5 players. The aim of the game is to repair the rooms on the damaged spaceship by collecting the necessary resources to repair the rooms. With luck and strategic moves, the crew must take precautions against the disasters that await them and repair all rooms within the time given to them.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Events, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Tiny Epic Game of Thrones: Ice & Fire
description:
Embark on an exciting cooperative gaming experience with the Tiny Epic Game of Thrones: Ice & Fire expansion. In this unique twist on the original game, players must work together to unite the Seven Kingdoms against the menacing threat of the Night King and his army of White Walkers. While the core mechanics remain mostly the same, players must now strategize and collaborate to outsmart and outmaneuver this formidable foe.

As fear spreads among the non-player houses due to the Night King's relentless advance southward, building alliances becomes crucial. The fate of Westeros hangs in the balance, and without the support of these houses, all hope may be lost.

The expansion introduces two new playable houses: House Targaryen and The Night's Watch. Players can embody iconic heroes such as Daenerys Targaryen with her three dragons, and Jon Snow.

The map of Westeros is expanded to include new regions beyond the Wall. As long as the Wall stands, the White Walkers are contained. However, once the Wall falls, they will be unleashed upon Westeros, wreaking havoc as they march southward.

Each round begins with players receiving a report from the Rangers of the Night's Watch. These reports, represented by a deck of cards, reveal where the Night King and his army will strike next. This mechanic, along with the Night King's Ice Dragon, adds an element of suspense and strategy to the game, driving the movements of the Night King.

The expansion also introduces a new element of exploration to the game. Throughout the domains on both sides of the Wall, players will encounter various exploration tokens with unique effects. It is essential for players to collaborate in searching these domains for Dragonglass and Valyrian Steel. The discovery of an ample supply of these resources is crucial for success, as the power of the Night King diminishes with each Dragonglass recovered, and the strength of the White Walkers decreases with each Valyrian Steel token found. Without these resources, players will have no hope of defeating the Night King.

The challenge of defeating the Night King requires seamless coordination among all participants. The ultimate outcome of their collective efforts will be clear-cut: either successfully eliminate the Night King within six rounds of gameplay, or face the catastrophic loss of Westeros.
categories: Bluffing, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Action/Event, Alliances, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Events, Follow, Hand Management, Income, Multi-Use Cards, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Le Banquet pour Louis
description:
Le Banquet pour Louis is a simple, fast and highly competitive game in which the players are chefs who try to satisfy every request of King Louis XV. before the big banquet.

In a series of separate rounds, the dishes you cook will be worth a different number of points, and it's up to you to maximize them towards victory. However, you must regularly watch out for other chefs at the table, because each dish activates special, sometimes insidious, mini-actions. This way you can run out of cooked dishes or someone can steal a dish that is just being prepared, but there are also ways of 'defense', for example if you cook a fish dish that gives you a short immunity to the wickedness of other teammates.

In the game, everyone is sweating about the random arrival of the king on a tour of the kitchens. As soon as he knocks on the door (jumps out of the deck of cards with dishes), the game stops, and the king goes from one table to another and tastes the finest dish - i.e. the dish that is worth the most points that particular round. The only way to save your most valuable dish is to distract the king with the king's cat, a card that rarely appears in the deck, and which is equally valued by chefs and the king.

Le Banquet pour Louis is primarily intended for families, has simple rules and is very intuitive. Replayability is guaranteed with a number of different cards with scoring dishes, and the always random appearance of Louis on a tour.
mechanics: Set Collection

name: Gaia Cards
description:
Step into a realm where real animals and nature come to life in the form of trading cards. Let your imagination roam free in this unique game that celebrates the wonders of nature. Embrace the challenge, savor the victories, and connect with the essence of the wilderness. Gaia Cards TCG invites you to embark on an adventure like no other!

Build your decks with your favorite animals and battle against friends by building ecosystems! Change the game with Event & Condition Cards, making the game everchanging and challenging. Each Animal card has educational information and a fun fact- they are truly fun to collect and trade with!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Events, Resource to Move

name: Scoville: 2nd Edition
description:
New addition to the classics line from Trick or Treat Studios. An updated printing of a modern classic! 1 to 6 players will plant peppers, harvest them, cross-breed them, sell them, and make delicious chili to score points!

This edition includes colorblind-friendly plastic peppers, new art, and a new solo mode!

—description from the publisher

NOTE: This edition also includes The Labs Expansion.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Grid Movement, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Turn Order: Auction

name: Roast
description:
A card game in which your objective is to roast the perfect mallow by placing it on the campfire. Watch your gooey points stack up as the longer your mallow is on the fire the more points it's worth. Beware however this makes your mallow vulnerable to attack from the other players and you must be clever when you take off your mallow to keep it from getting too crispy !

Players have the chance to destroy your fluff pillows and you must be carful of unsavory characters. You will have a chance to defend yourself with the mighty mallow knight but fate can be a cruel mistress so be warned. There are plenty of special cards including some naughty bears that come to steal your food, a very sexy ladies man mallow who steals your precious chocolates and several other misfit mallows.

The player with the most gooey tokens at the end of the game will be declared the winner.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Card Game, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: New York Noir Mysteries: High & Low
description:
High & Low is a film-noir, narrative mystery detective/deduction game, set in New York City, and spanning several decades from the 1930s through the 1950s.
A cooperative/solo game in the spirit of Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective, and consists of multiple chapters (cases) that form an ongoing campaign.
Investigate crimes, identify evidence, and bring justice to the victims. Along the way you’ll need to make tough moral choices that affect how the story unfolds.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: SocialDevastation
description:
#SocialDevastation the game where words have power and the internet is your canvas! In #SocialDevastation, players unleash their creativity by filling in the blanks on social cards, then posting them online to see what unfolds. With hilarious social prompts and potentially devastating results, #SocialDevastation turns social media into a daring adventure.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Unspecified

name: 宋韵西湖 (The West Lake)
description:
You and your companion have finally arrived at this place, a picturesque spot praised by poets and scholars—the West Lake. Now, you need to admire the breathtaking scenery of the West Lake, collect photos of the legendary "Ten Scenes of West Lake," and inquire about the colorful stories that have taken place here, experiencing the charm of the Song Dynasty. So that on the return journey, you can share the interesting anecdotes you've gathered with your companion and become an expert on all things related to the West Lake.

你与小伙伴终于到达了这个地方，这个文人墨客赋诗赞美，湖光山色争奇斗艳的地方——西湖。现在你需要一边欣赏西湖的绝美景色，收集传说中“西湖十景”的照片，一边打听这里发生的各色故事，体验宋朝韵味。好在返程的时候跟你的小伙伴分享你收集到的有趣见闻，成为西湖万事通。
mechanics: Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Mighty Meerkats Memory Roulette
description:
Meerkats, memories and roulette all in one card game. Cute and exciting, even solo! Take on the Mighty Meerkats Challenge, experience the chaos and win!

Channel your inner meerkat and dig your way through the sandy plain. But beware, as you dig in the desert, you’ll encounter many surprises. Collect more families than your opponents before all the cards are gone.

Welcome to the desert of Mirkatopolis, somewhere in the world of Fried Potatoes. Here, amidst the glowing sands and clumsy cacti, live the super-hero meerkats, known as the Mighty Meerkats. These heroes, though small in stature, embark on grand adventures! Due to various funny circumstances (a lost desert worm and a flying sandal), their families are now buried beneath the sand. Use your super digging skills to find them and bring them back together. Collect more families than your opponents or take on the Mighty Meerkats Challenge and rescue the families before it’s too late!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Matching, Memory, Push Your Luck

name: Not One Step Back!
description:
Expansion (scenario pack) for Advanced Squad Leader

The pack contains 8 brand new scenarios, using DTF special rules:

DTF-9 Mao's Iron Army - Japanese vs Chinese Communist
DTF-10 Five To One - Finnish vs Russian
DTF-11 A Greek Tragedy - Greek vs Italian
DTF-12 Not One Step Back! - Russian vs German
DTF-13 The Living Dead - Russian vs German
DTF-14 Pillbox Pains - Japanese vs American
DTF-15 Storming Lommel - British vs German
DTF-16 Panther Cull - Allied vs German
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Crimen en Casa: Covajon Case
description:
In this case of Crimen en Casa, a police officer named Laura was found dead in her room of the shared apartment where she lived.

To discover what happened to her, you will have to become a true detective. Access the police database to investigate criminals, analyze fingerprints, and obtain information on vehicles and flights.

Additionally, you will need to investigate Laura's notebook among other personal objects.
mechanics: Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Deduction, Events

name: DC Heroes United
description:
The greatest heroes in the DC universe unite to thwart the villains' plans in DC Super Heroes United, a fast-paced, family-friendly co-operative game.

—description from the publisher

Build your team of legendary Heroes to thwart the master plan of the most powerful Villains in the universe. Simple rules, deep strategy, easy setup, quick playtime, variable difficulty, eye-catching artwork, and amazing miniatures. All united to bring you the most fun DC play experience!
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Spin Master Ltd.

name: Villain's Veil
description:
Villain's Veil is a thrilling card game that can be played entirely in your hands. Inspired by the popular Yu-Gi-Oh TCG, this game fulfills the dream of being able to play Yu-Gi-Oh TCG solo, without the need for a playmat.

The rules of "Villain's Veil" are simplified, ensuring a dynamic and fast-paced gameplay experience. Players take turns drawing cards from their decks, strategizing their next move, and unleashing devastating spells and abilities upon their opponents. The goal is to outwit and outmaneuver your adversary, while carefully managing your resources and anticipating their moves.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Adventure, Card Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Drafting, Alliances, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Torgau 1760
description:
The SYW Battle Series (SYWBS) games are playable grand-tactical portrayals of battles of the Seven Years War. The series’ intent is to show how command operates on the battlefields, using the weapons and tactics of the period. The system emphasizes command & control and playability.
The games all share the following characteristics:

Scale = 200-220 m/hex (219-240 yrd/hex)
Time = 30 min/Turn
Counter = 1 Brigade, 1 Battalion, 1 to 3 Squadrons, 1 Battery, 1 Leader


Each unit's historical flag and uniform are displayed on Counters, Orders/organizational Displays, and Orders of battle (in Playbooks).

Torgau 1760 simulates the battle fought on the 3rd of November 1760 in northwestern Saxony during the Seven Years War. King Frederick II the Great commanded the Prussian Army: 48,500 men (62 bns, 102 sqns) and 246 guns in total. F.M. Leopold Daun commanded the Austrian Army: 55,500 men (67 bns, 116 sqns) and 275 guns in total.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Hollywood 1947: Costumes
description: This expansion pack adds a new character into the game (The Costume Designer!) along with her sketchbook of 9 unique costumes.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Deduction

name: Road From Disunion: The American Civil War
description:
Die Rolling game of conquest simulating the American Civil War in a casual yet historically based manner. In this game, two players take the sides of the Union and the Rebels, vying for control over the Thirteen Colonies. The map contains 42 locations some of which count toward victory conditions. Dice are rolled to conquer each location and its defenses. Event cards vary play. This is a follow up game to Road to Independence and uses similar game mechanics.

—description from the designer
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Re-rolling and Locking

name: Rondol
description:
A small-scale abstract strategy game inspired by Mancala. Rondol provides simple concept with surprising depth. Play is simple: pick up stacks of chips that you control and play them out either clockwise or counter-clockwise, placing each chip on a space. You can only pick up stacks that have your color on top. The goal? Control 4 stacks of chips in a row, or block out your opponent by controlling all available stacks of chips. Outwit your opponent to seize victory! Then play again.

Taking up a small amount of table space and easily carried, Rondol is great to take along and play most anywhere.

Create 6 stacks of alternating colored chips.
Place them in a circle.
On your turn, select 1 stack that has your color chip on top.
Drop all chips, 1 at a time in each space, going around until all chips have been dropped.
Objective: control 4 stacks in a row OR control all stacks on the table.

Use alternate rules and setups to increase depth of strategy.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Mancala

name: Gemblems
description:
Do you like shiny things and puzzles? Gemblems is a solo puzzle game that fits in the palm of your hand! Draw a few cards, then twist, flip, and move the cards to line up all of the Gemblems, BUT, be sure to follow the rules!

Complete a set of cards by following every rule listed on each card drawn. Fan the cards the other way or even rotate them to obtain access to different Gemblems. Flipping the card over to the other side will reveal new Gemblems, but will also a new rule to follow! Either discard the completed puzzle or draw a new card to complete a new high score streak!

Gemblems was created with the thought of reducing time spent mindlessly scrolling on your phone. Perfect for waiting in doctor's offices, car rides, and breaks at work. Gemblems fits in your pocket and plays directly in your hands for a great portable game!

Shuffle the deck and draw a few cards. We recommend 5 for a standard puzzle.
Fan the cards in your have so either the top right or left corner of all cards is visible.
Reorder, rotate, or flip cards until the Gemblems in the card corners meet all the rules listed on the cards.
Once the puzzle is completed; discard your hand and draw a new set of cards OR draw a new card and try to add it to your puzzle.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: The Cure
description:
You are scientists tasked with creating THE CURE. The cure to what? Not important! Work together with your fellow scientists; however, rumor has it that a rival company has attempted to bribe someone to sabotage your efforts... Of course, it is just a rumor, right?

The Cure is a small hidden role game where you are working together to reach your goal. Players are dealt a hidden role and 12 numbered cards with the rest set to the side. Then, players will take turns adding 1 card face down to a center pile while declaring aloud the supposed total of the cards. If suspicion gets too high, a vote may be taken to use a microscope to check the last played card, but only the active player may look. Once players believe they are close to the goal, they may vote to stop. If the goal is reached, the good players win! If not, the bad player wins. There may be games with no bad player, so if the goal is not reached, all of the players lose!

Carefully selected truths and lies are the main strategy of this game, whether good or bad, a well made lie can guarantee victory. Just be careful not to be caught.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Roles, Hidden Victory Points, Traitor Game

name: Fairy Day
description:
Fairy Day is a card-based placement game in which 2-6 players take on the role of a fairy and tend a magical garden. Over the course of the game, the garden grows and flourishes and the player with the most points wins at the end. The game is a good mix of tactics and luck.

Fairy Day ist ein kartenbasiertes Lege-Spiel bei dem 2-6 Spieler in die Rolle einer Fee schlüpfen und einen magischen Garten pflegen. Im Verlaufe des Spiels wächst und gedeiht dieser und es gewinnt am Ende er Spieler, der die meisten Punkte sammeln konnte. Dabei findet das Spiel eine gute Mischung aus Taktik & Glück.
mechanics: Drawing, Income, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: The Man From Sector Six
description:
Embark on a thrilling spy adventure with The Man From Sector Six, The Mystery Agency's latest home escape room by Olivier-winning writer Henry Lewis.
