This fourth instalment in the acclaimed series opens with players discovering a newspaper cutting and a locked, official-looking document portfolio left by a mysterious disappearing agent. A dire warning about a monumental peril facing humanity sets the stage for an urgent and immersive challenge.

Navigate through multiple brainteasers and locks, uncover a hidden website, and hack into the agency's secrets. Real-world objects, including a brass rotating cipher wheel and a complex data chip, serve as authentic clues, ensuring an engaging home escape room experience.

Designed for 1-6 players aged 12 and above, this escape room encourages teamwork or solo adventures. With nothing damaged during play, the fully reusable experience can be shared after for others to try - reset instructions provided.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: U-BOOT FIGHTER
description:
Clash between a cunning submarine commander and a ruthless hunter in a thrilling duel in the Atlantic Ocean during World War II. The hunter searches for and destroys the submarine with underwater charges, while the submarine commander hides and evades.

This exciting strategy game is 'print and play', meaning you can easily download and print it at home. To play, laminate the game and use a whiteboard marker to mark the movement of the submarine, draw the ship's loads, mark turns and depleted resources, such as sonar, hydrophone and loads.

Will you be the hunter who triumphs or the hunted who escapes in this exciting strategy game?

—description from the publisher
categories: Fighting, Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Deduction, Grid Movement, Hidden Movement, Line Drawing, Memory, Pattern Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: Black Sonata: Strange Shadows
description:
Black Sonata: Strange Shadows includes several expansions that may be added to the base game. These should work separately or in various combinations, including with the earlier Fair Youth expansions. The new content includes:

The Darkest Ladies - Unlike those in the base game or Fair Youth expansion, this alternative set of Dark Lady cards has no suits, and you must deduce the Dark Lady’s symbols in their correct order. Features more card-flipping hole-peeking antics.

Indirections - This expansion adds two different types of stealth cards to be mixed into your deck. Cards with compass symbols show what compass direction the Dark Lady traveled from her last location, while others show the potential colour of her current location.

Blazonry - The Dark Lady is hiding behind the shield of her heraldic blazon. To access her you must first deduce the symbols of her blazon using special fog cards.

The Ferryman - The ferry is the quickest way to get around London, allowing you to travel from any riverside location (marked with the boat icon) to any other riverside location in one turn, possibly heading off the Dark Lady as she flees. But this comes at a cost – the ferryman protects the Dark Lady, preventing you from searching for her at any riverside location. In addition, you must collect the location cards in a specific order.

Cat and Mouse - This is an asymmetric two-player game of cat and mouse, where one player is the Dark Lady and the other is the Historian trying to track and unmask her.

Tarry cards - This small expansion allows you to temporarily pause the Dark Lady’s flight, potentially letting you catch up to her, but you must pay a later cost...

Extra fog cards - Four additional fog cards are provided, each with a beneficial effect. You may use these to: (a) Increase the size of the fog deck to allow more searches in a game – especially if including the harder Dark Ladies from either expansion, as these may require more clues to solve; (b) Replace detrimental fog cards in the base deck to make it more appealing (but still risky) to use fog cards that arise; or (c) Randomly replace fog cards from the base deck to increase the variety of fog card actions.

—description from the publisher
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Renaissance
mechanics: Hidden Movement, Point to Point Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Shards of Alchemy
description:
Gather loose elements and build an engine of element producing resources to attain the highest score and win the game on round 21 using the magnetic turn counter built into the lid. The game is played with diamond-shaped cards in a single 84-card deck, held in a fold-open box insert that includes the six draw/discard areas.

This is a compact game for travel and table space, loaded with five play modes. It can play solo or up to five players with built in accelerators for higher player counts to speed the game along. In most game modes you are changing the purchase and draw options when you make your own purchases, laying new cards on top of the ones accessible to players atop the six draw-discard piles.

Varied and largely unique costs for permanent resources challenge players to find buy-path patterns and make strategic choices on wether to reserve cards as part of a draw or hope to buy them before someone else snatches it up. There are many paths to victory, and winning strategies may change as the purchase options alter. The cards have vital information clearly showing along with colorful imagery and art. Each of the seven element colors also has a unique symbol to aid color-blind players.

There are five play modes, from a very fast and easy intro-mode called "Initiate", to "Novice" (harder but much more strategically involved game, to the standard modes of "Apprentice", "Journeyman" (adds some rules to boost scores) and "Alchemist" (adds a few more rules to boost scoring even more). So that the game can be learned quickly and progressively. Play time ranges from 10 minutes to an hour depending on mode and player count.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Economic, Medieval, Puzzle
mechanics: I Cut, You Choose, Multi-Use Cards, Open Drafting, Ownership, Pattern Recognition

name: S'mores Galore
description:
Gather 'round the campfire everyone. Time to make some tasty, gooey treats. Grab a stick, toast those marshmallows just right, and smoosh them between some graham crackers with some melty chocolate. But you'd better make 'em right, or you might just end up with a hot mess!

In S’mores Galore players compete to score the most point. You score points by making S'mores. To make S'mores, you'll first have to grab graham cracker, chocolate, and marshmallow cards from a grid on the table. You'll have to stack them to your line-up in the order you pick them up to create the perfect S’mores. With some clever hand management, you can score a lot of S'mores and win the game.

—description form the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pattern Building

name: A Dutiful Fight: The Battle of Chateauguay, October 26, 1813
description:
“…that now they had fulfilled their duty to their God, they would fulfil that to their King.”—Remark by British Captain Longtin, Commander of the Beauharnais Militia, after leading his men in prayer before the Battle of Chateauguay.

The US capture of Canada was assumed in Washington, DC “to be a mere matter of marching”. However, the fight for the British colony was severe and prolonged. The US mounted a double-pronged offensive from New York to take Canadian capital city of Montreal in the fall of 1813 planned by US Secretary of War, John Armstrong, Jr. However, the two US forces were commanded by Generals James Wilkenson, who had a particularly dubious and corrupt history, and Major General Wade Hampton, who loathed and despised Wilkenson. With little to no cooperation between the US forces, their British and Canadian opponents were able to deal with each US force separately.

With most of the British regular forces devoted to dealing with Wilkenson, it was left to Canadian militia and First Nation warriors, under the command of Lieutenant Colonel Charles de Salabarry, to stop Hampton. The combined Canadian and First Nation force skirmished repeatedly with the Americans as soon as they crossed the St. Lawrence River, frustrating Hampton’s hopes that he could beat his rival to Montreal. The weather and sparsely settled region meant that the few trails were muddy quagmires that frequently mired the American supply wagons and artillery caissons, slowing the American’s advance even more. Along the Chateauguay River Hampton learned that the enemy had built a substantial defensive position along the main route to Montreal, and he divided his force in two. One would pin the Canadians and First Nation warriors in place, while the other crossed the river to flank the enemy and capture fords that were to the rear of their defensive works. If successful, the enemy would be trapped and the way to Montreal open to the Americans. However, dividing one’s force in the face of an undefeated and determined enemy is a very dangerous gambit in warfare.

Can you do as well, or better, than your historical counterparts?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: The Rats
description:
Mode 1: «The Couplets»

You and your brothers-in-law have bought some semi-detached houses, but upon entering, you realize they are filled with rats. It’s time to roll up your sleeves and clean the houses to be able to boast of being the best rat exterminators!

Objective of the game: Get rid of all the rats in your house as quickly as possible and compete with your brothers-in-law to see who is the most efficient in the task of rat extermination.

Mode 2: «The House» (Solo Game)

You have bought a beautiful countryside house, but when you enter, you discover with horror that it’s full of rats. You don’t want your brother-in-law to find out about this problem, so you must get rid of as many rats as possible before his visit.

Objective of the game: Eliminate the maximum number of rats within a limited time and prevent your brother-in-law from discovering the infestation.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Slide/Push, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: HitPoint
description:
HitPoint is a multi-purpose card game for players to create characters, build decks, and battle in a standalone trading card format or adventure in a tabletop RPG campaign.

Your deck represents your health, which is also your main resource to play cards. The more powerful the card, the more it will exhaust your character. You win when all opponents’ HP is reduced to 0 or they run out of playable cards, and you have cards remaining in your deck or your hand.

This keeps the game fast and simple, while giving a satisfying visual effect to your character’s exhaustion.

HitPoint features meaningful strategy in combination with random dice rolling. This allows each player to make choices that affect how the game progresses but the dice rolls can influence the potency of cards played. Even the rarest cards can underperform and the common cards can overperform.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Fantasy, Medieval
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Critical Hits and Failures, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Multi-Use Cards, Role Playing

name: El Templo De Cristal
description:
An adventure game: The search for the Crystal Spider!
A Secret Government Organization has managed to bring together the most intrepid adventurers and archaeologists for the most risky mission: the theft of the CRYSTAL SPIDER, the most valuable "stone" of all time, a spider-shaped meteorite fragment that is kept in its interior the Secrets of the Universe.
Those who dare to undertake this adventure will have to infiltrate a lost jungle, full of dangers, beasts, poisonous spiders, traps, fearsome cannibals... and gather the four fragments of the MAGIC AMULET, the key to open the crypt of the TEMPLE OF CRYSTAL, sanctuary where the strange jewel is hidden, guarded by the magic of the Sorcerer, a being abducted by the power of the meteorite.
Once in the crypt, the adventurer must reach into the SPIDER'S NEST and take out the CRYSTAL SPIDER. But beware! You can be bitten by the poisonous spiders that guard the nest.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Un juego de aventuras: ¡La búsqueda de la Araña De Cristal!
Una Organización Gubernamental Secreta ha conseguido reunir a los más intrépidos aventureros y arqueólogos para la misión más arriesgada: el robo de la ARAÑA DE CRISTAL, la más valiosa "piedra" de todos los tiempos, un fragmento de meteorito con forma de araña que guarda en su interior los Secretos del Universo.
Los que se atrevan a emprender esta aventura tendrán que infiltrarse en una jungla perdida, llena de peligros, fieras, arañas venenosas, trampas, temibles caníbales... y reunir los cuatro fragmentos del AMULETO MÁGICO, la llave para abrir la cripta del TEMPLO DE CRISTAL, santuario donde se encuentra escondida la extraña joya custodiada por la magia del Hechicero, un ser abducido por el poder del meteorito.
Una vez en la cripta, el aventurero deberá introducir la mano en el NIDO DE LA ARAÑA y sacar la ARAÑA DE CRISTAL. Pero ¡cuidado! Puedes ser picado por las arañas venenosas que vigilan el nido.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck

name: Bounty Board
description:
In Bounty Board you are tasked with capturing more high valued monsters than your fellow hunters. To achieve this goal you will have to use the correct Tool and Location that correlate with the monster. Action cards can be beneficial to you or detrimental to another hunter.

Each hunter has three phases per turn.


Draw Phase- Draw One Action Card.
Action Phase- Play as many Action Cards as needed.
Hunt Phase- Change your Tool or Location and then Hunt!


155 Cards make up this game featuring, Monsters, Tools, Locations and special Action Cards. Use these to ensure that you claim the Bounty Board.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Events, Hand Management, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Lose a Turn, Multi-Use Cards, Take That

name: Blood and Oil: The 1985 Persian Gulf Tanker War
description:
“If they help Saddam Hussein attack our economic resources they will not see oil.” –Ayatollah Khomeini, Supreme Leader of the Islamic Republic of Iran.

January 1985 marked over four years of bloody war between Iraq and Iran. The previous year Saddam Hussein, leader of Iraq, initiated a new campaign in the war with Iran by having his air force target the Iranian Kharg Island oil installations and any shipping caught loading there. Saddam realized that if Iran’s ability to sell oil was successfully brought under attack, that nation’s ability to wage war would be severely impacted. In response, Iran constructed a floating terminal at Sirri Island that was beyond the range of Iraqi warplanes. Iranian tankers ferried oil from Kharg Island to Sirri where the Iranian oil could then be safely off-loaded. What ensued was an escalating war in the Persian Gulf in which Iraqi warplanes targeted any vessel suspected of heading for any of Iran’s ports, and similar efforts by Iran’s warplanes, ships and Pasdaran militia attack boats targeting ships they believed were heading for Iraq and ports in Arab nations sympathetic to their enemy. 1985 promised to be a year in which the violence of the growing “Tanker War” could spread throughout the region and threaten the economies of nations all over the globe.

In Blood and Oil players take on the roles of the leaders of the Iran and Iraq military forces fighting the 1985 Tanker War in a moderate complexity level wargame. Can you do as well or better than your historical counterpart?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Don't Wake Whimsie!
description:
Whimsy the chimera is sleeping and if you wake him up, he might be annoyed and bite ! Use items to try and wake up Whimsy safely and get him to bite your opponent until he loses all of his Health Points. Roll several dices to set up the initial state of the game, prepare accordingly and start guessing. Very simple game you can explain and play within five minutes.

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction, Dice, Fantasy
mechanics: Action Drafting, Deduction, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Open Drafting, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Single Loser Game, Take That, Variable Set-up

name: Furmation of Rome
description:
Step into the role of a Roman noble and engage in a strategic tug of war for influence! Gather your wits, plan your moves, and exert your influence as you vie for the loyalty of the citizens of Rome. Will you emerge as the victor in this thrilling contest for influence in the grand city of Rome?

Furmation of Rome is a quick to play area majority game where players either play cards into their own area to contest for influence tokens or use card effects to disrupt the board.

There are over 20 unique card effects, and new mechanics are introduced into the game for different player counts.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Admiral of the Fleet: Naval Annual 1907-1921
description:
This volume of the AOTF NAVAL ANNUAL Series provides over 500 pre-formatted, printable ship logs. It covers the many ship classes of the 1907-1921 period for the navies of Argentina, Austria-Hungary, Brazil, Chile, China, Denmark, France, Germany, Great Britain, Greece, Italy, Japan, Netherlands, Norway, Peru, Portugal, Russia, Spain, Sweden, Turkey, and the United States. The ship logs are divided into sections by country, each preceeded by summary sheets listing basic information for each of the ship classes included for that country.

The AOTF Naval Annual Series is an obvious play on Brassey’s & Jane’s but with actual ship logs for playing AOTF. There will be three volumes in the series: 1885-1906, 1907-1921, and 1922-1944. Covers will be color-coded similar to Conway’s (blue, green and red respectively) and each volume will be comprised of ship logs for each country (alphabetic by country, then ship type, then completion date) preceded by summary pages for each country. A single ship log for each class (using the data of a representative ship of the class for the time period) is provided and for ship classes spanning volumes (i.e. all the WW1-era battleships and cruisers like HOOD, CAVOUR, PENNSYLVANIA, etc.), updated versions will appear in the subsequent volume.

The first two volumes are limited to battleships, battlecruisers, armored cruisers and light cruisers but the third volume will also contain individual ship logs for classes of destroyers.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game – Weapon X
description:
The 40th expansion in the Legendary line! 4 new heroes, including Weapon X before he was Wolverine of the X-Men! 3 new Masterminds and 2 Villain groups! 100 new cards featuring original art, detailing each hero, villain and attack!

"They are nothing but weapons... In this newest 100-card expansion, Legendary Weapon X will include heroes and villains created by the Weapon Plus program. New keywords and interactions including the all-new Enraging Wounds card type which will increase the intensity of battles. Explore Weapon X’s origins as he becomes the Wolverine and clashes with his most iconic rivals! It's time for you to assemble the best team to face off and overwhelm those deadliest living weapons!"
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Electric Card
description:
Electric Card is a card game that challenges your logical thinking and problem-solving skills by creating electrical circuits. With minimalist cards representing electrical components such as batteries, switches, and bulbs, you must strategically combine them to complete circuits. The game promotes practical learning of electricity fundamentals and fosters critical thinking through real-time challenge solving.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Educational, Electronic, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Connections, Hand Management, Take That

name: Interstellar Glory
description:
Interstellar Glory is focused on space exploration and combat, where players aim to increase the size of their alliances while defending against hostile races. The rules are structured with a detailed breakdown of various aspects, including set-up, turn sequence, phase actions, victory points, optional rules, advanced rules, card types, and designer's notes. Up to 6 players can play, each with a unique race with a unique benefit. Exploration is key, finding new planets increases your income which allows you to buy ships, and buy weapons for those ships. Ships help you explore and look for new planets, weapons help you protect those planets and the ships looking for them. The rules are organized into different sections, such as Core Rules, Optional Rules, and Advanced Rules, making it easy for players to find specific information. Additionally, the rules provide detailed explanations and examples, ensuring that players have a clear understanding of how to play the game. Overall, the rules are well-structured and provide a solid foundation for gameplay.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Economic, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Income, Multi-Use Cards

name: Breaking News
description:
In Breaking News, each player is a journalist trying to find the most interesting news that happens in the South Tyrolean region to report on the Salto portal. The players will play cards to explore elements of the region, and when they match the symbols of a goal card in sequence, an interesting fact will be found. To score the points, you must report breaking news involving all the elements in the respective cards. The player who could report the more interesting news is the winner!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Travel
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Storytelling

name: Pisanki
description:
Pisanki is the traditional art of painting Easter eggs, celebrated by Slavic peoples, mainly in Poland and Ukraine.

In this game, you’ll prepare the best presentation of Pisanki eggs to delight people all over the world.

Each round, players will reveal and acquire new cards showing the decorated eggs, flowers and tablecloths, to form their presentation table.

According to the order in which the cards are acquired, the player will also be able to earn movement points to sort the cards acquired on his table, which will be scored at the end of the game according to their position in relation to the other cards and according to the scoring cards set at the start of the game.

The player with the most points will be considered the winner.
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Movement Points, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: City of Blood: The Battle of Khorramshahr, September-October, 1980
description:
“Iran has bared its hostile designs against the Arab nation and its pan-Arab revolutionary movement” –Saddam Hussein, April 1980.

When the conflict between Iraq and Iran erupted into full scale war with Iraq’s invasion in late September 1980, the control of the Shatt al-Arab was a major goal for Saddam Hussein’s forces. Key to an Iraqi victory was capturing the crucial Iranian port and oil refinery center at Abadan just a few miles east of the city of Khorramshahr. Due to the earlier clashes along the border, that included artillery and air strikes as well as commando raids, much of the Khorramshahr’s populace fled earlier, and those that remained were being hastily evacuated by the Iranian government once full-scale war broke out. The Iraqis believed they would find the city abandoned or only lightly defended, and gave orders for their forces deployed further north to strike deep into Iran to secure their objectives and win a quick victory. However, the Ayatollah declared that the forces of the “godless Baathists” were to be resisted everywhere, and so units of the Iranian Army, including elements of the newly formed Pasdaran and Basiji militia, were rushed to defend Khorramshahr. What ensued was one of the most protracted and bloody city fights since the end of the Second World War.

Can you do as well or better than your historical counterparts?

Combat units are mostly battalions or their equivalent sized battle groups. Each day turn of the game represents 4 days of time with each turn’s Operations Phase representing two days. Each hex is approximately 100 meters across.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Amberlight
description:
In Amberlight, take the role of a brave hearted Apprentice in the world of Nous; gathering a retinue of friends and followers as you seek adventure in procedurally generated hexcrawls in 3 dimensions!

With a focus on hexcrawl exploration, roguelike adventures are supported by light deckbuilding and crafting/resource management with over 400 illustrated cards that allow for significant replayability and different means of approaching each scenario.

Modular hexcrawl rules allow for solo, cooperative, competitive and casual play across individual scenarios and fully fledged campaigns.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hexagon Grid

name: Viplex: Logical Board Game
description:
In the contemporary world, mental development and problem-solving abilities are increasingly recognized as crucial skills. Consequently, a newly introduced game named "Viplex" serves to facilitate players in enhancing their cognitive development in an engaging manner. The primary objective of the "Viplex" game is to utilize the available numerical resources to both endeavor to obtain the highest possible numerical value on one's own board and thwart the opponent's pursuit of the same objective.

Gameplay:

The game consists of 2 6x6 boards, 28 green, 28 white and 18 yellow pieces with the numbers 1 to 9 and 2 X's. The game is divided into two parts, green and white pieces. Each player has 3 pieces corresponding to their color and 1 yellow piece of each number. White and green pieces can only be played on your own board, while yellow pieces can be played on both the opponent's and your own board. In the two-player game of Viplex, the objective is to achieve the highest possible number by using the numbers in hand, horizontally, vertically, and diagonally from left to right and top to bottom. "X" tiles are considered wildcards in the game and are the most important tiles. "X" tiles are placed on the opponent's board and have the ability to cancel all movements vertically, horizontally, and diagonally from top to bottom and left to right where they are placed, and each player has only one of them. Our game can also be played with a sack. In this case, numbers are randomly selected from the sack. Thus, the bags add a factor of chance to the game and test the players' strategic thinking skills.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Push Your Luck

name: Territorial
description:
Fight off all usurping chipmunks and be the last chipmunk standing and win your new territory.

Chipmunks are extremely territorial - aggressively so.

These loners fight any invading usurper and chase them from their surrounding land. Each chipmunk has their own territory mapped out where they live, eat, patrol, and fiercely defend on a daily basis.

Your chipmunk has discovered a new territory, perfect for a homestead of its own - but what’s this? Other chipmunks are eyeing this territory too!

Now’s your chance!

The game is afoot. Not a word, grab your acorns and come.

Get in the game! It’s time to intimidate your opponents, send them fleeing in fear, and show the rest of these chipmunks what it means to be ... Territorial.

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: TIVOLI
description:
In the heart of Copenhagen, you will find Tivoli. The beautiful amusement park is one of the oldest in the world. Inside the magical gardens, trees, flowers, and hundreds of thousands of colored lights welcome you to a world of wonder, exciting rides, balloons, and delicious treats.

Tivoli is a family-friendly board game with enough depth to keep adults engaged. On your turn, you roll 3 custom dice and use the results to move around the gardens, go on the different rides, stroll the quaint and artful paths, and acquire treats and toys from the card row to score points.

When the big clock strikes twelve, the gardens close, and you score extra points for having collected card sets as well as for your placement in 5 different races. E.g. who has tried the most ‘daredevil’ rides? The player with the most points wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Re-rolling and Locking

name: Ecologies: Ancient Areas
description:
Dinosaurs roam the earth again in the latest twist on Ecologies!
⠀
This new game take things back to bygone eras such as the Cambrian ocean, Cretaceous forest, and the Pleistocene Tundra. You will manage food webs not only across biomes but also across time periods!
⠀
It’s all about building healthy food webs on different biomes. If you create a healthy ecology you get the perks and powers of that Biome. Each organism card lists what it eats and what it’s eaten by. You arrange them with plants on the bottom, predators on top. There is a trade mechanic where you trade with others based on what you need and what they need. It is a race to get 12 victory points and different organisms give different points. There are factor cards that can affect opponents and different strategies such as focusing on one biome, going for perks and bonuses, or attacking other ecologies.
⠀
—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Educational, Environmental, Negotiation, Prehistoric
mechanics: Hand Management, Negotiation, Set Collection, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Trading

name: Llaverinto
description:
Four clans of warriors compete for the right to the throne. To do this, they will need to seize one of their rivals' keys and take it to the castle in the center of a labyrinth full of traps.

Llaverinto is an easy to play boardgame for all ages based on the simplicity of the classics;"A non-linear roll and move" in which players decide the best route to move their pieces across the board and the best tactics to defeat each other.

With your purchase, we will donate a portion to the Dibujando Un Mañana Foundation to support girls, boys, and young people in vulnerable situations.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move

name: Rebellion without Rehearsal: Liberation – Part 2 (fan expansion for Android: Netrunner)
description:
Rebellion Without Rehearsal is the second half of the Liberation Cycle. It concludes the story began in The Automata Initiative, in which the passage of a law set to strip bioroids of personhood caused uproar throughout Brazil. As the protests turn violent, and only the President’s signature is needed for this law to be enacted, the activists striving to protect bioroid rights make unlikely alliances and decide how far they’re willing to go.

Rebellion Without Rehearsal contains full playsets of 65 new Netrunner cards, including three identities.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play
mechanics: Deck Construction, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Variable Player Powers

name: Pyramido: Forgotten Treasures
description:
Deep within the heart of a lush and mysterious jungle lies proof of a vanished tribe’s existence: the emerald canopy of Pyramido. Tales speak of majestic pyramids concealed beneath dense vegetation, each cradling precious gems of unimaginable worth. You’ll embark on a daring quest to unveil these wonders.

Pyramido: Forgotten Treasures is a standalone game for 1-4 players where you become an intrepid explorer venturing into hidden ruins with one precise goal: collect the largest fortune possible!

During their adventure, each player uses Dominoes to explore their own Pyramid. As a tile placement game, players take turns choosing a Domino and an available Gem from the corresponding space. To maximize their points, players must create areas with colored gem icons while placing their Dominoes and use Gems of the matching color to activate these as scoring areas. Each choice of Domino and its positioning has a significant impact since the previous stages influence the score throughout the game. A game is played over 4 stages and each stage is scored once completed.

Whoever earns the most points wins the game and the title of Great Explorer.
mechanics: Connections, Layering, Open Drafting, Tile Placement

name: Unfinished Business: Famiglia Reunion
description:
This expansion is not a sale item, but is/was exclusively available for free to all Unfinished Business: Final Chapter – Expansion pre-orderers during the pre-order campaign.

Contents of the "Famiglia Reunion" expansion:

12 playing cards (63x88mm) consisting of:

6 event cards (in German)

6 action cards (in German)

—description from the publisher (translated)

Diese Erweiterung ist kein Verkaufsartikel, sondern ist/war exklusiv und gratis erhältlich für alle Vorbesteller von der Unfinished Business: Final Chapter – Erweiterung während der Vorbestellerkampagne.

Inhalt der "Famiglia Reunion" Erweiterung:

12 Spielkarten ( 63x88mm) bestehend aus:

6 Ereigniskarten (deutsch)

6 Aktionskarten (deutsch)

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Katmai: The Bears of Brooks River
description:
A dynamic two-player card game of competitive area control, careful planning, and very hungry bears.

Every summer, dozens of ravenous brown bears descend upon the majestic Brooks River in the Katmai region of Alaska. Here they gorge themselves on its summer bounty of salmon that swim up the beautiful, glacial-fed rivers of the Alaskan wilderness.

In Katmai, you will be playing bears to advantageous fishing spots along Brooks River in order to gain dominance, satisfy challenges and catch delicious salmon. As the fishing spots fill up, you will need to choose your bears carefully, triggering unique abilities that will allow you to take advantage of situations and outwit your hungry opponent. Katmai weaves together simple mechanics with rich decision making to create an experience that is contemplative, competitive, and tense. Winter approaches and the wilderness is yours. It's time to feast!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management

name: Backstabbers
description:
Backstabbers is a battle royale game set in Solara, a new world discovered and corrupted by humans in their way to escape the total destruction they made on Earth.

In Backstabbers you're gonna use the power of more than 40 characters to eliminate your competitors. Eliminating players and being the last one standing will grant you coins, 5 coins will make you the Supreme, the most rich and powerful in the new world.

It is a game to 3-8 players within 45 min average where eliminated player still have a role in the game!

DON'T TRUST ANYONE, NOT EVEN YOURSELF!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Player Elimination, Take That

name: KeyForge: Æmber Skies
description:
KeyForge: Æmber Skies is the eighth set for KeyForge and features these exciting new elements:


Introducing the new House Skyborn, a loose confederation of baronies, pirates and merchants who live aboard skyships or among the floating isles of the expanse.
The return of the Red Baron! Be mindful of forging keys of given colors, lest the unscrupulous minions from the above pilfer your precious Æmber!
More than 200 new cards across Brobnar, Dis, Ekwidon, Geistoid, Logos, Mars, Skyborn and more!


New "House Enhancement" bonus icon to increase the versatility of new and old cards.

Deck-shaking Skybeasts unleash their dynamic abilities with a thunderous crash!


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Race, Take That

name: Potala Palace
description:
In 7th century, the Tubo king Songtsen Gampo gave orders to build a great palace on Red Mountain, name it “Potala”, means “the holy place”, in order to marry a noble chinese princess Wencheng from Tang Dynasty. According to legend, the princess Wencheng was a devout follower of Buddhism. When she married Songtsen Gampo, she brought with her as part of her dowry a precious statue of the Buddha that awaken a demon living in the Red Mountain during the construction of the Potala Palace, he tried to disrupt the work every night by destroying what had been built during the day. To prevent this, King Songtsen Gampo consulted an oracle, which advised that the demon be appeased with the offering of the body of a man or woman. Princess Wencheng, with great courage, volunteered to be sacrificed.

After two hundred years, with the perdition of Tubo Dynasty, the Potala Palace were damaged during wars in 9th century, there were only ruins left, making the demon awaken again.
Until in 17th century when the 5th Dalai Lama came to power, he commanded his Rinpoches (the players) with they monk-workers, to rebuilding the palace immediately and vanish the demon once for all, making the Potala Palace a new home and a spiritual tower for the next generations of the Dalai Lamas.

Potala Palace is a euro-game with deck building and worker/dice placement mechanics, where players take on the roles of Rinpoches who must assist in the reconstruction of the palace using their dice (workers) to acquire new resources and cards to improve their decks, allowing them to build new facilities such as halls, statues, reliquaries, thangkas (a type of Tibetan tapestry), thus accumulating "merit points" (victory points) and achieving enlightenment by completing the "Great Mandala" at the end of the game. The game features a day and night mechanics where players' deck cards can be flipped upside down, completely changing their effects, further expanding the strategic possibilities of the game, but beware of the demon's jealousy, as he may come during the nighttime to destroy something the players have built.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Tile Placement, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Cryptic Nature: Flora
description:
In the realm of Cryptic Nature, there live not only elusive animals but also mysterious plants. In the Flora expansion, you can explore these cryptid plants, bringing their existence to light. However, the task is challenging — obtaining a sample of a cryptid plant requires completing entire quests! Unlock greater reputation than in the base game by simultaneously pursuing quests alongside your search for cryptids. Bringing plants to the sanctuary adds to your exploration and rewards you with a valuable bonus action. 

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Mythology, Travel
mechanics: Action Retrieval, Dice Rolling, Grid Coverage, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Yaxha
description:
Build the 8th world wonder !
Yaxha dives deep into Mayas pyramids construction of the actual Guatemala.

Get the stone blocks to build your own pyramid.
Every round, batches of 3 stone blocks are available.
Choose the ones that bring some money back home through the various colors.
Assemble your blocks wisely to build the most beautiful Maya pyramid and win the game. Of course, your opponents will try to take them away from you.


Fill the markets with 3 cubes at every round.
Without telling your opponents, choose the one that interests you and reveal simultaneously your choice.
Assemble your pyramid with the blocks that you brought and try to make the longest series of colors.


Mind the common goals, since they can make a difference in the final match for victory. So be careful as to whom is getting the most yellows, whom is the most eclectic or whom has the longest series, all colors included.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Connections, Market, Predictive Bid

name: ElvenTrolls
description:
ElvenTrolls is a trick-taking card game with the stunning illustrations of the Swedish artist John Bauer.

"When you talk about trolls, they are standing outside your door listening." - Swedish proverb.

The forests of Sweden are restless, according to local druids, the number of trolls is increasing, forcing them to leave their caves to hunt in the forests, disturbing the peace of the elves who inhabit them, creating a natural imbalance.
ElvenTrolls is a card game with a trick-taking mechanic played in pairs, where one pair plays with the elves and the other with the trolls, competing for supremacy in the northern forests. Each night (round), the trolls will try to devour the guardian elves, who in turn must prevent the trolls from returning to their caves before sunrise, when they will turn into stones. The player with the highest number on their card wins the trick and takes all the trolls and elves to their forest, however, the player with the lowest number can take any troll or elf to any player's forest. The faction that has the highest total value in a forest wins against the rival, scoring points for their team (collecting the rival's cards). Just be careful with the curse of the druids' runes, where the faction that has 3 or more cards with the same runes will be destroyed, scoring points for the rival.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Team-Based Game, Trick-taking

name: Oarful Sea
description:
Oarful Seas is a fast-play ancient naval ruleset for wargaming fleet actions of 20+ ships per player. Players command multiple squadrons of oared vessels as they ram, shear, board and shoot missiles in an attempt to sink or capture enemy ships.

The ruleset is designed for 1/1200 scale miniatures using a 6x4 table. A typical game of Oarful Seas will need approximately 20-30 ships per player. Apart from ships, players need a measuring tape in inches, at least two 6-sided dice (though a few more would be useful), and some way of marking slowed, immobilized and wrecked ships.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement

name: The Totem Game
description:
The Totem Game is based on the totem pole mythology and all of the different cultural and mythological components that go along with it. Native American, Canadian, Norse and Pacific Islanders have used totem poles as part of their storytelling and belief system

Spirit animals, cryptids, or mythological creatures will come to your aid in this game to help you obtain your objectives or stop other players from attaining theirs. The average length of each game is about 5 minutes to 10 minutes and the fast pace of the game helps. The average teaching time of this game is a few minutes to you can be up and running and having a good time quickly.

Card powers can be augmented by using the combination powers listed on them, giving a second and deeper level of strategy. You can also use different deck building setups that will enhance or complicate gameplay.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Knockout Cards
description:
Game deck consists of 52 cards displaying attack and defensive boxing maneuvers. To begin, every player starts with six cards that are dealt face down. The rest of the cards are placed in a Draw Pile face down.
Roll a six-die die to determine start.
Player health is determined by tallied damage and scored on the six-sided die, beginning with six reducing by the damage taken each move.
Each round will be in two phases alternating between each player.
First Move: Player One shows an attack card. Player Two shows Defense Card. Tally Damage.
Next Move: Player Two shows an attack card. Player One shows a Defense Card. Tally Damage.
Special Cards: May be played in addition to move to negate an attack or defense after either player has acted.
Draw replacement cards to maintain a six-card hand.
Play will continue until a player reaches zero when they are considered “Knocked Out.”
mechanics: Turn Order: Role Order

name: For20 Cards
description:
Turn based game, the goal is to accumulate stoner points by smoking material cards with tool cards.

Earn action coins, and play action cards to mess around with other players and for your personal benefit.

Out-of-turn cards (e.g Short memory, drug test) to interfere with other player moves.

The player who reaches 20 stoner points win the game.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Action/Event, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Turret Dice: The Defenders
description:
Turret Dice The Defenders is a Cooperative, Dice Placement, Tower Defense Game about defending your planet from a colossal swarm of meteors that threatens to destroy everything. Players must work together to shoot down all incoming targets as even one slipping through will be the end of their world.

Players will roll dice on their turns to determine which actions are available to take. They will then spend their dice to activate turret spaces in their Defense Array to damage and destroy incoming meteors and tower spaces that have a wide range of clever abilities like making other actions better, and mitigating dice rolls. Alternately, dice can be spent on Dashboard Actions to build more turrets and towers into the player's customized Defense Arrays, to upgrade turrets, to draw cards, or play powerful one-time-use event cards.

Meteors are generated by randomized "Spawn Decks" and have special abilities and tricks of their own, as well as pesky Alert Cards to throw players off and distinctively different bosses. These randomized elements will keep the game fresh and different for play after play! Not to mention optional Gameplay Modifiers that can change up the way the game is played or increase the difficulty substantially.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Tesela
description:
It's a simple tile placing board game using the hexagonal tiles.

Game setting:

Each player receive a special blank tile to put it in front as their starting tile.
The rest of tiles are put on a "pool" where we can take them at random (we use a cloth bag).
Then choose who will be the "first player", using your prefered method of your choice, who will keep the pool of tiles.

How a turn works:

The first player takes from the pool as many tiles as players plus one and place it in the middle of the tables. It will become the "market" where each player, starting by the first one, will chose and take a tile (this is compulsory).
Once the player has taken the tile from the market may choose to place it next the starter tile (or any other tile placed before) following the RULE OF PLACEMENT or to keep it in his reserve. There's no limit of tiles one can have in this personal reserve and can be used in any moment but, once the tile is placed in a "legal" position it can't be moved.
Once all players have taken their tile and placed (or not), "first player" moves to the next player who now will keep the pool and replenish the "market".

Rule of placement:

A tile can be placed only next to another tile while there's no contact with a marked side.

Game ends:

Game ends when there are no more tiles to take from the "pool" or when there's no room for more tiles on player's figures.

Scoring:

Each tile has a value equal to its marked sides. So, for us, red has value of 1, blue of 2, yellow of 3, green equals 4 and brown is 5.
So each player has to count how many tiles have of every colour and do the maths.
Also we count each marked continuous side and take the value of the lonqest one. If this is a "circular" one, surrounding the figure, its value doubles. In case of ties the figure with less tiles win.
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Blood
description:
Blood is a Boss Battler game for 1 to 4 players. You will control a group of unusual monster hunters, each featuring their own customizable set of cards. Blood uses an innovative dice and card system to allow you to face the horrors of Vlad's Castle until you reach its powerful Master.

Each Raid will bring you face to face with one of Vlad's Champions, ready to confront you by deploying unique strategies varying based on the location where you encounter them, creating ever-changing combinations and situations.

At the end of each Raid, you will return to the village of Bran to build new epic weapons and learn new fighting techniques, to prepare for the final confrontation with the Prince of the Night himself!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Evelina Family Tree
description:
Players create personal fantasy Family tree using the powers of your faction DNA.

At the beginning, choose your factions that will give you unique powers. Choose a couple of secret score cards objectives. Each turn, choose two adjacent cards from the Public Market and add them to the growing Genealogy Tree you create: producing as many descendants as possible, choosing their mates, or leaving some singles whose branches will be cut off in the name of tree purity. Use the supporting cards, your creativity and planning ahead in multiple generations to achieve as many of your secret goals as possible.
Collect bonus points from public tasks, competing with all opponents. And most importantly, use your unique family DNA feature! The game ends when it runs out of cards. The winner is the player with the most points
mechanics: Connections, End Game Bonuses, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Eureka: The Mining Card Game
description:
The goal of Eureka is to collect 4 Gold Nuggets before the other Miners. By digging in the Mine and stealing from sleepy Players, you will have to strategically find the best way to victory.

A core mechanic of the game is fatigue: by digging, you gain fatigue, and reaching 3 fatigues will make you fall asleep, allowing other players to steal from you.

This game contains 126 high-end playing cards (M31) and a rule book.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Events, Kill Steal, Lose a Turn, Semi-Cooperative Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Neuroshima Hex! 3.0: Desert Tribes
description:
The Desert Tribes introduces a new faction adept at survival in the harsh wasteland environments of the Neuroshima universe. This expansion adds a fresh tactical layer with innovative mechanics such as "Hide" and "Ambush," enhancing gameplay unpredictability and strategic depth.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Gnome Kingdom
description:
Gnome Kingdom is a race through an enchanted forest, combining dice manipulation with strategic choices and a bit of luck.

Assume the role of one of the five clan leaders in the race to settle who should become the next leader of the Gnome Kingdom. Using the forest’s enchanted resources, unique clan powers and a lot of dice, each leader has to earn their skills to get through the forest.

The game ends when the hidden crown is discovered and the player who has collected the most valuable skills wins and becomes the new King or Queen of the Gnome Kingdom.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Race, Re-rolling and Locking, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Return to Dark Tower: Meshuggenah Promo Card
description:
Originally available from backing Secret Cabal 2023 Kickstarter campaign.

Corruption Card
If you would ever gain a card from the treasure market, gain the top card of the treasure deck instead.
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: 7TV: 80s Genre Guide
description:
A new hardback 7TV supplement to enjoy cinematic skirmishes inspired by all your fave 80s tv and films! Plus loads of new miniatures!

Everything you need to recreate your favourite 80s movie or show on the tabletop! 7TV comes from a love of action-adventure film and TV in all its variety. To capture this richness, our genre guides are themed around different types of TV shows and movies from different eras. Genre guides are a deep dive - exploring specific cinematic archetypes, tropes and shows - and this time we turn our attention to the 1980s!

You will need the 7TV Core Rulebook to play with this supplement.

Includes:
127 new profiles - a swathe of Neutral Stars and Co-Stars to reflect the 'blurred lines' of 80s anti-heroes. Plus 88 Extras to bolster your casts!

New script deck - 7TV: The 80s uses a deck of unique script cards to mark the countdown to the climax of the episode. Each script card contains an iconic quote and an in-game effect that benefits the player.

New props and maguffins - we add more buffs and iconic items to add to your games including BMX Bike, Fast Food, Demonic Box, Red Bandana and Time Travel Device!

New Episodes and Tropes - 12 Classic Episodes from the 8TV back catalogue offering a glimpse into the making of each production, with suggestions for using profiles and accessories from this genre guide to help you recreate key cinematic skirmishes from these classic episodes.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Humor, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Spies/Secret Agents, Video Game Theme, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Resource to Move

name: Jamboree
description:
Jamboree is a game all about crafting jam and filling orders for profit. It's a simple to learn money management, bag drawing, dice rolling, food themed game set in the Renaissance era. It's great fun created for the casual and family gamers alike.

Players take on the role of a Jam merchant who competes to fulfill customer orders. By rolling dice and gathering produce from the supply bag to fill jam jars as efficiently as possible without busting a jar, to gain lucrative profit and benefits for filling the orders. After three orders are fulfilled players go one more round. Add up the total of coins and VP on orders. Highest score wins.

-description from designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Income, Neighbor Scope, Push Your Luck, Random Production

name: Flowers of the Philippines
description:
OVERVIEW
Collect sets of flower cards to create ‘gardens’. This attracts colorful butterflies which count as points. The flowers and butterflies are all native to the Philippines.

It’s a family friendly card game for 2-4 players, which takes about 20 minutes to play. Featuring hand painted artwork created by local Filipino artists.

HOW TO WIN
At the end of the game the player with the most butterflies wins!

SETUP
Deal 3 flower cards to each player. Then place the remaining deck of cards to the side and reveal the top three flower cards, placing them in a line as cards that may be drawn.

Place the butterfly circle in the middle of the table and the butterfly deck on it. Reveal the top three butterfly cards and place them around the circle matching to their color.

Left of the dealer goes first.

ON YOUR TURN
Draw a flower card from one of the three revealed or the top of the deck.

Create a ‘garden’ by laying down 3 of the same color flower cards.

Flower cards come in 7 colors of the rainbow. There are also ‘double-color’ flower cards which may be one of two colors. And there’s also a ‘wild’ flower card that can be any color.

Collect any revealed wild butterflies that are the same color as your garden by laying them on your garden.
In addition, you may STEAL all butterflies from an opponent’s garden IF it is the SAME COLOR and WEAKER. Determine a garden’s strength by counting the total number of ‘butterfly symbols’ on the corners of each flower that match your garden’s ‘color’. (solid color flower cards are ‘stronger’ than double-color or wild-color flower cards).

At the end of your turn reveal a new wild butterfly from the top of the deck. A player with a matching color flower garden may immediately collect this butterfly. But they must pay attention because if they miss it before the next person’s turn then another player may steal it for their themselves!

The game ends when there are no wild butterflies around the wild butterfly circle. This usually happens when atleast one garden of every color has been made. The game may also end when there are no butterfly cards in the deck.

There are also 7 ‘sparkly butterflies’ which have a special ability that activates when they are collected by a player. See the reference cards for these. Example: “draw 2 flower cards”, or “reveal a flower card and steal this color butterfly”.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Euthia: Cruel Frost
description:
The final chapter in the Euthia trilogy, Cruel Frost brings the epic adventure that is Euthia to a chilling climax.

Euthia is an open world fantasy RPG board game for 1-4 players you can play co-op, competitively, or solo. The Cruel Frost expansion introduces challenging new scenarios, hair-raising new enemies, and unique new heroes.

The story centers around a malevolent Spider Queen who’s seized control of forbidden ice magic, and now threatens to plunge Euthia into frozen darkness. Take on the challenges as one of the existing heroes, or become one of the new heroes introduced in Cruel Frost, each with their own branching path.

As well as new replayable scenarios, Cruel Frost introduces icy new mechanics to your base game. Playable with almost any scenario, the Ice Claws module brings raging ice storms to Euthia, transforming your modular map with new frozen tiles and paving the way to fresh challenges and new opportunities.

Moving through ice storms will cause frostbite, but will also grant access to powerful ice magic, changing the way you play. Out in the snow, you’ll encounter the new Ice Entity, offering tantalizing rewards to the brave.

Luckily, with the Ice Claws module comes the arrival of the Ice Clans. These guardians of ancient wisdom will share their knowledge with your heroes to help them withstand the cold, revealing new ways to gear up, heal, and learn new abilities.

Speaking of gearing up, Cruel Frost introduces an entire new stock of items for traders, adding even more depth to equipment upgrades. Not only are there more levels and options (thanks to new items and four new gem types), but some armor can also now be upgraded with elemental essences, introducing powerful new effects in the advanced stages of the game.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Map Addition, Modular Board, Movement Points, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Aqua Tofana
description:
Aqua Tofana is a strategic 18-card game set in 17th-century Italy, themed around the famous poison that gives the game its name. In the game, players simulate a tense dinner between a married couple, with each player taking the role of either poison or antidote. The goal is to have the most cards of their role visible in the playing area by the end of the game. The game's premise revolves around Giulia Tofana, a famed cosmetologist who secretly elaborated and sold lethal poison to abused wives seeking a way out of violent marriages. The game's setting and design evoke a sense of historical tension and social commentary on gender violence and the resilience of women in patriarchal societies.

The game is played with 18 cards, each with poison on one side and antidote on the other. Players then take turns placing cards orthogonally adjacent to existing cards, applying the flipping effect represented on the card played. These effects can cause cards in the playing area to flip, changing the visible role and impacting the game's outcome. The gameplay symbolizes a confrontation between doses of poison and antidote.

Through its historical theme and social commentary, Aqua Tofana brings attention to the enduring fight against gender violence, promoting solidarity and resilience among women. The game’s design and artwork, alongside the unique gameplay mechanics, offer a thoughtful and engaging experience for players while underscoring an important message about equality and justice.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Print & Play, Renaissance
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board

name: Свечеварение (Candlemaking)
description:
In the Свечеварение("Candlemaking") board game, players will cook candles from a variety of components, including wicks, colored wax, fragrances and molds.

In the game there are candle cards and ingredient tokens. At the beginning everybody gets 5 cards with candles. Players create candles by taking component tokens from the game table.

The fastest and most accurate player wins by collecting all the candles in exact accordance with cards.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Tile Placement

name: Emociones en equilibrio
description:
How to achieve balance in complicated situations?
A story about a group of characters who found it difficult to find balance.
How to play? You have to accompany the characters in 3 moments:

Identify when emotions appear
Understand what happens to our body
Seek to regulate the intensity of the emotion


In competitive mode, one character is selected per player and the cards are arranged on the table so that they are placed from highest to lowest emotional intensity. In the middle of the route, the "emomemo" cards are placed that will be used at that point in the route for a memory game about bodily manifestations of emotions. Players take turns answering each card, either through questions about themselves, about others, exercises and self-regulation activities.

Whoever reaches the end of the route first, that is, who has resolved the card with the least emotional intensity, accesses the final card where it is confirmed that they have reached "balance."

It is a psychoeducational game to help children manage their emotions.

Includes MINDFULNESS and COGNITIVE BEHAVIORAL THERAPY tools.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Questions and Answers

name: Parecidos & Diferentes
description:
This is Valen's story: Valen moved around his neighborhood, he had friends who lived near his house and liked to do the same activities. One day he met someone from a different place who didn't share the same tastes.
Do you know what happened? Join us in this game to find out!

With attention and speed we are going to put together groups of friends based on their differences or similarities. Can we get along with people similar or different to us?

OBJECTIVE OF THE GAME:
Create groups of friends based on their differences or similarities:

How to play? We will find cards with combinations of 3 characters, 3 different places to live and 3 different interests or activities. Based on certain rules and without taking turns, players must assemble groups of characters. At the basic level, the person who has the most cards will win; at the advanced level, other elements are included to reward the greatest social diversity.
Includes a guide for adults with tips to work on diversity and enhance the game's resources.
mechanics: Matching, Pattern Building

name: Boxing: the Game
description:
Boxing: the Game is a simultaneous-play 1v1 game that simulates a boxing match. Punch, Block, & Feint your way to victory as you Master the Sweet Science.

Just like with real boxing, there are three ways to win: Score more points, exhaust your opponent, or land an epic KO!

Built with a passion for both board games & combat sports, B:tG puts fun first with a simple yet action-packed gameplay loop featuring deckbuilding, bluffing, character progression, plus an endless variety of tactics & strategies.

You don't need to buy any expansions or additional content for the full experience.

Boxing: the Game is designed with a balance-first approach. Our hope is that competitive & hobby gamers alike can enjoy an ever-evolving local metagame, similar to games like: Dice Throne, 7 Wonders: Duel, Star Realms, Radlands, or Mindbug.

However, unlike other classic 1v1 dueling games, B:tG is *simultaneous-play,* meaning you won't be taking turns or waiting around for your opponent. Just like in a real fight, you and your opponent are making decisions at the same time!

Whether you're hardcore boxing fan or not, you'll appreciate that every mechanic is dripping with flavor: stance-switching, clinching, balancing speed & stamina, styles making fights, & more.

B:tG is simple enough that a child can learn the game on their first playthrough, yet offers enough strategic depth that you can continue improving your fight game for many bouts to come.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction, Fighting, Real-time, Sports
mechanics: Action Drafting, Action Queue, Action/Event, Auction Compensation, Auction: Dexterity, Auction: Fixed Placement, Auction: Once Around, Auction: Turn Order Until Pass, Betting and Bluffing, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Chaining, Closed Drafting, Critical Hits and Failures, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Deduction, Events, Hand Management, Layering, Memory, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Ordering, Pattern Recognition, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Real-Time, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Score-and-Reset Game, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Single Loser Game, Square Grid, Stat Check Resolution, Sudden Death Ending, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Residuum
description:
Amidst the radiation, small pockets of civilisation attempt to develop their communities and survive this harsh world by harvesting the last of earth's untouched resources. But beware, thereʼs always someone who wants what you have and will do anything to take it.

In Residuum players seek to explore the game map while expanding their community, exploit the resources available and interact with other players through trade deals and conflict. Conflict does not result in player elimination or the ʻdeathʼ of your character, instead you lose ground, lose assets and lose resources, so be careful who you trust and who you deal with!

Residuum is an open world. Areas of the map allow different resources to be harvested and different technologies to be discovered. Each turn is only limited by the number of resources you have available to spend, so considerable expansion is possible through building a robust engine for resource generation.

At the end of the game, points are awarded for the size of your community, for the discoveries you have made, and for your stockpile of resources. Whoever has the most points at the end will be declared the winner.

—description from the publisher
categories: City Building, Economic, Fighting, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, End Game Bonuses, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up, Zone of Control

name: Carcassonne: 4 Seasons – The Spring
description:
The Spring is part of the 4 Seasons tile series with individual illustrations. You can use the tiles to expand the playing field or as a small mini-expansion.

Spring has arrived in Catcassonne ! Admire the gardens and flowers that are spreading across the fields!

Components: 12 land tiles.

Mix the 12 spring tiles with the landscape tiles from the base game.

You now score points for garden and spring tiles that are vertically
or diagonally adjacent to the spring tile you have placed:
- For each garden you get 3 points
- For each spring tile you get 1 point

Statue tiles
You will find 1 statue tile in each of the 4-season tile series. The following rule applies to all 4 statue tiles of the 4 seasons:
If your tile is vertically or diagonally adjacent to a statue tile of the 4 Seasons after being placed, you may place 2 meeple on this tile in different areas.

Matches the design of the 3rd edition of Carcassonne.
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Map Addition, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Weird Heraldry
description:
For centuries members of noble families often married their relatives. In the case of regal kings and queens; this meant some heirs were born with “issues” or would have perished in birth. It would also reduce their intelligence, which in turn impacted the monarch's ability to rule.

In this game you will manipulate shield heraldry tiles; tiles Representing bloodlines of six interbreeding noble families. The tradition of Intermarriages is centuries old. Once a dynasty had their power they were never willing to relinquish it. This will all take place on the family crests board to produce your own clandestine family crest. you will help choose which family name will blunder through the annals of history.

Will it be the boisterous Barkhouses’ or the silver-tongued Spongs‘? maybe the dapper De La Poles’ will remain, who knows; but never count out the raucous Rainecourts‘, they are always causing mischief. Although, I did hear that the Greedy Grabhams’ are trying to set up a marriage with the ageless Applebottoms‘. Will it succeed? That one may haps, you will help decide.

—descripion from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Deduction, Grid Coverage, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Pattern Building, Pattern Movement, Push Your Luck, Slide/Push, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Maître Confiseur: Le Défi Sucré
description:
Enter the sweet universe of Maître Confiseur : Le Défi Sucré, an engaging game where the objective is to be the first to fill both molds with gummy bears. Immerse yourself in a playful adventure where cunning, strategy, and a hint of mischief are the essential ingredients to claim the prestigious title of Master Confectioner.

Maître Confiseur offers a fast-paced and entertaining gaming experience, perfect for moments of togetherness with family or friends. The simplified version "Sweet Version 5+" ensures a gentle introduction for younger aspiring confectionery masters.

With vibrant illustrations and playful dynamics, this delightfully competitive game will delight candy enthusiasts of all ages. Get ready to take on the sweet challenge and be crowned master confectioner in this game where strategy and fun blend skillfully.

—description from the publisher


Plongez dans un monde sucré et coloré avec Maître Confiseur, un jeu de société captivant où la compétition et la stratégie se mêlent à la douceur des jujubes oursons ! Parfait pour des soirées ludiques en famille ou entre amis, "Maître Confiseur" vous invite à devenir le premier joueur à compléter deux de vos productions de jujubes oursons. Mais attention, vos adversaires feront tout pour vous barrer la route.

Dans Maître Confiseur, chaque tour est une opportunité de prendre des décisions stratégiques. Que ce soit en construisant vos propres moules ou en utilisant les pouvoirs des cartes saveurs et en déployant des explosions de sucre pour les renforcer, chaque choix compte. Anticipez les mouvements de vos adversaires et adaptez votre stratégie pour devenir le véritable maître confiseur !

Une version 5+ garantit une initiation en douceur pour les plus jeunes aspirants maîtres confiseurs.

Avec des illustrations vibrantes et une dynamique ludique, ce jeu délicieusement compétitif saura ravir les amateurs de sucreries de tous âges. Préparez-vous à relever le défi sucré et à être couronné maître confiseur dans ce jeu où la stratégie et le plaisir se mélangent savamment."
mechanics: Set Collection, Take That

name: Dieson Crusoe: Mini Expansion
description:
The expansion includes two new characters and two new tool cards.

New Tool Cards
Fishing Rod
Effect: At the start of the evening phase, if the value of a die used this round matches the value of a die from the previous round (connected by an arrow on the board), you receive one food. This can happen up to three times per evening phase, depending on the dice results, allowing you to receive a maximum of three foods.

Waterskin
Effect: When you perform the 'Play with My Friend' action, you gain one water, represented by placing a cube on this card. You can store up to two water cubes on the card. These water cubes can be used in any action that requires stars, granting an additional star for each water cube used.

New Characters
Farmer
Effect: At the start of the afternoon phase, if the weather die shows either sunny (1,2) or rainy (3,4), you receive one food.

Strategist
Effect: You start the game with the Blueprint tool card, giving you a strategic advantage in building and planning.
Gameplay Integration
mechanics: Unspecified

name: RCG: Random Card Generator
description:
Random Card Generator is a party game full of references and parodies to all those movies, games, and medieval fantasy culture that forged our nerdy childhoods.

The goal of the game is to destroy your opponents by damaging them or to take revenge on the one who destroyed you in the last game because grudges are never forgotten.

It is a fast, easy, (un)balanced, and totally (un)fair game in which up to 4 players can engage in an all vs. all combat full of magic, powers, and traps.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Player Elimination

name: Mythy
description:
Mythy is a captivating card game where players are cast as mystical guardians tasked with restoring order to the universe by returning creatures to their respective realms. The game centers around four diverse realms: Fantasy, Ancient Mythology, Folklore, and Urban Legend. Each player's hand is filled with creatures from these realms, each with unique characteristics and the power to bend the game’s rules.

As players draw and play these creature cards, they must navigate and manipulate the game's evolving dynamics. Each creature has distinct abilities that can alter the gameplay, offering strategic depth and requiring players to think critically about every move. The goal is to adeptly manage your hand and strategically deploy creatures, sending them back to their realms while countering your opponents’ attempts to thwart your plans.

With stunning artwork representing each of the four realms and a dynamic gameplay mechanism that changes with every card played, Mythy offers an immersive experience for players who enjoy strategy, myth, and the challenge of adapting to constantly changing game states.

Prepare for a game of wits and cunning where each card can shift the tide of play, and every game tells a new mythical story. Step into the guardian’s role and harness the chaos in Mythy!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Layering, Lose a Turn

name: Alpine Trails
description:
You have been given the opportunity to design the trail system of a national forest in the Rocky Mountains. You will build trails that wander through various habitats and pass by waterfalls. You'll develop campsites and leave other areas as pristine habitats for the alpine wildlife.

Players will simultaneously draw 2 random tiles and place them into their parks. Players will earn points by creating a long out-n-back trail, large areas of contiguous habitats, surrounding waterfalls, reaching lakes, making space for wildlife, and placing campsites.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Transmute: The Game of Alchemists
description:
Race against your opponent to transmute metals, complete quests, and utilize powerful Zodiacs. When the last Planet card is claimed, only one alchemist can be victorious and join the Hermetic Circle!

Transmute is a competitive, shared deck card game. Core gameplay revolves around a 5-suited deck. Four of the suits represent the classical elements fire, water, earth, and air, while the fifth suit - aether - allows for special effects in the game.

Each round begins by setting a target number and element that both players will try to match using the element cards in their hands. When a player matches the target, they can transmute those elements into different metals that are worth points at the end of the game.

In addition to transmutation, players can complete quests to receive bonuses and play Zodiac cards with unique effects that can change the course of the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Retrieval, Hand Management, Take That

name: Failtanic
description:
Failtanic is a competitive game of “every man for himself”.
It has a party / family style where from 3 to 10 players can play, although more could play.

All players receive two iceberg cards, one of which they can trade at their own risk with the next player, or if they prefer they can keep both.

The objective is to be the last player with a life preserver. If you have the lowest score at the end of the round you will lose a life preserver. However if you get the highest score, you will become captain, where you can add new rules in future rounds to make the game crazier and more fun.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Drafting, Hot Potato

name: Ice & Land
description:
Ice & Land is a competitive game Spin & Write where players must manage the resources of a survivor in the arctic guided by a compass compass wind rose.
To do so, they must cross different terrains while reaching the proposed objectives.

The game includes solitaire mode, a hard mode called Frozen Hell, and a campaign mode that expands the game with different ways to play.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil

name: Tuxedo Trouble
description:
Tonight is the annual Penguin Gala, but the penguins were all shipped the wrong tuxedos. It’s up to you to sort out this mess so all the penguins can look snazzy.

Your goal is to find each penguin a matching tuxedo, however the penguins are stubborn and won’t give up their tuxedos unless they have their proper replacement. To do this, you must complete a full matching set before sending the penguins on their way. Larger sets earn higher scores. Get the most points to win.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Matching, Set Collection

name: Build a Bot
description:
Build a Bot is a three-tiered robot building game that we created to play with our Little children, our Big children and our Adult friends. We use the Copper Bot cards when playing with our Littles. Game play mixes basic elements of “Go Fish” and “Rummy,” where the objective is to get the six parts of your color bot before everyone else.
