We then add the Silver Action cards to introduce on the table building, extra card drawing, card stealing, and bot sabotaging. When Silver is not enough for our experienced Gamer friends, we add Gold cards to the mix. These cards do a little of everything but faster and on other players’ turns; while also allowing aggressive, defensive, and stealthy play styles.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Matching, Memory, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Trading, Variable Set-up

name: All Time Wrestling: Abu Dhabi Rumble
description:
A stand-alone 2-4 player expansion to the highly touted game All Time Wrestling featuring legends like Sgt Slaughter, Junk Yard Dog, Kamala, Nick Aldis, and many more.
This Rumble Edition introduces new 3 and 4-player game modes:
Triple Threat, Fatal 4-Way, Rumble Matches and Faction Rumble.

All Time Wrestling is an asymmetric game where each wrestler has unique attack cards and special abilities (that you can customize before the match). During the game, you will play attack cards from your hand. This will require you to spend energy and roll dice. If the attack is successful, you will deal damage to your opponent build match momentum, and continue your attacks, dealing devastating combos. You win the game by executing a signature or finishing move (attack)that allows you to pin or submit your opponent.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Tug of War

name: Dragon Ball Super: Fusion World
description: A simpler, more digital-friendly version of the popular Dragon Ball Super Card Game, focused on aggressively attacking and defeating your opponent. It uses similar rules as the previous (still supported) game, but the cards are not compatible.
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management

name: Bulbous
description:
Welcome to the enchanting universe of Baelbulb, where players embark on a journey unlike any other. Delve into the captivating world of Baelbulb, a hidden realm beneath the Earth’s surface where bizarre and captivating life forms thrive. As a guardian of its lush forests, your mission is to charm and collect Baelfungious specimens, turning them into valuable score points through trick-taking rounds. Compete with friends, choose your actions wisely, and win the game by charming the most Baelfungious with delicious bulbs.

In Bulbous, each player becomes a biome guardian, utilizing strategic character control to outmaneuver opponents. The game seamlessly blends card play with strategic decision-making, offering a dynamic experience where every move counts. Navigate the trick-taking rounds with cunning and precision as you strategically play your cards to score points and gain an edge over your rivals. But that's not all – in Bulbous, strategic character control adds a whole new dimension to gameplay. Utilize your characters' unique abilities and resources to influence the game's outcome, thwart your opponents' plans, and seize victory for yourself.

Experience a game of strategy, luck, and underground wonders, and embark on a tasty adventure like no other. Are you ready to unearth the wonders of Baelbulb and charm your way to victory in Bulbous?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Advantage Token, Area Majority / Influence, End Game Bonuses, Predictive Bid, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Trick-taking

name: Zombiequerque
description:
Discover the Story

In the heart of the arid desert of Albuquerque, an abandoned scrapyard on the outskirts of the city has become the last bastion of humanity in the region – Zombiequerque! Struggling to survive, the few remaining survivors face a terrible threat: hordes of flesh-hungry zombies preparing for a devastating attack. The countdown has begun, and it’s up to you to use your tactical skills to save humanity from extinction.

Strategy is the Key

Every move you make is crucial – plan your tactical moves to take control of the Zombiequerque scrapyard. Each play offers the opportunity to capture invading zombies or weaken the survivor army – the players decide. The battle for survival requires cunning, anticipation, and a touch of daring to overcome overwhelming odds.

Heritage of the Classic Alquerque

Zombiequerque is an exciting variation of the ancient game Alquerque, which gave rise to the famous checkers game we know today. Mixing traditional elements with a modern touch of the zombie apocalypse, this game offers a unique and engaging experience that challenges your strategic skills.

Game Highlights

Exciting combination of classic strategy and apocalyptic theme. Stunning art that brings the arid desert and the eerie figures of zombies to life. Gameplay accessible to players of all ages but with strategic depth for enthusiasts. Engaging setting and captivating story that immerse players in the desperate struggle for survival.

Get ready to face the undead, make tough decisions, and fight for the survival of humanity.

Are you ready for battle?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement

name: Mage Dice
description:
Mage Dice is a speed, memory, dice rolling, puzzle building board game playable at any experience level. Play styles can vary from fast paced and frantic to slow and methodical. It is up to each Apprentice to decide how they will complete their Spell Puzzle.

As an Apprentice Mage you gather Essence with your dice. That Essence is used to examine face down Puzzle Shards in the Nether on the game board. If you reveal a Puzzle Shard that matches your dice color, you may place it face up in front of you. If you reveal a Puzzle Shard that does not match your dice color, you must place it face down back in the Nether. The Apprentice who reveals all their Puzzle Shards and completes their Spell Puzzle first, wins the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Dice, Fantasy, Memory, Party Game, Puzzle, Real-time
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Race, Speed Matching

name: Equation Builder
description:
Equation Builder is a three-tiered mathematics-based deck building game that teaches Pre-K to 8th grade.

Players begin with a 10 card personal deck from one of six decks (red, orange, yellow, green or purple) made of single digit number and mathematic symbols. Which is used, on their turn, to create their best equation.

Players earn cards, depending on their knowledge, from up to four decks (the community, copper, silver or gold). Earned cards are added to the player's personal deck and used in future equations in the game.

The game ends when one of the non-personal decks has been exhausted or after a preset number of rounds. The players count points gained from their cards. The winner is the player with the most points.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math, Number
mechanics: Deck Construction, Variable Set-up

name: The Ardennes Offensive: Panzer Dice 4, in the Bulge
description:
Between December 16, 1944 and January 25, 1945, the largest offensive of the German Army on the Western Front took place, called the Ardennes Offensive or The Battle of the Bulge. It was the last gamble to effectively confront the Allied forces advancing towards Berlin after the landing in Normandy. The objective was to take the strategic port of Antwerp in Belgium so that the Allies would deploy on two fronts and thus fight them separately.

Panzer Dice 4, In the Bulge, is the fourth part of the classic Roll and Write solitaire game, Panzer Dice. This time set in the Battle of the Bulge and is made up of four titles, of which two are German missions and two are American missions about this chapter of the Second World War.

The Ardennes Offensive is the first episode of this series, in which you assume the role of the commanding general of the 5th, 6th and 7th Panzer Armies that set out from the Siegfried Line to cross the thick forest of the Ardennes and take by surprise the allied divisions that were on their way to Antwerp.

—description from the designer
categories: Dice, Print & Play, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Nine Oils
description:
Tis the year 1861 and the snake oil trade is thriving. Thou art commencing a venture in the snake oil business and intend to establish a market stall to begin hawking thy own snake oil brand. As the business prospers, thou shalt need to improve thy stall, replenish thy stock, and sway influential figures to dominate and undermine thy rivals. Good fortune!

Nine Oils is a Print and Play game, where players stack snake oil bottles on their street market stall.

Players will try their luck with the dice and make dice combinations to influence people to help them fulfill the task.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: La Fuga di Velia
description:
On 10 June 1924 Giacomo Matteotti was kidnapped and murdered in Rome by a fascist squad for having denounced electoral fraud before the advent of the dictatorship in Italy. When nothing was yet known about his killers, but there were strong suspicions about the instigators, his wife Velia met Mussolini at Palazzo Chigi to ask for the return of her husband's body.

The Duce denies his involvement, but upon the widow's return to the large family villa in Fratta Polesine, the black cars of the secret police begin to tail the woman...

In three chapters Velia will have to leave Fratta Polesine and get to Rovigo station to catch the train.

La Fuga di Velia is a title produced by the State Archives of Rovigo on the occasion of the centenary of the death of Giacomo Matteotti, a socialist deputy from Rovigo who, with his own sacrifice, became the most courageous opponent of the fascist regime.

An escape room, capable of revealing a fundamental chapter of Italian history through the resolution of elaborate puzzles, from the point of view of a victim of the dictatorship.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Il 10 Giugno 1924 Giacomo Matteotti fu rapito e assassinato a Roma da una squadra fascista per aver denunciato i brogli elettorali prima dell’avvento della dittatura in Italia. Quando ancora nulla si sapeva sui suoi assassini, ma forti erano i sospetti sui mandanti, la moglie Velia incontra Mussolini a Palazzo Chigi per chiedere la restituzione della salma del marito.

Il Duce nega il suo coinvolgimento, ma al ritorno della vedova nella grande villa di famiglia a Fratta Polesine le auto nere della polizia segreta iniziano a pedinare la donna…

In tre capitoli Velia dovrà uscire da Fratta Polesine ed arrivare alla stazione di Rovigo per prendere il treno.

La Fuga di Velia è un titolo prodotto dall’Archivio di Stato di Rovigo in occasione del centenario della morte di Giacomo Matteotti, deputato socialista rodigino che divenne con il proprio sacrificio il più coraggioso oppositore del regime fascista.

Un’escape room da tavolo unica nel suo genere, in grado di svelare attraverso la risoluzione di elaborati enigmi un capitolo fondamentale della Storia italiana, dal punto di vista di una vittima della dittatura.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game
publishers: Archivio di Stato di Rovigo, Officina Meningi

name: The Cursed Artifact
description:
It’s 1942, and your country needs you. Word comes down from military command that certain lost antiquities may hold the power to sway the war in their favor. Your job is to obtain those artifacts by any means necessary; compete to control dig sites, gain powerful equipment, recruit workers, and steal from your adversaries. But beware - the most powerful artifacts impart a curse upon anyone who holds them. Can you make it to your exfiltration before the curse takes its hold on you?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling

name: Order of the Blade
description:
Assassins from around the world have been brought together for the next recruitment tournament organized by a shadow society known as the Order of the Blade. The Order, comprised of the most skilled assassins globally, hosts this tournament to assess potential new members and determine who merits a place among their elite ranks.

The rules of the tournament are straightforward: each assassin must utilize their skills and abilities to eliminate all other contestants, with the last one standing declared the champion. The Order of the Blade employs their most effective mercenary soldiers as their Shadow Guard to enforce the tournament's rules. During lulls in combat, they march in on the participants, making it perilous to maneuver outside the designated tournament space. The prize for winning is a coveted place within the ranks of the Order, along with the admiration of those who dwell in the shadows. Embrace this challenge, test your skills against the world's best, and prove your worth to become the newest member of the Order of the Blade.


Includes rules for a team, co-op & mini royale variations.


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Environmental, Fighting, Modern Warfare
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Line of Sight, Map Reduction, Modular Board, Movement Points, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Player Elimination, Square Grid, Turn Order: Claim Action, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Dune: War for Arrakis – Desert War
description:
Desert War is a new expansion for Dune: War for Arrakis that introduces new units for both the Harkonnen and Atreides factions, further detailing the harsh reality of the conflict fought on the burning surface of planet Dune.

Expert Fremen Sandriders summon giant sandworms and ride them into battle with unparalleled skill. Fremen Rocket Launchers emerge from their Fremen Camps to fire at Herversters and Ornithopters.

Suspensor Troopers scout ahead to make surprise attacks, withstanding the desert hazards like few can. Escort Ornithopters not only help move Legions around but offer direct support to them in battle.

This new expansion introduces new units for both the Harkonnen and Atreides factions, providing new tactical options for players.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Events, Simulation, Team-Based Game

name: Légende: L'Ascension des Héros
description:
Embark as intrepid heroes ready to tackle perilous dungeons teeming with monsters and littered with vile traps. Cooperate and master your abilities to overcome the trials. Harvest incredible treasures to enhance your skills.

Become a true legend by completing a campaign. "Légende" is a cooperative and evolving dungeon crawler board game where players explore dungeons, battle monsters, avoid traps, and seek treasures to fulfill a quest. Structured into four campaigns, each campaign consists of three linked scenarios, offering a narrative and evolving experience over multiple playthroughs.

With a system of random tiles, each scenario provides infinite replayability as the dungeon layout varies with each game.

Players must work together to overcome the dungeon challenges, manage their hand of cards, and evolve their characters throughout the scenarios to become true legends.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Exploration, Fantasy
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Legacy Game, Market, Variable Player Powers

name: Consultants of IT
description:
Your IT department is under attack! Defend it with your legendary IT consultants in this fantasy CCG.

The players take turns playing as attacker or defender, managing their budget. The loser of each skirmish depletes part of the budget.

Will you go bankrupt—or be crowned King of Consultants?
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction

name: Gunslinger
description:
Gunslingers each have 3 hearts (shells)
They are dealt 5 cards from the main deck.
Each Gunslinger looks at their hand for an Attack or Item card.
(Any card can be played face down as a "Shoot" card)
The Gunslinger holds their chosen card up, at eye level, facing themself so as not to let other Gunslingers know what they will be playing. All Gunslingers must have Steely Eyed Glares on their faces.
When the Dealer (a chosen Gunslinger or non player) says "GO!!!" all Gunslingers throw their cards at their targeted Gunslinger. Attack cards are thrown at opposing Gunslingers. Item cards are thrown in front of the Gunslinger throwing the card.
If a Gunslinger is attacked they may play Defense cards on top of the attack cards. A Gunslinger may play as many Defense cards as they like in response to an attack.
Gunslingers may play Special cards, if the requirements are met.
Gunslingers lose hearts for any damage that is not negated.
All damage is dealt at the same time.

Gunslingers with hearts remaining at the end of the round are dealt 2 cards. Continue rounds like this until 1 or No Gunslingers remain.

Things to know:
There is no maximum hand size. You can have as many as you are dealt.
The deck is never reshuffled. If you run out of cards, you run out of bullets.
You can't Bleed a Barrel.
If there are Gunslingers alive and no one has cards in their hand, the Gunslinger with the "Knife" card equipped wins (Because they brought a knife to a gunfight).
Fastest game is 13 seconds.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, American West, Bluffing, Card Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Ziegen jagen！
description:
You want to live in nature, so you decided to start a goat farm. First you bought a large plot of land full of grass, and then you built a fence. Now the real work begins. Barter for goats, breed them, and ship them out. Your goal is to become a full-fledged goat rancher.

What is Ziegen jagen? This game is a two-player abstract game with a ranch theme. The primary mechanic resembles Kalah or Mancala, which have been played since ancient times. However, in this game, the Mancala has evolved into something unusual and mysterious, creating elements that feel like worker placement, expanding options, area majority, and set collection. It is truly the "future of fun."

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Mancala

name: DinoCourse
description:
Embark on a prehistoric adventure where speed, strategy, and excitement collide! DinoCourse offers a frenetic race through prehistoric landscapes, where dinosaurs mounted on quads compete for victory.

With dynamic gameplay mechanics, strategic choices at every turn, and modular terrain tiles, each game is a unique and thrilling experience.

Throughout the race, players must collect food, herbs, and meat to purchase upgrades for their vehicles! Use these resources skillfully to unlock powerful vehicle upgrades and gain an advantage over your opponents!

DinoCourse offers fast-paced races of about 20 minutes, accessible to everyone from 7 years old. Choose from six unique dinosaurs, use a hand of numbered cards to advance. Explore a variety of game modes suitable for different group sizes.

Get ready to experience unforgettable prehistoric adventures with your friends and family.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Race, Set Collection, Speed Matching, Track Movement

name: Petryk & ten elephants
description:
Game based on Ukrainian cartoon how Petryk counted little elephants. Clever elephants conspired that will appear in certain conditions so Petryk needs your help.

At your turn you will place a toy in one of two available regions. If in result you get 3 or more toys in a row then one of the elephants will appear and occupy a spot in the middle of that row.

The game will end when all elephants will be counted or no empty spots available but be attentive because not only elephants will give you a victory points – area majority in every region also will be taken into account.

—description form the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Gambler
description:
Gunslingers each have 3 hearts (coins)
They are dealt 5 cards from the main deck.
Beer and Whiskey cards may be played in front of a Gunslinger before the game starts or between rounds.
Each Gunslinger looks at their hand for an Attack, Item or Skill card.
(Any card can be played face down as a "Punch" card)
The Gunslinger holds their chosen card up, at eye level, facing themself so as not to let other Gunslingers know what they will be playing. All Gunslingers must have Steely Eyed Glares on their faces.
When the Dealer (a chosen Gunslinger or non-player) says "GO!!!" all Gunslingers throw their cards at their targeted Gunslinger. Attack cards are thrown at opposing Gunslingers. Item and Skill cards are thrown in front of the Gunslinger throwing the card.
If a Gunslinger is attacked, they may play Defense cards on top of the attack cards. A Gunslinger may play as many Defense cards as they like in response to an attack.
Gunslingers may play Special cards, if the requirements are met.
Gunslingers lose hearts for any damage that is not negated.
All damage is dealt at the same time.

Gunslingers with hearts remaining at the end of the round are dealt 2 cards. Continue rounds like this until 1 or No Gunslingers remain.

Things to know:
There is no maximum hand size. You can have as many as you are dealt.
The deck is never reshuffled. If you run out of cards, you run out of fight.
If there are Gunslingers conscious and no one has cards in their hand no one wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, American West, Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Tech Race
description:
In Tech Race, you become the CEO of a tech startup in a futuristic world, starting by placing your first office on the map and developing your initial technology.

The goal is to race to the highest startup valuation, outwitting your competitors every step of the way.

The game takes place over a maximum of 12 rounds. Each round comprises 3 phases: Staffing, Action, and Lobbying.


Staffing: You hire and train employees to unlock new abilities and build your company. Each employee needs a salary, so you need to keep an eye on your payroll costs.
Action: You use your employees’ actions to drive demand, expand your territories, obtain customers/ steal from your competitors, and collect resources to develop futuristic technologies. Resources are limited, but you can exchange or buy resources from other players.
Lobbying: Starting in round 3, three policy cards are drawn every round. You may bid for your desired policy to earn rewards or trigger chaotic events. The policy with the highest total bid from all players gets selected.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, End Game Bonuses, Income, Market, Race, Simulation, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Trading, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Diktat
description:
Diktat is an placement, developpement and diplomacy game set in the NOC role-playing universe. It is designed for 2 to 5 players and 90-minute games.

At the begining of each turn, opportunities appear in the city, represented by cards. These cards enable you to form alliances with important groups, bribe powerful peoples, exploit recent scientific discoveries or make your presence felt at important events.

Players take it in turns to perform maneuvers to win these opportunities, or to earn Influence markers in the city's districts.

The basic maneuver consists of sending a team of agents onto the game board. Henchmen, guards, emissaries… Players secretly place their pawns on the board. At the end of the turn, the player who has the greatest number of Emissaries in a sector can take an opportunity card or an Influence marker first.

The second maneuver is to spy. The player can look at two face-down game elements: opponent's pawn or hidden opportunity card

The third maneuver consists of carrying out an assassination.
The player designates an opposing pawn and turns it over. If it is an Emissary, the assassination succeeds and the player gains 3 power points. If it is a guard, the assassin is captured and it is the assassin who must pay his opponent.

Power points are used in particular to unlock the special abilities of the factions, which are very asymmetrical.

The Others constitute an autonomous faction, opposed to all players. These monsters from the NOC universe are trying to invade the city and, if players cannot put their conflicts aside to unite against this force of evil when the need arises, they all risk losing the game.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Bribery, Hidden Movement, Negotiation, Secret Unit Deployment, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Zone of Control

name: Stargazers
description:
You are space enthusiast and artist, looking through your telescope at the universe and drawing what you see as a mural on your wall. You take photos, trace constellations, observe rocket launches, and journal every experience along the way to craft your beautiful artwork.

In Stargazers, you select tiles and tokens from the universe board that represent a collection of different observations you make through your telescope. Those tiles and tokens are then placed into your mural to create different connection points and features to score a variety of drafted objectives. Create the most beautiful and well-designed mural to celebrate your love of the cosmos!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Basalt
description:
Basalt is a dynamic connection game set on the side of an exploding volcano. It is played on the hexagonal tiles of a triangular shaped grid of side length 9, using Black and Red checkers. Before the game, the three corners of the board are filled with a checker (two Black, one Red). Red moves first.

Players control a stack if the top checker in the stack is of their designated color. On each turn, players take N checkers (where N is any number from 1 to stack size) from the top of a stack you control and move them N spaces in straight lines to a destination containing N or less checkers. Then, a new checker of that color is added to the destination. Stacks may not jump over enemies, but may land on enemy or friendly stacks, thereby burying them. If you have no legal moves, you must pass. You win if you have connected all three edges by a connected group of stacks you control (corners count for both edges).

NOTE: This game may optionally be played using a pie rule, in which the Host places 1 or 2 checkers of each color anywhere on the board (in any configuration), and the Guest chooses whether to play first as Red, or second as Black.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Connections, Deduction, Stacking and Balancing

name: Kingdom Combat: Imperials
description:
Kingdom Combat is a unique mix of a strategy card game and a tabletop war simulation. Choose your faction and build a deck from an expansive collection of impressive units, dynamic events, and surprising dirty tricks. Build up your homelands with interesting structures to gain resources to play even more powerful cards.

Kingdom Combat is a strategy card game designed for 2 or more players. You assume the role of the ruler of a faction. March your army across the battlefield and annihilate any hope of your opponents recovery from your devastating destruction left behind.

When you purchase a faction, you will receive the entire set! Everything you need to create multiple decks is included in the box. Here at Double Aye Games we have never been a fan of games where you have continuously buy packs and chase down the most powerful cards. We believe that it should be an even playing field and everyone should have access to the same pool of resources and cards. Depending on what deck you build and what strategy you use is the determining factor of who is victorious!

The Imperials bring their full strength and honor to the battlefield. Relying on the might of fast calvary and devine healing, they fight to spread the greatness of their leader’s might throughout the realm.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, City Building, Fantasy, Medieval, Renaissance, Wargame
mechanics: Alliances, Area Movement, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Moving Multiple Units, Player Elimination, Set Collection

name: Raise The Flag
description:
Yaaarrl!!
Hey privateers!! Get on board this pirate ship to set sail the seas, gain fame, fortune and become true pirates!

Once you face the dangers of the journey and your treacherous companions, only one will become the new captain.

But beware! Don't let the ship sink or all shall meet their end in the cold waters.

Prepare your best weapons and tricks to be the best pirate!

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Dice, Exploration, Humor, Negotiation, Party Game, Pirates
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Events, Modular Board, Negotiation, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Clash of Katanas
description:
The power of the Shogunate is in shambles, and Japan has fallen into the chaos of the Sengoku Jidai (warring states). Daimyos lead their clans into battle, fighting to become the next Shogun, while peasants rise in revolt. But those are the problems of lords and generals, yours is to lead your men, and achieve honor and glory for your house!

Hard Cover, 166 pages

New rules, characters, traits and equipment

Army lists for 9 major clans of the late Sengoku period and also for Ikko Ikki, Pirates, Ming Chinese, Joseon Koreans, and the Iga uprising

Includes an extensive historical outline of the period by renowned expert Terje Solum author of the Saga of the Samurai books.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Renaissance, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Alpha Clash: Unrivaled
description:
Unrivaled is the third official set for the Alpha Clash TCG featuring all new support!

The Discarded have arrived to wreak havoc on the Clashground with their Ambush abilities, led by the gruesome leader, Lord Krung.

Other Contenders such as LINN, Cao Ling, Magnate, and Flare also enter the fight and give support to new and existing characters, affiliations, and colors. This set is a game-changing set to the Alpha Clash TCG.
categories: Book, Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Science Fiction
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Power Brawl
description:
Power Brawl is a print-and-play, single-player card game. It consists of only 7 cards, and is played entirely within one hand. Each round, the player will rearrange the cards within their hand to set up the best offensive strikes, supporting moves, and surprising combos.

Each card, representing one super-powered character, can be used in 8 different ways, depending on whether that character is a heroes or villain, healthy or wounded, and attacking or defending. Once all villains in your hand are removed, the heroes win!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: S.O.B.
description:
S.O.B. is a dynamic card game filled with Bandits, Duels, and a Few Sons of Bandits.

Players take turns acting out cards from the Bandit deck. Guess the word, and earn the Bandit. But beware....some of the outlaws are S.O.B.s!

Strategically Duel opponents to steal Bandits or become the new Sheriff in town.

Goal is to collect the most Bandits before time runs out.

Can be played in either teams or individuals.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Acting, Take That

name: Vices and Vengeance Dice
description:
Engage in this thrilling, strategic dice game where role-playing steps aside for a mix of strategy and chance. Friends turned rivals face off in intense battles, rolling and scoring dice. Defenders navigate the treacherous effects of the 7 Deadly Sins and epic mythical clashes, while attackers aim to sabotage their opponents’ high scores. Experience the rush of dice-driven excitement—get ready to roll!

Unveil your darker side and get ready to battle your nemeses in Vices and Vengeance—a simple, yet thrilling dice game where heavenly virtues are nowhere in sight. In this perilous world, the Seven Deadly Sins reign, and your goal is to outmaneuver and out-roll your opponents while keeping your score as low as possible. Silver Bullets and Mirrors may be your key to success, but be careful, though; reaching 70 points, often the number of forgiveness, could spell your doom!

The Seven Sins have Colors! You will play with:

7 larger 6-sided Sin dice (16mm): Lust (Blue), Gluttony


(Orange), Greed (Gold), Sloth (Light Blue), Wrath
(Red), Envy (Green), & Pride (Purple).

7 smaller 6-sided Sin Dice (14mm).
1 special 6-sided Pride Die: Purple metal.
7 "Nemesis” dice: 20-sided & sin-colored.
6 Mythical Match-up 6-sided dice pairs: Mirror & Medusa, David & Goliath (Maroon - 25mm & 12mm), the Silver Bullet & Werewolf.
3 Spoiler dice: 12-sided (black), 10-sided (gray), & 8-sided dice (white).
2 rolling trays with a removable foam insert.
7 sin-colored "tracker" tokens.


THE GAME
Assign the Sins

Determine the first player by the highest roll on any 20-sided die (d20). Play goes clockwise.
The first player rolls the "Mirror" die along with the 7 (16mm) sin dice. That player chooses from any sins matching the mirror die. If none match, roll again. The next rolls 6 sins, etc. until all players have a sin.
Each player receives their 16mm sin die, the matching d20 (Nemesis die), and sin token.
A player with Pride also gets the metal purple "Pride" die.


Everybody Rolls!

The player whose turn it is is called the Defending Player (DP). The DP rolls all 7 of the 14mm sin dice, the Mythical Match-up dice, the 12, 10, 8-sided dice, and their d20 Nemesis die to start a turn (* See the example below).
The DP does not roll their 16mm Sin die on their turn.
All other players (Attacking players-APs) roll their 16mm Sin die and their d20 Nemesis die every roll. APs are trying to match the DP's 14 mm sin die of the same color as well as trying to match any Nemesis dice the DP rolls. Upon a match, the DP faces an Effect roll detailed below.
At least one die must be removed/scored each roll. The DP repeats rolls until the end of their turn. Their turn ends after all dice have been scored/removed.


† APs only need to roll dice they can still match to DP's!

Die Removal & Scoring

The DP must remove and score at least one die each roll.
When they have removed all the dice they want to score on a roll, they roll unscored dice again, and the APs roll their dice, too.
Mythical Match-up pairs must be scored in pairs. (See below)
A Matching Nemesis die from any AP must be taken by the DP and rolled next roll. It cannot be scored the turn it matches. The DP may still remove any nemesis die/dice that they rolled. For example, if an AP rolls any 19, and the DP rolls 19, the DP can only remove the 19 that they rolled.


Scoring

The DP wants to score the lowest total in each turn. The way to score low is to roll Max Rolls on dice or match specific dice.
Max Roll: Any die that rolls its maximum number can score 0.
Non-Max Roll: Points add up by 1 for each pip less than the max roll. For Example, an 8 on a 12-sided die scores 4.
Mythical Match-up: If a Mythical Match-up pair matches (e.g., Medusa and Mirror), they both score 0 points! If the bullet lands upright, it is wild and matches any number on the Werewolf die.
DP's Matching Nemeses or Sins: Any DP rolled Nemesis d20s that match, or any matching penalty Sin dice score 0 points.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Sacred Cipher
description:
Simple actions yield deep strategy in the sacred and enchanted lands of Grunndavell. Vie to build a hallowed village within the secluded forest glades under the watchful boughs of the sacred tree.

Within simple and easy to learn mechanics lies deep strategy, myriads of opportunity costs, and layers of agonizing trade-offs. Think, plan, and build a superior village, understand the mysteries of the Ciphers, and become one with the sacred tree.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deduction, Pattern Recognition, Worker Placement

name: Politics!
description:
Put your people skills to the test in this easy to learn, thrilling, and deceptively engaging game of people-reading, deal-making, and politicking.

Make deals to buy votes to further your agenda while limiting the success of your opponents’ agendas. Negotiate, deceive, deal, and betray. All is fair when furthering your agenda.

Now onward, you diminutive miscreant! For party, for self, and for the agenda!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Bribery, Negotiation, Voting

name: Similarities
description:
Showcase your command of the language with Similarities! In the time allowed, find as many synonyms for the chosen word as you can. List as many as you can and get points for matching the synonyms listed.

Or, you can take a risk and list a single antonym. If you match this, then you get the most points, but beware, if you miss on the antonym, its points count against your total.

So are you excited? Elated? Trepid? Nervous? Ambitious? Get ready for a robust game that engages and exercises your brain.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Memory

description:
In this game you will assume the role of a powerful Mentapol, a thought policeman of the single party Ingsoc, and your goal is to increase the party's power by controlling the inhabitants of London. Keep in mind that your fellow Mentapoles are also vying for power, and if Winston Smith reaches the Golden Country, your fate will be the terrible Room 101. The Ingsoc will reward you with Victory Points as you achieve the game's objectives. The Mentapol with the most VP at the end of the game will be proclaimed the winner.

At each turn, you will have to make important decisions, such as deciding what propaganda to distribute, what fake news to spread, and how to manipulate the population to support the party. In addition, you will have to be on guard against your own fellow players, who will also be trying to increase their power and weaken yours.
mechanics: Action/Event, Hand Management, Hidden Roles, Multi-Use Cards

name: BioForge
description: BioForge lets your creativity shine in a fast-paced Creature Creator Card Game for 2+ players. Over the course of the game, you will draft and build your creature and face off against your rival's own challenger. Mixing in-depth strategy as you combine different animal attributes with luck of the die roll will leave you never playing the same game twice.
mechanics: Action Drafting, Dice Rolling, Stat Check Resolution

name: Chrono Fall: At the End of Space and Time – Zwischen den Dimensionen Promo Pack
description:
The promo pack offers you the scenario Between the Dimensions with additional cards and the wooden token of the space probe Argo. Can you free it from its captivity in hyperspace and save its invaluable data for the fight against the rifts? The pack also includes an additional SPARC profile card: With the Ganymede, the SPARCs can interact even better.

Das Promo Pack bietet dir das Szenario "Zwischen den Dimensionen" mit zusätzlichen Karten und dem Holzspielstein der Raumsonde Argo. Kannst du sie aus ihrer Gefangenschaft im Hyperraum befreien und so ihre wertvollen Daten für den Kampf gegen die Rifts retten? Außerdem ist im Pack eine zusätzliche SPARC-Profilkarte enthalten: Mit der Ganymed können die SPARCs noch besser interagieren.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Events, Hexagon Grid, Pick-up and Deliver, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Variable Player Powers

name: Royaumes: L'Ascension des Trônes
description:
A captivating strategy game where you become the leader of a kingdom seeking domination. Direct your servants to gather resources, construct buildings, launch attacks, and trade with your adversaries to expand your influence and achieve your kingdom's unique objectives.

Easy to learn and intuitive, this game offers an immersive experience where strategy reigns supreme. With its tactical assault and negotiated defense mechanics, players must constantly evaluate risks and rewards in their quest for supremacy. The card selection process offers complex strategic choices, while the variety of buildings and their special abilities allow for deep customization of each kingdom.

The double-sided game boards, which flip under certain conditions to unlock new abilities, provide a mid-game refresh, adding an extra layer of strategy and increased replayability. Dive into this world where every decision matters and lead your kingdom to victory!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Connections, Open Drafting, Resource Queue, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Trading, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Phantom Ink: Arcana
description:
A standalone expansion to the party game Phantom Ink, Phantom Ink: Arcana adds 75 brand new question cards, over 200 new secret objects, a cooperative 2-3 player gameplay mode, and 22 fully-illustrated tarot-themed Arcana cards with unique special abilities to spice up gameplay.

Players form two teams, both competing to identify the same secret object. Teams take turns passing their spirit question cards, like “What would it have as a pet?” or “What is a jumbo version of it called?” Spirits know the secret object, and answer the questions in order to provide clues to help their mediums guess the secret object.

Each turn, the mediums can spend a crystal to play one of their Arcana cards, which gives their team a one-time or permanent bonus to help them figure out the object. For example, increasing their hand size of question cards they can choose from, or letting them secretly learn the next letter of one of their clues.

There’s a catch: the other team doesn’t see what question you asked, but they do see the answer. Mediums call “Silencio” when they know the Clue their Spirit is writing, to make it hard for the other team to learn anything from the Clue.

—description from the publisher
categories: Deduction, Party Game, Puzzle, Word Game
mechanics: Communication Limits, Deduction, Targeted Clues, Team-Based Game

name: Rätselräume
description:
Rätselräume is a captivating, co-operative game that takes you into a mysterious, empty house.

Your task? Investigate the rooms, solve a variety of puzzles and immerse yourself in the moving stories of the former residents. The scenes you unlock tell of different realities of life and the coexistence of a house characterised by conflict, but also by tolerance and solidarity.

The game thematises migration, social change, right-wing violence and resistance to it. It is set in the 1990s and 2000s and opens up references to the present day.

Rätselräume was developed for use in schools from year 7 and other educational contexts. It can be played by large groups of up to 30 people, but also by a single person - and therefore also at home, with family or friends.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Deduction, Educational, Political, Puzzle
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction

name: Anger Smash
description:
Anger Smash is a light strategy set-collecting card game that will have you on the edge of your seat as tensions rise and alliances shift. The theme revolves around the concept of maintaining a balanced state of mind, represented by the Anger and Zen sets you must collect. Ideal for family and travel!

The gameplay is deceptively simple: Players race to collect four matching Anger cards and four matching Zen cards. However, the real excitement comes from the strategic use of Bloodboilers (events that make your blood boil) and Disruptors (sneaky cards that can hinder your opponents). Players must carefully decide whether to focus on building their own sets, sabotaging others, or forming temporary alliances to obstruct the leader.

The game is fast-paced, with each round offering players the choice to draw a new card, take a matching card from the centre pile, or play a BloodBoiler or Disruptor card. The tension ratchets up as players get closer to completing their sets, and a single well-timed move can often determine the winner.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Take That

name: Dungeon Tales: Dark Fantasy Adventures
description:
An exploration and adventure game designed for one or more players set in a dark fantasy world where monstrous creatures watch over ancient treasures and powerful magical objects hidden in the shadows of the most dangerous dungeons.

The players slip into the roles of improvised adventurers, whose dubious pasts will often lead them to unlikely and glorious fates.

Dungeon Tales Dark Fantasy Adventures is a modern version of the great Old School tabletop RPG and Dungeon Crawler classics of the 1990s.

Ideal to be played both with pen and paper or with 28mm and 32mm scale miniatures with modular dungeons tiles.

"Grab your favorite weapon, make sure you have memorized the best spells and don't forget to fill your backpack with torches and healing potions. You're about to tell your first... Dungeon Tales!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Critical Hits and Failures, Grid Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing

name: Advanced Game System III
description:
The Advanced Game System III is an EXPANSION for the famous Board Game: HeroQuest. It is compatible with the expansions: "The Mage Of The Mirror" and "The Rise Of The Dread Moon" (new and old editions).

With the Advanced Game System, you can choose a "Class" and "Level Up" your Hero. You can also purchase "Advanced Equipment" during the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Square Grid, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Gatos de Ulthar
description:
In the enigmatic city of Ulthar, it is well known that no feline can suffer the slightest offense. Thus, countless cats, with their piercing and mysterious gazes, are drawn to this adorable refuge. However, even these innocent-looking creatures have arcane desires and earthly needs such as food, hydration, fun, and rest. Who can help the Cats of Ulthar?

We present a card game for 1 to 4 participants, recommended for ages 4 and up, where players are challenged to satiate the hidden desires of these kittens.

Among the needs to be satisfied, the one who fulfills two of these will emerge victorious in the match!

Objective
Complete TWO Ulthar Cats Quests to win and finish the game.
Each letter of need needs FIVE points to complete.
Playing Cats of Ulthar cards with a need is worth one point. If the letter has the same need printed twice, it is worth TWO points.

Gameplay
The game is played through several rounds consisting of three turns each.
In each round:

Receive three cat cards;
First Turn: Playing a cat card on a need card.
Second Turn: Playing a cat card on another need card (you can't play two cards on the same need in the same round).
Third Turn: Playing a cat card on a need card (not yet used in this round).
Pass the First Player card to the player on the left, who shuffles and deals three cards to each player to start a new round.


—description from the designer

Na enigmática cidade de Ulthar, é sabido que nenhum felino pode sofrer a mais leve ofensa. Assim, inúmeros gatos, com seus olhares penetrantes e misteriosos, são atraídos para este refúgio adorável. Contudo, mesmo essas criaturas de aparência inocente possuem desejos arcanos e necessidades terrenas como alimentação, hidratação, diversão e repouso. Quem poderá ajudar os Gatos de Ulthar?

Apresentamos um jogo de cartas para 1 a 4 participantes, recomendado para maiores de 4 anos, onde os jogadores são desafiados a saciar as vontades ocultas desses gatinhos.

Entre as necessidades a serem satisfeitas, aquele que cumprir duas destas emergirá vitorioso na partida!

Objetivo
Completar DUAS necessidades dos Gatos de Ulthar para vencer e finalizar o jogo.
Cada carta de necessidade precisa de CINCO pontos para ser completa.
Jogando cartas de Gatos de Ulthar com uma necessidade vale um ponto. Caso a carta tenha duas vezes a mesma necessidade impressa vale DOIS pontos.

Gameplay
O jogo é jogado através de várias rodadas formadas por três turnos cada uma delas.
Em cada rodada:

Recebe três cartas de gatos;
Primeiro Turno: Jogar uma carta de gato em uma carta de necessidade.
Segundo Turno: Jogar uma carta de gato em uma outra carta de necessidade (não pode jogar duas cartas na mesma necessidade na mesma rodada).
Terceiro Turno: Jogar uma carta de gato em uma carta de necessidade (ainda não utilizada nesta rodada).
Passar a carta de Primeiro Jogador para o jogador à esquerda, este embaralha e distribui três cartas para cada jogador para iniciar uma nova rodada.


—description from the designer (Portuguese)
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction, Educational, Novel-based, Party Game
mechanics: Drawing, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Conquistadores da Matemática
description:
Through engaging and interactive challenges, children embark on a journey of discovery and conquest, where numbers and operations become valuable allies in the quest for knowledge.

Conquistadores da Matemática is an educational card game, developed in the environment of municipal elementary schools.

Aimed at students from 4 years of age, this game is an ingenious tool that aligns fundamental mathematical skills with the guidelines of the São Paulo Curriculum and the precepts of the National Common Curricular Base (BNCC).

'Objective
To win, the player must complete the TEN mathematical operation cards correctly before their opponents.

Gameplay
Each player is dealt ten mathematical operation cards.
The cards with the results of the trades are left open in the center of the table within reach of all players.
When given the command to start, the players simultaneously open the mathematical operation cards and place the result of each operation on top of each one.
At the end of the resolution of the ten cards, if the player who finishes correctly first is the winner of the game.

—description from the designer

Através de desafios envolventes e interativos, as crianças embarcam em uma jornada de descoberta e conquista, onde números e operações se transformam em aliados valiosos na busca pelo conhecimento.

Conquistadores da Matemática é um card game educacional, elaborado no ambiente de escolas municipais de ensino básico.

Destinado a estudantes a partir dos 4 anos de idade, este jogo é uma ferramenta engenhosa que alinha as competências matemáticas fundamentais com as diretrizes do Currículo Paulista e os preceitos da Base Nacional Comum Curricular (BNCC).

Objetivo
Para vencer o jogador deve completar as DEZ cartas de operações matemáticas de forma correta antes dos seus adversários.

Gameplay
Cada jogador recebe dez cartas de operações matemáticas.
As cartas com os resultados das operações ficam abertas no centro da mesa ao alcance de todos os jogadores.
Ao ser dado o comando de começar, os jogadores simultaneamente abrem as cartas de operações matemáticas e vão colocando em cima de cada uma o resultado de cada operação.
Ao final da resolução das dez cartas, caso o jogador que terminar primeiro de maneira correta, é o vencedor do jogo.

—description from the designer (Portuguese)
mechanics: Hand Management

name: Soluna Explorers
description:
Soluna Explorers is a dynamic card game that offers a simplified D&D experience in under 15 minutes per round.

In Soluna Explorers, players set up a 5x5 grid of location cards, with a boss card at the end. During their turn, players spend gold to move as a group, revealing and battling enemies along the way. Combat involves rolling dice to attack, using loot cards for advantages, and surviving enemy attacks. Players earn gold and loot by defeating enemies. The game is won by the player who deals the final blow to the boss. Quick to learn and play, Soluna Explorers offers an exciting and collaborative adventure. Or you can attempt to complete a journey all on your own.

The game is perfect for both seasoned adventurers and newcomers alike.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Fantasy, Party Game
mechanics: Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Trading

name: Sugarpow: Dice Battle Royale
description:
Step into the sweetest arena in Sugarpow: Dice Battle Royale, where confectionery champions clash in a fast-paced, sugar-fueled showdown! This 2-5 player party game combines quick thinking, strategic drafting, and thrilling dice battles to create an exhilarating gaming experience.

In Sugarpow: Dice Battle Royale, players draft their team from a pool of 33 unique candy-themed fighters, each with their own special abilities and powers. Will you choose the fierce Caramel Champion, the agile Yummy Gummy, or the unpredictable Licorice Ninja? With a diverse cast of characters, each game offers new strategic possibilities and endless replayability.

Once teams are assembled, the battle begins! Players take turns rolling dice to determine their attacks and trigger special abilities, aiming to outmaneuver and outlast their opponents. The game's combination of speed and strategy ensures that no two battles are alike, and quick reflexes and tactical thinking are equally important.

Victory goes to the last team standing in this delectable duel of dice and wits. Whether you're a seasoned gamer or new to the tabletop scene, Sugarpow: Dice Battle Royale offers a deliciously fun and engaging experience for all.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That

name: Fugitives
description:
Fugitives is a story driven, co-operative adventure board game with thrilling story through the beautiful mid-century southern landscape.

In the story, players find themselves on the run but don't know why. The escape turns into an investigation, when you realize the only way out is to confront your enemies.

On your journey your choices matter and you’ll either be the hero or become the villain.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Role Playing

name: Burk
description: Players take turn rolling one of their 9 rune stones (dice) and placing it on the board. Grouping runes with the same number multiplies their value for a greater score. But be careful, if an opponent places a rune with the same value in their connected column, your runes are Burk'ed and must be removed from the board and returned to your pool of rune stones. The round ends once any player places all 9 of their rune stones on the board. The player with the highest score wins the round.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Habits
description:
Habits is a captivating 9-card solitaire game that challenges you to cultivate discipline and meaning in your life.

Each card features a good habit on one side and a bad habit on the other, creating dynamic interactions and strategic decisions. Your goal is to turn all your cards to their good habit side—leaving the bad habit powerless. Carefully trigger positive habits to transform adjacent negative ones, rearrange your cards for maximum future benefits, or protect crucial habits from turning to the dark side.

Exert your time and effort wisely, as bad habits left unchecked can quickly unravel your progress. Strategize effectively to achieve a harmonious balance of good habits and win the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Solo / Solitaire Game

name: World Wonders: Cristo Promo Card
description:
Promo Card for the Monument of Christ Coming with Extras Available During Pre-Sale

The Cristo is a transient piece that is available to all players from the beginning of the game and is worth 3 points to whoever possesses it at the end of the game.

After building 3 Monuments, any player can claim and build the Cristo for free if the requirements are met.

If any other player has more builds than the current player with the Cristo, and meets all the requirements, they can steal the Cristo from the current player.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Star Wars: The Deckbuilding Game – Clone Wars Edition
description:
War! The discovery of the droid factories on Geonosis and the sudden deployment of the Clone Army has set off the Clone Wars. The countless droid legions deployed by the Separatist Alliance have proven to be a fair fight for the Jedi, the guardians of the Galactic Republic. With the fate of the Republic at stake, the galaxy anxiously awaits the outcome...

In Star Wars: The Deckbuilding Game – Clone Wars Edition, the galaxy-spanning war between the Galactic Republic and the Separatist Confederacy comes alive on your tabletop. In this easy-to-learn game, you and your opponent each choose a side, playing as either the Republic or the Separatists, and as the game progresses you both strengthen the power of your starting decks and work to destroy each other's bases. The first player to destroy three of their opponent's bases wins!

This game can be played on its own or combined with the original edition of Star Wars: The Deckbuilding Game.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Tug of War

name: HeroQuest: Jungles of Delthrak
description:
The adventure continues with the HeroQuest Jungles of Delthrak Quest Pack! In the dense jungle surrounding the mountains at World’s Edge, an ancient dwarven civilization finds new roots. A sacred artifact prized by the dwarven refugees of Kellar’s Keep has been stolen, and a blight has infected the jungle to its roots. As a powerful Berserker or Explorer hero, traverse the jungles and discover what vile secret looms beneath its canopy – before all is lost! Follow your path to unique endings through a choose-your-own adventure mechanic. Includes a Quest Book featuring 16 quests, 36 illustrated game cards, 29 detailed miniatures, and 39 double-sided cardboard pieces.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Grid Movement, Role Playing, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Roll / Spin and Move, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Semi-Cooperative Game, Storytelling, Turn Order: Pass Order, Variable Player Powers

name: UpDogs
description:
UpDogs is the game of upsets and underdogs!

Play as one of four rival dog packs battling opponents for territory! The winner of any dog fight stacks their piece on top of the opponent, thereby eliminating the opponent's Dog and creating a dog pile. Taller piles have better odds in a fight. But watch out, even the smallest piece has a chance to upset the odds and change the powers at large! The Top Dog has the best odds of all, but there can only be one. Do you dare risk one of your Dogs for a chance to become the next Top Dog, or strategically send one of your hidden Underdogs that have the power to shift the odds in its favor?

The winner of the game is the player that remains after all opponents' pieces have been eliminated.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Alliances, Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, King of the Hill, Moving Multiple Units, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Kingdom Combat: Necronians
description:
From the depths of the underworld and the shadowy corners of your nightmares comes the Necronians. Drawing their power from fear, they strike before even being detected. Creeping up from the ground and becoming even stronger by their growing numbers.

Kingdom Combat is a unique mix of a strategy card game and a tabletop war simulation. Choose your faction and build a deck from an expansive collection of impressive units, dynamic events, and surprising dirty tricks. Build up your homelands with interesting structures to gain resources to play even more powerful cards.

Kingdom Combat is a strategy card game designed for 2 or more players. You assume the role of the ruler of a faction. March your army across the battlefield and annihilate any hope of your opponents recovery from your devastating destruction left behind.

When you purchase a faction, you will receive the entire set! Everything you need to create multiple decks is included in the box. Here at Double Aye Games we have never been a fan of games where you have continuously buy packs and chase down the most powerful cards. We believe that it should be an even playing field and everyone should have access to the same pool of resources and cards. Depending on what deck you build and what strategy you use is the determining factor of who is victorious!
categories: Card Game, City Building, Fantasy, Medieval, Renaissance, Wargame
mechanics: Alliances, Area Movement, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Moving Multiple Units, Player Elimination, Set Collection

name: Kingdom Combat: Mercenaries
description:
Kingdom Combat Mercenaries are thugs for hire. By use of their cunning and sneaky tricks to come up behind you and steal your gold or burn down your village. They will work for the highest bidder and do whatever it takes to get the job done. ​

Kingdom Combat is a unique mix of a strategy card game and a tabletop war simulation. Choose your faction and build a deck from an expansive collection of impressive units, dynamic events, and surprising dirty tricks. Build up your homelands with interesting structures to gain resources to play even more powerful cards.

Kingdom Combat is a strategy card game designed for 2 or more players. You assume the role of the ruler of a faction. March your army across the battlefield and annihilate any hope of your opponents recovery from your devastating destruction left behind.

When you purchase a faction, you will receive the entire set! Everything you need to create multiple decks is included in the box. Here at Double Aye Games we have never been a fan of games where you have continuously buy packs and chase down the most powerful cards. We believe that it should be an even playing field and everyone should have access to the same pool of resources and cards. Depending on what deck you build and what strategy you use is the determining factor of who is victorious!
categories: Card Game, City Building, Fantasy, Medieval, Renaissance, Wargame
mechanics: Alliances, Area Movement, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Moving Multiple Units, Player Elimination, Set Collection

name: Festoon
description:
When bees are creating honeycomb, they connect their legs together to form a chain, called a festoon.

In this game, players compete the be the first to form a festoon. Players take turns placing hexagonal bee tiles adjacent to the other tiles on the table one at a time. The first player who places four bees in a straight line wins.

As players create advantageous patterns and block others, Festoon becomes a game of reluctant cooperation. Players must decide whether it is more advantageous to block another player's festoon or set themselves up for victory. The simple rules and strategic gameplay mean that anybody can play it, but victory can only be achieved by the player whose strategy comes out on top.

Fun for two to six players, this is the perfect strategy party game for you and your friends. Only a few minutes to set up and explain, Festoon is a great warm up for family game night, or a breather between hours-long games.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Connections, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Pieces as Map, Semi-Cooperative Game, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Chummy
description:
Chummy consists of two games: Chummy Chess and Chummy Checkers.

Chummy Chess can be played by two or four players on the same circular game board. Each player commands a complete set of traditional chessmen. The chessmen are moved in a manner similar to traditional 2-player chess. While the original theme of chess has been maintained, Chummy adds several new dimensions which include circular moving, board control, team play, inheriting chessmen, and much more. To win in Chummy, a player must capture all of the opponent’s kings, or use his/her king to control the center of the game board.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Static Capture

name: Degenesis: Clan Wars
description:
Degenesis: Clan Wars is an asymmetric, semi-cooperative, tactical-scale skirmish wargame in which one player embodies the Hostile, who controls the swarms of Cockroaches and Clanners ready to tear the Protectorate and its citizens to shreds, while everyone else takes on the role of individual Cult members: powerful, iconic figures ready to tip the balance of the Clan Wars in their favor.

Throughout the expansive campaign contained within the box, players have to manage their roster of characters, make life-and-death decisions in every moment, struggle to keep their team together in the face of overwhelming opposition, battle against the Hostile's own objectives and goals, and, hopefully, survive...if they’re lucky.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Semi-Cooperative Game, Storytelling, Take That, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Poetic License
description:
Poetic License is a word drafting and poem crafting game where players, or “poets,” simultaneously compose creative poems, refine their poems using their poetic license, and narrate their finished pieces with dramatic or comedic flair.

After each round, poets assign “snaps,” or victory points, to their favorite poems. The poet with the most snaps after two rounds wins!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Educational, Humor, Word Game
mechanics: Hidden Victory Points, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Turn Order: Claim Action, Voting

name: Dark Blood
description:
Dark Blood plunges players into the abyss of darkness, where they embody powerful asymmetrical cults striving for dominance over a hapless village. Whether as the cult of the Demonologist, Warlock, Necromancer, or Doomsayer, players must adeptly recruit villagers or harvest their blood to empower their sinister rituals.
Through a fusion of Area Majority, Worker placement and Resource gathering, they vie with one another, navigating the perilous path of corruption, enhancing their Rituals, and staining various parts of the village to seize territories and augment their Taint (Victory Points). With each round introducing fresh challenges and opportunities, players must judiciously balance their strategies to outmaneuver their adversaries and emerge as the foremost cult as the fifth round draws to a close.
Game Overview:
Each player delves into their spellbook, serving as their player board, to oversee their Cultists, amass Resources, and upgrade their Rituals. The main board grants access to the five pivotal locations where the four cults will contend for control, eventually corrupting them.
At the outset of each round, during the Upkeep phase, these locations undergo random variations in the number of available Peasants, the resources they yield and more...
In the Placement phase, all cults place their workers (Cultist Miniatures) in these locations, determining the actions their cult can execute in each one. The majority in each location dictates not only special actions but also the initiative in which these actions will unfold.
Subsequently, in the Resolve phase, each cult assigns their cultists to diverse actions, from resource gathering for Ritual upgrades to hanging peasants at the Tree of the Damned to bolster their Dark Favor. Crucially, each cultist can be designated to various Rituals in the player Spellbook, with distinct effects such as Proselytizing other Peasants to expand your cult or Sacrificing peasants to procure their blood. Several additional Rituals are available, but the paramount one is Corrupting the land, which, when enhanced, may summon your Cult's Monstrosity!
In the final phase, players Defile the land and bid their accumulated Blood to dominate the most corrupted location. The number of Sigils placed by each player significantly influences the ultimate outcome. As the fifth round concludes, the locations you corrupted, along with other factors such as your cult's size, upgraded Rituals, secret quest, concealed Taint and more, will determine the prevailing cult.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Hidden Victory Points, Solo / Solitaire Game, Take That, Worker Placement, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid – S.P.D. Ranger Pack
description:
Say hello to the five original Rangers of S.P.D.’s B-Squad: the roguish leader Jack Landors, the by-the-books Sky Tate, the oddball Bridge Carson, the cunning Z Delgado, and the ever-forceful Syd Drew. These Space Patrol Delta members all bring new abilities to the battlefield. This crack team is here to save the galaxy!

This is an expansion and Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid is required to play.

Features

Adding S.P.D Rangers to Heroes of the Grid!
5 new Ranger figures, plus character cards & combat decks for each.
5 new Zord cards & 2 Megazord cards
Compatible with all Guardian System Releases

Contents

5 Ranger Figures
5 Character Cards
50 Combat Cards
5 Zord Cards
2 Megazord Cards

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Unspecified

name: The Weird-Ohs Game
description:
The Weird-Ohs Game, Ideal, 1964.

Theme based on the Hawk Model Co. Model Kits, "The Weird-Ohs", which were hot-rod designs by William "Bill" Campbell. (Similar to the drag-racing monster-like characters of Ed "Big Daddy" Roth and Stanley Mouse).

These were a huge hit in 1963/64, and this game follows their theme. (Some may remember this as a cartoon from the late 90's with different artwork.)

A spin-the-spinner and move game, with some event cards thrown-in.

Terrific, colorful artwork.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Table Air Combat: Mosquito Fighter variant
description:
Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface. Each ruleset is a self-contained game including cut-out miniatures of one aircraft and a set of rules. All you need are some six-sided dice and some coins to provide weight for the aircraft counters.

Each player has a flight of four fighters, represented by two counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.

TAC is designed for portability: the entire game can fit in a plastic bag. Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

This set is a self-contained rulebook that includes miniatures for the British Mosquito fighter-bomber variant.

In addition to the Mosquito FB VI (fighter-bomber variant), this set also includes:


Mosquito Mk. XVII Tsetse (anti-shipping variant with 57mm cannon)
Mosquito NF VI (radar-equipped night fighter variant)
V-1 Buzz bomb
ground target for Amiens Prison
Ship targets for verpostenboot, sperrbrecher, and Type VIIC U-boat
Bomb hit markers
Barrage balloon clusters
Flak circles


This set contains four scenarios.

Intruder: Night-fighter versions of the Mosquito raid a Luftwaffe airfield at night. Returning Ju-88 bombers are prey, but a Bf-110G night fighter defends.

Operation Jericho: Free French prisoners from the Gestapo by knocking down the prison walls. Fw-190A fighters from a nearby airfield counter-attack.

Operation Crossbow: Intercept V-1 flying bombs before they strike British targets.

Mosquito Bites: Tsetse anti-shipping variants of the Mosquito attack a surfaced U-boat as it transitions though the Bay of Biscay.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Table Air Combat: Mosquito Bomber variant
description:
Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface. Each ruleset is a self-contained game including cut-out miniatures of one aircraft and a set of rules. All you need are some six-sided dice and some coins to provide weight for the aircraft counters.

Each player has a flight of four fighters, represented by two counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.

TAC is designed for portability: the entire game can fit in a plastic bag. Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

This set is a self-contained rulebook that includes miniatures for the British fast bomber Mosquito.

In addition to the Mosquito, this set also includes:

ground targets for the Gestapo headquarters in Oslo, Schott Glass Factory, andZeiss Optical Factory
Bomb hit markers
Barrage balloon clusters
Flak circles


This set contains five scenarios.

Oslo: A treetop-level surgical strike against the Gestapo HQ in Norway, upon request of the Norwegian government-in-exile. Fw-190A fighters defend.

Operation Oyster: Brave heavy flak and defending Fw-190A fighters to bomb an electronic research plant in Nazi-occupied Holland.

Schott Glass: Heavy flak protects Jena in Germany, where Mosquitos need to hit two factories.

Pathfinder: Mosquitos use the cover of night to drop illumination flares on a target, paving the way for an imminent Lancaster strike. A Bf-110G night fighter hunt.

Photoreconnaissance: Armed with only cameras, a Mosquito element must fly over locations to photograph and then return to get the film developed. Bf-109F fighters defend, while a Spitfire V provides close escort.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: ハリーガール (Hurry Girl)
description:
Hurry Girl (ハリーガール) those famous scenes from anime and manga with a girl running to school with toast in her mouth, only to collide with someone. The game includes 2 toast tiles, negative chips, and cards showing male and female students from three different schools. Matching cards have the same color background as well as similar uniforms. There are also four Whoopsy! cards that do not have a match but act as a game timer.

All cards are dealt into draw piles for each player, and players take turns flipping cards onto their personal discard piles. When two different player's face-up cards show a matching boy and girl whose pictures are facing toward each other, those two players crash into one another. As long as the cards are facing the right direction, players will crash even if the cards are upside down or other players are between them. Crashing players must make a pre-determined exclamation ("Watch out!" "Ouch!"). Players not directly involved in the crash must try to be the first to "catch" (touch) the toast tile. In larger games, both toast tiles are used. If the crashing players fail to speak up before the toast is caught, or if uninvolved player fail to be the first to touch the toast, they must take a negative chip.

When a Whoopsy card is flipped over, all players must try to touch the toast first, or else they receive a negative chip. The Whoopsy card is set aside, and players put their discard piles at the bottom of their decks continue. When the fourth Whoopsy card is flipped, the game ends.

The publisher compares Hurry Girl (ハリーガール) to Halli Galli, and the name even appears to be a reference to that game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Real-Time

name: Sleuth the Bomb
description:
The players are divided into two groups, the "Detectives" and the "Bomber," and each group aims to achieve different victory conditions.
The detective's only condition for victory is to reveal six copies each of the "Bomb" and the corresponding "Bomb defuse key."
The bomber's victory condition is the achievement of one of three conditions.
The only action is to guess the card held by the player to the left and declare the "keyword".

Each keyword corresponds to several kinds of cards.
If you want to reveal a particular card, the player to your left chooses it.
If he/she finds out that you are the "enemy", he/she will reveal other cards "on purpose".

Find your teammates and achieve your victory conditions.
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Roles

name: Tiger Meet
description:
The game represent a simulation of aircraft maneuvers, which are held in Western Europe every year. All squadrons participating in maneuvers have image of a tiger in their emblem. The first such exercise was held back in 1949.

This is a game for 2 or 4 players. Each player has one base with airport. In the base are anti-aircraft guns, ammunition depot, radar, ... The game has 3 levels. In the first level are light attack aircrafts and fighter-bombers. In the second level supersonic attacker aircrafts are added, and in the third level interceptors are added. The planes are armed with guns, bombs, Air to Ground missiles and Air to Air Missiles.

The main characteristic is that the game board is covered with a net of equilateral triangles. Vertices of these triangles are points at which the players hold position and move figurines.

Each player has a task to achieve as many hits as possible in the enemy bases. Every hit and shot down aircraft counts as one point. The game lasts as long as players have planes and bombs, missiles... The winner is the player who has the best ratio of given and received hits.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Simulation

name: Rise of the Gummies
description:
Rise of the Gummies is a hybrid collectible card game that brings your play to life! Cards are played by showing them to an app on your device, which keeps track of the rules and game state so that you don't have to.

Rise of the Gummies takes about five minutes to learn, and can be played in fifteen minutes by one or two players aged 8+. The goal of the game is to build the tallest stack of Gummies. To build a stack, players simultaneously reveal cards from their hand to summon Gummies onto their side. When a card is played, the app recognizes it, adds the Gummy to the game, and executes any of its special abilities.

At the end of each round, the player with the taller stack gains a point. The first player to earn five points wins the game! But watch out - whoever loses the round earns a Salt, which some Gummies can spend to perform powerful abilities.
