Build a deck that combines the strengths of four unique Gummy planets to create the tallest stack and be crowned the Champion of the Gummiverse!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Fire in the hole!
description:
Fire in the hole! is a brand new social deduction game. Players take on the role of animal soldiers. But there are spies among us! The spies will try to interfere with our mission.

The way to complete the mission beyond the spies' disturbance is an unshakable body and mind and precise finger power!

Complete the mission by flicking the weapon assigned by the commander to the enemy's bunker exactly!

If 3 out of 5 missions are successful, the soldiers win. Otherwise, the spy wins.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Deduction, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Flicking, Hidden Roles

name: Tormenta de Hierro
description:
Tormenta de Hierro ("Iron Storm") is an air war game with MDF miniatures for two players, whose objective is to overcome the missions presented at the beginning of each game.

In this first 1.1 manual you will find all the information you need to play, along with the miniatures of this game.

Factions:

In this first instalment we will have 3 factions: British Empire, The Spanish Crown, and the Republic of France.

Each faction offers a unique condition that will be reflected in a passive and an active way.

—description from the designer
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Panzer Strike: Western Front 1
description:
Panzer Strike: Western Front is not a historical wargame but an engaging dynamic simulation of tank combat.

This is a first game in the series of Panzer Strike games which is centered around a theme of tank battles on the Western Front. This is not a depiction of any particular battle, but a simulation of possible tactical conflicts between the Allied and German forces during the 1944-45 period, in an urban environment.

Dice are a part of this game but strategy and positioning can always mitigate unlucky rolls. Still, even the most heavily armoured tank on the battlefield can be incapacitated by a lucky shot, but you should never rely on it. The outcome of each encounter depends predominantly on the tactical decisions taken.

The movement of the piece consists of a series of individual steps (forward movements to the adjacent square or a rotation in place by 45°) which resembles the movement of tracked vehicles in real life. In the Simplified rules, the destruction upon the action of shooting depends on the Firepower of the shooting tank (determined by red dice rolls), Armour value of the target vehicle (different values for each side of every tank type) and the Distance between the tanks (determined by a special ruler): the tank is destroyed if the Firepower is greater than the sum of the Armour and Distance values. In the Core Rules, the movement of the pieces is identical, but the difference is that in addition to Firepower, Armour, and Distance factors, there is a fourth one: Accuracy. Its introduction, along with some other elements, makes the game even more dynamic and realistic.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Line of Sight, Modular Board, Movement Points, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation, Square Grid, Stat Check Resolution, Variable Set-up

name: El Rey Planeta
description:
You are Philip IV, the King of Spain and Portugal since 1621. Your empire has reached approximately 12.2 million square kilometers, and you are the "Planet King".

The Planet King takes 1 to 2 players into the economic, military, and diplomatic actions of the biggest European empire. But each European powers has its own agenda and a series of events will try to undermine the empire.....

Player(s) recruit "Tercios" (armies), fleets, improve colonial defences, use the ambassadors, tries to improve the economy while defending the empire from the attack of other European powers. While Philip runs his empire, he must employ his nobles to lead the armies and rule the kingdom's territories.

But the king must not only run an empire, he must also "live life": have an heir for the kingdom, find a concubine, and of course fill the court with the best artists of the century.

Players: 1-2 (full solitaire system and cooperative mode)
Map: Area movement
Time scale: 2-4 year per turn

—description from designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Veil Between Cursed Lands
description:
Veil Between Cursed Lands is a fantasy themed tactical game in the magical world of Croya. Players will take on the role of a warden with their own special skill and item set. In the process, you will enhance your character and gears with experience and loot. Choose one of the wardens that suit you best and determine the fate of this battle for existence.

This game has several difficulty levels. Each level is played out through rounds of combat against automated enemies or a player that is controlling enemies. In each round, players will have action points that determine the order in which they move and what abilities they perform. At the end of the game, we will fight one of the demon lords. If we can beat it, we will win the game.

To break up the monotony of "move and attack," we created the Combo system. We will spend the combo points to use class abilities. Combo points will be granted to players based on the success level of their weapon attack. This level of success will be determined by the results of the dice roll.
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Action Retrieval, Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, Events, Hexagon Grid, Market, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Blitz in the East
description:
The Russian Campaign, 1941-45

After spectacular success in the West, Germany and its Axis partners turned East in June 1941 and launched the greatest land invasion in history against the Soviet Union. The goal of Operation Barbarossa was to decisively defeat the Soviet Union in a short lightning campaign before the onset of winter.

During the early stages of the campaign, the Wehrmacht caught the Red Army completely unprepared and had advanced its armored spearheads across the Dnepr in only a few short weeks. By mid-October, the Axis invasion appeared unstoppable and on the verge of ultimate success.

Unfortunately for the Axis, the time for a decisive victory had run out with the arrival of Russia’s notorious muddy season and the worst winter in a century. Despite suffering catastrophic losses over four months, the Soviet military was finally able to regroup and halt the invaders at the gates of Moscow. The Axis would never come so close to victory again and the initiative would slowly fall from its grasp.

As the Axis, can you do better and seize Moscow before the snow falls?
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Zone of Control

name: Ion Core
description:
Enter Ion Core, a thematic sandbox game set in a post-apocalyptic dystopian world. Humanity has been driven to piracy to secure a brighter future and it's up to you to guide your faction to victory!

Procedurally generated maps by placing tiles using specific actions ensure a diverse and different seafaring and treacherous landscape each time you play. How will you navigate in order to brave the perils of Ion Core’s world? Plan your course well or enemy factions will take all the glory!

Enjoy an adventure with minimal luck factor – actions like Scavenge or Plunder can be enhanced using a deck or upgrades to allow players to either enhance or mitigate chances, shifting the outcome to your favor.

Pillage or visit cities to upgrade your ship, gather spoils and forgotten relics, hunt dangerous beasts, enlist new crewmembers or entertain them to increase their morale, trade your way to riches or plunder your way to victory!

With a variety of ways to play and different aspects to focus on, there is never a dull moment - reading through your opponent’s intent is just as important as planning your own. No matter how you choose to advance, make sure to set your sights on controlling the energy source of this cruel world, and gather the most renown at the end! The choice is yours!

Beautifully hand-drawn artwork and components will suck you into Ion Core’s world and its unparalleled aesthetic! Each character comes to life through backstory and art to immerse players and make bonds, not just progress.

But beware, you are not alone in sailing the seas... Enemy ships and a mysterious, relentless adversary haunt your every move so plan well, take risks and brave your way to total control!

—description from the publisher
categories: Exploration, Fantasy, Miniatures, Pirates, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Hexagon Grid, Tile Placement

name: Wizard Miners
description:
A race to the treasure under the mountain requires a great mining company. Why not one run by a wizard? Dig, drill, & blast your way while casting spells to slow your opponents down!

In Wizard Miners, each player has a Mine Deck of cards that represents the cave they are mining. The object is to clear all of the cards from your deck before any other player does. As you mine, you will find gems in the rock. With these gems, you can buy more and better tools with which to mine and dynamite to cave in your opponents’ caves. But what’s the point of having a wizard in charge if you aren’t casting spells? Each turn, each player can cast spells to make their tools mine better, break other players’ tools, blast rock from your mine, or cave in your opponents’ mines.

Mining is important each turn as each tool gives you a better chance to mine cards out of your deck. But, be careful! You also have to take time to clean up the rubble or those cards (minus their gems!) could cave back in on you and make you clear them again!

Wizard Miners is a fast paced, light hearted, simultaneous-play game with both strategy and luck involved. It will keep seasoned gamers interested in the choices they make and novices excited as the luck of the roll can always change fortunes!

-description from designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Take That

name: Pet Master
description:
It’s finally here! A strategic card game that both kids and adults can enjoy.

It’s a race to collect all 5 pets, but every round presents you with some intriguing real-life questions: Should I save or spend my money? What’s the value of waiting? But don’t be intimidated! It all boils down into a simple choice of 3 card types: coins, pets, and time.

Each round opens with card drafting. Then each player takes turns playing their cards in an open-hand fashion. The cards represent 3 categories of resources. Coins increase your ability to buy. Time improves your bid to go first next round. Pets are collected to reserve the right to buy them. But when to buy them and at what price makes all the difference.

This game incorporates various classic board game mechanics in a simple format that makes it accessible to players of all ages. The themes are intuitive and universal. Open-hand play gives adults the option to guide children. And the ability to read is not a pre-requisite to playing this game at its fullest. You'd be surprised at how strategic a 5-year-old can be!

-description from designer
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Hand Management, Turn Order: Claim Action

name: Don't Crack
description: Don't Crack is the game where you are not allowed to laugh smile, smirk, grin, or giggle however it is almost impossible. Imagine if you pick up a card and it says. " Coffee is a natural laxative for me." You had to read it out loud without proofreading. Would that make you laugh? possibly. What if you had to get down on one knee and grab the persons hand to your left and confess your undying love for them. Would that make you laugh? Probably. If anyone laughs during game play they must move back spaces. Two categories are used, " Feel The Part" the acting out a silly situation category and "say It Out Loud" where you just pick up and read it. A game of non stop laughter.
mechanics: Acting, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Singing, Trick-taking

name: Table Air Combat: Il-2 Shturmovik
description:
Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface. Each ruleset is a self-contained game including cut-out miniatures of one aircraft and a set of rules. All you need are some six-sided dice and some coins to provide weight for the aircraft counters. Everything else can be printed from this ruleset. Download a free set of the complete rules here: Flight Operations Manual
Each player has a flight of four fighters, represented by two counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.
TAC is designed for portability; The entire game can fit in a plastic bag. Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

The Il-2 Shturmovik was a heavily-armoured attack plane used by the Soviet Union. It specialized in low-level attacks, and was occasionally pressed into service as a fighter.
This set is a self-contained rulebook that includes miniatures for the Il-2 Shturmovik and includes four scenarios that reference other aircraft:
Air and Bread: Attack a bridge on the Berezina river to slow down the invading German army. This is a standalone scenario using only the Il-2.
Circle of Death: Il-2s form a defensive Lufbery circle against Bf-109F fighters.
Anti-Transport: The Luftwaffe tries to supply by air, but has a shortage of transports. He-111 bombers are loaded with supplies and used instead. The Il-2 aircraft are assigned to shoot down the lumbering aircraft.. The airfield is defended by Bf-109F fighters.
Zementbomber: Fight the battle of Kursk by attacking German tanks. Il-2 are escorted by Yak-7 fighters, but the Luftwaffe defends with Fw-190A fighters and counter-attacks Soviet tanks with Ju-88 bombers.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Print & Play, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Table Air Combat: PBY-5 Catalina
description:
Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface. All you need are some six-sided dice and some coins to provide weight for the aircraft counters. Everything else can be printed from this ruleset.

Each player has a flight of four fighters, represented by two counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.

Each performance ruler is unique to each aircraft, and contains all the speed, cornering, and weapon information needed.

TAC is designed for portability; The entire game can fit in a plastic bag. Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

The PBY-5 Catalina was a flying boat designed for maritime patrol and rescue. Although slow, it had a long range and the ability to operate from unimproved pacific islands. When armed with bombs, depths charges,and torpedoes, it was effective at anti-submarine and anti-shipping.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Table Air Combat: CR.42 Falco
description:
Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface. All you need are some six-sided dice and some coins to provide weight for the aircraft counters. Everything else can be printed from this ruleset.
A player uses a flight of four aircraft represented by two counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved "performance rulers" that represent the aircraft's historical cornering ability and maximum speed.
Each performance ruler is unique to each aircraft, and contains all the speed, cornering, and weapon information needed.
TAC is designed for portability; the entire game can fit in a plastic bag. Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

The CR.42 Falco was one of the last biplanes used in combat. Extremely agile, Falchi were Although the Regia Aeronautica replaced the Falco with monoplanes like the MC.200, these biplanes continued to serve throughout the war.
The Falco was also exported to nations such as Belgium, Sweden, and Hungary.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Print & Play, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Table Air Combat: Me-163 Komet
description:
Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface. All you need are some six-sided dice and some coins to provide weight for the aircraft counters. Everything else can be printed from this ruleset.
Each player has a flight of four fighters, represented by two counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.
Each performance ruler is unique to each aircraft, and contains all the speed, cornering, and weapon information needed.
TAC is designed for portability; The entire game can fit in a plastic bag. Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

This set contains the Me-163, the only rocket-powered aircraft to see combat. Scenarios include:
Bat Out Of Hell: Komets bounce a flight of P-38 Lightnings
Point Defense: Me-163 Komets assisted Fw-190D fighters attacking a formation of B-17G bombers and their P-51D escorts.
Red Komet: Returning from a mission with no fuel, a lone Me-163 has to glide past marauding P-51D fighters to return to base.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Print & Play, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Table Air Combat: SM.79 Sparviero
description:
Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface. All you need are some six-sided dice and some coins to provide weight for the aircraft counters. Everything else can be printed from this ruleset.

A player uses a flight of four aircraft represented by two counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.

Each performance ruler is unique to each aircraft, and contains all the speed, cornering, and weapon information needed.

TAC is designed for portability: the entire game can fit in a plastic bag. Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

This ruleset comes with the Italian SM.79 Sparviero, along with:

Industrial target
HMS Liverpool naval target
Flak templates
Naval flak templates


Included are three scenarios that refer to other aircraft:

Spanish Civil War: Soviet-built I-16 fighters intercept a bombing mission during the Spanish Civil War.

Il Gobbo Maledetto: Attack the British stronghold of Malta with C.200 Saetta escorts, while RAF Hurricanes intercept.

Quattro Gatti: Spariveros of the "Four Cats" squadron catch HMS Liverpool and attack the British cruiser with torpedoes.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Table Air Combat: B-25H Mitchell
description:
Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface. Each ruleset is a self-contained game including cut-out miniatures of one aircraft and a set of rules. All you need are some six-sided dice and some coins to provide weight for the aircraft counters.

Each player has a flight of four fighters, represented by two counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.

TAC is designed for portability: the entire game can fit in a plastic bag. Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

The B-25H was an armoured strafer version of the B-25. The bombardier's position was replaced with a 75mm field cannon, the glazed nose was replaced with armour plating, and an additional four .50 machine guns were installed. B-25H aircraft engaged in anti-shipping and low-level strafing.
This set is a self-contained rulebook that includes miniatures for the B-25H and contains four scenarios that may reference other aircraft:

Destroyer: A single B-25H element engages a gun duel against a Japanese destroyer.

Convoy: Attack a Japanese supply convoy.

Wewak: Fight A6M5 Zero fighters while skip-bombing Japanese shipping

Rabaul: Strafe a heavily-defended Japanese airfield using parafrag bombs. Heavy AAA fire and continually-spawning A6M5 Zero fighters threaten to overwhelm the strafers.

New rules include:

AAA positions: Land-based guns that guard targets.
Flak suppression: Heavy maching gun fire can temporarily stop a ship or AAA position from firing.
Parafrags: Small fragmentation bombs that are used at low altitudes.


New targets include:

Kagero-class Japanese destroyer
Japanese cargo ship
Japanese airfield
AAA positions


—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Hewns
description:
Hewns is a modular boardgame, in which players are competing to mine a planet surface which is created differently by the players every new game. The purpose of the game is to mine more Substract (which is a highly valuable liquid with living sub-molecular creatures) than any other player.

Each round, players use bidding drones to bid on Aliens (called Hewns); technologies; scouting advantages; and the Turn order. The alien Hewns all have different skill levels and abilities. However, Bidding costs valuable Substract!

When a player has his/ her turn they can enter their Hewns through common entrances onto the board which is made up of Nodes and ravines. The spaces of ravines and nodes can be either big, medium, or small and these spaces sizes will restrict certain Hewns from entering. But beware! Hewns usually don't survive! They can become damaged, stunned, killed, or even stolen by other players, or even killed by the planet itself!

When Hewns reach the mines on the board they can choose to mine aggressively or normally. The more aggressive the mining the worse the planet will react to the Hewns and also the faster the game will play out.

Players can also attack other Hewns owned by other players but the Substract they have collected will be used up as ammunition for the long-range and/or powerful shooting. Even crazier Hewns and technologies let you take over other players Hewns: but watch out, they might die in the attempt!
mechanics: Action Points, Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Hidden Victory Points, Modular Board, Push Your Luck

name: နှစ်သစ်ပုဂံခရီးစဉ် (Bagan Journey: New Year)
description:
Explore the city of Bagan, ancient home of Myanmar kings. Players collect memories, curios, items, and vehicles as they discover the region’s vivid history and culture. The player with the most discoveries at the end of the game is the winner!

On their turn, players roll the dice and move on the board in a direction they choose. They explore the location they land on to gain Discovery Points (DP) or draw cards. There are different types of cards: Events to be resolved immediately, Vehicles to equip, and Items to keep, or use on other players!

The 10 main temples of Bagan are represented on the game board. They are a good source of points. You came to Bagan to visit temples, after all! But there are other ways to rack in many points, such as getting a 'Hot Air Balloon Ticket' for the trip of a lifetime (and a whopping 10 DP)! Or mounting an elephant and wearing the traditional Thanaka and visiting villages and markets (3DP per visit)!

There are two versions of the game to play, the Quick Start for first-time players new to the game, and the Advanced Rules once you've discovered your way around! Recommend to anyone: Who wouldn’t want to play a game about going on holiday?

-

ဤမိသားစုကဒ်ကစားနည်းတွင် ဆန်းကျယ်လှပလွန်းတဲ့ ပုဂံမြို့တော်အကြောင်း စူးစမ်းလေ့လာရင်း အံ့သြဖွယ်ရာများစွာ ကို ရှာဖွေဖော်ထုတ်နိင်မှာဖြစ်ပါတယ်။
ဤကစားနည်းရဲ ့ အဓိက ပန်းတိုင်မှာ ကစားပွဲအပြီးတွင် “လေ့လာရေးမှတ်” တွေ အများဆုံးစုဆောင်းနိုုင်ဖို့ပဲဖြစ်ပါတယ်။ ကစားသမားများသည် မိမိသွားရာ ခရီးလမ်းမှာရလာမယ့် အတွေ့ အကြုံများအပေါ်မူတည်ပြီး “လေ့လာရေးမှတ်” တွေစုဆောင်းရမှာပါ။ ကစားသင့်သူများ - အားလပ်ရက် ခရီးထွက်နေသည့်ခံစားမှုကိုနှစ်ခြိုက်သော မည်သည့်အရွယ်မည်သူမဆို။
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Superhero
description:
A rock-paper-scissors card game with superheroes theme. Every player will be dealt a number of cards and they need to challenge other players during the game to keep their cards.
The superheroes cards correspond to three different elements: water, fire or woods, each one beats another one.

The player will the challenge card will challenge any other player. Both cards will take one card from their hands and at the shout of "Water, Fire, Wood!" they will reveal their cards. The stronger elements winds and the winner will gets both cards (unless there is a Power Eraser, that can be only used once). If both cards are identical, they are discarded.

The last player still having cards in their hands will be the winner of the game.

-description from designer
mechanics: Player Elimination, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: Headless Horseman Board Game
description:
Welcome to the Headless Horseman board game! You are Ichabod Crane racing through the haunted woods. Can you be the first player to reach the covered bridge and not be defeated and turned into a Headless Horseman?

Each player chooses a numbered movement card to play, discards that card and moves their game piece then draws a replacement movement card so they maintain 6 cards in their hand. Play rotates to the left each time with players moving their pieces along the paths through the haunted woods. At the beginning of the 4th round, each player is dealt a Curse card but players don’t look at it. As each player begins their 4th turn, in order they will turn over the Curse card to see if they have been cursed and become a Headless Horseman.

Staying in the playing order, the Headless Horseman player(s) will use their movement cards to chase down the remaining Ichabods and turn them through battle. If Ichabod runs out of hit points, they are converted to a Headless Horseman. If a horseman runs out of hit points, they are sent back to one of the graveyards and can continue the chase. Any Ichabod that reaches the covered bridge on the opposite side of the board wins, but if all players are turned to horsemen, the horsemen win.
mechanics: Action/Event, Catch the Leader, Dice Rolling, Move Through Deck, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Set-up

name: Square & Compass
description:
Square & Compass is a resource management game where your successes can have you the most popular architect in town, or left penniless at the drafting table. A worker placement games played over a series of rounds, for 2-5 players, and an average playtimes of 30 minutes per player. Games can be as short as 60 minutes, or as long as 150 minutes. Players use action tiles to harvest resources, hire and play technicians, process resources into building materials, and draft/play building contracts. The first player to successfully complete 7 building contracts ends the game. But there are a lot of different ways to play Square & Compass, from sustainability bonuses given when special resources are paid for contracts. Or special building combinations made when completing contract sets.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Contracts, Market, Resource Queue, Worker Placement

name: Aeon Trespass: Twelve Sins of Herakles
description:
Twelve Sins of Herakles is a 1-4 player campaign game about adventures, exploration and fierce battles with giant monsters. Set in the same game universe as Aeon Trespass: Odyssey, it’s a co-operative, choice-driven boardgame experience played over multiple sessions. Set in an alternate Antiquity, where a reality-shattering cataclysm killed the Olympian gods and unleashed the otherworldly Primordials, Twelve Sins of Herakles places the players in the roles of Argonauts, the only people who can fight off the darkness and make things right. The base game covers three regions and three campaigns.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Ancient, Civilization, Exploration, Fantasy, Miniatures, Mythology
mechanics: Command Cards, Cooperative Game, Map Addition, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Sunday Bazaar
description:
Sunday Bazaar is a board game developed by a team of board game enthusiasts that brings the experience of a Pakistani flea market to every household in form of a board game.

It is a game of negotiation where players get to role play as buyers and sellers from the famous Sunday Bazaar. It’s a fun and exciting experience to challenge your bargaining skills amongst family and friends.

In Sunday Bazaar, players try to buy most items from the market to get most Victory Points. The active player tries to lower items’ price to get the best possible price, meanwhile other players try to counter the negotiations to not let the active player get away with a great bargain. 

All Items in the market are worth Victory Points and each item belongs to a set. Bonus Victory Points are rewarded at the end of the game if Players collect more items from sets as defined in the “End Game Bonus” Card. 

Game ends when either any player buys 5 items from the market, or when all the items from the market are sold out.

Enhance your Bargaining skills and enjoy the shopping in Sunday Bazaar.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction: Turn Order Until Pass, Multi-Use Cards, Negotiation, Role Playing

name: RANBU
description:
In the mysterious land of Kokoroyama, the evil wizard Kuroshin has awakened the ancient evil spirit known as Shinzuru, the Lord of Darkness. His intent is to obtain absolute power and dominate the entire kingdom of Kokoroyama. In the face of this growing threat, Princess Ranbu, of extraordinary beauty and magical powers, emerges as Kokoroyama’s last hope. Supported by a group of five valiant warriors, each equipped with unique and unparalleled abilities, Ranbu is determined to complete an epic mission that will change the fate of their world. As the shadows of darkness spread and Kuroshin’s evil powers grows, Ranbu and her companions embark on a perilous journey to defeat Shinzuru and stop the wizard’s dark ambitions. Ancient legends intertwine with the present and their adventure becomes an epic struggle between good and evil, with Kokoroyama’s fate suspended in an unstable balance. Together, they must overcome deadly challenges, uncover ancient secrets, and face Shinzuru in an epic battle for the future of the kingdom.

RANBU is an amazing, solo or cooperative, narrative experience for 1-6 players. Set in a unique fantasy world, with a deep, branching storyline, you’ll battle villainous foes, make courageous decisions or harrowing choices, to defeat the evil that threatens the peace, in a thrilling journey that leads you across the lands of Kokoroyama.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Map Addition, Modular Board, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Stat Check Resolution, Variable Player Powers

name: Aeon Trespass: Odyssey Expansions Box
description:
An Expansion Box of Aeon Trespass: Odyssey, consisting of Cycle IV: Gardens of Infinite Growth and Cycle V: Truthsayer. Includes all unlocked Core Game Stretch Goals, Daily Goals and Bingo Goals from our first Kickstarter campaign, as well as all applicable goals from the Second Printing.

In Gardens of Infinite Growth you must withstand the harsh, barren environment, reinvent your economy and rethink your strategies, then push into the very heart of the Empire to stop Xerxes before he murders a second god snared by his puzzle-box - or so they whisper - and stop a calamity to rival the Eschaton.

In Truthsayer Argo returns to the waves - and beneath them - to look for Ur-Fleece, the king that is said to have invited the Zero Point Entity to ravage Hellas. You will have to deal with the legacy of the Atlantean empire, manage your energy and oxygen reserves and journey deep into the underwater kingdom in search for answers. Just a fair warning, O Argonaut, for everything on land, sea and air there is an equal and opposite force. You have your Argo. They’ve got their Nemesis.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Miniatures, Mythology
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Storytelling

name: Rain, Rain Go Away...
description:
Quaint late '60s offering from Ideal. Plastic shelters are assembled on the roll-out plastic gameboard before players spin & move. In addition to regulation numerals on the spinner, there are 'umbrella' and 'rain' areas. Players spinning the umbrella get to slot the small plastic umbrella provided with the game in the allocated position in their mover's hand where it remains until the umbrella is spun by an opponent. If 'rain' is spun, all players without the umbrella must return to the closest previous shelter passed on the road.

The first player to reach the finish space is the winner and gets to squirt the losers with the hose (optional house rule).
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Simplified War Game
description:
Julius von Verdy du Vernois entered in the Prusian Army in 1850, he took part in the campaign on the upper Elbe and after this was promoted to the rank of lieutenant-colonel. Shortly, Verdy du Vernois became a reputed General and one of Moltke's principal assistants.
Among his works as a lecturer at the War Academy he developed a new wargame inspired in Von Reisswitz's Kriegsspiel. In the new game, Verdy du Vernois propose a free Kriegsspiel without rules manual in which the umpire is free to decide the results of players’ manoeuvres.
Simplified War Game is the American version of the original Prussian book, translated and arranged by Captain Eben Swift (Fifth Cavalry).
The book includes exercises and examples of manoeuvres on a terrain map.
mechanics: Simulation
publishers: Hudson-Kimberly Publishing, William Clowes and Sons

name: Schism
description:
Schism is a fast paced 'collect or kill' game of celestial warfare for 2-6 players.

Players take on the role of celestial beings, claiming Souls and influencing Believers, in an attempt to be the first to raise their very own army of the damned or legion of followers. Using grid-based movement over two different realms, Schism utilises an action-point system giving players access to a range of moves, options and abilities each turn, but decisions must be made carefully as some actions will cost you your life force and energy; lose too much and you may find yourself banished to one world or the next, edging you ever closer to the end of your existence. So, which path will you follow?

Action in Schism is spread over two separate board sections, one representing 'Life' - the world as we know it; and the other representing 'The Other Side' - the celestial world where the souls of the dead roam free. Players may travel freely between these worlds, or play an entire game in one of them, exploiting the resources available there and playing event/item cards to shape the way the game progresses.

Be the first player to collect 10 Souls/believers or be the last player standing to be declared the winner.

FROM THE BOX:

There is a war that’s raging, a war between celestial beings living among us on earth. No one can be sure whether there’s a heaven or a hell, but we can be sure that there’s a divide - a divide that will separate us all. Some of them care for us, watch over us and protect us, while others corrupt, kill and manipulate. We assume they have always been here, but now they are making it known. The world as we know it has been changed forever. ‘Angels’ are revealing themselves, gathering followers and building an army of believers to defend against the threats that emerge from the darkness. ‘Daemons’ are stealing souls, building rank after rank of damned warriors, preparing to ravage and consume one realm or the next. These beings have begun tearing each other limb from limb, wielding weapons of fire & light, spreading their wings and exerting otherworldly powers. So, which way will you turn? Influence believers? Claim souls? Slaughter your opponents? Regain your humanity? You decide.
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Hand Management

name: Arcane Warfare Excel: AWE – Field Battle Rules 300BC – 500 AD
description:
Arcane Warfare Excel (AWE) are rules for miniature wargaming in the Antiquity, from 300BC to 500AD.

They are the top evolution of the Arcane Warfare Project, run by Jerboa Wargames.

AWE is a miniatures game without randomizers, like dice, cards or equivalent, instead it is a true mind game.
The rules have been developed using '15 mm' miniatures on 40 mm frontage bases.
Each base represents a cohort size unit, that can fight independently of as part of a large formation, a phalanx.
The game is played over rectangular templates, by default 20 cm x 10 cm, but smaller and lerger areas are also used.
A battle with 32-34 bases per side can be confortably concluded within 90 minutes.

Features

Fast play, because of the grid movements
Basic armies around 32 stands
Scalable
Miniatures combat system based on dialog, decison/reaction
Decisive combat
Combat Tiles concept
Decided by player skill
Steep learning curve
Unforgiving


No dice, rulers, cards, bookkeeping or written orders.

Requirements: rectangle templates; magnetic sheet and metal steel paper, such as those found in hobby stores.

Warning: heavy base work required!

AWE version 1.1 can be obtained from Wargame Vault
mechanics: Area Movement, Modular Board, Simulation

name: Blobbiemundo: Masacre Cromática
description: The first Blobbiemundo expansion includes all the cards present in the 7 Introductory Decks plus 195 new Cards (including 50 Refractive Cards).
mechanics: Unspecified

name: SeQuel: The game of Quantum Marks
description:
SeQuel is the game where money is power. The object of SeQuel is to win power for your side: Champions who play to help bring an Alien to Earth and open us to new worlds of opportunity, or Guardians who play to power a shield that keeps us safe from advanced alien civilizations. Play to win numbered notes called Quantum Marks, that have codes used to generate power. Longer sequences create more power. The object is to create the most power by building the longest sequence. Your ultimate goal is to create the maximum power sequence, a Quay (pronounced key) made from all 118Q.
To begin play Deal 5Q to each player. The first player who can make a start sequence leads the play. The start sequence is a series of 2 or more Q created from Q received in the deal, or by using Q from draw deck. The longest or highest sequence wins the chance to lead. Players play their Q on table in clockwise order. The Leader calls the play by choosing a game (Dots, Age, Number or Name) and if high or low values win. At the start of your turn you draw 1Q, look for interception sequences, and use special forces to change the play in your favor. After playing your Q you draw again so that you end the round with 5Q. It will take several games to build a Quay.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Set Collection, Trick-taking, Variable Phase Order

name: Runeslingers: The Awakening
description:
"Runeslingers: The Awakening" is a strategic customizable card game that ingeniously melds board game and dueling card game elements into a wholly unique strategy gaming experience. It promises to challenge even the most seasoned gaming veterans with its myriad strategic win conditions, card combinations, and decision trees that confront players each turn.

Take on the role of a Runeslinger, a wielder of magical incantations known as runespells. Much of the game's art features runestones, ancient stone artifacts that empower your Runeslinger with runespells. Each runespell possesses a class affinity that provides guidance on its thematic origins and strategic pairings but does not limit card pairings in deck construction.

The game's objective is straightforward: diminish the enemy Runeslinger's power from five to zero. Achieve this by dealing damage, applying ailments, or discarding the enemy's cards to weaken their power. Reduce the enemy Runeslinger's maximum health to zero, or deplete their entire deck and discard pile to secure instant victory! With five distinct win conditions coupled with a unique ailment system, "Runeslingers" stands as an exceptionally complex yet rewarding strategy game that introduces significant mechanical advancements to the genre.

Customize your Runeslinger with a unique stance and ability to further develop specific strategies, limited only by your creativity. Select from a pool of over 180 unique cards in the Alpha set, and assemble a 40-card deck with no class or color restrictions. Employ six unique ailments that dynamically alter gameplay on a moment's notice. Master the art of shouting, Runeslinger's distinctive take-that mechanic that enables you to disrupt enemy actions, even when it's not your turn!

If you seek a challenging and genuinely strategic game, your search ends with "Runeslingers!"
mechanics: Deck Construction, Interrupts, Turn Order: Progressive

name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Jesus Booster
description:
Paul Monroe is more commonly known by his nickname – Jesus – bearing some resemblance to the biblical figure. Quick-thinking and highly skilled in unarmed combat, he is a natural survivor in the world of the walkers and valued member of the Hilltop community. Although Rick initially distrusts him when they meet, Jesus is quick to demonstrate his value and dedication –earning Rick’s trust.

Contains:
2 Resin Models – Jesus & walker and cards

Card included are:
Jesus Character Cards for All Out War and Call to Arms, and the following equipment cards: Leather Coat, Throwing Knives and Binoculars.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: The Coaching Game
description:
The Coaching Game is Board Game for studied about ICF Coaching Process.
There is 7 Steps of ICF Coaching into The Coaching Game with semi-cooperative easy rule for play
by Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement by Move Token for pick card up for finished eash Board,
when finished 7 Main Board, player went through 7 Steps of ICF Coaching already.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Semi-Cooperative Game, Track Movement, Trading
publishers: Game Lab Thailand, Thailand Coaching Institute

name: Ascension: Deckbuilding Game – Collector's Case Champion Cards
description:
Originally available during the Ascension Tactics: Miniatures Deckbuilding Game Kickstarter campaign as an add-on or included with the Ascension Collectors Case. Later available direct from the publisher.

A set of four new oversized champion cards and the corresponding hero cards, This style of card and mechanic was only ever seen before in the popular Ascension expansion, Dawn of Champions.

Comes complete with a rules sheet and reputation tokens.

This Ascension add on is compatible with any previous or future Ascension set.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: A Game of Corruption
description:
Lebanon is a country with a rich history and a bright future, but with today's rampant corruption, we need a reset. A Game of Corruption takes you back in time to Lebanon’s golden years and gives you a chance to fix what went wrong and change the course of history.

Each player is randomly and secretly assigned a role, either Reformist or Corrupt Elite, and then works on campaigning in the different districts to amass the most seats in the parliament. On your turn, you can either swap districts with other players, draw or replace a new secret objective, or spread influence by campaigning in swing districts or by battling against other players to take their districts. The game moves into the second phase of electing a president once 5 rounds are played or 6 objectives are completed. Would the corrupt succeed in sowing confusion and distrust and bluff their way to power? Or would the reformists be able to see through their game and vote them out?

The game of corruption is tricky and treacherous. Do you have what it takes to get to the presidential chair?

Mentioned in:

The Guardian:
https://www.theguardian.com/global-development/2023/apr/10/p...

SRF Television Channel:
https://www.srf.ch/news/international/mit-spielkarten-an-die...

Wired Middle East:
https://wired.me/culture/play-a-game-of-corruption-your-in-l...

Al Nahhar Lebanon:
https://l8.nu/rt8m

Mille World UAE:
https://www.milleworld.com/machrou3-ra2is-the-new-lebanese-b...

Info 3:
https://info3.com?news=102463&;text=short&lang=1
https://info3.com/?news=102463&;text=short&lang=2
https://info3.com?news=102473&;text=short&lang=5

Göteborgs-Posten (SWE):
https://www.gp.se/nyheter/v%C3%A4rlden/de-spelar-om-libanons...

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Deduction, Finale Ending, Hidden Roles, Negotiation, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Variable Set-up, Voting

name: Parasols
description:
Over a number of rounds, players compete to score the most points by having their parasols as close to sea as possible and in clusters of adjacent parasols.

Players draft domino shape cards and place them on a communal play area so they can score more points and block other players.
mechanics: Tile Placement

name: Hope: Chronicles of Osmae
description:
Hope, Chronicles of Osmae is an immersive and narrative Dungeon Crawler set in a dark fantasy universe.
Leader of one of the 4 ruling Houses, you are fleeing your homeland, facing a terrible threat. The only haven available is Osmae, the island of your Goddess Aya, an unknown land where you will set up camp.

This game offers an alternation of :

Cooperative exploration phases of "Dungeon crawler" type, with miniatures, strategies, fights & quests. Players join forces to overcome the dangers of Osmae and level up their characters.
Competitive camp phases with worker placement mechanics, where players compete and seek to take power while preserving their interests and increasing the influence of their House.


—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Action/Event, Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Command Cards, Deck Construction, End Game Bonuses, Events, Finale Ending, Hand Management, Interrupts, Legacy Game, Line of Sight, Map Addition, Market, Move Through Deck, Movement Points, Multi-Use Cards, Multiple Maps, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Semi-Cooperative Game, Storytelling, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement

name: Galactic Shogun
description:
Galactic Shogun is a fast-paced and dynamic social deduction game set in a fictional space/Edo-period themed story. The game involves hidden roles and teams with specific win conditions for each team.

Gameplay is turn based. Each player will, in order, play only one Play Card from their hand and resolve the actions as noted on the card played. The game ends either by successfully resolving the “Laser Katana of Judgement” card, or if all cards have been played.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Party Game
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Roles, Take That

name: Brebajes de Mictlán
description:
Immerse yourself in ancient Tenochtitlán, the vibrant capital of the Aztec empire, where the wise seek to create the most potent elixirs. You are one of these sages.

He uses the favor of the gods and your skill to collect the magical ingredients. Then mix them together to create unique concoctions.

This is a game of strategy and skill in which each decision can define victory or defeat.

To start a game in Brebajes de Mictlán we will have to assemble the board, the manual recommends a way for the first game, but from there we can arrange the board as we want because we will have individual tiles.

Then we will make a store in which we will reveal 3 potions and under them a card of favor of the gods face down.

Each player will be given a personal board to keep track of his resources, his 5 cubes and we are ready to play.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Income, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up

name: Conan: Red Nails
description: Across the 10 brand new scenarios we offer in this expansion, players will face the massive Forest Dragon in the green hell beyond the citadel of Sukhmet, cross the dark and forsaken halls of Xuchotl and take part in a never-ending war between the Xotalancas and the Tecuhltlis.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Kill The King
description: Kill the King is a quick playing card game of opportunity, timing, deception and tactics. Players each have three cards face down on the table. Players take turns playing a card for its attack power or its ability. The winner of the game is the person who kills the king, or the person who has the king when all other cards have been killed.
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Memory, Prisoner's Dilemma, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Sudden Death Ending

name: HAVOC
description:
HAVOC is a tactical card battler set in the perilous world of Port Terminus. In this game, you will compete against other players in one-on-one or two-on-two turn-based matches. Both players will deploy powerful combatants and utilise surreal alien technologies to gain the upper hand.

The game is a battle of both resources and position, featuring a dynamic board controlled by Reactors which, upon activation, grant the ability to play devastating Biome cards. Embrace strategy and maximize the advantages of the unique 6x6 card placement and streamlined combat-movement systems, providing players with an extraordinary degree of freedom.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck Construction, Grid Movement, Moving Multiple Units, Single Loser Game, Team-Based Game

name: Rage of Empires
description:
More information to come.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Player Elimination

name: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid – Zord Pack #3
description:
The mysterious Trey of Triforia gifted the Zeo Rangers the Super Zeo Gems, and with them the ability to use the powerful (and geometrically appealing) Super Zeo Zords. Add these zords and the Warrior Wheel to Heroes of the Grid with this pack of 6 new zords and 2 megazords.

Includes:
Super Zeo Zord I card
Super Zeo Zord II card
Super Zeo Zord III card
Super Zeo Zord IV card
Super Zeo Zord V card
Warrior Wheel card
Zeo Mega Battlezord card
Super Zeo Megazord card
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Stratagèmes
description:
Immerse yourself in a mystical world where magic and strategy are omnipresent.
Wizards, your goal is to summon gems to create alignments or capture your opponent's stones. However, gemstone summoning magic is unpredictable! Which makes the generation of your favorite secret stone uncertain... Analyze, adapt your strategy and anticipate the movements of your opponents to win!

3 game mode: One vs. All, Teams, Asymmetric
2 extensions
Gameplay variations

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Pattern Building, Square Grid, Static Capture, Team-Based Game

name: Grow Wars The CardGame
description:
Cards Game, set in the cultivation of Marijuana, compete with friends to show who is the most skilled grower.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Juego de Mesa de Cartas, ambientado en el cultivo de Marihuana, compite con amigos para demostrar quien es el cultivador más habilidoso.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Queue, Automatic Resource Growth, Hand Management, Role Playing

name: Cult
description: Cult: The Drinking Game of Politics in an Esoteric Order is the first game by Party Hard Corps. The players take on the roles of cultists in an occult group, vying for political influence on their way to illumination. One player, the Messiah- whose signifying ring could be passed on at any turn- gets to declare what the cult worships (and therefore what rules are in play). A party game of fast drinking and fast dice rolling.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure Battle Card Game
description:
JoJo's Bizarre Adventure is a popular Japanese comic created by Hirohiko Araki. It is first published in 1987 in Japan. In March 2007, Bandai Carddas release a CCG about this story. The first series features around 100 cards which contains characters from part 1 to part 3 of the original story. One of the main features of this CCG is that the card arts are all from Araki's original arts.

There will be 5 different type of cards: Hero card, Character card, Stand card, Event card and Stage card. The first set starter contains 32 random inserted cards (there will be a random selection of 47 common cards, 6 uncommon cards and 3 starter only cards). Rare cards are only available from booster packs.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip
mechanics: Unspecified

name: The Game of War
description:
This is an excellent example of a British officer's wargame, designed for the instruction of military personnel in military manouevres; a later British version of "Kriegsspiel", a wargame originally invented by Lieutenant Georg von Reiswitz for training officers in the Prussian army during the early 19th century.

The game is played on a map drawn on a scale of 6 inches to the mile, and the troops are indicated by small slate blocks, coloured red for one force, and blue for another. The example in the National Army Museum Collection also has 15 maps of the West Dorking training areas, including Aldershot, Camberley, Hog's Back and are part of a series issued by the War Office which have been coloured specially for the purpose.

"To carry out the Game of War in as most complete manner as possible, the instructions inform that one should have enough officers to fill the following posts:

Two officers to represent the commanders of the opposing forces.

Subordinate officers to command any detachments of importance from the main body.

An Umpire

Two Assistant Umpires

An Officer to keep a journal recording the progress of the operations, time of the despatch and receipt of messages and losses".
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Gradski Reli
description:
Each player has a 1 figurine - car. While driving through the streets players have to respect all traffic rules. In each round the player must take 2 counters, one type A and one type B. Counters are deployed throughout the city. In each subsequent round of the counters are in ever more distant streets. When 2 players are playing, 6 laps are driven. When 3 players are playing, 4 laps are driven. ... When 6 players are playing, 2 laps are driven.

With this game is very easy to learn all the important traffic rules.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Helicopter and Tank Battle Game
description:
This game is a simulation of an exercise held at a military training ground involving tanks and helicopters. There are three levels. In the first level only tanks participate. In the second level are added combat helicopters. In the third level participate transport helicopters and Surface to Surface Missiles.

The main characteristic is that the game board is covered with a net of equilateral triangles. Vertices of these triangles are points at which the players hold position and move figurines.

Players have a task to destroy enemy headquarters or to use transport helicopters which carry commandos who can capture enemy headquarters and in that way make a quick victory. Other way of determining the winner is by counting points. Every hit, destroyed tank and shot down helicopter counts as one point.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Simulation

name: Table Air Combat: U-2 Kukuruznik
description:
The U-2 Kukuruznik (Corn-Cutter) was a small utility biplane used as a trainer, scout, ambulance, and transport. It was also used as a light attack aircraft out of desperation.

This set is a self-contained rulebook that includes miniatures for the U-2 and contains five scenarios: Recon, Cat and Mouse, Siege of Odessa, Nachtexen, Kursk.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Print & Play, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Dust 1947: Guai-Lo Moloi
description: Steel Guards are some of the most formidable fighters on the planet. Their half-robotic bodies makes them very hard to kill, allowing them to gain incredible combat experience. And among them are a few that are even more formidable: Master Sergeant Guaï-Lo Moloï is one of them. The third human on the planet (and last one alive) to ever be encased in a Steel Guard armor, he has seen action in every part of the World. His armor has been heavily modified to his specifications, making him a fearsome sight on the battlefield.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Zombie Fight or Flight
description:
The zombie apocalypse has begun! Players are survivors of the initial outbreak. They have been thrown together by chance, and can only survive and reach safety as a team. Zombie Fight or Flight is a collaborative card game, where players work together or die trying.

Each player in turn chooses a card from their hand, which represents what the entire group does for a day. If the group goes 7 days without playing provisions or cannot recover from zombie encounters the entire group dies. The goal is to survive long enough (at least 3 weeks) and then get clear from the zombies so the group can be rescued.

The rules to this game are accessible for inexperienced gamers and is suitable for intergenerational play.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management

name: Mafia's Night: Dark Expansion
description:
The first expansion for the Mafia`s Night which consists of new roles, updated characters, contents for 15 more players and more!

Box Components:

A new season of Werewolf with new characters
A new Independent Character called “Faceless”
New Voting cards that have titles
New Last Action Cards
New Dang and Challenge Cards
The Syndicate’s Silver List
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation
mechanics: Player Elimination, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Table Air Combat: I-16 Ishak
description:
Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface. Each ruleset is a self-contained game including cut-out miniatures of one aircraft and a set of rules. All you need are some six-sided dice and some coins to provide weight for the aircraft counters. Everything else can be printed from this ruleset.

Each player has a flight of four fighters, represented by two counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.

TAC is designed for portability: the entire game can fit in a plastic bag. Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

The I-16 was an advanced design in the 1930s, but was obsolete by the time World War II started. Modern fighters such as the Yak-1 and MiG-3 had not been built in sufficient numbers, leaving the I-16 as the major defender against superior German and Japanese aircraft.

This set is a self-contained rulebook that includes miniatures for the I-16 and contains four scenarios that reference other aircraft:

In the Battle of Brunete, I-16s fight early German aircraft in the Spanish Civil War: Bf-109E and He-111

Battle of Wuhan: I-16s of the Republic of China Air Force defend against the Japanese A6M2 Zero and G4M Betty.

Moscow: A Luftwaffe strike force attacks Moscow using Bf-109F and Ju-87 Stuka.

Stalingrad: Ju-87 Stukas and I-16 Ishaks provide close air support in the city.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Table Air Combat: Bf-110G Night Fighter
description:
Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface. Each ruleset is a self-contained game including cut-out miniatures of one aircraft and a set of rules. All you need are some six-sided dice and some coins to provide weight for the aircraft counters.

Each player has a flight of four fighters, represented by two counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.

TAC is designed for portability: the entire game can fit in a plastic bag. Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

The Bf-110 was ineffective as an escort fighter but served as an exceptional night fighter. The twin-engine design allowed radar set to be installed in the nose. This was operated by the second crewman, who also operated the tail gun. This set contains the BF-110G4, the definitive Zerstroyer night fighter. Also included is the Bf-110G2, a daylight heavy fighter which trades the high-drag radar antenna for a higher maximum speed.

This set is a self-contained rulebook with miniatures for the Bf-110G and four scenarios.

Viermot: Engage a daylight raid of B-17 Flying Fortresses with air-to-air rockets. P-47 Thunderbolts escort the bombers.

Schrade Music: Attack a formation of Lancaster bombers at night using upward-firing cannon.

Jabo vs. Jabo: Engage Il-2 and Yak-7 while protecting tanks on the Russian Front.

Zahme Sau: Bf-110 and Bf-109G night fighters use spotlights to engage a regenerating stream of Lancaster bombers.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Codes: The Lost Island
description:
Codes: The Lost Island is a card game where 2-5 players reach the Lost Island seeking to find the Lost Magic Stones, hidden in treasure chests that are locked by digital codes. The first to collect 8 Magic Stones wins the game. To break a code and open a chest players need to seize digit cards the dealer flips and combine multiplication that results the code. Opening a chest doesn't guarantee them stones- they can hit pirates, ghosts, stinky rotten tomatoes or loads of other cruel surprises. The game is a strategy game where you need to predict, memorize, follow your opponents, make quick decisions and scream or sing ("Codes") your heart out!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Open Drafting

name: Table Air Combat: Walrus
description:
Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface. All you need are some six-sided dice and some coins to provide weight for the aircraft counters. Everything else can be printed from this ruleset.

Each player has a flight of aircraft represented by counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.
A performance ruler is unique to each aircraft, and contains all the speed, cornering, and weapon information needed.

TAC is designed for portability: the entire game can fit in a plastic bag. Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

The Supermarine Walrus was a biplane with a central floating hull. Its single engine was suspended between the two sets of wings and featured a pusher-prop. This arrangement allowed a gunner position in the nose and tail.
The Walrus was catapult-launched from British warships. Upon completing its patrol, cranes would winch it back aboard the warship.
Its intended purpose was to provide reconnaissance and gunnery spotting. However, the Walrus was heavily used for air-sea rescue and antisubmarine patrols.

This set is a self-contained rulebook with miniatures for the Walrus and three scenarios:

Fiord Encounter: While searching for U-boats, a Walrus engages in a dogfight with a He-111 bomber.

Operation Canned: Walrus flying boats from a Royal Navy cruiser attack an Italian coastal radio station. A single Cr.42 Falco biplane fighter defends.

Air-Sea Rescue: The Royal Air Force races the Luftwaffe to rescue a high-profile aircrew downed in the English Channel. Spitfire Mk.V escort the Walrus. A Ju-87 Stuka substitutes for a Luftwaffe Ar-196 float plane, escorted by Bf-109F.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Print & Play, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: The WitchBorn: War Mage Diary
description:
We are at war!

Our WitchBorn enemy is undead and seemingly limitless, stealing our bodies even as we fall on the field of battle, stealing our strength, stealing our wisdom, stealing our training, and sometimes even stealing our memories.

We organize and plot. But how can we ever hope to succeed without the power that prayer and magic bring us against The WitchBorn threat?

Four join me in writing this supreme work. With their remarkable knowledge, guidance, and mastery, War Mage Diary teaches over one hundred spells from the elemental, the dark, and the Divine. This tome also warns of the dangers WitchBorn pose to Lhyonnesse, Kasel, Asylum, the Wandering Forest, and all of Perdition. We share lore and include a compendium of magical wands, arcane gear, and Unreal Beasts for young Adepts like yourselves.

Please master this work, add to it, and practice the magic held within until The WitchBorn are no more. Short of this, do not let this work fall into our enemies’ clutches for fear they turn this last hope against us.

Aric Stonemason
Hammer of Dur, Adept of the Divine

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Role Playing, Team-Based Game

name: Las Ligas de la Ñ: Antología
description:
Las Ligas de la Ñ: Antología (The Ñ Leagues: Anthology) is a card game for 2 to 5 players that brings together all of the characters, objects, scenarios, and leagues that have been designed to date for the Las Ligas de la Ñ project.

Over 100 iconic Spanish literature characters will appear in the game in card form, with their name, work, author and representative quote. The time has come for Don Quijote, Sancho Panza, Carmen, Don Juan, Celestina, Segismundo, Fortunata y Jacinta and many more! And also for Alfonso X, Maimónides, Wallada, Bécquer, Teresa de Jesús…!

In this new Ñ game (the fourth in the series), the players have to combine cards correctly with the aim of acquiring more points than their opponents before everybody has played their hand. There are five types of cards: 1) ‘Character cards’, 2) Object cards, 3), Scenario cards, 4) League cards, and 5) Action cards.
As is the case with Mahjong, there are special card combinations that add up points (‘Character’ + ‘Object’; ‘Scenario’ + ‘Character’; or according to ‘Work’ or ‘Author’). There are also card combinations like ‘Heroines’, (Benina, Teresa or Esperanza), or ‘Villains of Literature’ (Doña Perfecta, Bernarda Alba). The value of each card is determined according to the ‘Ñ value’, (main value), ‘Wisdom value’, and ‘Strength value’. Unless an ‘Action card’ specifies otherwise, the ‘Ñ’ value is the one that should be used to score points.

During the game, players have to take turns choosing cards that allow them to score or undermine their opponents. The cards can be found in four different states of play: 1) in the players’ hands (each player receives a set number of cards at the start of the game), 2) on the table (visible to all players), 3) in the scoring area of each player, or 4) out of the game (used cards). Cards in the hand or on the table can be used to score points, while cards in the scoring area of the players or among used cards are irrevocable, meaning that they can not be placed in another area.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Educational, Fantasy, Novel-based, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Greatest Thief
description:
You have a priceless artifact that you “acquired” early in your career. The artifact is part of a set, and until recently you had no information regarding the location of the other piece. One of your contacts has just informed you that the other piece is in the hands of a rival “alleged” thief in the area. Your contact also told you this other thief is going to attempt to complete his own set by acquiring your artifact.

In order to win, you must steal your opponent's artifact and make sure they cannot steal it back. You will be able to purchase and install security systems to safeguard your own artifact. You will train up your skills at bypassing the different types of security systems. To fund your endeavors, you will take on smaller heists.

The most unique aspect of the game is that you may only take your turn while your opponent is not around. This means a single game can take days or even weeks to finish, but each turn only takes a few minutes. The game can be stored in the box between turns.

Dice rolling is the primary mechanic for bypassing security systems and accomplishing heists. Each security system has a minimum roll to bypass, and you will roll two dice (D6). Training and some cards you can get during heists can increase your roll.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Lose a Turn, Push Your Luck

name: City of Winter
description:
City of Winter gives us elegant rules, evocative prompts, and inspiring images to help us create a story as we play to explore characters in a world of our shared imagination. It is infinitely repayable and no two games will ever be the same. Like many Story Games, City of Winter does not need a game master or require any other materials or special preparation to play. Everything you need is in the box!

In City of Winter we tell a story that spans generations where the decisions we make as players define how our family changes over time. Over sessions of play our characters will grow old and pass into memory as new generations are born.

Play centers around the exploration of tradition. As we journey through the world of City of Winter, we will encounter varied traditions of the City represented by decks of Tradition Cards. As our characters change and grow the traditions they hold as a family change as well.

City of Winter takes place in a world of fantasy where things are possible that are not possible in our day to day lives. Use this space to imagine and discover without the restrictions we find in our day to day lives."

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Ikaroa: Libro Juego Didáctico
description:
IKAROA is a game created to enhance 21st century skills such as creativity, innovation, problem solving, communication, collaboration, logical thinking, self-regulation, determination and perseverance through a collaborative board game supported by maps, texts and suggestions for use.

Each unit of the game book contains:
1 laminated board for writing and scratching, with the large map of IKAROA.
1 set of maps and rules book.
4 large laminated sheets for drawing and taking notes, which we call the personal board.
1 whiteboard marker to use on laminated sheets.
1 6-sided die to solve difficult encounters or situations.

IKAROA is a cooperative escape room style game, in it we play to solve tests and against time. Once in this imaginary world, we must obtain clues that have different characters or places on all the islands. The goal is to reunite them before time runs out, solving puzzles, helping whoever needs it or defeating adversaries of all kinds. Each clue is obtained by combining 3 objects and / or characters, through a story. When you have solved enough encounters or events, you will have enough clues to stop the catastrophe they have invented and you can escape back to your world claiming victory.

------------------------Spanish-------------------------

IKAROA es un libro juego creado para potenciar habilidades del Siglo XXI como la creatividad, la innovación, la resolución de problemas, la comunicación, la colaboración, el pensamiento lógico, la autorregulación, la determinación y la perseverancia. Todo ello a través de un juego de mesa colaborativo, bellamente ilustrado, con una gran rejugabilidad y apoyado por mapas, textos y sugerencias de uso.

Cada unidad del libro juego contiene:
1 tablero laminado para escribir y rayar, con el mapa en grande de IKAROA.
1 libro juego de mapas y reglas.
4 Hojas grandes laminadas para dibujar y tomar apuntes, que llamaremos tablero personal.
1 marcador de pizarra blanca para utilizar en las hojas laminadas.
1 dado de 6 caras para resolver encuentros o situaciones difíciles.

IKAROA es un juego colaborativoestilo Escape Room o sala de escape, en él jugamos a resolver pruebas y en contra del tiempo. Una vez en este mundo imaginario, debemos obtener pistas que poseen diferentes personajes o lugares en todas las islas. La meta es reunirlos antes de que se acabe el tiempo, resolviendo enigmas, ayudando a quien lo necesite o derrotando adversarios de todo tipo. Cada pista se obtiene al combinar 3 objetos y/o personajes, a través de una historia. Cuando hayas resuelto suficientes encuentros o eventos, tendrás suficientes pistas para detener la catástrofe que hayan inventado y podrás escapar de vuelta a tu mundo reclamando la victoria.
Lo que hace diferente a IKAROA de otros juegos, es que cada componente del juego depende de tu imaginación y puedes jugar incluso con las reglas.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Deduction, Events, Storytelling

name: Watson & Holmes II
description:
After the original Watson & Holmes, more adventures are coming.

Watson & Holmes II is a game of deduction. One to seven aspiring detectives step into the shoes of Doctor Watson, working alongside the detective Sherlock Holmes to try to solve a series of so far unpublished cases directly extracted from Doctor John H. Watson's diaries. Those who accept the challenge relive the adventures of the crime-solving duo, visiting each of the locations where the inquiries were made. Following the trail, each clue brings players closer to solving the case.

New adventures, new special rules and new challenges. Now you can play the game competitively, in teams, cooperatively or solo.

The game is afoot again!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: CovidParty!
description:
Strategy card game.
Your goal is to accumulate as many points as possible by keeping the Virulence of the epidemic as low as possible, and through Missions carried out during the game. Draw and play humorous Development Cards to build your own strategy to resist the epidemic!

On their turn, players roll a dice to determine the evolution of the epidemic, then draw cards, and choose which cards to play to develop their country in accordance with their strategy. It is the intensity of the epidemic in a player's country that determines how many resources he/she will have to play cards during this turn.

Players try to accumulate points by developing certain abilities through playing cards. These abilities can help them slow the epidemic and reduce its intensity, or carry out missions. Both make the player gain points at the end of the game.

A game lasts 6 months, one month in the game being represented by a turn played by all players (so each player plays 6 turns). The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Economic, Humor
mechanics: Alliances, Dice Rolling, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Open Drafting

name: Rangers of Shadow Deep: Dungeons Dark – The Rescue: Part 2
description:
The quest that began in Across the Wastes continues in Dungeons Dark!

This new mission includes 4 scenarios that use a classic dungeon-style set-up. The rangers must explore the labyrinthine corridors and rooms of the dungeon, fighting monsters, dodging traps, and perhaps even finding a bit of treasure, in their bid to escape the dungeon and continue with their quest. The book also includes an extra scenario, should the rangers get captured, and a section on ‘shadow magic’, which the heroes can employ at their peril.

A Mission for Level 10+ Rangers
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Wings of Glory: Pocket Travel Edition
description:
Card-only version published on the issue #25 of the magazine IoGioco (April 2022). 3 maneuvre decks, 6 planes (to play in 6 with two copies), trenches and machine guns. Simplified combat rules and a range of scenarios. 100% compatible with all Wings of War and Wings of Glory sets.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Action Queue, Movement Template, Player Elimination, Programmed Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Team-Based Game

name: Myth Wars: Battle for Midia
description:
A fast-paced tabletop wargame for 2-4 players (expandable to 8 players with two copies). This accessible game features army building, a real-time move phase, simultaneous player turns, dice rolling, and beautiful myth-based art all combining into destructive and action packed gameplay.

In Myth Wars: Battle for Midia, players build their own armies, then team up or engage in free-for-all combat, moving their units during the move phase, then rolling and assigning dice during the attack phase. The goal: destroy all opposing creatures. The last player or team standing wins the battle.

The game features double sided tokens for army building. Each side of the tokens (and their cards) features unique colors including the character art and as well as the token's border. This means that with two copies of the game, the player cap goes from 4 to 8, as each player is able to uniquely identify their own characters in their army.

The real-time move phase in conjunction with the thoughtful attack phase creates great pacing, as players jump back and forth between quick bursts of action, then thoughtful strategy and decision-making.

–description from publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Moving Multiple Units, Player Elimination, Real-Time
