Visit KISS' history of hit singles, platinum albums and sell-out live shows!
6 customised heavy metal tokens included
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Grand Bazaar
description:
Constantinople (Istanbul) in the beginning of the 17th century at the Grand Bazaar (Kapali Carsi). Players are the proud owners of a few small textile shops with the ambition to build more and larger shops, sell more goods, gain customers' trust and popularity, in order to become the most successful merchant in Grand Bazaar. Players gain success points by satisfying their customer needs that are influenced by market demands. In order to expand, players need to hire more employees, build new shops and auxiliary buildings, increase their supplies, and attract more customers. Players need to make sure that they satisfy their customers; unsatisfied customers become angry, leave the shops and spoil players' reputation.
During the game, players compete in preparing in the best possible way for running their market shops. Players send their managers and employees to external jobs (common for all players) in order to build new shops, order supplies, hire new employees etc. Then they operate their shops in order to gain money for the next rounds and success points.
The goal of the game is to gain the most success points. Success points are gained by operating shops, having a large number of employees, operating a large market and by making presents to the Sultan.
mechanics: Worker Placement

name: Payoff Pitch Baseball: 1969 Cards
description:
1969 MLB Season - the first year of the Expos, Padres, Royals and Seattle Pilots.

This is the 1969 cardset. 856 player cards and 24 ballparks on 2 pages, printed on high-gloss heavy cardstock for use with the Payoff Pitch Baseball base game.

L/R splits on batter cards as with all Payoff Pitch Baseball sets.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Print & Play, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Darkholds
description:
Description from the publisher:

Darkholds is a co-operative board game of combat and adventure in which you and your friends will play the part of heroes and henchmen that battle against the hordes of undeath to gain the ultimate prize - the secret of life after death!

Set in the lands of darkness - the brutal, uncivilised world of dark ages Britain in the 7th century AD - Darkholds is a board game containing miniatures, tiles, counters and cards to enable 1-4 players to control legendary heroes and their henchmen as they explore the caverns, barrows and halls of the undead Wihts.

The game can be played as a story campaign comprising ten levels of varying design and aspect in three areas, beginning in the caverns and natural gorges near the coast (area 1, levels 1-3), then exploring the catacombs and barrows of the undead (area 2, levels 4-6) and eventually fighting through the halls of the ancients (area 3, levels 7-9) to gain the secret of undeath (the quest's end, level 10); but each level can of course be played on its own. You can even choose to play each area - three levels - as a mini-campaign! Players need not worry about the experience of their heroes or henchmen if they play later levels, either, for the skills and abilities of the adventurers are tied to the levels themselves.

If Darkholds is played as a campaign, players can purchase certain types of mundane equipment or hire henchmen in between levels - effectively meaning heroes have a retinue they can bring with them to the next level!

To succeed in their quest for eternal life players must overcome a horde of enemies trying to stop their heroes, gathering treasure, ancient artefacts and sorcerous weapons or armour to help them along the way. The Wihts, scampering grave spiders and huge, terrifying mound beetles, ancient Gāsta and shrieking Drēaguth all wish to deny the secrets of the Jutes to the outsiders, and they will do anything - including the destruction of their own halls and tombs - to stop them.

Players must also understand that - whilst the game is co-operative - there will also be an element of selfishness to how each player plays the game, for each hero has his own secret quest and must succeed in it if he is to progress through Darkholds successfully...
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Etchessera
description:
Etchessera is a chess-based abstract strategy game that utilizes draft-able armies in a medieval fantasy setting. Before each game, players build their own chess army from a collection of 17 different pieces. All of the original pieces from chess and checkers are available as well as several new ones such as a wizard, dragon, or guard.

During a player's turn, they choose to move or activate one of their pieces. Many pieces are similar to classic chess pieces in which they capture others by moving onto the same square. Some capture by jumping, and others capture via rolling a certain result on a die.

As in chess, the ultimate goal of the game is for each player to capture their opponent's King. Similar to the classic game, there are opportunities for stale-mates that result in draws.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: A Poison Apple
description:
The Evil Queen wants a poison for the poison apple. But only the rarest poison based on a dragon's blood will satisfy her needs. The only problem is, the last dragon alive was seen some thousand years ago... So she turns to a covenant of witches for help.

Players take role of the witches that compete to concoct most bottles of the rarest poison in the game (out of 3 kinds). While the total amount of poisons in the game is changing, the rarest type of poison also changes, so the winner is uncertain until the very end. When the 5-th bottle of any type of poison is made, the game ends, and only the rarest poison is counted toward victory condition.

There are 10 action tokens that players may pick, and they represent the actions that each player will play on their next turn. You can not pick action token that are in possession of other player(s).

Players will collect ingredients for the poisons from the game board by rolling dice. But ingredients are expendable and the sources will eventually dry up. So in time, it is harder and harder to collect new ingredients.

Players must discover rituals that can convert certain ingredients into a dragon's blood, necessary for concocting the poisons. Players build their gameplay based on the rituals they have discovered.

Each player starts with one Secret Ally card. If the player finish the game on his turn, and that makes his secret ally player to win - they both win! This eliminates the "kingmaker" mechanic.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Set Collection

name: Comitatus: Warfare in the Dark Ages AD250-1100
description:
Comitatus is a complete set of wargames rules designed to simulate warfare in Europe and the Mediterranean from about AD 250 to 1100. They have been primarily designed with Barbarian Migrations period in mind but the scope of the rules covers Dark Age warfare through to the period of the First Crusade.

Comitatus is a fast moving game that is relatively easy to master. Full-scale battles representing tens of thousands of troops on each side can easily be fought to a conclusion in 3-4 hours while still retaining the special characteristics of dark age warfare.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Gelatinous Cubes Devour the World
description:
Welcome to Gelatinous Cubes Devour The World from Wrectangle Games! In this game, you are finally able to live out your life-long fantasies of being a Gelatinous Cube. Famished from your travels underground, you emerge to devour the most delicious delicacies you can find – people. Travel from village to village eating everything in your path, or test your slimy grit against the heavily fortified Castle. The first player to masticate their way to 500 points wins!

Players create a world map (random each time) then move their Cubes through this world eating the most villagers by rolling dice to beat skirmish cards drawn when entering a village or castle.

What’s Included:

Player avatars: (6) translucent color cubes(Red, Green, Blue, Yellow, Orange, Purple)
D6 Dice: (2) – 6 sided dice for working out Skirmishes
Map Tiles: (12)
Skirmish Cards: (54)
Slime Tokens & Negative Modifiers: Punch cards with colored
Slime Tokens for each player color and punch cards with “-1” Negative Modifiers


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board

name: Winner's Drink: Apostrophe Edition
description:
Drinking games are fucked! Unless you're some kind of alcoholic super-Chad who shits frat parties or a walking rule book, the games are an impediment to your liquor. And worse yet, if you do manage to eek out a victory, it's the LOSERS who get to drink! Fuck that shit. WINNERS DRINK.

This game was made from a lifetime of sitting around bullshitting in bars and getting kicked out of those bars and getting into heated arguments with people over stupid shit and screwing up with women. If you play this game, those things will probably happen to you.

Players draw a card from the 52 card deck which are comprised of 5 categories: Balls, Contest, Truth Bombs, Rage, and Wild Cards. Balls present you with a social challenge to overcome. A contest will pit you in a challenge against other players. Truth Bomb will reveal more about your friends than you ever thought you'd care to know and you'll learn what minute details of life are causing your friends to feel a rage this week.

Each card type has its own challenge to win at. Players that win a card, keep the card. The player with the most cards at the end of the game, wins.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Acting, Memory, Push Your Luck

name: In Her Majesty's Name: The Rise of Akhenaton
description:
In Her Majesty's Name: The Rise of Akhenaton is set in a Steampunk world of 1895, the players represent the major nations of the Victorian era competing for both mechanical & mystical advantage.

Three decks of cards (Destination, Mission & Adversary) create challenges all around the world and the players compete to accumulate Fame Points by travelling to destinations and claiming the cards for successfully completing the challenge at that location.
Challenges involve Shooting, Fighting or Mystic traits; they are resolved using a dice roll adjusted by skill level, 'Operation' cards played and money spent.

During a challenge all players can opt to play cards to either help or hinder the current player.
Six of the challenges in the game involve the 'Regalia of Ra', if players obtain these items they increase their Mystic powers.
However Akhenaton’s agents are also searching for the Regalia of Ra and on every player’s turn all regalia in play will move towards their headquarters in Cairo, if a regalia item reaches Cairo then Akhenaton claims it.

When the sixth regalia item is revealed Akhenaton himself appears on the board and moves on London, if he reaches London he wins, if he is defeated then the player with the most Fame Points wins.

—description from the designer

Feedback from playtester Mark T
“it’s an atmospheric, retro experience with simple, fast, well balanced, logical game play. We all loved the subtle balance of co-op and every man for himself. The pain of taking one for the team by compromising an intended mission to help someone else pick up a Regalia rather than let it get to Cairo makes for some fantastic gameplay with all the deal making/breaking that goes with that.
The end game is a lovely ramping of tension and the option of going for total loss rather than helping someone who has previously screwed you over win outright is also a very nice/nasty touch.”
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Dronica
description:
Two-four players maneuver their drones around a crowded battlespace, vying for advantages in space and positioning. Place and move your drones strategically to control key areas, allowing you opportunities to disable your enemy and protect your Controller. Work to impede enemy Controllers by forcing them to the outskirts of the battlespace. Be the first player to surround your Controller and unleash a final attack, destroying all enemy forces.

Game Type: Abstract Game (Hex-tile)
Mechanics: Tile Placement, Modular Board

This is a boardless positional strategy game where players try to control space, lay traps, disable their enemies, and protect their Controller. The first player to completely surround their Controller wins the game. The combination and interaction of the different drones fosters depth of strategy and supports various types of play (e.g. quick/offensive, sneaky/traps, conservative/defensive).

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement, Tile Placement

name: Quantum Shock
description:
Quantum Shock is a scifi horror boardgame for 1 to 4 players with modular map tiles, cards, dice, amazing miniatures and a powerful narrative campaign.
Players can manipulate time and space, jump between dimensions, and learn all kind of weird skills, while fighting or hidding from the twisted horrors that will infest their reality.

Players can perform common actions like moving, searching for items or attack enemies. But they can also hide from enemies, teleport though portals or jump to unknown areas of the map.
The attack system uses a combination of dice roll and card decks, including intense fight with huge bosses.

Rotating the modular map tiles, players change between dimensions, finding new secrets and special items but also unlocking deadly menaces.

The game has a timeline that controls the turns of players and creatures. The characters can use their skills to manipulate time, adjusting this timeline and the events of the campaign.

The core game has a 10 episodes campaign, with an average time of 90 to 120 minutes each one. The main goal of the game is to return to your own dimension, as players are lost in time and space.

All players and enemies are represented by highly detailed miniatures, including bosses and secondary characters.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Veil Of Ruin
description:
Inspired by tabletop classics like Dungeons & Dragons and Magic: The Gathering, Veil of Ruin is a progressive deckbuilding RPG.

Veil of Ruin is an immersive gaming experience designed to give you hours of unique and ever-changing enjoyment. Thanks to Veil of Ruin’s quick setup and simple, yet intricate combat and dungeon crawling systems, you and your friends can go from opening the box to slaying monters within minutes. Venture into the dangerous, dying jungles of Orman, taking on the persona of one of our six unique Heroes as they fight their way through a myriad of Enemies.

Gameplay:

Veil of Ruin features three modes, Skirmish, Into the Jungle and PVP.

Skirmish games are a cooperative one time experience for 1-4 players that take between 45 minutes and 2 hours. Select the difficulty, pick the monsters you are fighting, draft your deck, get some equipment and then fight!

A more intense experience is our Into the Jungle mode, a roguelike adventure designed with replayability in mind. Each cooperative session for between 1-4 players takes between 2 and 5 hours, players draft cards, gain items and other loot as they progress through the jungles of Orman.
PVP is best played once you have a good understanding of the flow of gameplay. With a few tweaks of the rules 2-4 players can battle one another to determine who is the champion of the jungle.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Closed Drafting, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Matching, Open Drafting, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Crossroads and the Green Emerald
description:
A miniatures adventure that is set in an old west town called Crossroads. A giant 8 foot by 8 foot game board with 20 core characters and over 100 town characters provide a unique one of a kind adventure every time Crossroads is played. Each game begins with a random building of the town with up to 50 structures and then placement of your fort followed by choosing your characters. Then you pick the order for your characters and enjoy the unfolding of a new adventure.

Your team of 2-4 characters begins their quest to bring the green emerald back to their fort. On each turn a player may move a character and use that characters weapons or special power. Each characters movement is defined by a number of chain links giving your character a speed limit but allowing movement in any direction. Each character also has a set of weapons that have range limitations based on line of site and distance. Each character also has a unique power allowing them to use dynamite, arrest a character, use multiple weapons, etc. Temporary alliances, control of strategic vantage points, and a balance of defensive strength and offensive risk taking make the inevitable race to get the emerald a do or die moment. Hits on each character are achieved though a damage bag that inserts an element of chance in which a hit could mean a miss, 1 or 2 life points or possibly an instant kill. The game is won when one player has returned the green emerald to their fort. The key to winning is choosing your moment to go for the emerald when you are strong enough to beat all the others players.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Retrieval, Catch the Leader, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Modular Board, Three Dimensional Movement, Variable Set-up

name: Deadzone: Incoming Intel Deck
description:
The Incoming Intel Deck is an entirely new way to play Deadzone! Out in the field, you never know what your next target will be and the Incoming Intel Deck represents this with missions that change on the fly. This 66-card deck includes ever-changing objectives and special events that can shape the conflict.
Contents: 66 Incoming Intel Cards. Standard Playing Card Size.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: High Seas Fleet: The Great War at Sea: August 1914 - November 1918
description:
High Seas Fleet 2nd edition Scenario Booklet provides over forty scenarios for all the major WW I naval actions, which include the well-known big battles like Jutland (broken into three parts, as well as the complete engagement), Dogger Bank, and many smaller fights.
The scenarios often include variants, covering historical “almosts” and “what ifs”.

This second edition takes advantage of the new scholarship and many information sources that have appeared since the first edition was published in 2001. This includes the massive amount of material associated with the centenary of WW I, and especially the Battle of Jutland, or Skaggeractschlacht, as the Germans call it.

Naval historian Nick Jellicoe, grandson of Admiral Sir John Jellicoe, has graciously written a foreword.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Europe 3020
description:
It's 3020 and mankind is now able to travel freely in space. They discovered planets and civilizations previously unknown.

On Earth culture and democracy are at their highest level of splendor and the entire humankind wants to share its achievements with all space populations. You are part of one of these missions.

Europe 3020 is a cooperative board game for 2 to 4 players set in a future far away, in which terrestrial beings discovered a way to travel in space and had the chance to meet other civilizations. Humans have decided to share the European Community's Founding Principles with these alien civilization, as an example of progress, democracy and freedom. The ambitious plan is to help them prosper and guard them against repeating earthlings' past mistakes.

The game's goal is to build as many Founding Principle as possible before leaving Earth, in a limited number of turns. Throughout the game experience, players will be able to learn the importance of the values and objectives achieved by the European Community, not only in a theoretical way based on abstract knowledge, but experimenting in first person all their relevance.

Every player has 5 activity points in each turn, and they can spend them to perform their choice of the following actions: Moving, Identifying Values, Recovering Values, Storing Values, Building Founding Principles.

In order to build a Founding Principle, players have to identify, reach, collect and store Values. When a Founding Principle has been built, it has an impact on gameplay.

After 15 rounds, there is a tally of Victory Points, depending on the number of Founding Principles built and the final placement of the pawns on the board, and the game is over.
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Mediterranean Fleets: The Italian, Greek, Turkish and Yugoslav Navies in WWII (2012 Standard)
description:
For the first time the Admiralty Trilogy system covers the Greek, Turkish, and Yugoslavian Navies. Previous listings of Italian ships and aircraft have been updated with information from many new reference sources (including naval experts in Italy who were consulted and graciously shared information that resolved many questions. Fire control and ASW capabilities especially benefited from their assistance.)

Mediterranean Fleets includes over 150 ships and 90 aircraft. All data and information has been updated to Command at Sea 4th edition standard.
More than just making the information compatible with Command at Sea, this data is now in the same format as Harpoon and Fear God & Dread Nought, the other core games in the Admiralty Trilogy.
All ships and aircraft extant from 1939 to 1945, including several projected or hypothetical platforms are here; such as the projected Italian aircraft carriers, the Turkish Batiray mine-laying submarine, and the Italian G.55/II Centauro fighter and Piaggio P.108 bomber

Mediterranean Fleets has been updated to use the 2012 Standard, an improved formula used to calculate a ship’s damage points.

Please make sure that all ships on both sides in a scenario are using either the older 2006 Standard, or the new 2012 Standard.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Simulation

name: Tail Feathers: The Wilderberry Patch
description:
"Blimey!" hissed Filch. Before them was a wilderberry bush from which sprang the first blooms of the season. A bush such as that could yield the most magical of fruit and influence the outcome of the ongoing war.

This scenario features the Downwood Militia and the Vermin Raiders battling over magic berries!
categories: Animals, Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling

name: Warbirds: Duel of Eagles 1939-1945 – Module 1: Blitzkrieg
description:
The Duel of Eagles rule set of the Warbirds Game System will see rapid advances in engine, airframe design, weapons and radar. New rules will cover the impact on air combat from weapon harmonization, simple, reflector and gyroscopic gun sights, compressibility, effects of armor, turbo chargers and much more.

One addition to the game system for WWII is increases in aircraft performance which are addressed with additional columns in the Maximum Speed section of the data card. Military (MIL), War Emergency Power (WEP) and thrust augmentation systems such as water injection or nitrous oxide deliver varying horse power and thrust. Each throttle setting has a maximum speed determined by the thrust provided. For example, the Bf 109 E-3 has three maximum speeds, Military, 1 WEP and 5 WEP. The WEP has a one and five minute allowable time limit over-boost which provided additional power over the military rating of the engine. Fuel use increases with the use of WEP and pilots of aircraft with short legs will need to watch their use of fuel or getting home may be a problem when flying a flight operations mission. Aircraft specific overheating, trains, shell penetration and ground unit armor thickness are some of the areas covered.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Código Secreto: Expansión Promocional México
description:
10 cards with 20 words chosen by the Mexican community to make up these cards.

This promo pack was launched at the MegaXP 2020.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents, Word Game
mechanics: Communication Limits, Memory, Push Your Luck, Team-Based Game

name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Anthology
description:
The Anthology book is a handy one-stop-shop for all the published rules for the smash hit The Walking Dead: All Out War miniatures game. The rules are updated with all the latest changes and FAQs. The book also includes a host of new exciting content and scenarios and new ways of playing for All Out War, along with the Call to Arms and Here’s Negan Walking Dead games, also from Mantic. Will you survive!?

—description from the publisher's website
categories: Book, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Day of Independence
description:
A competitive semi-anti-co-operative board game of world domination. Warring human faction must choose to keep fighting one another or join forces to defeat the Alien invaders... or both... or side with the aliens to get help in defeating their human foes... or not.

Day of Independence is a grand strategy game for 2 - 5 players set in an alternative steam-punky future. Each player plays a human power trying to take over the world. At some random point in the game Aliens may show up. The Aliens' true intentions are slowly revealed over time, and players must decide whether to fight the Aliens or not. Players choose actions that will make them either Collaborators with the Aliens or Resistance Fighters. The benefits and penalties of each decision depends upon the Aliens' true intentions. Lots of strategy, forced cooperation, and the ever present possibility of a knife in the back makes this game fun and different each time it is played.

You live on an Earth that is a fractured world of rival human powers, struggling against each other for dominance… you know, the usual — like it’s always been. Each unwilling to let other nations just chill.
Culture, art, religion, language, population, and even military might have been reduced to a single quantified unit of influential power, called Influence.
Advances in technology have allowed all economies and industries to rely on just three resources: Ever-Stones, a chewy red resource crystal especially good in stews and as a sealant for nuclear waste sites; Green Avoidium, an aromatic mineral green resource used to put off chores and unpleasant tasks until tomorrow, and; Un-salt, a yellow resource ore best described by what it isn’t — it’s not salt.
Scientist the world over have postulated the possibility of extra-terrestrial life for centuries, but there has never been any proof that Aliens exist and no proof that they are heading to earth on a mothership filled with super-powerful weapons and a willingness to use them.
So don’t worry. There probably aren’t any super advanced Aliens out there with incredible technology that could pose a threat to humankind. Just keep fighting amongst yourselves. If only you could capture enough territory to declare yourself Ruler of Earth, everything would be great. All problems would be solved and you could go to bed at night and sleep the sleep of the just, knowing that you are the winner, ‘cause winning is all that matters.
But, if Aliens came… they might Exterminate the human race, or maybe they would come to Enslave you all. If they knew the Earth contained the Resource of Interest that they have been scouring the Universe for, they might come to Mine the Earth dry. Or maybe they might just come to say ‘hi’, as part of their mission to Explore strange new worlds and seek out new life and new civilizations. Or maybe capitalism would be their bag, and they would come to Trade, with a special offer, just for you.
But they probably don’t exist, so just keep fighting amongst yourselves.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Alliances, Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Moving Multiple Units, Semi-Cooperative Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Single Loser Game, Track Movement, Turn Order: Auction

name: Bye Bye Virus
description:
INTRODUCTION: There is a virus outbreak in town. Stay safe against virus exposure by dealing with real-life situations. The deck has 3 types of cards: Protect cards, Panic cards, and Power cards.

SETUP: Choose your Deck depending on the number of players. 3 to 3 players, use the Green Deck only while for 4 to 6 players, use the Green and Blue Deck. Shuffle the Deck and place it face down on the table. As you play, throw cards face-up into the Discard pile. HOW TO PLAY: Players start with no cards. Choose any player to start and continue in a clockwise direction. For each turn, draw 1 card from the Deck into your hand. Look at it but do not show it to the others. Choose to pass your turn or play an action by discarding cards face-up into the Discard pile. You can play 1 of 3 actions: Use 1 power card and perform the effect described; or, discard any 3 panic cards to steal 1 card from any player; or, discard 3 of the same cards to pick any 1 card from the Discard pile. IMPORTANT TERMS: To discard a card: without seeing the cards, select a random card and throw it into the discard pile. To steal a card: without seeing the cards, select a random card and keep it in your hand. To pick a cards: looking at the cards, pick one and keep it in your hand.

HOW TO WIN: At any time in the game, be the first to collect one of each of the five Protect cards and shout "Bye Bye Virus" without getting caught by the Police! Take note of these 2 special power cards: Use the Stay at Home card to replace any Protect card. Use the Police card to stop someone from winning. SPECIAL RULES: All cards lost due to Special Rules are thrown into the Discard pile. Maximum 8 cards in hand: To prevent hoarding, discard any extra cards at the end of your turn. Don't touch your face: Catch any player touching their face and randomly discard one of their cards.

OUR FAVORITE POWER CARDS: There are 12 different Power cards in the deck to make it fun. Government, to Create a new rule, rule breakers to discard a random card. Citizen Watch, to pick a player to recite one of the protect card's advice from memory, if they fail, steal a card. Virus Exposure, pick a player to discard 1 Protect card or to enter quarantine (skip 2 turns). Stay fit, do 10 jumping jacks to draw 1 card. And more...
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Humor
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Role Playing, Simulation, Turn Order: Random

name: WizDice R&W
description:
WizDice is a roll and write game in which players pretend to be sorcerers in training, the final exam is about and they must fight among all the applicants, there will only be one pass ... will it be you?
WizDice is a game for 1 to 5 players, with an approximate duration of 45 minutes.
In the game each player controls their learning sheet and through this they must cast spells, summon creatures, prepare your lesson book and gain experience in order to attack the other players, the player who is the first to leave will win. KO a player.
During the game, the player in turn will throw X dice, choose the ones that help him the most and leave some for the other wizards, collect different elements depending on the chosen dice, these elements will then serve to cast powerful spells against a player of his choice.
-Remember this is the final exam and alliances are short-lived in WizDice.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game, Take That

name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Maggie, Hilltop Leader Booster
description:
When the violent group calling themselves the Saviors threaten the Hilltop community, Maggie Greene is the one to issue the call to arms. Ousting the previous leader, she stands alongside Rick Grimes to fight the nefarious Negan. She’s in charge now – and everyone knows it.

Contains:
2 Resin Models – Maggie & Sophia and cards.

Card included are:
Maggie and Sophia Character Cards for All out War and Call to Arms, and the following equipment cards: Longbow, Hilltop Spear, Hilltop Sword, Backpack, Binoculars, Aug A3, Blacksmith’s hammer, Utility belt, Throwing axe, Hilltop spear and Throwing spear.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Tit Albert dans Villaz
description:
Tit'Albert Dan Vilaz is a fascinating and extremely simple game system!
The peaceful Vilaz is invaded by the Tit'Albert who devour the Vilazwas one by one.
If no one reacts, it is otut le Vilaz that is threatened! The game continues until the Tit'Alberts are eliminated or the Vilaz is emptied of its inhabitants.

A turn-based game alternating day / night cycles, the story of Vilaz is told by the Storyteller, who will put the Vilaz to sleep and wake up the actors of this story to play a specific role in this confrontation between the players.
Play as a Tit'Albert to eat the Vilazwas or Cliffeeeeurd the White Hunter, take the lead of the Vilaz by becoming the Sef'Vilaz and eliminate every day a player you suspect to be a Tit'Albert.

Tit'Albert Dan Vilaz is based on Mauritian folklore which describes the myth of the werewolf. Each character in the game comes from local folklore and represents an icon from Mauritian culture.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Player Elimination, Semi-Cooperative Game, Turn Order: Role Order, Voting

name: Fyra
description:
Fyra is a card game about matching and stacking meant for 1-4 players who have, at a minimum, the ability to differentiate colors or printed patterns. You take turns matching up your cards with the ones already on the play field. The cards overlap but you must match the colors of at least one of the corners. If you can't find a spot for your cards, you get to place one next to the other cards, but have to take two replacements. Alternately, if you find a spot where you can match all four corners you don't have to take any replacement cards and get one step closer to going out.

The real fun comes in when you choose a team color and try to make sure as few of those squares are showing by the time you go out. Make alliances to spread one player's color all over the field and make their score worse while setting up spots where you can match up all your own corners the next time your turn comes around. There are 2 goals: be the first to get rid of all your cards and second, have the fewest squares of your color on the play field when you do.

You can also play a solo game trying to make the smallest pile of cards based on randomly selected hands of cards. A game with 4 players should last around 5 to 20 minutes.

-description from designer
mechanics: Matching

name: Little Nutters: The Card Game
description:
A card game where memory, strategy, and luck are needed as you maneuver around challenges presented both by your fellow players and randomly by the game itself. Little Nutters is a turn-based game where you take on the persona of a squirrel trying to uncover their buried nuts through the various patches on the playing field. Be the first to find all of your nuts before your opponents, but beware of rapid kittens, quack attacks, and ninja beavers. The dangers are very real in Little Nutters.

One by one, players take turns searching or digging through 27 randomly shuffled patches of 4 cards. The ultimate goal is to uncover a nut within these patches, but along the way players may find defense cards to bolster their hand or obstacles or animal attacks to possibly hinder their turn. Watch out for other players too as they can play trouble cards during their turn to weaken your hand or bust-a-nut cards to try and steal one of your hard earned prizes.

Set in a whimsical environment with fantastic cartoon-ish artwork, Little Nutters is a perfect party game with a quick and easy set-up and rules.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deduction, Hand Management, Memory

name: Skåne (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description: Skåne is the southernmost part of Sweden. Game rules are the same as Ticket to Ride Europe.
mechanics: Network and Route Building

name: Tales of War
description:
Tales of War is a competitive tactical board game for two players, which places you in the roles of army generals in the conflict for the Cross of Eternity, an ancient artefact holding the key to immortality!

The game board represents an open book filled with ever-changing terrain and mighty heroes leading their armies of medieval troops and fantasy creatures into battle. Each time you play the game, you write a new tale. It is your very own tale of war!

Key gameplay features:

- Skill-based combat. Players take turns activating one unit at a time and either move it to another position or attack an opponent´s unit. Tales of War doesn’t use dice, nor cards to resolve combat. Instead defeating enemy units is as simple as either moving your melee unit onto a square occupied by them or positioning your ranged units in the line of fire and range.

Each unit has different equipment, which defines its special rules. For example, units equipped with spears will automatically repel a direct cavalry charge and archers cannot make a frontal assault on units armed with shields. A player can still use the cavalry to outmanoeuvre a unit equipped with spears and devastate it with a flank or rear charge, just as archers may trap a shielded enemy by attacking at an angle.

There are 21 unit types and each has unique abilities, strengths and weaknesses. As the campaign progresses, your initially small force expands to include units, such as Elves, Dwarves, Fire and Ice Sorceresses, Giants, Hydras, Fire Elementals or even Vampires!

- RPG-like sense of progression and a constant arms race. Both armies evolve from one battle to the next, and your heroes learn new skills making them more dangerous on the battlefield;

- Replayability. Tales of War offers new, unique challenges and strategic/tactical possibilities each time you play. Each battle has its own victory conditions and is played on unique terrain. You will face a different, custom-built army each battle, just as your own army will have been re-equipped and re-organised.

- Fast setup and quick turns. Tales of War takes under 5 minutes to set up and tear down. Watching your opponents moves is as exciting as making your own as it always has an impact on the situation on the board;

- Ease of saving campaign progress. Simply put your units and their cards into your army box and that's it. You can pick up where you left off in the next session.
mechanics: Action Points, Advantage Token, Area Movement, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Open Drafting, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Backyard Chickens: Solo Expansion
description:
A sneaky fox has her sights set on your chicken coop! You must score ten or more points before the fox breaks into your coop to steal your eggs. These rules allow you to play Backyard Chickens by yourself.

Contains 15 cards, a small four page rule book, and one token. for playing the solo game. Available as a free print-and-play add-on or through The Game Crafter.
categories: Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Farming, Print & Play
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: HeroQuest: The Halls of Durrag-Dol
description: This expansion came with White Dwarf issue 134 published in 1991. The Halls of Durrag-Dol is a quest for MB Games HeroQueset. Included with this quest are new rules for using Skaven in your HeroQuest games and an option to include Kili Thekkrsson as a Dwarf Trollslayer player character.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Game System, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Grid Movement, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Role Playing, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Roll / Spin and Move, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: The Game of Skate TCG
description:
The Game of Skate TCG is a fast paced competitive dice-battle card game.

If you've ever played a game of H.O.R.S.E. on a basketball court, then you already know how to win at The Game of Skate! Play skateboard trick cards and roll the dice to land them! Players take turns trying their best not crash and bail on their opponent's tricks at the risk of taking a letter! Spell out S.K.A.T.E. and you lose the game!

The Game of Skate is easy to learn but offers deep strategy and boundless opportunities for customized deck building.

Each Hero is built around a unique Skateboard archetype. Maxx, a Hammer-type Hero specializes in huge drops and maximum impact. Tawny is a Vert Hero who owns the skies with super-charged spin moves. Choose cards that sync with your Hero’s Abilities to unlock your Ultimate Banger!

Card Types

Trick types include Flip, Spin, Grind, and Grab. Most trick cards will be resolved, or Landed, by a roll of the dice. Action type cards are divided into Steeze and Stoppers, where Steeze cards will usually help, while Stoppers hinder your opponent. Location Cards are where all the magic happens. Activate your Local, Gnarly, and Heroic spots to gain an edge over your opponents!

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Sports
mechanics: Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Drawing, Hand Management, Interrupts, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Re-rolling and Locking, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Holiday 2022 Promo Cards
description:
Black Friday and Holiday 2022 exclusive cards for Shadows of Brimstone, received from orders of $100 or more on their website during this sale. Includes:

Trederran War Skull - Trederran Artifact - (Once per adventure, draw a growing dread card and add it to the stack to gain +2 combat or +2 shots for an attack).

Rotting Within - Darkness - (Every hero must immediately make a spirit 5+ test, rolling one fewer die than normal for each corruption they currently have (minimum 1 die). If failed, roll once on the mutation chart).

Also made available during the GenCon 2023 sale.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Clockwise
description:
Join the race against time in Clockwise, the worker placement board game played on functioning mechanical gears.

Based on a Jules Verne short story, players collect resources and build clocks to save the city of Geneva. The game board consists of five inner mechanical gears and one large outer gear that rotates all the inner gears when it is moved. The inner gears contain resource spots that correspond to resource items used to build clocks. Players must place one of their workers on the starting position of any gear. The more turns you wait on the inner gears, the more valuable resources you will receive.

With the resources claimed, players can trade them in to build one of the revealed clocks located at the bottom of the board. Each clock has unique resources to build them and each hold a different victory point value when completing them. The game is played for 24 hours and when the clock strikes midnight, the game is over and clock victory points are tallied. The player with the most victory points wins the game and is titled as Geneva's next Clockmaster. Can you restore order before time runs out?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Worker Placement

name: Ecologies: Contact Creatures Business Card Expansion
description:
These business cards are made to work with the first three Ecologies games. They have biome abbreviations, possible trophic levels, point totals, and work within the food webs. The only thing they lack is information on "what eats what." If players want to use these cards in their games they'll have to do their own research and agree on "what eats what." There simply wasn't enough room to include this information on the cards.

These 54 unique cards feature organisms from all 21 biomes introduced in the "Ecologies" series so far.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Educational, Environmental, Negotiation
mechanics: Hand Management, Negotiation, Set Collection, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Trading

name: Vedrfölnir
description:
"It is said that in ancient times, the völvas of the different clans met to attract the good graces of odin and thor.
They practised galdr, runic magic.
To transmit their prayers, they sought to approach Vedrfölnir, the great eagle at the top of Yggdrasil. To flatter him, it would be enough to pluck 12 stars from the sky.
The path to the great eagle is a perilous one, and the Norns will have to help you tame Sleipnir, outwit Loki, trick Nidhogg and coax Ratatosk... ".

The game consists of collecting Odin or Thor runes, each rune card giving a certain number of points indicated at the bottom of the card. To do this, the player will try to accumulate the cards in order to obtain 12 stars (except in the case of modifying effect cards). If one of the players exceeds the goal, the others will share the runes in the stand.
The winner of the game is the player who has collected the most rune points at the end of the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: The Collapse
description:
The Collapse is a wargame that will be published in Spanish and English, which has a point-to-point mechanic for 2 players (with an optional multiplayer rule, and solo system under playtest) with a common deck (CDG), depicting the epic campaigns of the Thirty Years' War in Europe between 1618 and 1648. Each player takes on the role of a faction (Catholic or Protestant), seeking to direct the fate of the "Holy Roman German Empire" while pursuing their own national interests, allowing to reproduce bold moves and influence or control Regions in the Holy Roman Empire, Flanders and the United Provinces, Northern Italy and Hungary. With the crucial support of foreign nations both military (troops) and with 'Subsidies' (financial resources) will help to achieve victory for one of the two game’ factions.
The game will include a historical book with very interesting historical information about the conflict, and a detailed game example to progressively learn the mechanics of the game.

The Collapse is an intense and very fun game, which is easy to play due to its main mechanics (point to point) and being a card engine (CDG), but with unique aspects such as the planning phase at the beginning of the turn, the prestige points that grant more options to the players (leaders, abilities and much more), and the intense but impressive diplomacy of 9 nations (Saxony, Brandenburg, England, Papacy, Hungary, Spain, Denmark, Sweden and France). Each card has Operations Points (OPS), which allow you to play the card for Operations and/or the event by paying its cost from the OPS of the card, giving many different game options and strategies.
The different Operations that players can use with their operation points are Deploy, Movement, Diplomacy, Naval Blockade, Siege and Replacements. The tension of the game will be increased by having players loot regions and fortresses to pay their units (the 30 years’ war was devastating and troops were frequently fed and paid with what was ravaged. And be careful not to pay the mercenaries in the game, because they can add unrest to the game!

The game has 10 turns, with an average time length of 50 minutes per turn (2-3 years) and a duration of 5 hours for the complete campaign, although it has several shorter scenarios from 2 to 6 turns which includes the Bohemia Palatinate campaign (recommended to play as the first scenario and which will also serve as an example of the game), the Danish, Swedish and French Interventions, or the Cardinal Infante Fernando march. With the recommended optional rule that players can go one more turn with some modifiers if they want to continue playing once the scenario is over and they are having fun.

The sequence of each game turn is divided into 4 main phases:


Planning phase: depending on the prestige of each faction, various actions of the factions may have more or less options
Campaign phase: players alternate cards from their hand (6 cards per turn)
Imperial Election Phase (only on turns 1 and 7): simple phase where it is decided which player has the status of Emperor, with some important benefits in the game
End of Turn Phase: where players use their replacement points to strengthen their troops and armies, determine possible attrition of units outside of their home regions, observe possible expansion of revolts, impact of Dunkirk Corsairs, redeploy units to prepare for the next turn (campaign) and extra victory points can be earned for certain conditions.


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Advantage Token, Alliances, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Events, Movement Points, Multi-Use Cards, Point to Point Movement, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Track Movement

name: Roll N' Pin: The Brazilian Jiu Jitsu Game for the Whole Family
description:
Roll 'n' Pin' is an engaging 2-player tabletop game that simulates Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu competitions. Players assume the roles of skilled BJJ competitors, aiming to defeat their opponent either by achieving a "submission" or accumulating more points during the 10-minute match.

The game incorporates a combination of cards and dice, employing a straightforward war-style mechanic with a rock-paper-scissors system. This design choice ensures easy accessibility for players while allowing for strategic depth. To secure victory, players must defeat their opponent's cards, claim them, and add them to their own "submission" collection. The player who successfully gathers all the required cards for their submission emerges as the winner. Alternatively, players can opt to accumulate points cards to pursue victory through points.

Adding to the excitement, Roll 'n' Pin introduces "VAI!" cards, which serve as action cards. These cards offer players opportunities to bolster their strategies or make it more challenging for their opponent to achieve success.

The game thoughtfully incorporates various design details that create a strong connection to the theme of Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu while providing an avenue for players to learn about the martial art. Notably, the point system utilized in the game closely mirrors the scoring systems employed in actual BJJ tournaments.

Overall, Roll 'n' Pin offers an immersive and cohesive gaming experience, merging the world of BJJ with dynamic gameplay mechanics and thematic elements that educate and entertain players.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Take That

name: I C E: Companion Set
description:
These are two new booster packs and a new edifice tile offered as part of the ICE Limited support campaign.


GUILD booster pack: Not only does this pack feature 5 new Request cards and 1 new Decree (all give new scoring conditions), but it also features 7 Guild Favor cards (a new card type!). Guild Favor cards can be added to any game of ICE for some extra variety and strategic gameplay. Players choose a new Guild Favor card each new Day (round), and during their turn they can turn the card over to use that card’s special action. These can have a special synergy (when using a Favor card from the same Guild you’re playing), or allow for special combos when playing Favors of other Guilds.



EDIFICE booster pack ** As you know, Edifices are the final layer of tiles in the game, and when you discover one it offers a special variant for your next game. But there was no easy way to track this before. Now with the Edifice deck, you have three useful ways to use these cards:
As a displayed reminder of which Edifices you have discovered in previous games, to know which game variant is now in effect.
To randomly choose which Edifice(s) you’ll play with in your next games (if you’ve discovered several, and only want to use 1 or 2).
As a way of choosing an alternate Edifice, if you excavate one you’ve already uncovered previously, and would like to play with something new.




One new EDIFICE tile
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Modular Board

name: Unlikely Minds
description:
Unlikely Minds is a social deduction, hidden identity, party/family game. Get ready as it is time to awaken your dormant psychic powers!

In this game, there are two types of characters, the Psychics and the Swindler. Each turn, a unique topic is chosen by the players from the Topic Deck. All players try to "read the minds" of each other and write down three answers about the topic on their answer sheet, that they think other players will also write down. All players are psychics, except for one - the Swindler. Psychics try to write down answers that they think someone else also would write down. The Swindler tries to write down answers they think no other player would write. After all players write down their answers, they begin reading them off, player by player. All players draw a checkmark next to all matching answers and a cross sign next to all answers no one else wrote.

Now the voting process begins. All players write down the name of the player whom they suspect to be The Swindler and then read off their suspect. If the majority of votes singles out one player, they reveal their role.
Psychics progress one space on the board for each checkmark on their answer sheet plus one additional space, if they correctly voted for the Swindler. The Swindler moves two spaces on the board for each cross sign on their answer sheet, only if they were not caught. However, if the Swindler was caught - they don't move at all.
After all players have moved their pieces, all role cards are shuffled together and handed out to players. A new Swindler is among the Psychics, a new Topic is chosen, and the next round begins.

Each game also comes with the Psychic Master version! In this version of Unlikely Minds, all psychics have a unique power, which they can use to help themselves out, mess with other players, or get unique bonuses.
mechanics: Action Timer, Area Movement, Catch the Leader, Deduction, Hidden Roles, Lose a Turn, Matching, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Ur: The Royal Game
description:
A modern interpretation of the first recorded game, inspired by archeological discoveries.

The Royal Game of Ur is an epic ancient board game that has been around since 2600 BCE. It came into being as a court game in the ancient Mesopotamia.

The game has a 3×8 grid board with 20 squares. The dice used are typically D4, with some alternative solutions existing.

An inevitable reality surrounding the game is that due to the historical context, the full rules and the way of playing are largely unknown. Ur: The Royal Game is a project intended to re-interpret and expand upon the existing concept of the Royal Game of Ur.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Ancient, Dice, Educational, Mythology, Party Game, Racing
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Grid Coverage, Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Square Grid

name: Deep Rock Galactic: Space Rig Expansion
description:
Get ready for new upgrades and a host of new missions, chained together as assignments.

On the orbital space platform, known as the space rig, you can prepare for new missions by visiting the Abyss bar and study the details of the new mission types.

New challenges in the form of anomalies and warnings will make missions progressively harder, but fear not, as your dwarves will advance, too, with the latest and greatest gear.

Get ready to embark on two new mission types; The Drilldozer escort mission and the Liquid Morkite extraction mission.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Miniatures, Space Exploration, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action/Event, Advantage Token, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Events, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Tile Placement

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Dark Beneath the Ice Supplement
description:
The frozen Norselands are already treacherous, but now you can make out something dark...beneath the ice! This does not bode well for your group of heroes.

The 15-card Shadows of Brimstone: Dark Beneath the Ice Supplement includes new Norse Darkness cards, Growing HungerDread cards, and Norseland Encounter cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, American West, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Open Magic
description:
Open Magic is an open source PvP card game that mixes spell casting fantasy with deck building aspect and randomized stats.
Summon creatures, cast enchantments and defeat the opponent wizard, this game is endless thanks to its deck building features and random spells stats.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management

name: The Realm of Sword and Snow
description:
A war strategy-based board game for 3-4 players set in the fantasy realm. Players must outwit their rivals to seize coveted territories, all while fending off the relentless advance of the Undead. One wrong decision could plunge your ambition into the chilling realm of the undead.

Embark on an epic journey in this dynamic war strategy board game, where cunning cooperation meets fierce competition. As a determined prince in a chilling realm plagued by undead, joins forces with an ally to claim strategic regions and outsmart both rivals and the relentless undead. Every move becomes a strategic dance, testing loyalty and tactical wit.

In the icy embrace of winter, unity is your strength against the dual challenges of betrayal and undead forces. The throne awaits the shrewdest tactician in this riveting battle of minds, where every decision shapes your destiny. Will you emerge victorious through clever cooperation or cunning competition?

Game Highlight

Liquor Ceremony
In an intriguing twist, players also have the option to forge alliances through a liquor ceremony, fostering mutual benefits throughout the game, which takes place during spring.

Summer Explore
The game then commences in summer, granting each player the opportunity to select an action phase. Players might also inspect all the cities to explore skill cards and relics.

The War Begin
As autumn arrives, the battleground ignites with the clash of rival princes. Get ready for the excitement to unfold, as players engage in negotiations, deploy their skills, and unleash powerful relics, all in the pursuit of winning this war.

Undead Rising
The war ends and the snow has falls, it’s cold embrace serves as a poignant reminder that victory comes at a price. During winter, players must prepare for the imminent awakening of the undead, who will now launch attacks against all the players. Can you take the advantage in this chaotic season?

—description from the designer
categories: Civil War, Fantasy, Miniatures, Negotiation, Political, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Hidden Roles, Kill Steal, Multi-Use Cards, Semi-Cooperative Game, Victory Points as a Resource, Worker Placement, Zone of Control

name: D-Day Dice (Second Edition): Rogue Regiment
description: D-Day Dice: Rogue Regiment is a mini expansion inspired by Word Forge Games' Rogue Regiment by Robb Butler. It contains a Legendary Unit (Rogue Regiment), a War Story (Rogue Agent) and 6 unique Servicemen cards, based on the real life heroes that inspired the characters in SAS Rogue Regiment.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, World War II
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Role of Fate
description:
Role of Fate: a team-based competitive TCG and strategy skirmish game.

Welcome to the Everrealm, a location that lies beyond corporeal reality.

The Weaver has beckoned you. You are a voyager of the fourth wave.

Are you prepared to face that which is unknown to you?

To stand with or against those who have also been summoned?

To learn of your true beginnings and start your journey?

It is time to seek your role...

Role of Fate brings the ground breaking concept combining competitive team-oriented play, twenty years of Lore creation, campaign-based PvE play, dynamic card rarity system with universal card playability, and the revolutionary Player vs. Creator (PvC) mode.

In Role of Fate, a player chooses a role, builds a deck, and utilizes attunement (a regenerating resource throughout game play) to play cards from their hand and defend against actions from opposing team members. Players battle it out in PvP with their chosen teams, or engage in voyages and adventures in true tabletop fashion, through PvE or PvC.

Role of Fate's innovative game structure brings the community together for an experience unlike any other TCG/TTRPG on the market. Players' actions can affect the direction of the Lore and how "The Weaver") the omniscient/omnipotent central neural hub for all creation in the game) responds within the Official Campaign and PvC events.

Know your role, play it well...

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Math, Space Exploration
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: Kokeshi
description:
In Kokeshi, players are Japanese artisans improving their art of crafting handmade wooden dolls, strategically positioning them on 5 tracks on their boards to produce faster and better, and receiving happiness points.

Kokeshi presents a twist in the engine building mechanic, focusing on the aspect of "track building".

Basically, the players will activate one of their tracks to move a Kokeshi meeple, triggering the action on the landing space, that could activate another Kokeshi while allowing them to buy new pieces for their tracks, making it more efficient and earning happiness points according to the size of the tracks.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Track Movement

name: Super Boss Monster
description:
After a decade of dungeon-building fun, Boss Monster is leveling up to the next generation with Super Boss Monster! 1-4 players compete to build the ultimate side-scrolling dungeon by drafting room cards, playing spells, and luring in hapless adventurers.

Super Boss Monster introduces the Town Board, which brings in new mechanics to the classic card game. Random room draws are replaced with a simple draft. Heroes still show up in town, but overflow into Locations (Temple, Stadium, Library, Hide-Out, and Tavern) where players can nab them with your all-new Minion meeple! If players choose to not use their Minion to direct a hero, Minions can activate other action spaces.

The Town Board unlocks a long awaited single-player mode! In this mode, players will be trying to lure and slay as many heroes as possible. Players will need to keep an eye on damage, but luring is key to success; if too many heroes stack up in town, they'll head to the Tavern and end the game!

Super Boss Monster is 100% backwards compatible with all existing Boss Monster cards. As a standalone game, Super Boss Monster will contain everything that 1-4 players need to play.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid – Forever Red Pack
description: Includes 10 different combat cards (2 copies each) that you can use to customize your deck for any Red Ranger, celebrating the long history of the often-times leaders of Power Ranger teams.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Wars: Shatterpoint – Fearless and Inventive Squad Pack
description:
Brave heroes set out to rescue one of their comrades! Once a simple farmer on Tatooine, Luke Skywalker is now a Jedi knight ready to fight the Empire and free his friend Han Solo from the clutches of Jabba the Hutt.
Luke is assisted in his efforts by Leia Organa and Lando Calrissian, who have daringly infiltrated Jabba's palace under false identities before Luke's arrival. With the help of R2-D2, Luke's astromech field droid, this intrepid group sets out to put an end to the evils of some of the most evil ruffians and channels in the galaxy...

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Star Wars: Shatterpoint – Fear and Dead Men Squad Pack
description:
With the full power of the dark side of the Force, Vader is one of the first Primary Units of the Galactic Civil War era.

One of the Galactic Empire's most terrifying commanders, Darth Vader destroys any enemy at the behest of his dark master, the Emperor. Known by many nicknames, Lord Vader's authority is almost absolute among the forces of the Galactic Empire. Using the full power of the Dark Side of the Force, Vader is able to quickly and efficiently eliminate even the most skilled of adversaries.

When "Darth Vader, the Emperor's servant" takes to the battlefield, he does so commanding the most experienced and competent stormtroopers in the ranks of the Imperial army. The mere sight of Darth Vader accompanied by his stormtroopers strikes fear into those who dare oppose the power of the Empire...

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Star Wars: Shatterpoint – Yub Nub Squad Pack
description:
Unexpected heroes appear on the eve of the Battle of Endor! The Ewoks of Shining Tree Village played a vital role in that battle thanks to C-3PO, whose tales of the Rebellion encouraged the brave Ewoks to stand up to the Imperial forces on the forest moon. Convinced that these stories came from the mouth of a god come to guide them, warriors such as the shaman Logray, the explorer Wicket and many cunning Ewok hunters joined C-3PO and his comrade R2-D2 to become small but brave heroes of the Rebellion...

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Phoenix New Horizon
description:
In the year 2021, after years of seclusion underground, humanity emerges onto the surface, propelled by the development of groundbreaking new technology. Decades of catastrophic fallout from a nuclear disaster during the Cold War have laid waste to the known world, compelling civilization to seek shelter beneath the earth. The pressing task now is the construction of regenerators, which will generate new habitats to facilitate the resurgence of life and the reclamation of the Earth. A world brimming with hope awaits aboveground.

Phoenix New Horizon is a Euro-style board game in which players assume control of a team of commandos tasked with the mission of recolonizing Earth. Throughout the game's four rounds, players accumulate victory points by constructing regenerators and buildings, bolstering the planet's population, and achieving diverse objectives that vary between playthroughs.

Players must adeptly allocate their commandos to various actions throughout the game while also specializing them to enable more potent abilities at the expenses of versatility. Fulfilling missions assigned by the governing authorities yields additional actions on a player's turn.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Connections, Contracts, End Game Bonuses, Income, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: PLACES-Bid
description:
PLACES-Bid is a bidding game where you compete to collect the most points from purchasing building cards, collecting tokens, and assembling a portfolio of building cards from the PLACES categories. PLACES is an acronym that represents the ideal mix of activities in our neighborhoods: Play, Live, Academic, Community, Employ, Shop.

Players have a chance to "win" each round, whether it is to (1) win the highest bid and the right to choose from one of the available building cards, (2) attempt to be the second highest bidder and sacrifice getting first choice of building cards for a lower cost, (3) work to purchase building cards that match the same letter/color as their project card, (4) collect cards from each PLACES category, or (5) build their token bank.

The game ends when either someone(s) has purchased a building from each PLACES category or all building cards have been purchased or discarded. The player with the most points through a combination of cards, collections, and tokens wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Bids As Wagers, Investment

name: Trouble on the Tempus
description:
Trouble on the Tempus is a game about travelling through the depths of space in a lovely spaceship … as it catches fire and the electronics explode and it falls apart around you. You're pretty much doomed. Luckily you're in a time machine, part of an exploratory mission to test the latest time traversing technology, but you pushed the ship too far and things have gone horribly wrong.

Fortunately, as mentioned, the Tempus is a time machine. Your science officers have jury-rigged it to perform very localised jumps of the crew, allowing you to transport yourselves back to a time when you were not about to explode hoping that if you can gather enough information about the future you may be able to prevent the your ultimate destruction.

Of course it's not a perfect system, if you cause too many paradoxes the ship may find itself trapped in a fate much worse than exploding in the depth of space, if such a thing is possible.

Trouble on the Tempus is a co-operative game of disaster management where the players must prevent fires, electrical faults, and mechanical failures, as they work to fix the hyperdrive of the Tempus so they can power themselves home. Tragically this is a truly impossible task so the players will have no choice but to engage the ships time drive, resetting the board to the way it was at the start of the game so the players can try again with the added knowledge of when and where the disasters will appear.

If you can repeat the timeline enough, collecting the right equipment and positioning yourselves to pre-empt the disasters as they happen, you should be able to predict enough rounds to fix the hyper-drive and win the game. However, each time you time travel you cause a paradox, and the difficulty of the game can be adjusted by how many paradox's you can cause before reality collapses in on itself.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Movement Points, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: VOID: The Frontier
description:
VOID: The Frontier is a competitive card game for 2-6 players, where you collect rare Specimens, secure Favors from the locals, and deploy Maneuver cards to benefit yourself or sabotage opponents. Sell completed sets to gain the most points and win the game!

The game begins with three Expedition rounds, where players simultaneously reveal their chosen route. If they choose to travel to VOID, they are dealt cards. If they travel to the Hub, they gain favors.

Each player can then play cards: either Specimens, by laying them down in front of them (their Warehouse), or they can play Maneuver cards, which help the player or hinder their opponents.

Gameplay then moves to Market rounds, where players choose different Transactions, including sell sets of 3 Specimens to score points, or use one of the Favors they have accumulated.

Hidden within the deck are Empty cards. Once 8 of these cards have been drawn by the players, gameplay immediately moves to the last Market rounds and the game ends. The player with the most points from selling sets wins the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That

name: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid – Merciless Minions Pack 2
description:
Emperor Gruumm has traveled into the past to recruit the villainous Zeltrax in his plan to conquer Earth before the formation of Space Patrol Delta! The S.P.D. Rangers must follow and stop him, with the help of the Dino Rangers, before the wormhole closes and they’re trapped in the past. These villains’ forces draw from the power of past and future, striking fear into the hearts of all who face them. This expansion pack includes Zeltrax’s Tyrannodrones, Emperor Gruumm’s Krybots, and the even more dangerous Blue-Head Krybots!

Features:
Fight against Emperor Gruumm and Zeltrax’s minions!
Introduces two new Foot Soldier types for added replayability: Tyrannodrones and Kryots!
Krybots include dangerous Elite Blue-Head Krybots.
Adds four new location boards.

Contents:
20 Foot Soldier Figures
4 Elite Foot Soldier Figures
30 Enemy Cards
20 Deployment Cards
4 Location Boards
1 Rulebook

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Story Time
description:
Story Time was the Southern California finalist in the 2010 Rio Grande Games Design Contest.

Story Time is a competitive card game with a story writing theme. Each player chooses a character in the story and tries to guide the story so that his or her character fares the best. The pages of the story are represented by cards, with each card having both story text and game rules. The players build the story by taking turns adding pages. Several times during the game the story is read. During the reading, the game rules on each page of the story are followed in turn. Those rules will result in the players gaining or losing points depending on how well their characters fare in the story. At the end of the game there is one final reading, and the player with the most points wins.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Table Air Combat: Yak-7
description:
Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface. Each ruleset is a self-contained game including cut-out miniatures of one aircraft and a set of rules. All you need are some six-sided dice and some coins to provide weight for the aircraft counters. Everything else can be printed from this ruleset.
Each player has a flight of four fighters, represented by two counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.
TAC is designed for portability; The entire game can fit in a plastic bag. Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

The Yak-7 was a trainer for the Yak-1 but was developed into a new fighter. It can also substitute as a Yak-1 or Yak-9.
This set is a self-contained rulebook that includes miniatures for the Yak-7 and contains five scenarios that reference other aircraft:
Barbarossa: Yak-1s defend an airfield against the Luftwaffe's Ju-87 Stukas escorted by Bf-109E fighters.
Teeth of the Bear: Yak-7s ambush a group of Bf-109F fighters.
586th: Stalingrad is under attack from Ju-88 bombers and Bf-109F fighters. An all-female fighter regiment defends the city with their Yak-1 fighters.
Jet Ambush: A German Me-262 jet fighter is caught unaware by a Soviet aces flying a pair of Yak-9 fighters.
Yaks vs. Lightnings: USAAF P-38 fighters mistakenly attack Soviet ground forces in Yugoslavia. Soviet Yak-9s coutnerattack.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Print & Play, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: The Unseen: You Have Been Chosen
description:
Assemble your friends and set off on a unique co-operative, role play, story driven adventure into The Unseen world: a spiritual battleground where you and your team of Word Wielders take on hordes of demonic afflictions. Strategize and fight back the armies of darkness to expose the Monarchs of Doubt, Guilt, Fear, Sickness, Suffering, and Hatred. These Strongholds of ever-present lies must fall!

This game includes 9 different Word Wielder heroes to choose from, each with their own unique set of Gifts (abilities) from 4 different Classes: Champions (Melee/Tank), Seekers (Range/Bow & Arrows), Edifiers (Prayer Type Weapons/Words of Holy Fire and Healing Light), or Discerners (Dynamic & Well-rounded/weapon specializations are player’s choice).

Play through The Story (main campaign) that is broken out into 7 Chapters meant to be experienced over multiple sessions. Each Chapter can take between 60-90 minutes to complete. There are Checkpoints provided to help you pick up where you left off even if you put the game away.

Gameplay alternates between Two Phases:
One - The Chosen Phase where player’s spend their chosen Word Wielder’s Guidance Prayer and Action tokens to prepare for and battle The Darkness by rolling dice and comparing results against the enemy stats, and advance the Chapter objectives and
Two - The Darkness Phase where the Darkness on the board then takes their Actions trying to Burden and Overwhelm the Word Wielders in order to stop them.

So equip yourselves for battle by praying for Discernment, allowing you to draw from over 90 cards packed with anointed Weapons of Light, Armor, and Single-Use items. Each new card collected has its own abilities offering your Word Wielders limitless combinations and tactical possibilities. Slay the Darkness and collect their cards to build up a Light Pool - once enough enemies have been slain, return them to the Darkness Deck and draw a Heaven’s Armies Card with one of three different Angels that can be played to help your Wielders gain the advantage in battle. Work together to overcome the Darkness!

Get swept away in over two hours of intense, fully-narrated, audio dramas that bring each chapter of the game to life; drawing you into an epic journey you won’t soon forget. These can be found and listened to for free on the game’s official website.

Once you’ve played through the epic campaign you can continue your adventures in 7 nonlinear alternate game modes, each introducing new stories, objectives, and ways to play.

(PVP) Or, if you’re looking for something more classically competitive but with a twist, step on to The Sea of Glass (flip side of the board), for a bright and colorful map made for fast paced, lighthearted, head-to-head combat where you can compete against one another in 4 more game modes where it’s a race towards the objectives while Refining each other along the way through inevitable encounters.

With so many different variables and ways to play, no two games are ever the same…

Go, and know that He is with you!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Novel-based, Number, Religious
