mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Events, Line of Sight, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling, Team-Based Game, Trading, Turn Order: Pass Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Basketball Legends
description:
A comprehensive basketball simulation with the capability of playing high school, college, and professional basketball teams based on their real stats.

After the initial setup, which adjusts a team's ratings in various offensive and defensive statistical categories, the play is resolved by rolling dice and consulting the appropriate chart on the applicable team.

Players can adjust the rolls by spending "Coaching Points" that affect the outcome of particular plays. This adds a strategic gameplay element to a genre of games that is often very dice-driven.

Example: Team A may be very good at offensive rebounds. When a shot is missed, they would have a better chance of grabbing a rebound than teams without as good ratings. By spending coaching points, those results can be modified. Doing so at key moments can have a huge effect on the game outcome.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Stat Check Resolution, Take That

name: GRIM the Card Game
description:
GRIM is a two-player tarot-inspired Expandable Card Game creature battler designed by Grimoire Games. Venture beyond the boundaries of life to a world where The Fiend reigns, imposing his will upon the Grim who war over the Spirits who roam there. For an eternity, the Fiend has cast his shadow upon the Grim, forcing them to battle for his entertainment. But you, a powerful and strategic Grimlord, are positioned to stand against him with your Grim to finally end the strife.

In GRIM, players combine two Elemental Grim Decks each embodying a unique style of play, to face off in an undying war. The strategy of GRIM begins with players' decisions regarding how to pair these Grim Decks together, as each Grim Card has Synergy Effects that will only trigger when played next to certain Elemental Grim. Attach Spirits for powerful Spirit Bonuses, react with Elements to negate and manipulate Attacks, and position wisely as you and your opponent place terrain effect Afterworlds in play. Secure enough knockouts and you will win the war.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Drawing, Open Drafting, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: Shattered Chaos
description:
Shattered Chaos is a fully cooperative Adventure Game for 1 to 5 players set in a world torn asunder when the God CHAOS is slain. You will be part of a group of adventurers desperately trying to reclaim the Jewel of the Gods to prevent the destruction of your world. Yet your search for the gem is thwarted by the teeth and claws of several shadow creatures, monsters that guard the Jewel of the Gods. On the brink of death, the fallen God CHAOS suddenly appears and offers you the chance to fight on… for a price that may, in the end, prove to be too high!

Shattered Chaos is set out to include several Adventure Boxes, each containing 5 adventures. Each adventure can be played in 2 to 3 hours and comes with a uniquely drawn game board and a complete set of narrator cards through which you will learn about the setup, the story and the rules of the respective adventure.

The first 2 Adventure Boxes Destruction and Despair are now ready. The Kickstarter Campaign for the first Box will launch in autumn 2021

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Tour de France Board Game
description:
Tour de France Board Game is a realistic simulation of the largest professional bicycle race in the world. The basic game set contains game plans for four stages that copy real stages of the 109th Tour de France race. The game can be further extended by additional individual stages.

Each player uses pawns to represent their cycling team. The movement of pawns is determined by throwing dice. Dice of different colors have different functions, depending on whether the terrain is flat or hilly, or when a tactical situation emerges.

The game is played as a sequence of individual moves in which the order of pawns on the game board is determined by arrows. Players take turns to move their pawns in a given order. The whole sequence is completed after all pawns are moved, upon which a new sequence begins. The beginning of each new sequence is confirmed using an application, which adds up all moves and calculates the finish times and final standings.

The game mechanism is not based on accident only but rather on the reasoning for each individual move, as the hexagonal net allows a relatively large freedom of movement. The placement of a pawn (rider) can be planned with respect to anticipated moves of other players' pawns. The choice of dice provides the opportunity to plan a strategic maneuver that can lead to the breaking up of a group, initiate an attack, or slow down pursuers.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Star Wars: Legion – Asajj Ventress Operative Expansion
description:
A sinister new character awaits in Star Wars: Legion – Asajj Ventress Operative Expansion.

Asajj Ventress is a talented warrior who wields two curved lightsabers in a fighting style known as Jar'Kai with deadly efficiency. This pack adds her to the ranks of the Separatist Alliance along with four new Command Cards that give her the opportunity to unleash her unique skills on the battlefield.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Warfighter: Fantasy Expansion #6 – The Armory
description:
This Warfighter Fantasy Expansion adds 48 cards and 6 Counters to your Backpack!

Suit up, load out, we've got monsters to slay, Hero.

This expansion offers 48 cards including:

6 Squad Hero cards
7 Skill cards
3 Gear cards
7 Armour/Shield cards
12 Weapon cards
13 Item cards

—description from the back of the box
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Mythic Battles: Isfet
description:
Embark on an epic journey into the heart of Ancient Egypt with Mythic Battles: Isfet!

Seize the reins of powerful Egyptian deities and unleash their might in a battle of cosmic proportions! Dive deep into the mystical realms, where gods clash, heroes rise, and monsters lurk in the shadows. Lead your divine army of troops into the fray, commanding legions of warriors and mythical beasts in a thrilling skirmish that will test your strategic prowess and courage. Are you ready to conquer the sands of time and etch your legend into the annals of history?

Join the fray and unleash the chaos of Isfet!

—description from the publisher

According to Monolith, ISFET will be available for pledges on Kickstarter from June 4th through June 20th, 2024.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Miniatures, Mythology, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Line of Sight, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Chiclets Gum Village Game
description:
Chiclets Gum Village Game where the winner of the race through the town wins a box of CHICLETS GUM. This advertising based game was created to try and increase awareness for a new product on the market 'CHICLETS GUM'.

The game was produced by HASenfeld BROs of Central Falls RI
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Ironclads: Divided Waters
description:
From the publisher's website:

The American Civil War saw the dawn of modern naval warfare, as technological advances in weapons, metallurgy and engineering allowed ironclad warships to take to the seas. It also saw an emphasis on economic warfare, as Confederate raiders tried desperately to erode the Union's enormous financial advantage by attacking Northern trade.

Ironclads: Divided Waters is a complete boxed game in our series of Industrial Age naval combat. It's based on the Confederacy's program of long-distance commerce raiding, with action taking place around the globe. Famous raiders like the Alabama, Florida and Shenandoah take to the high seas in search of fat Yankee merchantmen, while the U.S. Navy upholds its proud tradition of protecting the nation at any cost.

The map covers the entire world, as Confederate raiders attempt to ruin Yankee commerce, while the Union strangles the Confederacy's cotton-based economy with a tight blockade. While the search procedure is very different from Hearts of Iron, given the vastly different map scales, combat is resolved in exactly the same fashion.

COMPONENTS:
44 1.3" x 2/3" long counters; 88 2/3" square counters
1 34" x 22" strategic map; 1 25" x 24" tactical map
1 16 page rulebook
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Admiral's Order: Naval Tactics in the Age of Sail – Trafalgar Expansion
description:
Admiral's Order: Naval Tactics in the Age of Sail is a simulation of naval engagements between ships-of-the-line and frigates in the Age of Fighting Sail. The focus of the game lies on the wars between Britain and France and her allies in the years 1775 to 1815. The Trafalgar expansion allows players to recreate the dramatic and decisive battle between the British and the allied fleet at Cape Trafalgar, an engagement featuring no fewer than sixty vessels.

A game turn equates to a ½-hour watch on the day of battle. In each turn, players will play cards to execute sailing manoeuvres such as tacking, wearing or changing sail configuration in order to put their ships into position for devastating broadsides or even rakes on the enemy vessels.

In larger engagements ships are grouped together in squadrons and usually form a “Line of Battle”, a formation that provides the commander with the most control over his fleet. Using Admiral's Order cards players signal general commands to their squadrons ranging from "Form a Keel Line" and "Wearing in succession" to "Prepare for Close Action". Keeping the ships in formation and effectively deploying the fleet in the heat of battle while also retaining the initiative is the main challenge for a commander.

Occasionally, ships will engage each other in brutally destructive Close Quarter combat. In such situations the game 'zooms' into the action: Using a set of "Close Action" cards, players can employ grapeshot, grenades, carronades, and sharpshooters to wreak destruction on the opposing vessel’s upper deck. Through a clever use of grappling hooks and boarding crews it is possible to overcome the enemy's defenses to take the ship as the ultimate prize.

The Trafalgar expansion can be played by 2 to 6 players, and fighting the whole Battle of Trafalgar will take up a weekend.

The game is produced in a small, limited edition and comes in a hancrafted linen-bound box, including a wooden presentation box with 60 handcrafted, wooden ship models. Each ship with removable masts and ship names burned into each side.
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Ironclads: Space Battles in the Victorian Aether
description:
Description from the publisher:'

You've explored the dark corners of the Earth in Leagues of Adventure.
You've built a rocket and put a man on the Moon in Rocket Race.
Now it's time to conquer space in Triple Ace Games' new miniatures game!

Take control of a faction, build a fleet of armed rocketships, and battle your foes in space!


3d printable allowing unlimited fleets sizes
Customizable models
Hundreds of combinations of weapons and gadgets
Easy rules for quick play
Mission, campaign and competition play
Rich, story driven background
Multiple factions
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling

name: Battlegroup: Pacific War
description:
Battlegroup: Pacific War is a supplement for the Battlegroup game system, covering operations on the Pacific Theater, including Burma.

It contains background and army lists (Imperial Japanese Army, US Army, US Marine Corps, Engineer, British Infantry...).
It adds special rules for this theater and specific rules for the Pacific terrain.

Also includes 5 scenarios.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Tome of Champions 2021
description:
The Tome of Champions 2021 is an essential companion to Warcry, no matter how you like to play. From new narrative content to twists for matched play and fresh open play game modes, it’s packed with updated rules and ideas to inspire you. Incredible new adventures in the Eightpoints await.

Inside, you'll find:

A Rules Update for 2021, including the introduction of Grand Alliances in Warcry
Updated points values for Warcry fighter cards to better reflect their power in battle
Open play rules for fighting sieges between two teams of players
Narrative play rules for branching quests where players get to choose their path through the adventure
New fated quests for warbands from each of the four Grand Alliances
Six narrative campaigns that offer a new dynamic challenge to players
Pitched battles battleplans for the new Warcry season and a detailed tournament pack, making running your own even easier than ever before
New hidden agendas that can be used as secondary objectives in tournaments
Rules for using the Lumineth Realm-lords, Soulblight Gravelords, Kruleboyz orruks, and Thunderstrike Stormcast Eternals in Warcry
Rules for using Warhammer Underworlds warbands from Shadespire, Nightvault, Beastgrave, and Direchasm in your games of Warcry


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Werewolf in the Dark
description:
The unforgettable game that combines the classical game of Werewolf with hide-and-go-seek, Werewolf in the Dark!

The social deduction of Werewolf
Who among the villagers is the Werewolf?
During the daylight phase, vote to eliminate a player you suspect of killing others at night.

The childhood intensity of Hide-and-go-Seek
During the night phase, everyone hides in pitch black darkness
Only the Werewolf can double tap you, eliminating you.

A never-ending night only the dead can cure!
Don't get too cozy in your hiding spot, as a Werewolf can win in a single night.
You must venture out and find a body to end the terrifying night phase.

Dozens of roles with unique abilities
Many different monster types
Many different "villager" roles,

No need for a host, everyone plays

Elimination is only the beginning!
Eaten by a monster? Eliminated by vote? No worries.
Everyone comes back as one of many different types of "ghosts" to enhance the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Murder/Mystery, Negotiation, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Acting, Hidden Roles, Negotiation, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Traitor Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Agemonia: Talents & Rituals
description:
Enhance your Heroes' capabilities with a Master Skill or Recipe for each Profession! Heroes may learn these skills and recipes to achieve truly amazing feats of artifice and knowledge. Unlock such recipes as the Alchemist’s Draught of Veils, the Inscriber’s Resurrection Scroll, and many others.

The promo pack will also feature two rituals to bolster the strength of the Heroes through magical means: Aiuncraft and Aoxcraft. These powerful rituals tie in with the Heroes' choices during the campaign.

The promo pack will feature nine additional standard-size cards, which will be exclusive to the promo pack and not printed with the base game.

—description from publisher's website
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Tibetana
description:
In Tibetana, you collect energy from the territories to erect new settlements, react to the effects of the unstable deities, and pressure the adversary to hinder their growth. The goal is to build three five-story pagodas on a hex-shaped board with different territories representing the lands of Tibetan mythology before your opponent can do so.

Your faction is made of channelers, which extract energy from the territories and build new pagoda stories, and sentinels, which protect your channeler and restrict those of the enemy. On your turn, you can perform up to three actions: move your figures, train new ones, relocate magic portals, devote energy to building pagoda stories, and so on. Extracting this energy may wake ancient demons: neutral deities that can influence and be influenced by any of the players once they're woken. However, their rule-bending effects may disrupt your plans, and as the game progresses, they become more and more powerful.

The demons featured in the Tibetana base game are:


Chemchog: the channelers' horror
Citipati: the death dancer
Kuberan: the heist
Kurukulla: the thousand faces
Mahakala: the occupier
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement

name: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid – Ranger Allies Pack #3
description:
This expansion introduces five new playable characters! Many universes are connected by the Morphin Grid, and these five heroes are paragons of knowledge and skill.

Enter battle as Udonna, the Mystic Force White Ranger, with her mastery of ice-cold magic; Delphine, the swift and skillful leader of the Alien Rangers of Aquitar; Kendall Morgan, a brilliant scientist and the Dino Charge Purple Ranger; and Karone, the Galaxy Pink Ranger, formerly the villain Astronema, who comes armed with the Lights of Orion.

At the head of this group of Rangers is none other than Doctor K, the creator of the Ranger Operator Series and the lead scientist at the domed city of Corinth. Together, these heroes fight to save the Morphin Grid!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Bark Magic: Ruins of Dhogoon
description:
In Bark Magic, 2-4 players compete to unearth mystic gems and be crowned Ultimutt Sorcerer. Players can only reach this goal by outwitting their opponents, winning heated battles, and gaining the strength needed to dig deep into the ancient ruins.

Players take on the role of anthropomorphic wizard dogs, playing skill cards and participating in events triggered by event cards.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Dice, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Events, Hand Management, Take That

name: Buona Pesca!!!
description:
A card game as simple as it is fun set, as you may have already guessed, in the world of fishing.

The two or more players will draw to create their starting deck from the equipment deck, i.e. boat, rod, reel and hook, and the totality of points determined by the equipment will affect which and how many fish can be caught. In the course of the game it will be possible to improve one's equipment in rounds where variables such as bonus cards will also influence the strategy to be able to catch bigger and bigger fish that will be worth more in the final count.

It will be possible to conjure up storms against one's opponent and steal equipment to slow him down, a true elemental and non-fishing competition.

The time of the game is punctuated by the 9 bonus cards which, once awarded, will trigger the final account where the most capable - but also the luckiest - fishermen will take home the coveted fishing trophy. You will receive one point for every 5kg caught and in the event of a tie, the one who caught the most fish will win.
mechanics: Deck Construction, End Game Bonuses, Lose a Turn, Turn Order: Progressive

name: How to Win Brexit?
description:
Experience Brexit Negotiations with Our Engaging, Role-Playing, Strategic Political Board Game!

You've certainly heard of Brexit, but now you have the chance to immerse yourself in the roles and strategies of Europe's most complex negotiations of the 21st century.

How to Win Brexit? is a game for EVERYONE with a passion for politics, negotiations, leadership, and making challenging decisions. All you need is to like strategic board games!

Embark on a journey back to the historic Brexit negotiations period of 2017-2019, with just a maximum of 90 minutes to strike a Deal. Navigate the highly polarized political climate, reconcile conflicting objectives, and tackle the challenging task of finding consensus.

Step into the shoes of a key political figure from either the United Kingdom or the European Union, and immerse yourself in the captivating world of politics and diplomacy!

In this role-playing game, you'll take on the role of a real-life character, such as the UK Prime Minister or the German Chancellor, amongst others. You'll need to navigate complex political interests, seeking common ground between teams, all while prioritizing your own team's needs.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Negotiation, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Bindu Mandala
description:
Bindu Mandala is an immersive tabletop game that draws inspiration from the ancient Sanātana Dharma culture. Players embark on a profound journey of self-discovery and enlightenment, navigating the beautifully designed game board featuring the Sri Chakra, devised into 9 Avarnams (veils), leading to the ultimate destination - The Bindu, a symbol of total self-awareness.

Each player's progress is influenced by their accumulated awareness earned through strategically playing sets of awareness cards. Interaction between players is encouraged through command cards that manipulate their awareness and hinder opponents. The game intricately blends elements of strategy and competition while proving an engaging experience for players of all ages and backgrounds. Bindu Mandala not only delivers hours of enjoyment but also serves as a gateway to explore the depth and beauty of the Sri Chakra for anyone interested.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Collectible Components
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Automatic Resource Growth, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, Hand Management, Interrupts, Matching, Movement Points, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Race, Re-rolling and Locking, Set Collection, Take That, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Auto-Dungeon
description:
Auto-Dungeonis a cooperative game made for 2-6 players, where the goal is to navigate the dungeon and defeat the boss monster. If at any point all heroes have 0 health, the game is over, and you have lost.

To play, the only 3 things you can do are roll the dice (to read what happens) and use potions to heal yourself or others, and use treasure cards you collect throughout the game. Simply roll and read.

The game is played using up to two six-sided dice. Most of the time, rounds are played only using one six-sided die.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Fantasy, Medieval
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Líneas estratégicamente divertido
description:
Lines is an exciting abstract strategy board game that will test your intelligence and strategic skills. Lines is perfect for the whole family, with games lasting from 15 to 30 minutes, and can be enjoyed by 2 to 8 players, ages 8 and up.

In Lines, every decision matters. You start the game with 5 cards and 2 or 3 different wildcards in your hand, so use them with cunning and cooperation to form lines of 5 chips on a meticulously designed board, where luck is minimal and victory is achieved through your skill and strategy.

••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••

Líneas es un emocionante juego de mesa de estrategia abstracta que pondrá a prueba tu inteligencia y habilidades estratégicas. Líneas es perfecto para toda la familia, con partidas que duran de 15 a 30 minutos, y puede ser disfrutado por 2 a 8 jugadores, a partir de los 8 años.

En Líneas, cada decisión cuenta. Empiezas el juego con 5 cartas y 2 o 3 comodines diferentes en tu mano, así que úsalos con astucia y cooperación para formar líneas de 5 fichas en un tablero meticulosamente diseñado, donde la suerte es mínima y la victoria se alcanza gracias a tu destreza y estrategia.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: I C E: RELICS
description:
Relics are a brand new tile-type: the pieces of them are smaller and diamond-shaped, and are 1/3 the size of a regular I·C·E hexagon tile. But when put together, they can make a full hexagon image of a completed Relic. When assembled, they also unlock a new way of scoring for that player!

The game play of RELICS will rely on trying to assemble the pieces - and depending on how many of one Relic you are able to piece together, it unlocks powerful new abilities.

Players can swap discovered Relic pieces, but once at least 2 of the 3 pieces of a Relic image are obtained, they are "locked" and can't be swapped.

The Preachers guild specifically makes use of the new Relics with their unique ability, while the Telepaths are able to take over other player's Leaders and use them as their own.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Auction: Turn Order Until Pass, Modular Board, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Galatune: Cosmic Deception
description:
The Cosmic Deception Expansion Pack is the first deck booster for Galatune, including 32 new action cards emphasizing traps, darkness, back-stabbing, and evil underhanded strategies. It can be mixed into your Galatune Starter Deck to customize and expand gameplay options.

Cards Included:
Masquerade, Savage Creed, Divine Annul, Cloneroot, Arms of Ken-daal, Grand Theft, Poetic Justice, Inhibitor, Blight, Kiss of Betrayal, Temporal Revision, Chromashift, Despair, Mega Boost, Treaty, Overload, Confiscate, Shadows of the Past, Confound, Deathwish, Infinite Power, Numbness, Twist of Fate, Pacify, Evil Plot, Magnificent Sacred Phoenix Rebirth, Borrowed Body, Edge of Ages, Manaswap, Omni, Stupid Rock.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Party Game, Real-time, Science Fiction
mechanics: Player Elimination, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Take That

name: TechCommander
description:
From back of book:

TechCommander is a fast paced sci-fi action tactical game that puts you in the command chair of a hi tech operations center leading an elite squad on dangerous missions! TechCommander combines miniature gaming with the sci-fi action seen in first person shooters and sci-fi real time strategy video games. The game has powerful Mechanized Strike Vehicle units (called MSV’s for short) that can destroy targets in seconds, but also has the ultimate in elite power armor infantry units. These units are based on a possible progression of future soldier programs in development in the modern day, and are equipped with technology to keep them agile, powerful and somewhat safe from the monster MSV’s roaming the landscape. The infantry are jump jet equipped, and in many cases, running a visibility and sensor masking stealth suit. Many also have capacitance based shield meaning if you do not fully eliminate them, they will recharge! The MSV may be powerful, but left unguarded, it is no match for a crack squad of USSC Force Recon Marines! TechCommander MSVs are fairly large miniatures, standing anywhere from four inches to a foot high. They use a peg-together system so that swapping out weapons and gear for a battle that requires a custom load out is easy!
categories: Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Eldfall Chronicles: Northern Wind
description:
Northern Wind is an immersive dungeon-crawl experience paired with our tabletop skirmish mechanics, plunging the players into a spine-chilling adventure, that will decide the fate of a whole Empire!
You will battle a devouring and profane evil with 4 courageous – but unlucky – “heroes”. Prepare yourself for an arduous journey to the top of the blighted Mt. Byōdō.

A dungeon-crawling RPG experience featuring the EC skirmish mechanics.
Standalone game with new elements, but fully interchangeable/fully compatible with the EC skirmish wargame – you can use the Eldfall Chronicles minis and profiles in Northern Wind, & vice versa!
->TWO GAMES IN ONE!
New characters, new enemies.
Signature top-quality miniatures – made with next-gen resin.
Fast-paced, tactical combat, tile-based movement.
Nail-biting quests and challenges, unexpected twists and instances, it will offer dozens of hours of content – endless replayability with a branching story & leveling!
Solo, Coop, PvP mechanics.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Victory Points as a Resource

name: 18OE / 18C2C
description:
This Box contains 18OE game and a new version of 18C2C game.

This deluxe version was only available on 18OE kickstarter project at president level.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Illimat: The Rusalka
description:
"The Rusalka" Luminary card was hidden in copies of The Decemberists' "I'll Be Your Girl: Exploded Edition" boxset. The card will also be made available in limited quantities at Gen Con 2018.

The rules for "The Rusalka" Luminary were hidden as a secret message in the liner notes for the boxset.

The rules for "The Rusalka" are:
"When you play a card in to the field of The Rusalka, change the season of the field as if you had played a face card, regardless of the value of the card you played. When you collect The Rusalka, take one card at random from the hand of each player and add it to your harvest pile. Opposing players wait until after their next play to draw up."
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Kam'on
description:
You may find KAM’ON interesting for one particular reason- you can scam. Although this turns out to be incredibly interesting and allows for millions of different scenarios, plays, and manipulation, KAM’ON has many other aspects and cards that give it a quite perfect balance between fun, complexity and possibilities. For example, take poker, a game that is not too complex yet allows for so many different plays on account of the player/human factor of the game; players can manipulate others, bluff, etc. KAM’ON is very similar, although frankly our cards look a bit nicer.

Having tens of distinct cards lets the player combine different plays, playing as many cards as they would like during their turn, yet only playing one card per type. The true intrigue comes when you realise that you may not make it without trading- or scamming. You decide to bluff. You lie about having a card that another player needs only to scam him out of a card you need. A player may only complete their part of the trade during their own turn, therefore it is quite easy to scam someone- at the cost of your in game reputation.

This aspect of KAM’ON works perfectly with the beautifully designed cards that work to get you your 4 organs- the cards needed to win. In all honesty, KAM’ON is quite simple. Do everything you can to get 4 organs, whether it be destroying your opponents and stealing their organs, or scamming them out of their organs. Whichever it is, as long as you get an organ, it was probably worth it.

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Bluffing, Card Game, Humor, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Trading

name: Legends of Wrestling: Color Starter Set
description: Everything you need to start playing the Legends of Wrestling card game! This game edition includes 16 new game cards featuring the best of the Legends of Wrestling game and the Legends of Wrestling Handbook, featuring bios for all wrestlers. This set also includes starter instructions and charts.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Fast Builders
description:
Everything is ready for the biggest constructions! Now it's your turn to carry them out as soon as possible. Put yourself in the shoes of one of the most important contractors in the city and make your builders work to be the first to carry out the projects.
Fast Builders is a family game of 2 to 4 players in which we must send our workers to collect a series of materials for the construction of the best buildings in the city; with games of 20 to 40 minutes and recommended for players of 8 years or more.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Contracts, Grid Movement, Hidden Victory Points, Modular Board, Variable Set-up

name: Infection
description:
Currently, various infectious diseases are spreading around the world. Players participate in the game as part of the CDC and must quarantine and treat infected patients in the most efficient way.

The goal of the game is to prevent the spread of infectious diseases among flares distributed in each city.

The first player in each round starts with a vaccine card. He throws all the dice and selects one set of the same scale dice in one color in the order of play and takes them.

Each round proceeds in the order of the next three steps.
dice rolling (infection and research), dice distribution (allocation), and worksheet writing (isolation and treatment).
All players share all the dice in order until they disappear, and fill out their own worksheet paper. (Players who take the dice must immediately record all the dice scales they took into the worksheet.) When all players finish writing the worksheet, the round ends with isolation treatment.

The next player will take the vaccine card and become the first player to proceed with the new round.

If the following situation occurs while playing several rounds, the game ends after playing the round: a player fills up both the infected patient and the vaccine treatment section in two wards, Or if a player O marks his third time in a space where he's in a worksheet or a shortage of hospital rooms.

When the game is over, the player with the highest total wins by calculating each of the following scores: Treatment score, infection patient score, vaccine treatment inventory score, infection eradication score, vaccine treatment acquisition rate score, and hospital room shortage score.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building

name: Forbidden Psalm: The Last War
description:
Last War is a small-scale skirmish game, you play with a crew of 5 miniatures per player, against AI controlled monsters in scenarios that take you across the wastes of the Last War. Play as enemies, cooperatively or play solo mode.

Last War is a stand alone game using the Forbidden Psalm rules. You do not require any other book to make use of this new setting, campaign, weapons, monsters and so much more.

Inspired by historic wars, set in a world at its end, you will face such horrors as the Trench Maggots, living clouds of poisonous gas, Things from the Fog and many more horrors from the mud clogged trenches.
categories: Book, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, World War I
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Shadow Royale: The Magister's Cup
description:
Shadow Royale: The Magister’s Cup is a fantasy based battle royale board game taking place in a hedge maze on a small planet called Targola. During the game you control and customize your character. As you explore the maze you will equip your combatant with armor, weapons, spells, and skills. Be prepared to fight some ferocious creatures, other players, or maybe even yourself. If you manage to survive the battles; experience, loot and treasures will be your rewards that will help you become stronger. Special items, called Relics, can be found in the maze and if you manage to collect 5 of them, you immediately become the Champion of the Magister’s Cup! Or if you are simply the last combatant alive, that counts as winning as well.

—description from publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Parks & Potions
description:
Players step into the boots of Park Rangers, whose expertise in botanical alchemy transforms the wilderness into a sanctuary for healing. With the roll of the dice, players gather extracts from the park's flora, concocting potent potions to treat the ailments of animals from different biomes. Successfully healing animals and performing experiments earns points, directly reflecting your role in maintaining the park’s well-being. Aim for animals in similar habitats to unlock bonus points, reflecting the depth of your commitment to conservation. Or, take the path of experimenting to find new potions. The player with the most points at the end of the game is crowned as the guardian of nature!

Parks & Potions plays over 5 rounds (6 in a 5-player game), each representing a day of work. The game is divided into phases where players roll dice to discover flowers to extract, manage their inventories, and use potions to fulfill objectives and cure animals. Strategic potion mixing and objective completion are key to becoming the most renowned ranger.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Contracts, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Matching, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Ophelia: Histories Collide
description:
Who will history remember?Time and Space started to glitch, as the multiverse Ophelia tried to reconcile all timelines of history. Heroes triumphant throughout time are now being thrust into the heat of its defining moments, to be resettled once and for all, reforging reality.

Ophelia: Histories Collide is a game of strategy, tactics and manoeuvring, designed for intense head-to-head battles over the table. We took the drafting, strategy, bluffing and intensity of your favourite TCG games and removed all of the hassle. One box between players, endless replayability.

Players draft or use pre-constructed 21-card decks to compete for points across five rounds. Each round, players take turns to play cards and characters from the Ophelia multiverse onto the board, activating abilities and contesting lanes to swing the chances of glory in their favour.

When the dust settles, only one player will be awarded the points. The board is wiped clean, and a new round begins. When a player reaches 5 points, they are declared the victor. Otherwise, players take what resources they have left in their hand into the next round!













Three Unique FactionsWinning is more satisfying when you win on your own terms, and with your favourite heroes of the multiverse. Take command of the mysterious and ethereal Mattervoid, the honourable Yucatec Scale-Clan, and the high-tech Animae Mechanicus, as you draft cards featuring stunning Mayan, Demonology and Mecha inspired art.

Restore history for your favourite faction, or draft a variety of characters and write your own story across Ophelia.

































Contents- 100 Cards (64 Unique)
- Game Mat
- 20 Page Full Colour Rulebook
- 50 Tokens
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Deck Construction, Interrupts

name: Shining Shadows Saga
description:
Shining Shadows Saga is a strategy-based trading card game inspired by Japanese Role-Playing Games (JRPG). Using a customized deck of skills, spells, will, and other actionable cards, players battle in an arena-like fashion to knock out each others champions and become victorious.

Based on the recommendations of the Seer of Sanctuary, Azara, Monarchs can choose up to 3 ancient champions to take into battle. These champions from the past all hail from different realms within the world of Limsia where they once were revered by their respective species. Players take turns controlling their champions and use actionable cards that can cool down to be used again and the first player to deplete the HP of all of their opponents' champions is the winner.

As this is a strategy-heavy game, players can best strategize gameplay by using weapons and potions from their inventory to influence survivability and any attacks that are relevant to their champions of choice. New cards are released monthly so players can build as many unique and versatile decks as possible to vary their gameplay and avoid being locked in to specific play styles. With the number of champions growing, every battle provides a new ground for players of all skill levels to show off their customizations and strategies.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management

name: Mettle to the Petal
description:
The root idea is simple: you’ve been dealt quite a handful, and your task is to empty your hand before your opponents do, matching the card atop the discard pile in face value or color. (Play one card per turn, and do what it says!)

Will you be the first person to play your last card? Be alert, because every card has stipulations, and the strategy increases with each expansion set of the game.

You’ll need your wits sharp and your attention undistracted, if you are to win. Good luck.
categories: Card Game, Math, Mature / Adult, Number
mechanics: Chaining, Hand Management, Interrupts, Lose a Turn, Matching, Pattern Recognition, Real-Time, Speed Matching, Take That

name: |Hop> Quantum Game
description:
«Quantum»? Did you say «quantum»? With |Hop>, come and explore the world of atoms. Move your electrons, use physical properties and discover the exciting world of physics!

|Hop> is a competitive card game, where players clash to move electrons from their “electrodes” to those of the adversary. By doing this, they will learn crucial cutting-edge concepts in quantum physics in a simple and fun way. No math required!

You are physics researchers. An accident occurred at the university: a cutting-edge experiment machine was fried because the energy was not controlled. Each person is trying to prove that it was the others who made the mistake.
Grants are at stake! So, roll up your sleeves and heat up the electrodes!

—description from the designer

In turns, players will move their color electrons across the cards that form the board in an attempt to reach another player’s source. They will have 2 actions to choose from among several possible types of movements. The player whose source is reached has lost; the others are safe… for this game!

—user summary
mechanics: Grid Movement, Move Through Deck, Take That

name: Trigger Happy
description:
Trigger Happy is a mix of Crazy Eights and Russian Roulette. Survive this game of chance by matching numbers or colors of cards. If you cannot match the cards then roll the die. If the die matches the card then you lose. It’s just that simple but be careful: trick shots, cards that can hinder other players, can be lethal. This game can last for ten minutes or even ten seconds; it depends on the luck of the draw and your wits. Be the last player standing to win.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Number, Party Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Matching, Player Elimination

name: Tiger Banana Pancake
description:
Tiger Banana Pancake is a crazy and chaotic fast-reaction card game for kids, families and parties.

Players race to do silly actions, but don't fall for the sneaky imposters!

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Party Game
mechanics: Memory, Move Through Deck, Speed Matching, Sudden Death Ending, Take That

name: Freakin' Fractals
description:
Freakin' Fractals is a 2-4 player tabletop game where players race to be the first to fill in their side of the pyramid with all the same colored fractals! The pyramid can unexpectedly be turned. Or pieces can be stolen. Or cards can be taken. Frustrating fun!
Each player gets one TAKE OR STEAL THE LARGE FRACTAL card. Throw the rest of the cards onto the table and mix them up. After sufficient randomizing has occurred, each player should draw four cards. All remaining cards go into the draw pile.
Youngest player starts the game play, of course. Try to fill in your side with the same colored fractals, before the pyramid is turned. When the pyramid in turned, whatever color is facing you is your new side. After you play one card from your hand, place that card in the discard pile and draw a new card; you should always have FIVE cards. The game continues clockwise. If the draw pile runs out, shuffle the discard pile and it becomes the draw pile.
First player to fill in a side of the fractal with all the same color, and then place the LARGE fractal in his or her side, and exclaim "FREAKIN’ FRACTALS" wins! The large 'mega' fractal must be placed after the other three same colors on that side. For a longer game, decide the first player who wins three games is the ultimate champion.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Big Conspiracy Card Game
description:
Big Conspiracy Card Game is an original strategic party game that will keep both conspiracy theorists and skeptics laughing. Players play as conspiracy theorists investigating a "Big Conspiracy." During a game, players cite ridiculous evidence and make absurd arguments in order to make wild accusations that support their unique biases.

Big Conspiracy Card Game is a satirical trip down the rabbit hole. The game consists of 175 unique cards full of original art, jokes, conspiracy theory lore, and tons of Easter eggs.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Bias, Hand Management, Matching, Take That

name: Pundit
description:
Pundit is football’s original trivia game, made for fans like ourselves, who love to revisit memories of legendary players and iconic moments!

Challenge friends and family to see who best remembers the forgotten greats, cult heroes, one-hit wonders, fringe players and young prospects - to take the Pundit crown!

1. Choose your best five categories to compete in.
Taking turns, the two teams pick a question category to compete in. Whichever team wins the coin toss picks three categories, the loser picks two.

2. Answer questions correctly to keep hold of the ball.
When answering a question correctly the attacking team chooses to either pass the ball up the pitch or draw a Tactic card. If answered wrong, possession is turned over to the opponent’s captain.

3. Forwards score the goals.
When the attacking team gets a question right with the ball at their forward’s feet, a goal is scored. It’s also possible to score from the penalty spot via Tactic cards.

4. A match lasts 45 minutes.
When time is up, the team in possession can finish their attack for one last attack on goal. No Tactic cards allowed in stoppage time, it’s in God’s hands from here.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: KILLWAGER
description:
Killwager is an extremely tactical, small-unit based, realism focused Ultramodern and Near future tabletop game. Minimal tokens, full on narrative. It takes you from the modern day to a newly colonized planet 80 years into the future. The only consistencies? Cash and Violence..

Lead a hard team of near future mercenaries as they do the bidding of several powers in the area. Blazing a corpse soaked trail of glory, cash, and spent casings across intense "End of the movie" style direct action engagements.

During their turn, a player has one model perform (or two if they are within 4"), which consists of moving, shooting, taking cover, interacting with terrain, and many other measures. Any model performing can be targeted by a reactive measure. Moving across the battlefield can give your opponent an opportunity to stun, or eliminate outright, your moving asset. It's very simple and breaks down into individual actions with no math. Only increasing difficulty in performing your actions. No more adding 2 or three different modifiers together. Just one flat target number to roll a D10 and add your single stat to. That's right. One stat for the entire game

A game of Killwager can end in multiple ways. Typically, you want to get the most objective points, and exfiltrate off the battlefield, while trying to deny your opponent the same outcome. However, one player can be forced to end their play time prematurely if they hit pullout conditions specific during a scenario. Often times this is having too many assets killed. Once pullout conditions are met, a player must move all of their forces off the board edge or face capture by their opponent or death at the hands of 3rd party AI.

A player wins when points are counted up after a scenario or a chain of scenarios. Capturing objectives matter on the battlefield, and count towards your overall score. However, losing assets, including very important ones, or accidentally eliminating non-hostiles, will give you negative points. So even if you have the most people alive at the end of a match, you might not be the winner.
categories: Dice, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement

name: Gaia Project: The Lost Fleet
description:
There will be four new factions: Darkanians, Mowyed, Space Giants, Tinkeroids, corresponding to 2 new planet types: proto planets and asteroids
The new layout of the map will feature holes where the ships of the lost fleet and some new planet types will be placed
There will be new smaller sector tiles (edge sectors)
Ships of the lost fleet allow access to new action spaces and technolgies to be found on the new board, aswell as special federation tokens and artifacts, no standard Q.I.C. actions anymore, Q.I.C. actions only available on ships
6 new adv. techs
4 new roundboosters
3 new round scorings
Some faction balancing (start resources, income, additional actions or different costs to explore a ship)
Lantids get cover up tiles for their PI (1-3 player)
categories: Civilization, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Territory Building
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hexagon Grid, Income, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tags, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Turn Order: Pass Order, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up, Victory Points as a Resource
publishers: Capstone Games, Feuerland Spiele, Portal Games

name: The Hunters A. D. 1492
description:
The Hunters A. D. 1492 is a fully cooperative game which enables you to play solo or with a group of friends.
Players become monster hunters who participate in a complex and gripping campaign comprised of hundreds event, road and town cards and tome of tales. The narrative presented on the cards and book is full of story twists and difficult decisions to make.
During the campaign, players execute quests. Each of them takes 30 to 60 minutes to play. It may take place during the day or at nighttime, in various weather conditions. Every time players must choose proper tactics and equipment matching current circumstances.
Players may barter with local inhabitants, undertake various jobs, overcome unexpected obstacles or expand their wagon in order to manufacture over 70 different types of equipment from resources found during the game.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Miniatures, Renaissance
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Sankokushin: Five Sacrifices
description:
A brokenhearted god.
A woman carrying the collective hate of mankind.
How many times will you sacrifice yourself before giving up hope?

Sankokushin: Five Sacrifices is a fully cooperative campaign game set in a fictional version of medieval Japan.

Take control of several heroes arriving to assist the city-state of Yamashiro, a land destroyed by the quest for the Unseen, and help the city survive its grim destiny.

Experience an adventure in which you’re free to decide what activities the heroes pursue, where they explore, who they meet and how they interact with their opponents; all of which organically generates a unique storyline inside of the main plot that moves the destiny of Yamashiro.

Fight monsters and human foes in psycologically-intense encounters where personality and tactical manuevering are paramount. Intimidate or provoke your enemies to scare them or force them to attack carelessly. Use your diplomatic abilities to calm dangerous, psychopathic entities until you are able to backstab them or plead on the behalf of honorable opponents. Manage the stress of battle, seek to understand your opponents’ perverse intelligence and use that knowledge to destroy them or to find a way to save them from destroying themselves and everyone you hold dear.

Welcome to Yamashiro.

Campaign

The city of Yamashiro is an immense micro-universe where the lives of the citizens, heroes and enemies are tightly intertwined. Experience a unique adventure that unfolds over the course of 12 months during which you decide what activities the heroes pursue, where they explore and who they meet. Craft equipment, revel in festivals, expand the city, take advantage of the amenities of its many facilities, and explore personal relationships with the town’s inhabitants as well as its assailants. Sankokushin does not require a heavy, multi-player commitment to reach the end of a campaign and it will not abruptly end if things go poorly. However, only those who travel across time and memory will gain the knowledge necessary to free Yamashiro from the burden of its tragic fate.

Procedural Narrative

No walls of text. No “Yes/No” choices. Sankokushin instead wraps you in its unique story as you experience Yamashiro without confining you to a guided plotline. Instead of presenting you with only narrative choices, the storyline is organically generated by the heroes’ actions during both the combat encounters and the city phase. The assailants of Yamashiro and its inhabitants are all intimately connected by a dark fate and only the actions of the heroes can alter the course of their destiny. These interrelationships have profound consequences in game and they are the heart of Sankokushin’s narrative and it is impossible to experience them all in a single playthrough as they are a reflection of your unique playstyle so different gaming groups will have different experiences.

Intelligent Enemies

Each of the 10 bosses included in Sankokushin has a unique personality and story arc that is closely linked with the overall narrative. The way you deal with each of them will reverberate throughout the course of the campaign. You will learn to love and hate their twisted personalities and will see that the methods used to fight them will deeply influence their future behavior. They learn from your strategies and change their attitude towards you (and the way they fight!) according to the way you psychologically approach them thanks to the unique communication system. Sankokushin is designed by a small team whose knowledge in the fields of psychology and psychoanalysis have made possible bosses with realistic, uncanny, and perverse personalities that will show you the darkest sides of human nature.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Royal Steeple Chase
description:
Royal Steeple Chase is a very astonishing game, published in 1939 by Miro Company in France.
4 horses compete on a track of 21 spaces, with hedges and rivers. The players receive cards which indicate two actions. They use these to bid on the horse of their choice. They can then buy better cards at auction. The money from the bids is shared equally between all the players, and then the race takes place. Each player in turn plays a card and carries out its two actions in the preferred order. The horses which win and place second award points to their owners. If no horse finishes, the players who did not have a horse gain points.
The game contains several variants, some of which were inspired by Bridge and were created by French officers who were prisoners of war in Germany in 1941.

Royal Steeple Chase est un jeu très etonnant, paru en 1939 chez Miro Company en France.
4 chevaux s'affrontent sur une piste de 21 cases, avec des haies et des rivières. Les joueurs reçoivent des cartes qui indiquent deux actions. Ils enchérissent ensuite pour acheter le cheval de leur choix. Ils peuvent ensuite acheter de meilleures cartes aux enchères. Les mises sont partagées équitablement entre tous les joueurs. Puis la course a lieu. Chacun à son tour pose une carte et réalise ses deux actions dans l'ordre de son choix. Le cheval qui gagne et le second cheval rapportent des points à leur propriétaire. Si aucun cheval n'arrive, les joueurs qui n'avaient pas de cheval gagnent des points.
Le jeu contient plusieurs variantes. Plusieurs variantes intégrées dans le jeu sont inspirées du Bridge et ont été créées par des officiers prisonniers de guerre en Allemagne en 1941.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding

name: The Magic Box
description:
The Magic Box is really two puzzle games. A solitaire game where one player competes versus the layout and his or her best score. It is also a competitive challenge for two thru four players. Which player can remove the most tiles before the layout becomes "locked"?

The Magic Box includes rules for both The Magic Box: Escape (solitaire), and The Magic Box: Power Politics (two - four players). Also included are more that 60 2" x 2" tiles (cards), and a play mat.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Mafiosi Spinosi
description:
A mafia-themed memory game for children.

Theme
Signore Spinosi, an old mafia boss, has learned that a gang of young mafiosi is plotting his demise. But they have reckoned without their host - old Spinosi isn't fooled that easily. He sends six of his most trusted spies to uncover the conspirators. You are one of his confidants. Will you be the first to uncover all 8 members of a conspirator gangs?

Goal
Be the first to find and reveal all 8 wooden discs of the colour determined by the card you draw at the beginning of the game.

Game play
The 50 wooden discs (48 of them with a face in one of 6 colours) are shuffled face down and then placed on the board. The 6 cards are also shuffled. Each player draws a card, remembers its colour and places it face-down in front of him/herself.

Players take turns looking at the face-down side of one of the discs (without showing it to the other players). The active player may either uncover the mafioso (= put him back face-up) or just put him back. If the player reveals him, he/she gets a second try. If not, it's the next player's turn now. If the second mafioso is also revealed, the active player gets a third and final attempt, on which he/she always has to mask an already revealed mafioso (= return the disc face-down). A player's turn always ends after a maximum of three attempts.
A player's turn also ends when he/she looks at one of the two discs without a face, and these cannot be revealed.

The game ends when all 8 conspirators of one colour have been uncovered (unless that colour is not attributed to a player, which can happen with fewer than six players). The player with that colour card wins the game.
mechanics: Memory

name: The Family Game
description: Family members gather to play. A playing deck is arranged from the question cards provided to reflect the relationships of the players. The players advance along the gameboard track by giving answers without being challenged as fakes. The first to reach the end of the track wins.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move

name: Gargoyles Stone Warriors Battle Card Game
description: In this card game, based on the animated TV show, players try to collect a complete set of 6 Gargoyles - Lexington, Brooklyn, Broadway, Bronx, Hudson, and Goliath. You are dealt 3 cards and start your turn by drawing enough cards to bring your hand to 4. You may then play Gargoyle cards to the table in front of you to start your set. Finally, you can attack other players with villain cards trying to take Gargoyle cards you need from them. Demona and Xanatos cards steal cards automatically. Lesser Villains must use battle cards (with a rock-paper-scissors outcome) to win a Gargoyle. Sunrise/Sundown cards turn an opponent's gargoyle to stone and prevent it from counting towards a set. The first player to complete a set of the 6 different Gargoyles is the winner.
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Set Collection

name: Fan-Play Ice Hockey
description: The game is mathematically designed for perfect results in scoring and individual team performance. The relative strength of opposing teams having already been established. For thrilling ice hockey competition, form a league with friends. Each player chooses and coaches his own teams.
mechanics: Simulation

name: Twelve Tarot Games
description: Extensive details for tarot games from all over Europe. Note that there are also variations in the tarot packs used for the games. ISBN 0715614886
mechanics: Trick-taking

name: Backyard Bug Buffet
description:
Backyard Bug Buffet: Play this fun and easy game in which your insect species races to increase its population to the victory level, before the other players' species do!

Search the board for your required food, eat it or collect it, and breed young. Watch out for the predators out there though! They won't hesitate to gobble your six-legged animals!

Backyard Bug Buffet is a good introduction to the study and appreciation of insects, for children ages 6 and up.

Components:
1 washable felt mapboard
135 colored chips
40 plastic insects
56 food & predator tiles
6 species information cards
2 bonus predator information cards
rules
die

Game Ratings: non-aggressive, moderately competitive
Skill-Luck Ratio: 2:3
mechanics: Unspecified

name: The Green House Game
description:
An environmental awareness board game. The game encourages children to become knowledgeable in environmental issues. The object of the game itself is to demonstrate one's knowledge of issues concerning the environment and thereby turning the home into a "Green House". The winner of the game is the first player to earn an ENVIROMIND certificate. There are two ways to earn a certificate, either by being the first to reach the greenhouse or by being the first to collect ten ECOPOINTS.

Players enter the gameboard by descending in the balloon onto the balcony of the Kids' Room. Players roll a die and follow the arrows to move through the rooms/areas of the house. Along the way players encounter green, red, and yellow squares and by doing so learn new environment related facts.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move

name: Gretrix
description:
Variation in Kalah. Users sow a pocket around, then drop piece in final space, putting one of the pieces up in an unoccupied corner. Once all the corners are filled, ALL the pieces in that pocket are removed from the board and scored. Board gradually gets smaller and smaller.

The game was found here: http://www.abstractstrategy.com/gretrix.html
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Captain Morgan's Wrath
description: Captain Morgan's Wrath is the pirate drinking game by Party Hard Corps. Spinning a tee-totum (think a dreidel), the players are encouraged to be as loud with their yaaaaars as possible while the it spins, or even bang on the table to try to make a player "walk the plank!" First player with five doubloons and the captain's patch is the commodore, and the winner- unless the crew mutinies, and leaves that land lubber on an uncharted island!
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Formula Road Racing
description: This was published by McGartlin in a DTP form only with limited copies. It is basically their stock car game adapted to Formula One racing. The difference is that instead of making a lap count you must change gears. As track deck cards are flipped, the section of track has a gear that you must shift to. If you are in 1st gear and the track is a long straight (6th gear) you must play gear change card(s) totaling 5, shifting from 1st to 6th.
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: The Sword in the Caribbean: Pirate Forays Along The Spanish Main
description:
A Variant for "The Sword And The Flame".

From the rulebook:

"Being a set of playable, entertaining and enjoyable skirmish-level rules that can recreate the excitement and savagery of the countless forays, skirmishes and raids in the islands of the West Indies in the 1700's."

Expands:

The Sword and the Flame
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Pirates, Wargame
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation
publishers: And That's The Way It Was...

name: RoCo
description:
RoCo was developed to answer a challenge, "You can't produce a race game that doesn't rely on dice". RoCo is a simple game for 2-4 players. If you can count you can play RoCo.

But can you win?
mechanics: Point to Point Movement

name: Batailles de L'Ancien Regime 1740-1763
description:
Battailles de l'Ancien Regime 1740-1763 (BAR) is, despite its French title, a set of miniatures rules in English designed to simulate European land warfare in the mid-18th century. The players supply the figures at any desired scale. The hallmark of these rules is the highly detailed and historically meticulous system for portraying the various types of military organization during this period. Units consist of variable numbers of figures and constitute infantry battalions, cavalry regiment and artillery batteries.

Despite its deliberately "Old School" design (i.e., large-sized units, figure removal, historically accurate rules on movement and changes of facing), the rules use modern mechanics and so do not require the writing of orders. Existing miniature armies need not be re-based to use this rules set. The rules book is self-published but has been produced to a high standard of quality.

* 72 pages including the color cover
* Quick Ref. Charts for large/small games, miniatures and/or tables.
* If you know the 18th Century, you can play right away with just the Quick Reference Charts.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dark Age Infantry Slog
description:
Miniature wargame rules for the Dark Ages up through Norman Conquest. Originally published in "Miniature Wargames" Magazine, No. 7, 1983. Referred to on occasion as "D.A.I.S" or "The D.A.I.S. System."

Made available through Wyre Forest Games Club as a free download:

The game strives to capture the "feel" of the period using two or three "divisions" or "battles" of grouped warrior bands of Retinues and Contingents, rather than a number of independently-maneuvering "units" of like-armed soldiers.

The qualities of Aggression, Formation and Strength are key along with Leadership which seeks to maximize these qualities to gain advantage over opposing troops. These qualities ebb and flow depending on the fortunes of the unit, nearby friendly units, and Leaders.

The actual resolution of combat is literally resolved by each player engaging in a single round of rock/paper/scissors for each pair of units, or aligned groups of soldiers from a unit, brought together in melee.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation
publishers: Miniatures Wargames Pireme Publishing Ltd., Wyre Forest Games Club

name: The Face of Battle: The Hill Battles – Khe Sanh, Vietnam: 1967
description:
During April 24 - May 11, 1967, the 3rd Marines battle NVA forces around Khe Sanh! During the spring of 1967, the "First Battle of Khe Sanh" or "The Hill Fights" took place. In extremely bitter fighting with North Vietnamese troops, the 3rd Marines cleared Hills 881S, 881N, and 861 overlooking Khe Sanh Combat Base. This is the first scenario book for The Face of Battle. The book contains 12 detailed scenarios, maps of Khe Sanh and the surrounding area, time line, weapon data for numerous Marine and NVA firearms, grenades and ordnance, the M50 Ontos, and more. Many scenarios include optional forces for maximum re-playability.

This book is compatible with numerous skirmish rules including: Face of Modern Battle, Free Fire Zone, Charlie Company, Battleground WW2: Vietnam, Arc of Fire, Crossfire: Vietnam, Bodycount, Fire Team Vietnam, Dogs of War, and more...

The scenarios are ideal for 15mm to 28mm individually-based figures. All maps, weapon data, templates and ordnance data are provided in 3 scale ranges; 15mm, 20mm and 25/28mm.

Period: Vietnam War, Quang Tri Province, 1967
Scope: skirmish, squad level
Figure Scale: 15mm to 28mm, 1 to 1 scale
Figure Basing: individually based figures
Ground Scale: 1" = 2 metres

What's Inside:

6 Maps of Khe Sanh and surrounding Area
Khe Sanh Timeline
12 Scenarios
Squad Reference Sheets for each scenario and force
M50 Ontos Vehicle Data Sheet
M40A2 Recoilless Rifle in detail including Beehive rounds
M79 Beehive round
Complete Marine Weapon Data: M16, M14, M79, M60, Shotguns and more
Complete NVA Weapon Data: AK47, SKS, RPD, and more
3 hole punched for North America Binder
5 hole punched for A4 Binder


and more...
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Print & Play, Vietnam War, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: The Sword In Gaul
description:
Adaptation of The Sword and the Flame for Caesar’s Gallic Wars 58-51 BC by the original designer.

"Being a set of playable, entertaining and enjoyable skirmish-level Wargame rules that can recreate the excitement and savagery of the countless forays, skirmishes and raids along the frontiers of Rome."

Includes appropriate force composition, rules for assaulting palisades with ladders, and notes on using the system for the Roman Civil War. Both armor type and formation type strongly influence combat. Fourteen pages including reference and preface but excluding ads.
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Simulation

name: Stupiduel: Modifiers & Tricks Expansion
description:
Since the very first game of Stupiduel, duelists’ ears have perked up to the phrase: "I don’t have any Modifiers!" (Trans: "I can’t stop a modified attack.")

There are many such flubs for the ruthless duelist to exploit, but this is certainly the most frequent. However, the phrase also carries a deeper plea: "I love Modifiers, give me more!"

Lost Adept Distractions listened, because though they don’t go and blurt out such things while dueling, they love Modifiers too! In this expansion for Stupiduel there are 40 new Modifiers; enough to make your original deck a full 50/50 collection of Modifiers and Items!

But wait, there’s more! They also enjoyed your original ideas (didn’t read the rules) and clever gambits (cheating) so much that we’re adding 20 new "Trick" cards to mix things up!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Storytelling, Voting

name: SHOLF
description:
Sholf is a hybrid creation of two classic games. Sholf fuses the accessories of golf with the strategy, competitive play and scoring of table shuffleboard. Played head-to-head, Sholf is wildly addicting and fun for all skill levels. Anyone can play, day or night, indoors or out. Sholf's portability makes it possible to play anywhere, all the time!

If you know how to play table shuffleboard, then you pretty much know how to play Sholf.

The object of Sholf is to putt your golf balls further into the scoring end than your opponent. Point values increase as you get closer to the edge of the playing green. The first player or team of players to 15 wins.

Visit the Sholf website: http://sholf.com/
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Shogun: Takeda Kawanakajima 1553-1564
description:
Takeda Kawankajima 1553-1564 is part of the Age Of Battles table-top miniatures gaming system using 1/72 scale miniatures and the Shogun rule set. Takeda Kawankajima 1553-1564 allows you to play the five battles that took place on the plain of Kawanakajima.

The boxed game set includes everything needed to play out the five battles as a campaign:

Two complete armies in tan & grey
- 88 Samurai Infantry - tan/grey (8017)
- 34 Samurai Cavalry - tan/grey (8025)
- 56 Samurai Army Headquarters figures & two honjins w/accessories - tan/grey (8029)
- 1 exclusive General Uesugi Kenshin mounted figure - tan
16 Regiment Cards
16 Regiment Stands w/flags
2 D20 dice
2 Rulers
1 Pen
1 Angle Pattern
1 Shogun Rule Book
1 Campaign/Historical Background Booklet

From the back of the box:
This game allows playing the episodes of the battles having become the plot base of many films and books about the medieval Japan. In the second half of the 16th century on the Kawanakajima plain two armies under the leadership of two famous Japanese commanders. Takeda Shingen and Uesugi Kenshin, each strived for the supreme power, went into bloody battle.

Zvezda 8239
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Checkerboard Dodgeball
description:
Run! Dodge! Catch! Dodge! Throw! Dodge! Win!


"There are many variations of the game, but generally the main objective of each team is to eliminate all members of the opposing team by hitting them with thrown balls, [or] catching a ball thrown by a member of the opposing team"

Hello Coach! Welcome to the furiously competitive sport of Checkerboard Dodgeball! Prepare for a fast game of team elimination!

In games of Checkerboard Dodgeball!, teams of 5 five players face off on a standard checker or chessboard. Coaches select up to three players with differing abilities and activation speeds to run and throw balls at opposing players. Hits are determined by opposing die rolls - often, the higher roll hitting and knocking a player out of the game. A defender's lucky roll dodges or even catches the ball, taking the thrower out and bringing a friendly player back into play!

Momentum breaks ties and Coaches mitigate luck with smart use of Extra Effort! tokens and unique Player
abilities.

The Coach that knocks out all the other Coach’s Players wins!

Playing time is normally under 20 minutes.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Pixl
description:
Pixl is an abstract strategy game based around the balance of elements (fire, earth, water, and spirit). Players lay down blocks of their color and attempt to convert or erase opposing elements -if a Pixl is cornered by two pieces of the opposition a number of points may be awarded depending on the status of the opponent. Each player has the advantage when pursuing their "prey" element and must be eternally weary of their "predator" - who is always hunting them.

The game is structured so as to create an abstracted modern art piece by the conclusion of every game, as the elemental Pixls spiral around each other. While each player has a multitude of Pixls, only one piece in the game (the Port) may move - players must work to master the immobile Pixls and the Port necessary for their survival.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Enclosure, Network and Route Building

name: 5 Colonnes à la une
description:
According to popular believe Wolfgang Kramer was supposed to be the first designer who introduced a points scoring track (Kramerleiste) around the board with his game Heimlich & Co.

But this French game published back in 1961 already had such a points scoring track over 20 years earlier which makes this possibly the first game to implement this.

In the game each player plays a journalist trying to get the best stories whilst traveling from city to city on the board that depicts a map of the world. The game used beautiful cards depicting either countries, historical events or historical figures from that era such as General de Gaulle, the Pope, president Kennedy or Kroutchov.
mechanics: Hand Management, Race

name: Bx Rock, Paper, Scissors, Fire and Water
description: Bx Rock, Paper, Scissors, Fire and Water (BxRPSFW) is an abstract strategy board game for 2 players. Each of the 2 players takes turns moving one of his/her 17 game pieces which include Rock, Paper, Scissors, Fire and Water. Rock captures Scissors, Scissors captures Paper, and Paper captures Rock. In addition to this, Fire may capture any of Rock, Paper, or Scissors. Any of Rock, Paper, or Scissors may capture Water. And Water captures only Fire. No like pieces may capture each other. The object of the game is to be the first player to capture the opposing flag, which may not move at all.
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: Captain's Log #17
description:
(excerpted from the back of the book)

COUNTERS: 108 brand new Tournament counters.

FOUR NEW SHIPS: Federation Fast Cruiser, Klingon Fast Battlecruiser, Kzinti Heavy War Destroyer, Lyran Heavy War Destroyer! PLUS six new Cadet Ships and two new Squadron SSDs!

10 Scenarios
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Unspecified
publishers: Amarillo Design Bureau, Inc., Task Force Games

name: International Business
description:
"A game of buying and selling, Banking, Mortgaging etc."

International Business is well known worldwide with different names. This is an evergreen game where you act as a foreign businessman who buy or sell properties in famous countries of world. You also get an idea to deal with another person. So, let play & ready to prove himself, the wealthiest person of the world."

Poor grammar is from the back of the box.
The game itself has a lot taken from Monopoly with only some minor changes and totally different subject matter.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move

name: Wasteland
description:
Smoldering ruins are all that serve as a reminder of our once civilized world. Wary survivors nervously forage for meager food and scrap, constantly haunted by the shadow of death. Ravenous hordes of zombies march a desperate humanity toward extinction. Trust is but a memory, peace is no longer an option, and safety no longer exists…

Yet there is hope. A number of Visionaries are rising within the remaining human havens. These individuals have amassed followings to be reckoned with, engulfing the denizens of the waste in something far more than the daily struggle for survival.

What they have started, you must finish. With your leadership, humanity stands a chance to reclaim the Wasteland from the walking dead and revive civilization. Will your people unite with others against the zombie menace or crush and exploit their rivals

2-4 players clash for the future of humanity in Wasteland, a post apocalyptic zombie survival strategy game. Take control as one of eight factions pitted against one another and hordes of ravenous zombies, struggling to survive and rebuild civilization in their image!

With the help of your people’s Visionaries your fledgling band explores the waste, battling the restless dead and scavenging for resources. Victory brings hope, expanding your territory and raising morale. Survivors flock to your banner, shaping the future of your society with new ideas and issues. Will your faction rise to lead the rest of humanity back from the brink of extinction, or will they die alongside it?

Wasteland is inspired by games like Fantasy Flight’s Twilight Imperium, Flying Frog Productions Last Night on Earth, Avalon Hill’s Axis and Allies, and other favorites of the OHMS Gaming team. We’re confident it will satisfy your cravings of crushing your enemies, slaying zombies around you, and hearing the lamentations of your friends!
