Major Features of Wasteland:


ZOMBIES! ZOMBIES! ZOMBIES! Constant waves coercing players into uneasy alliances!
Eight Factions with variable powers, each with three unique Visionaries, giving you the ability to customize your faction to your play style and adding replay value!
A modular, gradually revealed hex map for a new Wasteland every game.
Scouting encounters and Site cards adding additional risk and reward to conquering areas.
Resource management, simulating the scarcity of useful material and encouraging strategic thinking.
Speed based combat system relying on the management of your resources.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: NUTS!: War Without End – Weird War 2
description:
From the publisher's website:

Weird War 2 Start with the inherent weirdness of World War II, add the public fascination with the new science being unleashed around them and top off with the popular pulps and comic books of the day – and you have set the stage for Weird War II. Welcome to the Weird War, a no-holds barred clash of chaos in which Combat Walkers stride the battlefields, Yankee Rocketmen blaze through the skies and ray guns reduce tanks to glowing scrap metal.

Here's what's included:

Some actual technology history.
Fantastic technologies.
Weird Science unit and vehicle lists.
Special or expanded rules.
General rules on creating your own Weird Science campaigns.
Sample scenarios that may be fought head-to-head with players taking opposing sides, cooperatively against the game or solo as either side.

NUTS! War Without End (WWE) is a supplement for the game NUTS! 2.0 by Two Hour Wargames. A copy of that rule set, as well as gaming implements and miniatures, are required to play.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Mighty Morphin Power Rangers: Finister Trivia Game
description:
Calling all Power Ranger fans! Do you think you have what it takes to beat Finister? Answer trivia questions in this trivia game about the hit TV show Mighty Morphin Power Rangers!

Players shuffle the deck of over 50 trivia questions and put them face down. Players then play rock, paper and scissors to decide who goes first.
The player left of the player going will always draw a trivia card and read it off to the player. If first player answers correctly, they receive the trivia card. If they answer incorrectly, the card goes to the bottom of the pile.

Play continues till all of the trivia cards have been answered successfully. After all of the trivia cards have been answered, players count the number of cards they've answered correctly. The player with the highest correctly answered trivia cards is the winner!
mechanics: Memory

name: City of the Century
description:
Overview:
City of the Century is a heavy stock/economic game based in Chicago during the Industrial Age.

Players gain points from playing stock cards into their tableau. The stock cards correspond to four different industries: Manufacturing, Railroads, Livestock, and Grain. These industries increase in profit through the course of the game by the players collectively operating Chicago. Each time a player increases an industry's profit, they can either draw an stock card or play an stock card from their hand.

Gameplay:
Each turn, players can perform two of the available actions: Ship, Manufacture, Build, Run Chicago, and Run the Canal. Through these actions, players manipulate the six major goods that were vital to Chicago becoming the heart of the Industrial Revolution: Steel, Coal, Livestock, Grain, Lumber, and Brick.

Winning:
Players win by totaling the points scored from their stock cards, buildings they constructed, and other small bonuses that appear throughout the game.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection, Simulation, Stock Holding

name: Malifaux: Mr. Tannen
description:
From the Malifaux Tactica Wiki page:

Overview
Walking the floors of the Honeypot, Mr. Tannen invites himself to a chat with the patrons. Suddenly, their winning streaks turn sour, and piles of chips disappear bet by bet. Mr. Tannen is very good at debuffing the enemy crew. He can reduce the enemy hand size by removing Arcane Reservoir, stopping models from drawing cards, or using Equalize Fate to reduce the opponent's hand size to the same size as his controller.

Mobility
Mr. Tannen has 4 Wk, and no charge. Shambling helps him get through severe terrain. His Immune to Influence prevents him being lured, obeyed or pushed by his companion Mr. Graves however.

Offense
Melee
Mr. Tannen's melee option is his Pocket Knife. It has a mid Cb, and no triggers.
Ranged
Mr. Tannen has no ranged attacks.

Resilience
Mr. Tannen is Immune to Influence and Pitiful, making it harder to pick him as a target.
Due to Cooler, enemy models trying to cheat fate within 5" of him must discard a control card before cheating fate. This can make your opponent burn resources to ensure their actions occur near Mr. Tannen.

Tips and Tricks
Mr. Tannen has several abilities that affect enemy models.

Luck's Turning
This spell is Mr. Tannen's only (0) action, so there isn't a huge reason not to use it. If successful, the targeted model cannot cheat with a card higher than it's opponent used in a Duel.

Bore to Tears
With this spell, Mr. Tannen can reduce the movement of an enemy model. This spell has a trigger that can also make the target lose Use Soulstone.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Power Rangers in Space: Space Pursuit Pop Action Dice Game
description:
Move your Power Ranger from pop and move them around the board by pressing the dome in center to pop the die. Get all your Power Ranger pawns around the board without the evil space monster attacking you to win!

Game includes
pop action game board
(12) Playing Pawns; (3) each of Red, Black, Yellow, & Blue
(1) Space Monster Pawn
instructions
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: 1650: A capa & espada
description:
1650: A capa & espada, is a miniatures game that takes place in the Kingdom of Iberia, a ucronía very similar to the Spanish Empire in the seventeenth century, which is being besieged by multiple enemies. The Court flee southward to new capital called Ysbilia. But the Old Purple Regiment, with the Duke of Alba at the head, expelled years ago as traitors Ysbilia return, taking its main points and autoploclamando the "New Order", ready to take over the crumbling empire, to resurface and acaudillar the reconquest. Any man willing to fight now travels to Ysbilia ready to deliver his weapon on either side in search of maravedis.

The game allows us to represent skirmishes between gangs of the two main factions, the Old Regime and the New Order, in different scenarios (Degollinas, ambushes, escort missions, assaults, etc ...) and with conditions as varied nightly contests, meteorological phenomena, rules enclaves (scenery that provides special rules who take their control), antagonists (characters managed "the game" and will face either the cause) and even an option to play solo when you will always contenders to that challenge.


1650: A capa y espada, es un juego de miniaturas que se desarrolla en el Reino de Iberia, una ucronía muy semejante al Imperio Español del siglo XVII, que esta siendo asediado por múltiples enemigos. La Corte huye hacia el Sur, a la nueva capital llamada Ysbilia. Pero el regimiento de los Morados Viejos, con el Duque del Alba a la cabeza, expulsados años atrás como traidores, regresan a Ysbilia, tomando sus puntos principales y autoploclamando el “Nuevo Orden”, dispuestos a tomar las riendas del derruido imperio, para resurgir y acaudillar la reconquista. Todo hombre dispuesto a luchar viaja ahora hacia Ysbilia presto a ofrecer su arma en uno u otro bando en busca de maravedíes.

El juego nos permite representar escaramuzas entre cuadrillas de los dos bandos principales, el Antiguo Régimen y el Nuevo Orden, en diferentes escenarios (Degollinas, Emboscadas, misiones de escolta, Asaltos, etc...) y con condicionantes muy variados como contiendas nocturnas, fenómenos metereológicos, reglas de Enclaves (escenografía que otorga reglas especiales a quien tome su control), Antagonistas (personajes manejados "por el juego" y que se enfrentarán a cualquiera que los provoque) e incluso una opción para jugar en solitario cuando te falten contendientes a los que retar.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Supplices
description:
A card party game.

Gather friends around the table, select the level of "hotness" of the actions to be done (from simple questions on lower levels, 1 to 3, to actions on higher levels 5 to 7. Level 4 is a balanced level).

Once you've chosen 3 levels to play with, the first player draws a card from the pool and select one of the two action written on it. Ask a player to execute it;

If he doesn't what he'll have to draw a Supplices card and will have to execute the action written down on it. You'll keep the card and get the points associated with it.

If he does the action, he will take the card and it's associated point.

The game continues like this until the deck of action card is completly depleted. The winner is the one with the most points.

Higher level cards score more points.
mechanics: Acting, Open Drafting, Storytelling

name: Orient Express Supplement #3
description:
From the cover:

This supplement contains 10 new cases for Orient Express Mystery Detective Game. It can only be used in conjunction with that game and is not a complete game in itself

It contains:
Clue book for Cases 31-40
Solution pad for Cases 31-40
Detective notepad
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Loops
description:
A very simple game that you could play with Xs and Os. It's certainly related to Go but has much simpler rules, and while definitely not as "deep", it can still produce some interesting competition.

The best board for beginners is probably 7x7x7, maybe 6x6x6.

The rules are explained here: http://www.scribd.com/doc/287823949/Loops

Here are a bunch of interesting variations: http://boardgamegeek.com/thread/1286815/variants

You can also change things up by playing with two moves per turn and/or the ability to place either side's color each move. The easiest way for beginners to account for pie while playing with two moves per turn is by playing only a single move on the very first turn.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Enclosure

name: Casey on the Mound
description:
Issued by Kamm Games in 1947. Endorsed by Brooklyn Dodgers pitcher Hugh Casey (who later committed suicide in 1951).

The ball is pitched through an opening in the center field wall. The opposing player holds a bat through another opening to hit the ball. The box cover shows casey in his Dodgers uniform.

The playing field folds flat for storage.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Hanoi
description: Players start with three stacks of five discs, each stacked by decreasing size 5-4-3-2-1. Each move involves splitting a stack to deploy each piece along a (possibly different) line of the mover's choice, to stop on the closest N+1 disc, if any, else the furthest empty cell. The game ends when a multicoloured stack of height 5 is formed, and is won by the player with the majority of discs in this stack.
mechanics: Pattern Building

name: Engage: Spaceship Combat
description:
Engage: Spaceship Combat is a miniature wargame that allows players to control and battle one or more starships.

Players alternate in choosing one of their ships and completing three actions with it; these actions can be to attack with various weapon systems, move, repair, transfer power etc.

Each ship has its own small play card showing its key systems; to which damage and extra power tokens are added making it easy for the players to see what condition and power level the ship's various systems are currently at.

The game has several pre-set missions with victory conditions allowing players to win a Combat Victory (destroying more of the enemy fleet than their own) and/or Objective Victory (completing the mission objectives).
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling

name: Quad Kingdom Chess
description:
Quad Kingdom Chess is a chess variant for two to four players, utilizing a standard chess board with two rows added to each side (called a Kingdom) for the players' starting positions, and with a line of pawn promotion much drawn between squares six rows out from each Kingdom. Players need only reach the square adjoining the line for promotion--crossing it is not necessary. Four squares of empty space at each corner of the board are called Towers and are not in the field of play.

The goal of the game is to force an opponent's King into Checkmate. Each player has his own colored set of standard Chess pieces, which move and capture the same as in ordinary Chess, but for a few variations related to this multiplayer adaptation, including an optional point system.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Player Elimination

name: WWII: The Struggle for Asia
description:
WWII: The Struggle for Asia simulates the Second World War at a strategic level. It features seasonal turns and a unique combat featuring historical leaders, initiative, the movement of reserves, and alternating movement rather than more the predictable "you move / I move" system. Geographic influences on play includes mountainous, forested, wooded, rough and arid terrain, major rivers; amphibious assaults, air transport, supply, rail movement and more. This game is designed for players who would like to buy their own miniatures, paint and mount them.

The game consists of a beautiful 4’x6’ rolled-up map board of the Asia & Pacific Theatre – from Aleutians to Ceylon and from Novosibirsk to Fiji; as well as files for all of the necessary charts, unit counters and rulebook on a disk. Players will need to print and mount the counters which have all been sized to accommodate miniatures which players can purchase and paint to their taste.

WWII: The Struggle for Asia can be played by 2-5 players, but is ideal as a 4 player game (2 Allied and 2 Japanese players). Tabletop space is recommended to be at least 4’x8’ to accommodate the map as well as the battleboards and country charts needed to play the game.
mechanics: Area Movement

name: RoboDev
description:
RoboDev is a card based game in which players develop a robot by releasing Features. They earn points by fulfilling Contracts, building a well rounded robot and releasing the most Features.

With so many combinations of 60 unique Features, you'll create a different robot every game. Release Features in pace with your competitors to maximize your points based on which Contracts you're aiming to fulfill.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Hannibal Island
description:
“Hannibal Island, the perfect secret getaway resort for every over-privileged upstart that has access to Daddy's bank account, some lotion and Dr. McRaph's private number. Maybe it's your first time in this tropical paradise. Perhaps you are a veteran of the sun and sea, either way none of you expected to be trapped here. Dr. McRaph's keys have been stolen, the food supply is dwindling and if you don't get off the island in a few days everyone is going to starve.

With the key held tight in their grasp, the guilty party watches everyone descend into fits of rage and paranoia. This is the moment they have been waiting for, a chance to break the taboo without a single witness left to tell the tale. It is now time for the meat feast!”

In Hannibal Island everyone adopts the secret role of a over-privileged holiday goer or perhaps Dr. McRaph himself. One player is dealt the role of the Cannibal it is their aim to murder/eat everyone on the island, while it is everyone else’s aim to survive and lynch the cannibal before he/she eats them all.

Hannibal Island is a Mafia/Werewolf variant. Unlike Mafia, the Cannibal does not have to kill every turn and the time limit is set by the dwindling food supply. Each character has an appetite (how much food they need in a day) and a health value (how many days they can not meet their appetite value before dying) Once players get used to the game extra cards/roles can be added to vary the game play and add more strategy, victory conditions and most importantly fun!

The game is designed to work with up to seven players without a moderator or judge, if you have an honest gaming group. With more players the game still requires a judge to assist with the flow of the game.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Negotiation, Party Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Team-Based Game, Voting
publishers: (Looking for a publisher), (Web published), Twin Sword Trading

name: Mighty Armies: The Black Sea Pirates
description:
Mighty Armies: The Black Sea Pirates is an army book supplement for the fantasy game Mighty Armies by Rebel Minis. This book contains army lists, scenarios, and campaigns to play Pirates or Pirate Hunters in the world of Zatariel.

You will also need a copy of the core rulebook, Mighty Armies. The Mighty Armies core rulebook contains everything you need to know to play Mighty Armies fantasy battles and to play any of the armies in this book. You will still need miniatures to play. Many Army box sets are avaiable at the Rebel Minis website.

So hoist the flag and set sail into adventure!

2+ Players
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Pirates, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Cathedr'l: Fantasy Role Playing Chess
description:
Using the strategy associated with chess, and the complexity of an RPG, adventure through the world of Cathedr'l and conquer the realm of battle.

Both sides have equal forces. Though, the pieces and their abilities, in addition to 20-sided dice (called action dice, or AD) are what makes this game maintain its role-playing aspect. Each character has the following attributes:

Hitpoints: Ranging from 8 to 14. Based on the physical prowess of a character, the Hitpoints of the character can change. for example, the Sorcerer only has 8 hitpoints, while the Knight has 12 and the Warrior has 14.

Armor Points: Ranging from 1 to 4. The difference between armor and health being that you can roll a D20 to try and negate damage as damage will always go to armor first.

Accuracy: This is broken up into either melee, ranged, magic, or shield accuracy. You must roll equal to or higher than the indicated number. Rolling a 19 or 20 will cause a CRIT, usually causing double damage. When you have to hit your target you roll however many action dice your weapon allows. Refer to your accuracy, and if the dice you rolled are equal to or above your accuracy, you successfully hit.

Weapons: Each character has some form of a melee weapon. Most characters will be able to cause either 4 or 6 total damage with their weapon. Though the way it is caused is different for every character. The knight with a flail rolls 1 action dice causing 6 damage. While the Crusader with his longsword rolls 6 action dice each causing only 1damage. The Cleric with his hand mace causes 4damage with 1 action dice, while the Sorcerer and their casting staff rolls 2 action dice each causing 2 damage.

Movement: Movements between the characters vary based on their maneuverability and battlefield mobility. The ranger holds roots to the Bishop of Chess, allowing them to go as far as they want in a diagonal line. The knight is able to move in the classic 'L-move' associated with knights of Chess. Though when it comes to the Crusader (able to move up to 2 squares diagonally) or Assassin(able to move up to 2 squares in ANY direction) Cathedr'l takes on its own personality as characters must use their unique movement to navigate the battlefield.

Spells: The Sorcerer, Cleric, and Paladin, utilize magic to support themselves and their allies in combat with powerful abilities only used by the select few magic users of Cathedr'l.

Abilities: Abilities are what will allow certain characters their unique traits. The Warrior and his Charge ability allow him, like a pawn, to move up to 2 squares on his first movement. The Paladin with the ability of STED, has built extreme strength and endurance and has an extra Hitpoint that regenerates at the end of every turn, essentially ignoring 1 point of damage whenever he is hit.

Using a system that is as deep and complex, as a tried and true RPG, and the unique strategy offered by chess, both players will use strategy and the role-playing aspect of a 20-sided Action Dice in order to outsmart and gain better positioning against their opponents.

In order to beat the game, you must slay your opponents King AND Queen. After slaying either of the two 'royal' characters on your opponent's team, all of the their characters that started the game on their respective royal's side of the board, go into exile and are removed from play. This allows for another layer of strategy as slaying your opponents king or queen can leave your opponent at half strength and weak against your troops.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing

name: Spiritual Warfare: Luther's Small Catechism Edition
description:
A Simulation of the Post-Reformation Smack Down!

The premise behind Spiritual Warfare: Luther's Small Catechism Edition (LSCE) is that there is a very real war that is being waged across the world. Look, you may not think this is your thing. You may be completely unaware of the earth-shattering implications of the Reformation or a guy named Martin Luther. You may not know that there is a legacy of this radical confessing church that exists to this present day. Regardless, this is still a boss game that helps people understand the battle for truth that plays out for every member of planet earth. It is not combat that can be fought and won with worldly weapons. It is a war of words.

The game is played with each side choosing their champions. The Enemies of the faith can choose between slick Gurus, irreverent Pagans, boastful Humanists, and wicked Fanatics. The Defenders of the faith square off against them with wise Mentors, sharp Theologians, courageous Missionaries, and generous Stewards.

Game play moves through 4 distinct phases: the Draw Stage, the Activation Stage, the Encounter Stage, and the Resource Stage. Each player uses their champion to make the best on the spot decisions through each individual phase in order to gain the edge and silence their opponent.

This game comes with:
12 Defenders of the Faith Champion cards
10 Defenders of the Faith Interject cards
12 Defenders of the Faith Possession cards
36 Defenders of the Faith Teaching cards
12 Enemies of the Faith Champion cards
15 Enemies of the Faith Interject cards
14 Enemies of the Faith Possession cards
29 Enemies of the Faith Teaching cards
140 Square Shards
2 Simplified Rules Mats
1 Spiritual Warfare: LSCE Large Rules Booklet
1 Spiritual Warfare: LSCE Gaming Box

This game can also function as a training tool in connection with Luther's Small Catechism to help students of any age learn the six chief parts of the historic, Christian faith.
mechanics: Action Queue, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Simulation

name: Fall, Caesar
description:
Fall, Caesar is a social game of assassination set in ancient Rome. Players take the role of one of twenty city leaders, some more powerful than others.

Each round of the game, one player is eliminated by a majority vote. Players will have a chance to force weaker players to vote with them, or force quiet players to vote by playing "The Wine". Only players who were in the majority on the previous vote are eligible for elimination in the next.

Once two players are left, the eliminated players vote for a winner.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Team-Based Game, Voting

name: Mark of the Werewolf
description:
Mark of the Werewolf is a game of deduction, accusations, bluffing, survival, and mob mentality involving two teams: Villagers and Werewolves. The Villagers don’t know who the Werewolves are, and the Werewolves are trying to devour the Villagers one by one before the Villagers discover who they are.

Mark of the Werewolf takes place over a series of “Day” and “Night” Phases.

NIGHT: During the night the Werewolves pick an innocent Villager as their victim, eliminating them from the game. The Seer will pick a player and learn if they are a Werewolf or not. The Moderator will lead the players through the Night Phase of the game following a script provided.

DAY: During the day, the players try to discover who the Werewolves are. They do this by lynching one player during each Day Phase in an attempt to eliminate the Werewolves from the Village before the Werewolves kill all of the Villagers. Once a player has been lynched he must remain silent for the rest of the game. It is often best to have lynched players get up and watch from an area close by.

Winning the Game
Repeat the “Day” and “Night” phases until all Werewolves have been killed, or the number of Werewolves is equal to the number of Villagers (at which time the Werewolves overtake the village and win the game).
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Murder/Mystery, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Player Elimination, Take That, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Pretty girl
description:
Pretty girl is a simple game for the younger audiences.
The game contains: board (58x47cm), dice, 8 figurines, 60+24 counters.

On the board is shown part of a city where is a shopping mall. Fields on the board are following streets and sidewalks. In front of stores are marked fields next to which are one or more counters. On the beginning of the game players place their figurines on any field on the board. Figurines are moved in any direction for the number rolled on dice. In order to collect a counter, figurine must stop on marked field and player choose on of counters beside. Players have task to collect as much counters as possible. Every counter represent one clothing item. Assembled set worth extra points. Players also have to visit cafe, hairdresser and bank.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Set Collection

name: Mythic Heroes
description:
Mythic Heroes is a light strategy game, where each player controls a famed hero of Greek Mythology. Players are vying for the title of Greatest of the ancient heroes. Win by finding and defeating mythical creatures or by battling your fellow heroes.

Each player uses the cards in their hand to perform actions on their turn to gain an advantage or trip up the competition. All the while, the Gods of Mt. Olympus will appear at random to mix up the game play.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board

name: Conquest
description:
Κατάκτηση (Conquest) is a wargame very much alike to Stratego.

The gameboard is a 3D battlefield. You have an army of men at your disposal and your mission is to win your opponent's army.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Deduction, Fighting, Memory, Wargame
mechanics: Grid Movement, Memory, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Forsaž express
description:
Board for this game represents a modern city. Forsaž Express is a company that drives packages around the city. Packages are represented by counters. The company has eight drivers all have the information where to take the package and where to deliver it. Markers are collected by stopping on marked field next to counter.Each delivered package brings one point. The winner is the player who ends up with the most points.

Figurines (vans) move around the city respecting all traffic rules. The game has an educational character - playing the game, players learn the traffic rules.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: WW2: Lost Chronicles
description:
WW2: Lost Chronicles is a PNP wargame for 1-2 players. The game is a fan made project for fun & sharing.

It is a tactical wargame based on historical battles & fictional what if battles. Game scale is 200 meters per hex & roughly 10-15 minutes per turn. Game unit is platoon size(company for USSR). A game will last 6 - 12 turns or with a variable turn system.

Each player is a regimental commander who controls 4 - 9 companies. All companies are color coded & under command of a battalion HQ. A HQ can issue orders to three companies (three colors). Platoons of same color are from same company which should share same morale & training. Morale of a company will vary from scenario to scenario.

Air-support, OB artillery, reinforcement, mines, snipers, hidden units, weather change & other unexpected battlefield events will be handled by cards. Leadership will be implemented by command points & cards.

There is also a solitaire mode in which a player will play as a fictional regimental commander who will do daily routines like refit, replace units or send units for patrol & recon when there is no action. Enemy force is unknown until first contact. Your regiment will gain more & better resources if you proof yourself in battle. If you see too many casualties, you may request to retreat from battlefield & end the battle of the day but withdrawal request is not always permitted depending on the overall battle situation.

There is a battle-fatigue system. As a regiment commander, you choose which of your one/two battalions or attached companies will be upfront for attack or defense mission. The company will get one fatigue point for mission without contact and two fatigue points for contact with enemy force after each mission. A company's morale will drop by one if fatigue point is 2 or more. So you need to decide whether to send more troops upfront or call troops back for refit to remove fatigue points.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Dead Man's Hand: Down Under
description:
Down Under is a source book for running Dead Man´s Hand games set in Australia. It includes 12 new scenes (Scenarios), rules for two new rogues (Named characters) and has rules for three new gangs: The Kelly Gang, State Police and Bushrangers.

The book also comes with three sets of playing cards. One set for each of the new gangs.
categories: American West, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Franky Expansion pack No. 1
description:
Franky Expansion pack No. 1
2 game expansions for Franky Reloaded, contains the expansions Red Eyes & Tally List.

The laboratory of Franky is opened.
These expansion dice bring a new depth and even more fun for Franky Reloaded!
Every single expansion die is rolled as usual together with all other dice at the beginning of the player’s regular dice turn and can be laid aside according to the existing rules.
The new features of the expansions have great influence on the game behavior of all players!

German description:
Franky Erweiterungspack No. 1
2 Spielerweiterungen für Franky Reloaded, enthält die Erweiterungen Red Eyes & Tally List.

Das Labor von Franky ist eröffnet.
Diese Erweiterungswürfel bringen eine neue Spieltiefe und noch mehr Spielspaß für Franky Reloaded!
Jeder einzelne Erweiterungswürfel wird am Anfang des regulären Würfeldurchgangs ganz normal mit den anderen Würfeln mitgewürfelt und kann dann nach den bestehenden Regeln rausgelegt werden ..
Die neuen Funktionen der Erweiterungen haben großen Einfluss auf das Spielverhalten aller Spieler!
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Franky Expansion pack No. 2
description:
Franky Expansion pack No. 2
2 game expansions for Franky Reloaded, contains the expansions Sexy Six & Thunder Storm.

The laboratory of Franky is entering the secound round.
These expansion dice bring a new depth and even more fun for Franky Reloaded!
Every single expansion die is rolled as usual together with all other dice at the beginning of the player’s regular dice turn and can be laid aside according to the existing rules.
The new features of the expansions have great influence on the game behavior of all players!

German description:
Franky Erweiterungspack No. 2
2 Spielerweiterungen für Franky Reloaded, enthält die Erweiterungen Sexy Six & Thunder Storm.

Das Labor von Franky geht in die zweite Runde.
Diese Erweiterungswürfel bringen eine neue Spieltiefe und noch mehr Spielspaß für Franky Reloaded!
Jeder einzelne Erweiterungswürfel wird am Anfang des regulären Würfeldurchgangs ganz normal mit den anderen Würfeln mitgewürfelt und kann dann nach den bestehenden Regeln rausgelegt werden ..
Die neuen Funktionen der Erweiterungen haben großen Einfluss auf das Spielverhalten aller Spieler!
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Franky Expansion pack No. 3
description:
Franky Expansion pack No. 3
2 game expansions for Franky Reloaded, contains the expansions Crazy Nine & Dead End.

The laboratory of Franky is entering the third round.
These expansion dice bring a new depth and even more fun for Franky Reloaded!
Every single expansion die is rolled as usual together with all other dice at the beginning of the player’s regular dice turn and can be laid aside according to the existing rules.
The new features of the expansions have great influence on the game behavior of all players!

German description:
Franky Erweiterungspack No. 3
2 Spielerweiterungen für Franky Reloaded, enthält die Erweiterungen Crazy Nine & Dead End.

Das Labor von Franky geht in die dritte Runde.
Diese Erweiterungswürfel bringen eine neue Spieltiefe und noch mehr Spielspaß für Franky Reloaded!
Jeder einzelne Erweiterungswürfel wird am Anfang des regulären Würfeldurchgangs ganz normal mit den anderen Würfeln mitgewürfelt und kann dann nach den bestehenden Regeln rausgelegt werden ..
Die neuen Funktionen der Erweiterungen haben großen Einfluss auf das Spielverhalten aller Spieler!
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Dust Tactics: Kampfgruppe Von Stein
description:
The BlutKreuz Korps has arrived in the Middle East! Along with the rest of Operation Babylon's forces, the dreaded Korps is now fighting the Allies and the SSU in this part of the World.

Content of the box:

one zombie hero: Frank Von Stein
one squad of five zombies, the Braineaters
one Heinrich (Trop) walker with a zombie pilot
one rule booklet with the introductions rules to Dust Tactics
twelve Axis Dust dice
one tank trap
one ammo crate
one gaming mat
six terrain tile
one catalog
3 unit cards
and one leaflet
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Dust Tactics: Taskforce Tanya
description:
The Mercenaries have arrived in the Middle East! Operation Babylon fierce battles have called for the extensive use of Mercenary forces, fighting alongside, or against, any other bloc in the region.

Content of the box:

one hero: Tanya
one squad of five Sisters of Demolition
one Wrecker walker with a pilot
one rule booklet with the introductions rules to Dust Tactics
twelve Mercenary Dust dice
one tank trap
one ammo crate
one gaming mat
six terrain tile
one catalog
3 unit cards
and one leaflet
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Feline Fortunes
description:
It’s a fur-flying frenzy for the late Olga’s cash!

For weeks, the nation has been captivated by the competition to win the fortune of the late Olga. The rules are simple, the one who takes care of all the cats wins. But contestants are running out of patience as their opponents resort to tossing cats and outright sabotage. There’s only a handful of contenders left, will you be the last caretaker standing?

Feline Fortunes is a card game for 2-4 players that plays in 20-30 minutes. In the game you’ll need to manage the cats in your Lap, defending yourself and attacking others. If you run out of Patience, you’re out of the game, and the last player to keep their wits is the winner.
COLLECT CATS
Gather Olga’s cats into your Lap and show the world you’re the best caretaker. Gather 3 or more and you’ll get back some of your precious Patience as they purr.

TOSS CATS
If a cat falls off your Lap, you can toss it at an opponent to wreak havoc with their play space. You don’t win the cash by playing nice, after all.

UNIQUE CATS
Cats can push each other, fight with one another, launch other cats and even copy each other’s abilities. With more than 60 cat cards, who knows what will pounce into your Lap next.

STRATEGIC CATS
All information is open in Feline Fortunes, so you always know what you’re opponents are capable of. But a single move can dramatically affect the entire game, so don’t get too comfortable, buddy.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Card Game, Fighting
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Player Elimination

name: Unitar
description:
Unitar is a simultanuous-choice 8 round 3 person strategy poker and, hopefully, the Arabic game.

Goal
You win Unitar by dominating the field with your color, in other words the game color with the highest number of frames on the playing field wins.

Strategy
Each turn, every player selects one block of stones that will be moved or rotated. By doing so, blocks may start to overlap. When blocks overlap, actions can be selected to eliminate the overlapping pieces, or to unify the two blocks, which means that the squares they occupy are divided amongst the two colors.

Poker
You have to guess your opponent's intended moves, because your own intended move will only be performed if it shares two characteristics with the other player's moves.
mechanics: Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Ogoola Karuta: 50 English Classics
description:
Ogoola Karuta is a westernized version of a 400-year-old Japanese card game called Hyakunin-isshu Karuta. The game is sometimes described as intellectual martial arts. It is about listening and being extremely focused and fast, just like the Samurai with their swords. Only here you fight with cards instead.

The game is comprised of two decks of cards, the Reader deck and the Player deck. Cards in the Reader deck contain short poems or poetry quotations while cards in the Player deck contain only the second part of these poems. To begin the game, a Reader is chosen (or you may opt to use the Reader app) and the players are divided into two teams sitting on opposite sides of the table or play area. The Reader shuffles the Reader deck and the Players mix, split evenly the Player deck between the teams and place them face-up in 3-4 rows in front of them. The Reader will read the complete poetry quotation on their cards and the player that finds the matching card first takes that card and puts it aside. If the card taken was on your opponent's side, you must give one card from your side to your opponent. The first team that has no cards left on their side is the winner (you must get rid of all your cards first, to win).

The game is set in Japan during the Genpei war (1180-1185). In order to win the war, you need a strategy. Place the cards you are familiar with close to you (in the beginning it is normal that none of the cards are familiar). If you know what cards your opponent is familiar with, place those cards as far as possible from them inside the playing field. Since the reader or app will always read the complete quotation, you do not need prior knowledge of the poems. Strategically place the playing cards in a way that you can find and take them quickly such as laying them alphabetically or categorize them under the same first words.

Ogoola Karuta Poetry Game is not a translation of the original Japanese game. In this first edition, we have selected 50 of the well-known classical poems written in the English language. It is the first western version of Hyakunin-isshu Karuta, which means Karuta: 100 poems by 100 poets.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Take That

name: Keeper's Dissension: Unchained!
description:
Keeper's Dissension is an intense two player strategy game where players battle it out in a Civil War using great warriors, abilities, and resources!
During the game, players will move across the board destroying opposing pieces for loot and board control, while also keeping an eye on available resources that they can use for building defenses and powerful allies!
With a selection of 70 unique Abilities, players can create exciting and engaging effects to pieces, players, or even the entire board, giving the game great dynamics and replay-ability!
In order to win, players must deplete their opponent's LifeForce to 0 while at the same time keeping themself alive!
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Inglorious Space
description:
Inglorious Space is a 1-4 player, semi-cooperative tabletop game inspired by arcade shooters of the 80s & 90s.

Based on classic arcade shoot-em-ups from Galaga to Gradius, Inglorious Space is a tabletop game about working together... as long as it's profitable. Players take control of ace bounty hunters and use "Command Cards" to pilot their fighters across space, shoot enemies, and activate unique character abilities.

In multiplayer, the enemy is too much for you to overcome. Allegiances are made by necessity. But as soon as your usefulness has run out, you better watch your back! There's money to be made on these bounties and between a cold-hearted strategist, an unpredictable hot head, an infamous con artist, and a wanted backstabber, you may find your ship rammed into the path of enemy fire.

Meanwhile, single player features adjusted difficulty that, while manageable, makes every action count. Meticulous decision making is rewarded to earn the highest score (and bragging rights).
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Ottonian Empire: The Struggle of Medieval Dynasties 900-1050 A. D.
description:
Ottonian Empire is a card based board game for 2 – 5 players, ages 13+, set in the 10th century.

Players re-live the dynastic struggles which brought into being the Holy Roman Empire from the dying embers of the Carolingian Empire. The game includes a map, 250+ cards, 6 dice, score pad, 200+ counters, play money & rule book.

The games includes 2 Decks of Cards: the Imperium Deck and the Title Deck. The Imperium Deck contains the most famous nobility of the Ottonian Age (900-1050 A. D.), with their personal characteristics, and a collection of strategic cards, which the players use to build up their Dynastic Faction, acquire offices and titles and vie to become Holy Roman Emperor. The Title Deck includes the most notable titles of Nobility and Ecclesiastical Offices of that age and a description of the possessions of their domains.

The map features the political divisions of 10th Century, Central Europe, with the Kingdoms, Duchies, Margraviates and Counties that existed in the Ottonian epoch.

The player who has accumulated the most points wins the game. The cards are used to gain victory points. See my website at www.bison-games.com
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Voting

name: Homero
description:
The players praise one player.
But almost are indicated by a card. These are just a order! However just one player says it sincerely. Because his/her card is blank!
You will feel happy and ashamed.

--

「褒める」ゲームです。

褒められる人を決め、他の人はカードに書かれている「褒め方」で褒めます。社交辞令！でも1人のカードには何も書かれていません。本音で褒めて！　嬉し恥ずかしゲームです。
mechanics: Storytelling

name: Fire Team Airsoft: Out
description:
OUT : Tactical Airsoft(the new name) is a Sub-Tactical Wargame (with a Hexagonal grid) that simulates the Airsoft. The Counters represent some Characters, that are more or less controlled by you, while assigning them the Actions that are going to do during the Game Turn, at the time of identical Scenario to those used in the game of real Airsoft. You will be able to represent yourselves by a Character in the Game, by his Dress and in particular his REPLICAS.(Replica of weapons in the scale 1:1 And being able to fire biodegradable harmless 6 mm balls).

From the publisher (French):
Le Jeu fait partie de la Série "FIRE TEAM", dont le premier est "FIRE TEAM VIETNAM", qui utilise la même base de règles concernant les Ordres d Action et les mêmes échelles de jeu.

OUT: Tactical Airsoft (nouveau nom du jeu) est un Wargame Sub-Tactique qui simule l'Airsoft. Les pions représentent des Personnages, que vous contrôlez( plus ou moins), en leur attribuant des Actions qui vont effectuer au cours des Tours de Jeu, lors de Scénarios identiques à ceux utilisés dans les Parties d'Airsoft réelles. Vous pourrez également vous représenter par un Personnage dans le Jeu, par sa Tenue et ses équipements en particulier ses REPLIQUES. (Répliques d'armes à l'échelle 1:1, pouvant tirer des billes de 6 mm inoffensives et biodégradables)
mechanics: Action Queue, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Modular Board, Simulation

name: Pulsar Event
description:
From the publisher:

Pulsar Event, is an action-packed game using strategy, logic, and skill. It takes 30 minutes to play, and players will learn their character and craft combinations to stack odds in their favor. This battle card game is in the vein of RPG video game battle systems. Rounds play out through three phases: recovery, equip, and attack. You may have to recover after an opposing attack, then you can build your team back up by adding a character to your battleground, or by supping up with upgrades. Players can have a max of three of their characters on the battleground at a time, to attack card v. card. This allows players to become familiar with their team members, and also allows for fair and balanced game play throughout.

The sole light in the dark zone is a beacon for those who seek knowledge, adventure, and power! Build a team of characters with unique attributes, equip them with powerful and sometimes unpredictable upgrades, and battle your way to unlock the mysteries the Pulsar Event left in it's wake.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Adventure, Collectible Components, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Role Playing, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That, Trading

name: The Prophet
description:
In a time of crisis, will you choose to remain calm or fall into the panic? This is a game about a doomsday prophecy. Players’ goal is to become the Prophet and brainwash everyone into believing that the world is ending. In this mind game, Everyone starts out with the same amount of sanity points. Once your sanity points are gone, you fall into a state of madness. The player who plays the role of the Prophet will spread his prophecy(madness), and convert every other player into the state of madness, thus becoming his follower. Once he turns everyone into his follower, he wins.

The rest of the players need to not only keep themselves from losing their sanity but at the same time, expose the Prophet’s lies. The player who destroys the Prophet’s last bit of sanity will become the next the Prophet. There is no trust in this game, as anyone who fights on your side might be your enemy next round; because the only way to win the game is to become the Prophet and eliminate the nonbelievers yourself.

Our game features a handful of controversial historical figures that had made the significant impact through the course of the world history, whether it is good or bad. Players will be able to play the role of a historical character of their choice, use their unique ability to either fight against the Prophet or be the Prophet themselves.

Now stay sane, and spread the madness.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Role Playing

name: The Warriors: Turf War
description:
Description from the publisher:

The Warriors: Turf War is an aggressive strategy board game licensed by Paramount based on the cult classic film The Warriors. Assume control of one of the film’s iconic gangs and immerse yourself in the action as you fight to take control of the city’s boroughs and add them to your growing turf. Unpredictable events and a growing police presence complicate even the best-laid plans, compelling truces between bitter rivals or forcing gangs to flee in the face of insurmountable odds. Watch out—each choice you make will either reinforce your dominance … or bring you closer to defeat. Warriors, come out to play-i-yay!
categories: Dice, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Armoured Syndicate
description:
Armoured Syndicate is a miniatures based board game for 2+ players set in the post-apocalyptic ruins of Las Vegas in the early 22nd century.

The game uses zoned game boards for movement and combat range with a heavy focus on characters and their individual special skills in combat, hacking and repair.

The game feature a lot of mechs and robots alongside humans and cyborgs. The two factions in the core game are the 'Dromeda Corp',the corporate landlords of the abandoned city, and the 'Dead Crows', a Mexican mercenary gang sent in to conduct a series of daring heists.

Winning the game is all about building up the most profit, this can be achieved through saving you 'salary', looting resources and completing objectives.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: League of Confessors
description:
PRE-ORDER at our official website below!

This board game is a simulation of the spiritual and physical warfare that erupted after the Reformation. It is the only game that covers the specific battles that took place between the Schmalkaldic League of Confessors (the Lutherans) and the Catholic League (Holy Roman Empire) between the years 1532-1555. The setting of League of Confessors begins after the death of John the Steadfast as the leaders of the Augsburg Confession prepare to defend themselves against the impending armies of the Holy Roman Empire. Power and wealth will collide with conviction and courage as two leagues of heroes go to war with sword and the pen!

League of Confessors comes with 4 different classes of heroes.

Commanders – Commanders are the heroes that initially lead your entire army. They are good leaders in battle and are very versatile.

Generals – Generals are good leaders in battle, but that is all they will do. They can advance in their battle abilities very quickly.

Princes – Princes will help build the infrastructure of your expanding territory through the construction of armories, castles, or churches.

Confessors – Confessors do not have the ability to lead troops in battle. They are the only heroes who have the ability to publish confessional writings to convert opponents to their side.

The goal is to win the game by gaining seven Conquest Points. Each electorate territory is worth 1 Conquest Point (CP). The other way you can gain a CP is to fully advance a hero in their abilities. If you fully advance a hero in their abilities, you will also gain 1 CP for as long as that hero is alive. If your league has seven or more Conquest Points at the end of one of your turns, you win the game!
categories: Medieval, Pike and Shot, Religious, Renaissance, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Role Playing, Simulation

name: Don't Get Bit in the Mead Hall: Zombie Expansion
description:
This is an expansion for "Don't Fall in the Mead Hall" and requires that game to play. The "Allies and Drunk Guys" expansion is not needed but strongly recommended.

There are many stories in the Icelandic sagas about an undead creature called the draugr, or aptrgangr (lit. "after-goer," "again-walker," or "one who walks after death"). Most would call them zombies in this day and age and they have found the Mead Hall! Think you have what it takes to keep playing? Well go and prove your mettle once again. But this time you must fend off zombies as you out drink your Viking opponents.

You will send zombies to other tables, fight zombies, and summon zombies. Just don't fall OR get bit in the Mead Hall!

Each time you get bit the sickness at your table gets worse and you lose a heart. If you get bit when you have no hearts one of your Vikings will turn into a Zombie and stay at your table as a threat.

Also included are two zombie themed Tipsy cards that you can add to your Tipsy deck if you have the Allies expansion.

The Last table with at least one Viking standing is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Xếp Toán: Math in Wonderland
description:
In Xếp Toán: Math in Wonderland, players have to find their ways out of the mystical forest. Follow the instructions of Friendly Mushroom and make accurate Math equations is the key. Who will be the first one to get out of the forest? Who will be the fastest and smartest one? Let’s do Math together!

Xếp Toán – Math in Wonderland is a calculation and action game. After rolling the dice, the first player to say out loud “Xếp!” will get the turn. He/she will combine the tiles to make an accurate equation that gives the same result in the dice roll. Each tile will give you 1 points and star tiles give 2 points. The one that has the most points after the tiles run out will be the winner.

You can both learn Math and have an enjoyable time in this game!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Educational, Math, Memory
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Memory, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Everything Makes Sense
description:
Get ready to tell stories like you've never told them before. What's that? Why is this different and just not some marketing ploy? Well, I'll tell you internet friend!

In Everything Makes Sense, you'll be telling stories will all your friends, your family, and even your greatest enemies for story glory!

Games last several rounds or until THE END OF TIME ITSELF. Play until your heart's content. Play for laughs, play to win, play to tell the greatest tale. Play to understand the fundamentals of what it even means to play!

It's up to you.

We're pretty confident things will make sense, otherwise, that would just be awkward.

- How to play -

The game is simple. Each player draws two cards from the Character, Setting, and Plot decks up to a maximum hand size of (6) cards. Whenever you play a card, draw the same card type, always drawing back up to six cards.

The group selects a Story Stickler (judge) who reads off the Theme card, enforces any rules of that card, weights in on the direction of the story if needed, and most importantly awards the points.

Each player plays up to three cards per theme, playing one between the Beginning, Middle, and End of each story. The Player who goes first has the freedom to set up the story however they like, whereas the player who goes last has the power to really end with a bang.

The round ends when all players have played three cards between the Beginning, Middle, and End. The Story Stickler then picks whom the winner is based on whatever they liked from that story. A new Story Stickler is chosen and a new Theme is picked, giving way to a new tale.

Oh! I almost forgot. There's also Plot Twists that can be played anytime to override any card in the story with another card from your hand.

As crazy as stories can get, hopefully... Everything Makes Sense!
mechanics: Acting, Storytelling

name: Dust 1947: Raketentruppe Battle Squad
description:
Death from the skies over Babylon! The Raketentruppe Battle Squad deals with any infantry target the Luftwaffe ground forces might encounter. Thanks to their Machine-gun and Panzerfaust, they can engage any enemy and destroy it in seconds. The squad is presented here in Babylon camouflage pattern, as used in the Middle-East circa 1947.

These miniatures come with their own unit card, to use with Dust Tactics and Dust Tactics Battlefield rules and provide new tactic opportunities.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Dust Tactics: Panzerspahlaufer I-E (Light Flak) – "Henrich (Trop)"
description:
Quick and agile, the Axis Light Panzer Walker "Heinrich," is a versatile addition to any mission. Its 2 cm FlakVierling gun is more than a match for infantry and air support alike, and its superior reactive fire means it will never be caught off guard.
The “Heinrich” Tropical is presented here in its Babylon pattern camouflage, as observed around Mesopotamia circa 1947. This model is a recent one, built with the new and improved turret with advanced optics designed to help target low flying aircraft.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: History Maker Golf: 2015-16 Pro Golf Season Card Set
description: Individual cards for over 150 real-life pro golfers from the current pro golf tour. Each golfer's card based on his performance for the 2015-16 season.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: History Maker Golf: Course Collection Three
description: Includes four courses: Texas Provincial CC, Ft. Worth, TX; Pacific Pines (South), San Diego, CA; Tycoon Pro Course, Miami FL; Connecticut River GC, Cromwell, CT. Each course includes individual cards for each hole, based on real-life pro tour golf course in indicated locale.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: History Maker Golf: Course Collection FOUR
description: Includes four courses: Alamo Oaks GC, San Antonio, TX; Desert Sky GC, Scottsdale, AZ; Palmetto Harbour Golf Links, Hilton Head, SC; Southern Breeze GC, Memphis, TN. Each course includes individual cards for each hole, based on real-life pro tour golf course in indicated locale.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: History Maker Golf: Course Collection FIVE
description: Includes four courses: Lone Star GC, Irving, TX; Federal CC, Bethesda, MD; Napa Valley CC (North), Napa, CA; The PLAAYers Club, Ponte Vedra Beach, FL. Each course includes individual cards for each hole, based on real-life pro tour golf course in indicated locale.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: History Maker Golf: Course Collection Six
description: Includes four courses: Lagarte Viejo Mundo GC, Playa Del Carmen, Mexico; K-L GCC, Kuala Lampur, Malaysia; Blue Lantern International GC, Shanghai, China; Firth of Clyde Golf Links, Ayrshire, Scotland. Each course includes individual cards for each hole, based on real-life pro tour golf course in indicated locale.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: History Maker Golf: Course Collection Seven
description: Includes four courses: Pacific Pines (North), San Diego, CA; Pearl River CC, Jackson, MS; Fownes CC, Oakmont, PA; Rock River GC, Silvis, IL. Each course includes individual cards for each hole, based on real-life pro tour golf course in indicated locale.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: History Maker Golf: Course Collection Eight
description: Includes four courses: Golf City Stadium Course, La Quinta, CA; Long Island Public (Black), Farmington, NY; Diamond Head CC, Honolulu, HI; Country Club at Mile High, Cherry Hills, CO. Each course includes individual cards for each hole, based on real-life pro tour golf course in indicated locale.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: History Maker Golf: Course Collection Nine
description:
Includes four courses:
1843 Golf Links, St. Andrews, File, Scotland
Sam's Bell Tower Course, Wishaw, Warwickshire
England; Usk Valley Resort, Newport, Wales
The Straffan Club, Straffan, County Kildare, Ireland
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: DC Universe Miniature Game: Supergirl
description: This expansion to the DC Universe Miniature Game introduces Supergirl to the game. This white metal kit comes ready to assemble and paint.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: RANKaree
description:
A casual and fast card game extracted from the Living Starship universe where each player is a ship captain vying to have their crew complete the most work to earn the admiral's attention.

The game is for 3-7 players and features a hexagonal deck of 98 cards that come in each of the seven Fleet Division colors (suits): Agency, Flight, Engineering, Health, Operations, Science and Tactical. Each suit has 14 cards - 7 officers and 7 enlisted.

Each round an increasing number of mission tokens (points) become available to be claimed by the crew cards. On your turn you play ONE CARD from hand and claim all the mission tokens of that color. If the mission tokens are as yet unclaimed, you take them. If another player has already claimed them and your card outranks the one they are using to hold the tokens, you steal them from that player!

The deck is seeded with 7 ALERT cards and the game ends when the last one is drawn. The player with the most points accumulated from claiming job tokens is the winner and is hailed by the admiralty as the most formidable captain in the Fleet.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Team Kill
description:
(From the introduction in the rules)
You were all looking forward to your class trip. You'd spent so much time raising money so you'd be able to afford a trip to a tropical island. However, on the boat ride out you are all gassed. When you wake up some anonymous men instruct you that you will compete in a Battle Royal, where only the sole survivor will be allowed to leave the island. One by one, you get to pick up a back pack with one random item within, and leave and set out on the island. What terror!
How will you survive this terrible ordeal? You open up your bag, your stomach churns at the sight of what's inside. How will you be able to survive, knowing your neither the strongest nor the smartest in the class...

Team Kill is a social party game of negotiation, bluffing and tactics loosely based on the Japanese movie Battle Royal. At the start of the game each player is dealt one card with a printed value on it (from 0 to 32). Players take turns interacting in "confrontations", i.e. making a fist and simultaneously making a thumbs-up or thumbs-down. Thumbs down will result in a violent confrontation where the players try to kill each other by comparing cards, eliminating the player with the lower value. Thumbs up will let players form teams, whose card values are then summed in later confrontations. Often though, one player will do a thumbs-up, while the other will do a thumbs-down. In those cases, the teaming player is instantly "team killed".

There are only 36 cards in the game, ranging from the weak Teddy Bear, Canned Food and Ornate Fan, to the very powerful Sub Machine Gun, Automatic Rifle and Bazooka. Needless to say, the more powerful cards usually come with better odds for winning. However, the more powerful cards require the player to make a sound like "bang", "ra-ta-ta-tat", or "kah-boom" when using them, thus signaling to the rest of the players that trouble is coming.

The object of the game is to become the last man/woman standing in this death match on the tropical island. However, in certain circumstances two players can win together by forming a final bond of trust.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Negotiation, Party Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Player Elimination, Team-Based Game, Trading

name: Love Means Nothing
description:
Love Means Nothing is a real-time tennis game for exactly four players. Players volley back and forth, rapidly playing the correct defensive card that also says where that response shot is headed.

The game plays with standard tennis scoring, so you can play a single game up to a full match. With only a count of five Wimbledons to respond, screwing up is inevitable, so when your partner drops the ball, you'll quickly see that Love means nothing...
mechanics: Hand Management

name: Dirty Vocab
description:
Description from the publisher:

Dirty Vocab is a fast, fun, adult party game to play anywhere with a group of friends.

In each round you have 90 seconds to get your friends to guess as many dirty phrases as possible. Dirty phrases are composed of two clean words (like "Custard slinger" or "Shark week") that aren't dirty on their own, but come together to form a dirty phrase.

You give clues by saying anything you'd like as long as it's not part of the phrase, it doesn't sound like a word in the phrase, and it's in English!

Whichever team correctly guesses the most phrases wins!
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Acting

name: Double Play: Gorilla Warfare
description: All Double Play card decks can be combined to make larger decks. Each deck includes a trivia game for 3 or more players. All cards are plastic. Gorilla Warfare is a game of where players fight each other for bases and the last player with a base wins.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Test of Honour: The Samurai Miniatures Game – Bandits & Brigands
description:
Kojirō leads a gang of bandits and brigands with a reputation for robbing travellers in sudden, vicious attacks. His lack of mercy has earned him the nickname 'Oni' - the demon.

Ruthless, cunning and upholding little to no honour, these bandits and brigands will fight for any side if they have the right amount of money. Nothing is too beneath them and nothing is too challenging, making them the ideal hire for anyone who wants a job done.

Kojirō’s has the ability to take Coin cards from samurai he cuts down, and make use of those cards for the rest of the battle. Combine that with other skill cards like Rotten to the Core, Ambush and Mob Tactics, and you have a dangerous bunch of thieves!

Get more out of your battlefield with rules for climbing, leaping (and falling!), entering buildings and fighting from defended positions.

Rules for night-time battles – keep your enemies at a distance and they’ll have a hard time spotting you through the darkness unless you’ve strayed too close to a lantern!

Rules for unaware enemies, for battles in which one side is launching a surprise attack and the other is initially clueless about the danger. This allows you to sneak around, trying to take down outlying foes without alerting the others… But if an unaware warrior spots a dead body or overhears the commotion of an attack, they’ll soon become suspicious and realise what’s happening!

Three new scenarios – Sudden Attack, Ambush in the Dark and Undercover Raid – which utilise the new Darkness and Unaware rules. These battles are perfect to try out the less honourable behaviour of the warriors in this set.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling

name: Venture the Fog: Hydra
description:
A board game designed to be a suspenseful adventure of exploration, strategy, and gambling where you are immersed in epic battles.

Action Battle System
Our interactive Battle System brings you directly into the fight itself, where the dice represent real-time actions your hero is performing

Our D8 custom Battle Dice include the following die faces: Attack (x2), Defend (x2), Roll, Jump, Slide, Wild.

Mist Monsters
As your Hero embarks on their journey, they will encounter monsters from the Mist (included in the core game).

Fog Monsters
Once your Hero is strong enough, they can begin Venturing the Fog. Lurking there are fiercer, more vile monsters (included in the extended game).

Gambling
Stay constantly engaged, wagering currency while other players battle monsters. Gamble correctly and use the newfound currency to your advantage.

Exploration
The expansive swamp is different each time you play. Venture deep into the unknown, carving you own path to collect treasures and defeat monsters along the way.

Gearing Up
Defeat monster and loot them for better armor and weapons. Be rewarded with additional loot by risking more challenging fights along the way.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Role Playing

name: Crooks: Crime Wave
description:
A promo expansion for Crooks - new edition (WGG 1201-02)

These six expansion cards (included in the game Matryoshka) replace the six cards in the base game that share portraits. The rules for these new cards are:

Racketeer
Each Racketeer shows a bonus or penelty on its left and right edges. During scoring phase, the number on its right edge affects the value of the target to its immediate right, and the number on its left edge affects the value of the target to its immediate left.

Turncoat
At the end of the game you must decide which of these two gangs this Crook is a member of. If multiple Turncoats are in the game, they must choose their affiliation from highest to lowest rank.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mafia
mechanics: Hand Management

name: Malifaux: Kamaitachi
description:
A variety of myths surround this creature from Dust Devils to Wind Sickles; they take the form of weasels and generally do unpleasant things to people...

Ten Thunders Box Set, containing one 32mm 'heroic' scale miniature made of high quality plastic. Will require some preparation and assembly.

Set Contains:

Models

Kamaitachi

Stat Cards

Kamaitachi
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: ATS: Broken Arrow
description:
This is an Advanced Tobruk module detailing the bitter fighting around Ia Drang, Vietnam, in November 1965. In this module the men and weapons of the 7th Air Cavalry face stiff opposition from NVA regulars in a series of scenarios that depict the Americans' landing in the "Hot LZ" and the subsequent battles with an entire NVA battalion in extremely difficult and unfamiliar terrain.

ATS fans will find new weapons such as "thumper" grenade launchers, M60 machine guns and, best of all, a brace of Huey helicopter types and new rules to implement their use.

This set is a remastering of a previous release, LZ X-Ray, with cardstock map panels and new counters. The module is available in two versions: one with only the new maps & scenarios for owners of ATS: Hue, and a "full" version that adds the required combat counters.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Vietnam War, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: The Infiltrated
description:
The Infiltrated is an intriguing and fun board game act for all audiences (+16). In the game, a group of citizens discovers that an Infiltrated is to blame for their misfortunes and will do everything possible to find out. But the task will not be very easy, because there are those who support the infiltrated and cunningly use their arguments to hide the truth.

This Game Emulates Venezuela political Turmoil in both sides of the political view, but encouraging teamwork to reveal the agitator and win as citizens.

Each player receives a rol among 2 infiltrator and up to 8 more citizens, they close their eyes and the infiltrated recognize among them and several roles appear on the citizens like the witch, the smuggler, the thief, the para-military, etc. After the Night the players vote to imprision one player and after 3 nights they gotta discover the infiltrated or they lose.

Also there are several roles that put spice to the game with several gaming variant to taste the feeling of the political turmoil in Venezuela.

—description from the publisher

El Infiltrado es un intrigante y divertido juego de mesa acto para todo público (+16). En el juego, un grupo de ciudadanos descubre que un Infiltrado es el culpable de sus desdichas y harán todo lo posible para descubrirlo. Pero la tarea no será del todo fácil, pues hay quienes apoyan al infiltrado y con astucia usarán sus argumentos para esconder la verdad.

—description from the publisher (Spanish)
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Humor, Mafia, Party Game, Political
mechanics: Player Elimination, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Coops And Dragons
description:
This is a role playing board game focused at learning and discussing the theme of collaborative economy and its relation with open digital services. In particular focuses on platform coops as an alternative crowd-sourcing model with respect to privately owned network models. A main inspiring reference is Uberworked and Underpaid: How Workers Are Disrupting the Digital Economy by Trebor Scholz.

This is a board game that mixes role playing, card deck building, collaborative gameplay and transformative narrative aimed at exploring platform coops and their integration.

What is the object of the game? For the single Megacorp player, to acquire all the Platform Coops transforming them in its subsidiaries. For all other players, who play as Platform Coops, to earn 5 happiness points. Players can decide whether the game ends as soon as one Platform Coop reaches their goal, or all are required to reach the 5 happiness points.

How is it won or lost? Players win when they reach their goal.

What do players do in their turns? Each player picks a new card which goes in their hand, and also may play a card as a new service of the coop or Megacorp. Each player has then to pay taxes and compute earnings, which are determined by the cards that they have played. For coop players, the effects of the cards of their deck are integrated with those of the shared service which require all coops subscription to become effective.

The game is available as print and play, all materials available on Github with the rules. On Youtube there is a how-to-play video.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Role Playing

name: Killer Dinner
description:
You are invited to a Killer Dinner! However, this is no ordinary dinner party. Everyone is masked and has their own hidden agenda. Who is your friend, and who is planning on stabbing you tonight?
Ask questions, collect items, and attack other partygoers to accomplish your hidden agenda before anyone else. Blend in while figuring out your fellow partygoers’ hidden agendas before it’s too late!

At the beginning of the game each player gets a card with their secret role and hidden agenda. Attending the party are The Host, The BFF, The Trickster, and The Hitman. Everyone, except the Hitman, is also informed of the Host’s profession on their Role Card.
The Host’s agenda is to figure out who the Hitman is and to kill them.
The BFF’s agenda is to help and protect the Host.
The Trickster’s agenda is to attack or get attacked a total of seven times.
The Hitman’s agenda is to figure out the Host’s profession, or to kill them.
While in the same room, players may ask each other yes/no questions to discern information about the Host’s profession, revealing who the Hitman is based on incorrect answers. Players explore the house and collect items upon entering an empty room. Items can be used to help gather information, attack other players, or replenish lost Health.
Whoever accomplishes their hidden agenda first, wins the game.

Killer Dinner is a party game that will create a new social dynamic each time it’s played. A great number of Host’s professions and the random role allocation, makes every game different. Due to the social aspect and asking questions the game is a good opportunity to get to know your fellows players better!

—description from the designers
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Party Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Acting, Hand Management, Team-Based Game

name: The Duel: Point of Honor
description:
"...a story of dueling, which became a legend in the army, runs through the epic of imperial wars. To the surprise and admiration of their fellows, two officers, like insane artists trying to gild refined gold or paint the lily, pursued a private contest through the years of universal carnage."

-Joseph Conrad, The Duel: Point of Honor, 1908

The Duel: Point of Honor is a two player tactical card game that offers a fast-paced tactical experience. The game highlights elements of dueling culture, sword-fighting, and the discipline of martial arts.

You are a robotic soldier in a life-long rivalry. Every few years, you meet your opponent to test your skill and to preserve your honor. In each game, opponents will participate in multiple duels to earn the most Prestige while managing to stay alive in the process. Each duel will be a choice when and how to attack your opponent in the most efficient manner. Players will then have the opportunity to evolve their play to surprise their opponents in later rounds with newfound tactics and attacks.

Duel players will challenge each other with subtle but impactful decisions within this ten-minute card game. The game is enacted through a series of escalating duels fought between the players. In each duel, players will earn Prestige by dealing damage and playing faster timing cards than their opponent.

Each duel consists of three rounds of combat, divided into two phases: Timing Phase and Action Phase. In the Timing Phase, players simultaneously choose a card from their hand to bid on turn order. In the Action Phase, players will play cards to try to win the duel. After each duel, players earn prestige and can gain better cards from the Advanced Techniques Deck. At the end of a duel, if a player has earned 7 Prestige, the game is over and the player with the most Prestige wins!

The art and graphic design of the game captures the look and feel of renaissance era aristocracy. And the game's illustrations evokes the grace and intelligence of sword-fighting... but also robots.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Wings of War: The Dawn of World War II – Aichi D3A1 Val
description:
Take your Wings of War game into the third dimension! Each historically-accurate, fully-painted miniature represents an aircraft from Wings of War: The Dawn of World War II. All miniatures come complete with maneuver deck and variable-altitude stand. This Japanese dive-bomber participated throughout the war, including at Pearl Harbor.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Queue, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Atride
description:
Atride is a three-player abstract strategy game with a rock-paper-scissors mechanic between the three players: the foxes can kill the chickens, but the chickens can kill the snakes which can kill the foxes.

Each player starts with five of their animal ranged along one side of a 7x7 triangular board. On their turn they advance one of their animals one step in one of two forward directions. They can capture a prey animal by putting two of their animals in a line with it (custodian capture) or in a small triangle with it. A captured animal is replaced with an additional animal of the team that captured it.

The winner is the first player to get one of their animals to the opposite corner of the triangle.

—user summary
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: Wreck-a-Mech
description:
Sunday! Sunday! Sunday!
Build mechanized engines of death and destruction using spare parts, expired munitions and a can-do attitude! Witness these lumbering juggernauts tear each other apart for your amusement! Do you have what it takes to win the belt?!

The most advanced mechs in the world compete every week in the Mech Combat League. Soaring arenas glitter from a million cameras as lethal machines tear each other apart. Each combatant costs millions of dollars and represents the very pinnacle of corporate technology.
